reviews.review: another church. We visited the basilica. It's just another church. Nothing special. But when you love churches ... Nice neighbourhood.

Just Wow. This place really took our breath away. Access is only €10 and you can go down into the cript but that doesn't really have anything in it. If its a good day you can go up the stairs to see the views of the city. But luckily it was raining and my husband declined. Not though that it costs more money if you wish to go up onto the roof. Décor is amazing. We spent so much time here.
Very impressive church. Came here about 2pm on a wednesday ans to my surprise it was empty.Fantastic stained glass windows and impressive altars inside. Definately worth a visit.

A very nice church. Right in the middle of El Born , this is a very nice church, very interesting interior.They have real candles to light here, a lot of churches only have those stupid little electric lamps.Well worth a visit, a haven of peace and quite in busy Born.
Beautifully intense. So much history! The visuals of this building and surrounding museums are amazing. My favourite place in Barcelona for sure.

I want to go back again. If there's only one place that you can visit in Barcelona then make it this place, the Montserrat Abbey! In fact one day is not enough to explore this place. Getting at the top is like being in heaven or as close to heaven as you can. There is something about the place that will make you want to go back. It was busy and quite hot when we were there but I would rather it hot than raining. It is like a place above the clouds which is truly amazing. The train ride from Placa de Espanya is one hour so it's always best to leave as early as you can. But it was worth it. I will definitely go back again.

Fabulous guided tour to the rooftops. Apart from visiting the church, take a ticket to visit the rooftops.You will see a nice view of the city and you will learn curious things about the history of the city.

Probably best with a guide. Certainly this church is an important part of the older, central area of Barcelona and deserves a visit. I have been twice. Once having read-up about it beforehand and the second time I went on a guided tour which was so much better. There is a great deal of interesting history contained in this building, but it is no immediately evident just by looking at it. Going with a guide really unlocked for me lots of detail about the origins of the church, what was on the site previously, about how the church was built, quirks of the building, its materials and the windows, how the building has survived the various invasions and wars that have hit Barcelona and how the church functioned (functions still) within its community.

Is Catalan Gothic always so stunning?. Another example of stunning Catalan Gothic architecture - after entering the church (via main doors!) people are just standing, struck by the great interior, monumental and shadowy, with the gigantic cross in front of them. It makes a huge impression, makes you feel like you are in different world - it's so different from the noisy streets outside. It's a calming, soothing, almost religious experience just to walk around this church an explore the details of splendid Gothic architecture.
a peaceful place. It a nice and peaceful place with nice architecture. The dress code is not that strict as with other basilicas.

Simple but beautiful Gothic church. We visited this church twice in the early evening. It is truly beautiful when lit up by candles and strategically placed lights. The stained glass windows are still lovely even in the dusk light. It is a cavernous space with various dedications around the walls - worth wondering around, absorbing the atmosphere as you go along, and then sitting down to look at the nave, making the most of the peace. Lovely square outside to have a drink.
Beautiful basilica.. Santa Maria del Mar is a beautiful gothic church near the sea which is why it is named del Mar. Entrance is free and there are always crowds.

Loved it here. We stumbled across this by accident and it was beautiful. Well worth a visit. There was even a traditional Spanish wedding happening which was lovely. The wine bar (La Vinya del Senor) just bedside was lovely too!!
Magnificent. Breathtaking a place that will blow your head a must see for 2 hours.the architecture is fabulous absolutely beautiful.
Gorgeous old church with beautiful design inside. Another must to see when in Barcelona. This old, huge church with it's beautiful architecture. It was truly amazing. Took a lot of pictures.
Unique gothic Basilica. A little off the beaten path and a little difficult to find without a good map or GPS. Nice altars and not a crowded place to visit

Very old and authentic Must be and beautifull. This cathedral is so nice. Many courts inside and good. This Cathedral can add to the dayly wolking starts at the gothic Quater it there , and recomended goes after to the port . i add some nice pictures TIP - watch your wallent its croudy and theres some theives all over the area .
Beautiful!. It deserves a visit, this Basilica is rich in history and is one of the most important churches of the actual Barcelona, there are so many books that were written because of the church.

Lovely Building. Well worth finding. On entry may seem a bit dark but you can light up areas with a donation. And, make sure you go up the stairs to where the Virgin Mary is sited. All in all a place of Faith that will appeal to anyone who apprciates art, architcture and places of solace.

Very peaceful place. We stumbled upon this basilica whilst walking around Barcelona. It was easy to get inside, there were no queues and no entrance fee. Make sure you have shoulders and knees covered as this is a requirement. It was fairly busy but lovely inside. This is a typical basilica - highly decorated and worth a look. There is also a little garden where they keep fish and geese.

Beautiful sonorous space. I knew I wanted to visit the Basilica while visiting Barcelona, but I could not anticipate the beauty and surprise that awaited inside. The architecture and stained glass windows are gorgeous and inspiring. My unanticipated surprise was stumbling upon an announcement of a concert by the Barcelona Philharmonic later that same evening in the Basilica. The program was Mozart's Requiem. My habit of carrying cash paid off as credit cards were not accepted for tickets, and I returned that evening for a once-in-a-lifetime experience.
Better . I liked this cathedral better than Gaudi's. It was the best among all cathedrals I have visited in Spain. A cathedral is to worship and this has the atmosphere for that. Highly recommended.

Yes, yes, yes. This is very ne of the must visit in Barcelona. Preebook as the queues are very long. It is very easy just go online and it will take you 5 minutes. Amazing place and I am sure you will love it.

It is a beautiful cathedral. We did not pay 8Euros for entrance fees because it was a public holiday. Mass was going on and the front part of the cathedral was cordoned off -- as it should be because some tourists were simply disrespectful in this place of worship. The interior architecture is beautiful with towering columns and intricate gothic stone carvings. Do not forget to walk behind the cathedral to the cloister and visit the interior gardens and a pretty fountain in the center of the building.
A big church, that is.. It happened to be close to our hotel so we checked even this one. Nothing so special but always ice to see these beautiful catholic churchs!
a hidden gem. we literally stumbled upon this beautiful church in the gothic quarter. Its definitely worth a visit - in particular, look up and you will se the extremely unusual chandeliers!
A must to see. What a wonderful architectural structure outside and in with its marvellously decorated small chapels
very moving place. We were very happy, because at the time of our visit there were festival of choral music. Beautiful voices in beautiful place made me feel like in heaven.

Beautiful building ,church and history. Lots of fascinating statues and historical iinformation . the feeling inside is so peaceful. It a must .it has amazing acoustics if you can visit when it has musician there .

Beautiful, ancient Church. Super neat, very detailed church in Barcelona's Gothic quarter. It's lovely and peaceful. It's a working basilica which offers multiple masses, so be aware of the times when you go to visit. There are a lot of non-church related tourist traps around here, so be wary when looking for more information. We almost got sucked into a weird art exhibit while looking to access the Basilica. Overall - this is a great stop!
good tour guide to top. interesting 14th century church pure gothic. its worth paying the 8 euros for the tour up to the tower
AMAZING!. We stumbled across this basilica whilst walking around in the area. The church is very big and has magnificent chandeliers and architecture.

Interesting Gothic church. This church is attractive, but it does not match the cathedral. As Gothic churches go it is fairly dark, and some of the stained glass is not particularly interesting. Show up after 5 pm and the entry is free. Before that you'll pay 5 euros, more if you want to visit the rood.

Beautifull Church. This is a very beatiful church, that if you have the chance you have to go to.
Go after 5pm as is free from 5pm or if you prefer, book a guided visit, don´t know the priches though.

Beautiful and peaceful. My first impression on entering the Basilica was how vast and beautiful it is. The height gives it the feel of somewhere much larger and grander but it is actually quite small. The stained glass windows are breath-taking, and the statues in each of the alcoves all tell their own story. Take time to sit for a while and take in the atmosphere. I did a 'circuit' of the Basilica then sat and read the leaflet, then went round again! I personally am not keen on taking photo's in places of worship so I was more than happy to buy postcards in the tiny shop.Compared to some 'tourist' attractions this was quiet and not overcrowded. Will definitely visit again next time I am in Barcelona.

beautiful church. stunning church... we actually got to see a wedding there! centrally located in the gothic quarter this is a must to see from the inside. please respect the people as it is in the end a church and not just a "site"

Dont miss this!. We were so taken with this church. Gaudi was supposedly inspired by the columns of the altar. It is a Gothic Masterpiece laid bare because of fire during the Spanish Civil war. The starkness is part of it's beauty.
Standard Catholic Church. Stained glass, archways, etc. The sculpture outside honouring the Catalonians is quite interesting too

Simply wow.. Religious reasons aside it's a gorgeous building from the XIV century, with beautiful decorations. Like most historic locations in Barcelona different layers and additions make it an enjoyable sight.Visit in the daytime to enjoy the awesome vitrals.

a beautiful experience... deeply spiritual; go with time in hand. Truly spiritual place, and you would love to just sit there and soak the experience inNot over-the-top in a touristy Sagrada Familia way, but a very meaningful must-visit in Barcelona...

Seen one Gothic cathedral, you've seen them all.. It's beautiful, but how many Gothic cathedrals does one need to see? It is, however, quite different than Italian Gothic. Worth a visit, in particular because it is free.
Definitely go to the roof!. This is a beautiful cathedral but the real treasure is the nicely guided roof tour and its stunning city views. This was truly a highlight!
Nice Basilica. Worthwhile for a visit. Interesting stories about why and how it was built. Interior is nice but does not compare to Gaudi's work at Sagrada Familia. Of course much different eras.

Better visit Sagrada Familia. Crowds of people taking photos from all the possible sides. The entrace cost 2-3 euro, and I understand why...So mich tourists in a holy place makes it just another landmark. The streets near the Church are good for shopping rather than spiritual journeys)

Visit. We visited the church today. I had walked passed the entrance before but never gone in. So we went in today and I must say that I didn't realize how big it was on the inside. The top of the roof was emended and the size was overwhelming. I noticed that people where going up to the tower for a look at the city.

Goose Bumps. My family and I purchased tickets to assist a Mozart classical concert in the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. This astonishing church is worth visiting in a regular basis and I would recommend to arrange a cultural activity arranged inside. A must see if you pass by the Ramblas.
Beautiful church!. We had to visit this church as it was on the must see list. It was huge with very high ceilings and beautiful stained glass windows.
beautiful building. this is a beautiful cathedral in the Barri Gotic district. admission is 3 euros. i think a must visit place if you are in the area
Visit the church of the book. By the people for the people. This is an emblematic church for the people in Barcelona. Nice places to eat near by.
Just beautiful!. You have to go there to feel how beautiful it is! It just draws you in, just like everything here in Barcelona - created with love!

Wow!!. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. Of course La Segrada Familia is more impressive, but Santa Maria is just so beautiful and peacefull.
You must vist this. I think the fair is about €10.
Well worth a visit. This is an old church in the Gothic style that dates back to the Middle Ages. The architecture is interesting and it is free to visit.

Stunning! Could have stayed hours. Such a beautiful place. Lots to see and look round. Wish I was able
To stay longer and have a proper look around. It is fairly touristy so unlike romes churches where you feel like you could sit for hours undisturbed. But so stunning!

Beautiful - short visit required. In the heart of "El Born" is Santa Maria Del Mar.You can even at certain times go up to the top (look it up in advance - google) before you go if you want to pay the couple euro to do so.It's another beautiful cathedral, but I'm not so big on cathedrals so a 10 minute visit was plenty for me. It's a very very busy area and noisy all times of day.

gorgeous basilica, avoid the mass. go visit the church, it's beautiful and impressive and it's free. the mass takes place twice a day - AVOID IT! it's 45 minutes of boredom, the priest can't sing and it's not the special experience I though it would be, it was just tiring...

A great example of the Barcelona scene!. While walking towards the beaches of the Mediterranean Sea; we passed this very ornate and breathtaking Cathedral! Sadly, we did not have time to see the inner beauty. Next trip!
Stunning. Visit on a morning as there is free entry before mid day. Stunning inside and out. Also in a nice neighbourhood of Barcelona with bars and restaurants. Definitely worth a visit.

History and culture by the bucket load. Loved this place. One of my favourite places in Barcelona. The history and culture is amazing. It has a real story that everyone can relate to and understand. It's beautiful!

A MUST VISIT. The Basilica is one of the wonders of the world, There is so much to explore here. You can just sit and experience so much wherever you look. Plus this part of town is a wonderful walking area that is full of old history, shops and locals. A must see

Fantastic view from the rooftop. We visited the church today and joined a tour with a guide telling the story about the church history. Walking up more than 154 steps to the top of the roof. There is a fantastic view all over Barcelona. We have been there before but thanks to the guide we saw new things in a different perspective.

nice to see. We visited during a short walk around the city this basilica which was nice to see. From outside it looks very common, but if you stay inside you can se how impressive this basilica is. If you have some minutes, you should do it for getting an idea, how they have built it.

Gothic wonder. The lines of this are a wonderment. Imagining its construction in the 13th century, without heavy equipment, is intriguing. Would definitely consider this a "don't miss" when exploring the Storico

Amazing!. How beautiful this church is! Was so impressed at how they were able to build this beautiful building with the tools they had hundreds of years ago.We wandered through the church and the cloister for almost two hours. So many wondrous things to see. Loved the geese and their story.Will have to read "The Cathedral of the Sea" to understand what I'm missing!
Beauty and Peace. This old church is my favourite in Barcelona, its elegance, the high ceiling, the beauty of its colorful glass windows transmit a peace that you feel deeply inside.

Loved this beautiful cathedral. We stumbled upon this beautiful basilica one night while looking for a bite to eat, and enjoyed eating at a cafe looking up at the front of the basilica. We later went inside, and appreciated its openness and relatively simple (compared to the more baroque churches) design. During our days in Barcelona, we happened to wander past and into this basilica a few times, and found it to be our "favorite".
Worth a look. Nice example of gothic architecture worth a look. The history of the name is pretty grim but interesting. Have a look if your in the area there is also alot of food options around

My Bucket List. Cathedral Of The Sea, an historical novel of 14th century Barcelona, took me back in time, when the cathedral was constructed. Reading of the devotion Arnau had for the blessed mother as he carried stones down the mountain on his back, one by one to build the cathedral, the Inquisition as a backdrop for the world stage, the hunger for a better life.....Barcelona came alive for me. Seeing the Cathdral in person was thrilling, the Bastions carved on the front door, the simplicity of the decor of the Cathdral built for "the people", the architecture lifting one's spirits towards heaven. Definitely one of the must see and do experiences in Barcelona.
Worth the visit. If you have read Cathedral of the Sea, you will love this church. If you haven't go, and then read the book!
Beautiful, sacred place.. This is stunning for its architecture and even based on the fact that I have seen some of the world's most fabulous cathedrals. It evokes a sense of calm and respect.

Beautiful . FYI you can enter without a ticket and see many sites. I went on a Sunday about 6 and was able to hear the organ played and some of the mass. It was beautiful. Lots to do nearby in so far as shops and restaurants.
Gothic grandeur. Amazing, awe inspiring building with its soaring pillars and vaulted roof. Exudes an air of calm and peace

Awesome architecture. This building has its main structure then lots if outbuildings and areas with statues and fountains that I didnt expect.The stained windows are a beautiful addition to this widely recognised cultural building in the centre of Barcelona.
Gothic church dedicated to Sant Maria. Less decorated than the city's main cathedral but provided an intimate glimpse into the religious beliefs from the people then.

The visit to have to do. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is an imposing church in the Ribera district of Barcelona, Spain, built between 1329 and 1383 at the height of Catalonia's maritime and mercantile preeminence. It is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic, with a purity and unity of style that is very unusual in large medieval buildings.
Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Very peaceful and beautiful church with lovely stained glass windows in the heart of the Gothic Quarter.

Fantastic place! I'd love to see it in 10 years.. This Basilica is absolutely amazing. We took a tour and totally enjoyed our guide and his knowledge of the different architects as well as the building materials, symbolism and history surrounding this church. Their goal is to have the facility completed in 10 years for the 100th anniversary. I hope we can return. The difference in the Nativity side and the Crucifixion side is dramatic. The detail work is unbelievable as are the early models in the museum. Truly you can't come to Barcelona and not take time for this magical place.
calm and impressive. Still one of my favorites situated in the cool Born area, it is worthwhile to enter , enjoy and relas the catalan gothic style

Very fine Catalan-Gothic church. This is the finest Catalan-Gothic church in Barcelona dating back to around 1330 and it is free in the morning. Just outside is a sculpture with an etarnal flame commemorating 1714 when Barcelona lost in the war of succession..
Amazing. Large and beautiful cathedral in the middle of restaurants and shopping. Open to walk around or sit and meditate. Very beautiful
A gem. This little gem is often overlooked by many visiting Barcelona, but be sure to pay it a visit. You can be lucky and not run into tons of other tourists.

Majestic, Gothic. A beautiful gothic-style church in the city centre. Easily accessible from Catalunya. Looks majestic from the outside. Would no doubt appeal to architecture lovers. The inside is grand and spacious, elaborately and elegantly furnished. Not exactly luxurious, but fits perfectly as a house of religion. Certainly worth a visit. Entry to the Church is free from 9 am to 11 am, and from 5 pm to 8.30pm. It charges 5€ to 8€ at other hours.
Beautiful!. In my opinion, way more beautiful that La Sagrada. I loved La Riberia, the area this church is in. Much quieter and very quaint. A must see!

Great Rooftop Tour. We bought tickets online through the church for their rooftop tour. What a fabulous experience! Not only did we get to see the stunning interior of the church but were treated to all sorts of wonderful stories from an exterior perspective. And the view was a "wow"! Very reasonable price. Highly recommend.
Stunning Building. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is an absolutely stunning building. Located in the El Born area, you will want to add this Basilica on your must see list.

Lovely old church. Huge church with some nice stained glass windows. Some traditional and some modern design. It's free to enter and photography is allowed. Be respectful though to those who are here to pray. Worth a look.

My Favourite Church. This is one of my all-time favourite churches that I've visited in Europe. You normally don't have to pay but depending on time of day there may be someone at the door taking admission. The stone pillars at the alter are truly something to see. Be mindful that they may not allow you to step inside if you have exposed skin (guys and girls).

Peaceful. Came upon a wedding here and wanted to go in but was closed to the public.Came back next day with friends and it is stunning.Very peaceful and definitely worth a visit....be sure you check opening times first

Don't miss and take the time to do the Guided Tour. This really is a church with the wow factor, and on balance we preferred it to the Cathedral in Barcelona. It is a lovely, lofty space and really send the tingles down your spine, especially if the organ is being played as it was on our visit.The church was badly damaged by fire during the Spanish Civil war, which means all the Baroque interior was destroyed, leaving the original Gothic interior exposed. As we are not great fans of heavy Baroque interiors this for us is a massive advantage, as the church is a fine example of the clean gothic style and the decoration in the side chapels is, in the main, pleasingly modern and simple. There is some beautiful carvings, statues and stained glass from across the centuries.You can visit the church for free in the mornings (when the light is great) and later in the day (after 5pm), but it really is worth taking one of their guided cultural tours during the afternoon - cost us 8 Euros each in 2016. It includes a visit to the roof tops, crypt and choir space, but more importantly the details of why and how the church was built and how it fitted into the environment of 14th century Barcelona. The guides are extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and offer tours in various languages.

Must View the Interior. A surprise contrast to the exterior, the inside is a blaze of color on a sunny day due to the stained glass, especially the rose window. The slim columns afford an open, welcoming space, with a lighter feeling than most Gothic structures.If possible, visit on a Saturday evening before services to enjoy the organ practice and/or attend the evening service. Great acoustics.
A church with a wow factor. This is a vast church with an amazing high roof. The internal space is just stunning. Go late in the afternoon and get in for free.

Interesting. A guide from free walking tour we did on the second day recommended us to visit this church so the next day we went back and we found inside is not marvelous but it is very meaningful for community.

The Cathedral of the Sea. This church isn't the Cathedral.
It's worth visiting.
Its gothic architecture is awesome and the chorus quite good
Ineresting cathedral and nice rooftop views of Gotic.. Visit the Cathedral in the morning when it is free. Cloister with geese. Cathedral and cloister closes at 12 and then opens at 5.

Old church!. Beautiful old place of worship, i actually preferred visiting here over the Sagrada!
Only €4 to visit and bang in the middle of the Gothic Quarter.

Basilica of Santa Maria. A splendid building that impresses any visitor.
High arches, stained glass and artwork everywhere, the Basilica shows off its spiritual and material wealth for all to enjoy.
Take time out to step inside the magnificent building

Beautiful Basilica. We stopped by here when we were in the area. We were happy we stopped in, the Basilica was beautiful. It is near the Ramblas and Barcelona has many areas that you can walk to and see the sites. Also in the area is Roman ruins. If you are visiting you can map out the sights you want to see and make this Basilica part of your own walking tour.
Beautiful Church. If you love beautiful old churches, this will be a good place for you to visit. Very grand, and lots to look at.
Nice stop in Barcelona. Stumbled on this basilica while walking around near our hotel. Beautiful inside, certainly worth a few minutes.
Great gem. This church can easily be mistaken for others but is a pleasant place to visit. The indoor courtyard has much to see
Amazing architectural structure, shame it's still under construction. A very interesting piece of Gaudi architecture. Well worth the experience of seeing this, although far too many tourists.

Beautiful . A truly beautiful church. Doesn't look much from the outside but the interior is stunning.
Very close to the Picasso Museum, right at the end of that street actually.

Beautiful!. Beautiful church to tour (free of charge) during the day and at night, the surrounding area had awesome street performers. The night we were there, they had two young opera singers that had everybody stopped in their tracks! The sound resonating off the church walls was unbelievable! Loved it!

Tucked Away in Gothic Quarter. Part of our Gate1 local tour. Nice and quiet and great history of church actually built by the people. Still a little shabby on the inside from burning of interior during the Civil War. You can still imagine the former glory of the interior. Entrance was free but on Sunday entrance may be restricted as it was when I tried to get in Sunday afternoon after visiting Picasso Museum.

Beautiful. Acouple of streets away from Barcelona Cathedral, when we went there was a small orchestra playing inside and the acoustics were amazing. Enough to make the hairs on the backs of your neck stand on end. Beautiful church with gorgeous windows, in particular the rose window.
One Of Barcelona's Fine Places of Worship. Had a look around in this lovely Basilica dating back to the 14th century less ornate than the city other large places of worship but no worse for it.

Authentic and Beautiful. I visited this Basilica to visit my family roots, (St Josep Oriol), but found instead a beautifully maintained and extremely accessible Basilica. Quite a fascinating visit to an authentic part of Barcelona's ancient history. recommended.

Beautiful and magnificant. This basilica was the inspiration for antonio gaudi's Sagrada Familia and it would suggest seeing it after because you'll have a greater appreciation of the interior architecture.

Born District Basilica. The Basilica of Santa Maria by the Sea, took a relatively short time to build, as it was a labour of love by the people. It is next to the monument of the Catalan Shine of Remembrance. Amazing to think that this basilica was once right on the seaside!

Pilgrimage. Attended for a Mass. It was so beautiful. Altar was higher level which I had a excellent view to the altar. This church is really very old, year 1340. Suggest to visit maybe to stay for the Mass.

Not a "must see". We visited the Basilica , since it is close to the Picasso Museum . It is impressive in size ,but the stark interior is less than other sights in Barcelona . The interior was stripped during the Spanish Civil War . It is a nice restful stop , but not a "must see" attraction .
One of the great extra muros churchs.. Dedicated to the Virgin Mary is one of several church's out side the walls of the Vatican. Worth visiting, together with Saint Paul Extra Muros.

Amazing Building. Lovely building, with peaceful atmosphere, in easy location of the city. Beautiful side altars, dome, and plenty of time to walk around, although generally always busy. Well forth a visit.
On our 3rd European holidays. This is a very beautiful Cathedral ,it is in walking distance from the La Rumbla. You can also stay at the Conan hotel with views of the cathedral.A must see!!!
Nice basilica. A nice basilica to visit in the gothic quarter, especially it is free to enter. Very pleasent inside, and you can cool off if it's hot outside :P
Amazing Basilica. You need to visit this when in Barcelona, beautiful Basilica to explore - beautiful stained glass windows. If you have a chance try to attend a mass for the experience
Must see. This is a typicall church of barcelona, it has history and you have to see it from the inside, it is a must see.
Subtle beauty -- a bit hidden but worth finding it. Not as magnificent as some others in BCN, but was one of our favoriates with some interesting (and contemporary) sculptures.
Very beautiful church. This church is also very beautiful and has a rich history. If possible use a tour guide to learn about the history. Worth visiting.

Serene and majestic. Simply put, this church, in the El Born district, is stunning inside. The soaring ceilings and Gothic architecure are amazing, and to think this was built in the 1300s! Be sure to check out the stained glass windows, they are brilliant. Recommend going either in the morning or late(r) afternoon to avoid crowds and have some quiet time in the church. Otherwise, unfortunately there are too many tourists. But even if crowded, go, because it is not to be missed.

Beautiful Basilica. This is a must see, especially the interior from cloisters with the geese swimming on the water the gardens and palm trees growing and then all the beautiful alters and chapels it must rate as one of the most wonderful churches. There is now a charge to enter but this has improved your visit as before people crowding in and it was very noisy but now you can enjoy the tranquility it offers.

beautiful gothic church 10/10. This is really a must see in Barcelona.. it is free of charge, it is located in beautiful Gothic barri part of the city, you can enjoy garden and then fantastic interiour.. Gothic churches are probably the best thing architecture gave us and this one is one of the best.. be sure to visit it and find out why this church inspired even Gaudi

Visit in the morning. This is one of the oldest churches in the area, and it's size and scale is incredibly impressive for how they would have built it in that era.Items to note:- There have been periods of time where the church experienced significant damage, including an 11 day long fire. So some original facets of the church and decor are not from the original time period.- The church has periods of time where it closes and forces a fee to enter. If you go in the morning or after 5:00pm, then you can avoid the fee and experience the church for free.
Fabulous basilica. So beautiful - the detail inside is amazing and the basilica has a number of individual alters around its perimeter - very impressive stain glass windows and stonemasonary

Beautiful church. We did not do a guided tour nor did we have to pay to enter. It's a very beautiful, peaceful and cool place to visit in Barcelona. Ladies be sure to wear clothing to your knees and over your shoulders or take a scarf to cover yourself. There are staff at the entrances to enforce this but having said that I did see other women inside who were not covered, not sure how that worked!!

An ancient cathedral with high vaulted ceiling. Another excellent church dating back to the 1350, with a story board of thr founding of the cathedral. Excellent location near the hgarbour area and botanic gardens
Holy. Amazing building.How on earth they managed to build it is astounding.Very peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.
Beautifull!. Located in the middle of everything interesting, this-basilica holds beautifull vitragges and defenately leaves you at awe.
Quick Tour .... Hopped off the tour bus into this beautiful architectural design of a building =)It is quite grand, sense of calm/peace and worth a visit if you're in town.

Built in 1300's w/interesting history. Started in 1329, with a brief interruption of work in 1340, it was completed in just 54 years - a very short time for a medieval church of its size. The stained glass windows which date back to the 15th to 18th centuries all survived the Spanish Civil War.It's considered to be the most impressive example of Catalan Gothic church architecture. Inside, the soaring cathedral ceilings aren't as covered with decoration, which was the intent.We also were surprised to see a copy of the Black Virgin of Montserrat statue in one of the small side chapels. Impressive. And worth a 15-30 minute stop.
Very grand cathedral. We did not go on an organized tour but you can enter the cathedral for a fee and tour the interior. The church is very grand and tall inside with lots of interesting relics.

So engry. I have been in bigger and more visited churches in the world and to say a prayer there was always entry with no fee at least at some corner part of the church. But here is impossible do do that since all doors are blocked by staff and for me who just want to pray or to someone who wants to visit entry is still 7 eur. So it is clear that this is a turist attraction primary organized for money making and all rest comes secondary.

Another splendid church. There are many splendid churches in Barcalona and this has to be one of the best. It is always a tough decisions as what to see when you are on a weekend break but this one is a must. The only downside to our visit was that we could only fit it in on a Sunday and access was restricted blue to services.
Great basilica . Very nice architecture very impressive and big.Outside looks very beautiful but inside is more beautiful. Recommended.

As beautiful as the Cathedral. Gorgeous basilica in the gothic quarter. Strangely, they charge an entrance fee (5eu) during the afternoon, but it is open later in the day and you can enter free of charge. Wonderful shopping in this area too! Local artisans and shops surround the basilica for an authentic experience.
Breathtaking . You have to go inside to believe it. To think it took over 50 years to build and it was built by the "commoners" is amazing. Must are this. Spectacular.

Amazing panoramic views over Barcelona. Located close to the sea (although much nearer when it was built apparently) and near the beating heart of the city, this is a lovely church. Unlike the Sagrada Familia this is a church that offers a peaceful and calming experience with an amazing stained glass window. We did the rooftop walk and it was well worth the 300 or so stairs to get to the top. We had a walk around and the guide was very informative and was able to point out many interesting places in the city. Well worth a few euro to get in.
Lucky. When I visit this place, my luck was cahnged. Its a very mistic place. In the middle of center and friendly people and such a beatiful consrruction.

Nice basilica but not memorable . We happened to encounter a wedding while we were visiting, which made it a particular delight. But otherwise there wasn't much that stood out about this nice basilica. Hard to compete with Sagrada Familia and the Cathedral, I suppose. But not a bad visit, if you enjoy religious sites or need refuge from the hot sun.
Splendid. The basillica is under renovation, so some areas were not accessible. We did not tour the roof because it was still closed by the time we were there.

architecture delight. i adore the architecture and you have to visit, but beware of the queue so buy the tickets in advance . The walk up to the top is arduous and if you like me are claustrophobic it is a tight spiral but the views worth it. Also take lots of water.

Beautiful church. Like most of Western Europe Barcelona has a few churches, but the little church is worth a stop. The stained glass is incredible from multiple periods in history. This the church that sailors in ancient times before they put out to sea and thought the earth was flat! And the chance of survival small!

Cozy relaxing cathedral . Like other cathedrals it is also very much catching your eyes from the inside ND outside as well. It is free to go in and look around although when there is mass it is more likely you'll have to wait bit. The place around the cathedral is full of cafes so you can drink a coffee or eat some tapas.

Beautiful. I decided to visit this church after reading other reviews. I love looking around churches and it didn't disappoint. We visited about 11 in the morning, there were no queues and it was free to visit and you can donate via collection boxes at each little coves. Beautiful stained glass windows. We didn't bother going up to the terrace, legs not willing anymore.

Beautiful interior . Beautiful church and exhibition to go to whilst on Barcelona. We didn't go up the tower but I'm sure the view would have been beautiful! Stunning stained glass windows, especially beautiful when the sun shines through. Note: Student/ seniors rates available.
Sites from top amazing!!. Took the tour and climbed the stairs to the top. The views of the city spectacular. Very much worth the climb.
Must see. I found this a beautiful place to be. It had a quiet and calming atmosphere and some of the best stained glass I've ever seen.

Impressive. This basilica is open until late in the afternoon ~8pm. There is a small shop selling candles, votives, rosaries, and postcards near the altar. I also read they do group tours during the day where people have the opportunity to go up to the terrace. Overall, very impressive basilica!
Truly Beautiful. Although we did not do a tour the view from outside was outstanding...lines were long so pre book if you want the tour. It is.some magic architecture.
Nice but nothing special . It is a very nice church but there is nothing special about the church. During the day they charge for admission so go to the church after 5pm when it is free.

Huge place. From the outside, this basilica is deceiving. When you go in, the place has tons of details and seemed like there was several sections that are dedicated to different saints. It is really pretty.

Beautiful. A must see you wont be disappointed.
Detail is fantastic and inspirational to all the family.
Bit of a Que but you can always book online
Lovely building. Enjoyable visit, especially the architecture and artwork within the basilica. A "must see" in Barca.
Neat to see in conjunction with Gaudi. Neat to visit the region's premier Gothic cathedral as a contrast with Gaudi's more modern basilica Great sense of the history and architecture in Barcelona.

Interesting roof tour.. The roof top tour of the Basilica offers a different aspect to the church and Barcelona. Unfortunately due to a fire during the civil war all of the very interesting artefacts normally found in a church of this age were destroyed, along with all the original stain-glass windows. As a result, the main points of interest are the simplistic Catalan Gothic architecture, so it is quite a quick visit.

Nice but not outstanding - not worth a special trip. This church is in an area that many people will visit because it's the oldest area of Barcelona - so you may want to make a quick visit. But it is not the most beautiful, oldest, or most impressive cathedral in the area. So It's worth, perhaps a brief visit. But I would not go out of your way to come here.
Regular cathedral . Not very special, if you see the St Pietro or Milano cathedral it's similar but smaller than them , Gothic architecture, if there definitely visit also visit the Gothic quarter
Beautiful Gothic Church near Santa Catarina Market. Stumbled into this by accident. No admission, just a beautiful church dedicated to people who work on the sea
Beautiful!. Stumbled across this beautiful church in the gothic quarter.Beautiful - visit, light a remembrance candle.

Great view of the city and worth the trip!. We are a family of 5 that took this tour. It is relatively inexpensive - only cost 8 euros for adults and children over 12 years of age. For the 8 euros, you get to see the crypt, the tower, and the church. 5 euros if you just want the church. in my opinion, it is worth the extra to see the tower. We walked up the really narrow walkway and it was pretty cool. The church is old and built in the original Catalan style, versus the mixed Gothic/Catalan style of the larger cathedral! The church is beautiful and so is the tower. The crypt was nothing spectacular - a small room showing a video of the interior of the church. We were glad we visited!

beautiful moving church. love Barcelona, our hotel was in walking distance of the main Las Ramblas, could spend every night here watching people go by. Lots of lovely little cafes around, including the Hard Rock café, which does also have live bands on)

Beautiful. Completely beautiful. The stain glass windows are particularly stunning and so vivid with colour. There are certain times of the day when this is free to enter and others where there is a charge.

The windows make the church!. This beautiful Gothic church is sequestered within the narrow streets and alleys of Barcelona. Unlike the cathedral (La Seu), it is not situated overlooking a large, open plaza. And, there are no mobs of people waiting to visit. Just pop in and allow yourself to be dazzled by an exquisite display of light and color through the stained glass windows. The church was designed to be minimalist - and it is. Except for the windows. It is also unusually spacious for a Gothic building. It won't take long to enjoy - and cafes await outside for your pleasure.
Beautiful church. Found this church strolling through the gothic quarter. It is free and worth the quick trip in to see the architecture and art work.
Skull & Bones. Austerity for giants and an impressive engraved skull&bones on the floor and take your time but hurry up because hundred of years walk on begin to disappear.

Beautiful Traditional Church. This is in contrast the exact opposite to Gaudi's Cathedral, But it is so beautiful with lots of little chapels dedicated to Saints and The Holy Family. Well worth the visit. Only a short stroll off La Rambla
Go go go! . Christian or not - go see one of Europes finest cathedrials. Amazing, read the book by Ildefons Falcones first to understand it's glory!

You'll see it when it's on top of you. Large basilica surrounded by narrow mainly pedestrian streets and building, so although it is very large, you can't see it on approach until you hit it, you will be looking up at it as you are so close.

The view from the rooftop . Really interesting visit. There are lots of things to see within the church and the stained glass is beautiful . It is well worth taking the lift to the roof and going to see the breath taking views of Barcelona. Just be mindful of the fact it is a church and that it is best to dress conservatively. We did witness them asking a lady in shorts to purchase a scarf to cover her legs in a sarong style.
impressive. not open all the time check schedule but worth going back for after finding it shut on the first occasion, can be hard to find from street signs as off the main drag .
simply amazing. a great unknown for tourist. if you are visiting Barcelona for sure you will walk close this Basilica at some point, so don't hesitate to enter and be magnified with the inside view

A Great find in Barcelona's Gothic Quarter. This so-called "Cathedral of the Sea" was a great find during our walk through the Gothic Quarter. Though the inside is more bare than others (it was stripped during the Civil War and carbon still blackens the ceiling), it is still very impressive in its beauty. You can see how the tree-like columns must have inspired Gaudi for his Sagrada Familia. Once you have enjoyed the visit and the soothing sound of its organ, you have plenty of choice outside for a good lunch in this section of the Quarter.

Read the book cathedral of the sea. Read the book and wanted to visit and yes I know book was fiction but some of the background was historical correct so delighted I visited this beautiful gothic cathedral.

Nice Facade. While walking around the Gothic Quarter through the narrow streets we came across the Basilica of Santa Maria Del Mar. The Basilica looked very nice from the outside there was a line to get in we did not have the time to queue next time.
Beautiful building. This is a stunning church to visit. While there is also the cathedral and Sagrada Familia to explore, this is also worth a visit.
A true gem. In the middle of the gothic square hides this gem, a very interesting and impressive basilica, take a short walk inside and admire it.

Amazing dome. We wandered around inside without the audio tour (5 euros) and marveled at the beauty inside. We noticed a door with a sign saying views of the dome and asked. It was 3 euros each and a guy walked us up to see artifacts, the bell tower staircase and a porch area from which we could see the gorgeous detail of the dome. He also pointed out where to go up on the left side to see the mosaics next to the Virginia Mary.

Another Barcelona Gem. This Barcelona gem is situated in a lively part of the Gothic Quarter, making it a good visit to include lunch, people watching and window shopping. The church itself is Cathedral-sized and equally impressive. Definite wow factor....and free to visit too.

Part of cruise tour. So glad we went here. One of the best basilicas we have been in gold everywhere. Loved the pond with geese around based in the old part of Barcelona well worth a visit. Have a guided tour here

Nice visit. The basilica is on the must see list in most guides and it is quite impressive - very tall, beautiful, with a nice cloister. Very crowded and I can't say I enjoyed the art there, the building itself is the reason to visit.
Stunning Cathedral from 1300s. We had just finished the Picasso museum and happened upon this cathedral. We were amazed by the beautiful interior. This is a jewel.
Beautiful place. This was so beautiful would tell everyone to visit a must visit would go back so much to see. Love the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar

An ancient church close to the old city. Opening off a small plaza with plenty of restaurants this church is worth a short visit.
It is an active church and has a huge nave but is quite plain and devoid of major embellishments. It is quite dark inside but on the weekends it can be lit up wth many weddings.
Impressive. An amazing Basilic, I had the opportunity to visit as part of a old town walking tour. This is one of the must see in the city.

Beautiful experience. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited! The style of the building combined with the (lack of) interior decorations made a strong impression.This is a place that does not take long to visit (probably maximum 30 minutes), however the architectural beauty of the slim columns and the quietness to spend some minutes for contemplation were very well spent.

Stark beauty . There is very little in the way of furnishings or colour in this church. But this allows you to see the simplicity and beauty of the church. The church has no transepts or extraneous additions. There are interesting stained glass windows.

High gothic church; beautiful by its simplicity.. Well worth the detour. A short walk from the Palau de Musica Catalana, passing by the Mercat de Santa Catarina (for lunch), short walk then to Picasso Museum, and the Church is a hundred yard more. (check a map, easy walk on your own).

Wonderful basilica. Wonderful basilica in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. The architecture is superb with wonderful stained glass windows. The interior of the church including the windows was destroyed in the 1930's during the Spanish Civil War so the interior is all relatively newly restored. We visited during the afternoon at a time when a payment of 5 euros was required for entry - we paid an extra 3 euros for a guided tour and this was well worth the money. The tour was interesting and included a rooftop walk that provided excellent views across Barcelona. This is a light, airy church and well worth visiting.
Awesome place to visit on a budget. No money but want an experience? Then check this place out! Really cool and its free to get it. So much to see.
Beautiful building . A must see if you love to explore churches. You can pay to go up the tower also. We just bought tickets at door and had no problem getting in.

Amazing inside. Free to visit before 1pm. This is my 3rd time going inside the church and I am still impressed each and every time. It is my favorite church to go into in Barcelona and I take all my visitors to see it when they come. If you're in the area make sure to stop by.
Beautiful Basilica in Barcelona. Beautiful basilica worth a visit open to the public and it's free. Highly recommended as a Gothic monument.
It's a must do when in Barcelona!. No traveller to Barcelona can say they have visited the city if they leave this off their list of "must-dos".

Free for the public later in the day. Nice basilica in the city center. Easily accessible by foot or bike.
Later in the day the access is free, so time your visit and you can save a few euro's

Spend 5 minutes. Gorgeous Basilica...like all the others, spend 5 minutes and move on. It's free on certain saturdays at a certain time - we did a free walking tour that timed it just right so we were able to enter with 10 mins before they started charging again and it was perfect.

beautiful Building. its a very peaceful Place. Beautiful from both inside and outside.
Shorts and sleeveless shirts are not allowed. make sure when you visit you are appropriately dressed.

Beautiful Basilica. I love the antiquity (early to mid 1300s) of it and the grandness of the interior. It's very large and spacious inside. The basilica is open to the public and it's free. While cruising around or walking around the Ribera District, make sure you stop inside and take a quick peek. Highly recommended for anyone interested in Catalan Gothic architecture.

Nice church, free entry after 1700. Located between Gothic an El Born areas , walking distance from Cathedral BarcelonaNice decor, and Good ambient.read some of this church's history before you go, it is amazing.By the way you can see most of the sights in Barcelona on foot, the rest are easily accessible by metro.If you are family of 4 like us get the T-10 Pass for the metro it is big bang for your $$C U Around.
Beautiful place worth your time. If you have the time, make a quick stop, in contrast to the cathedral, you don't have to pay, they also will let you in even without covering your shoulders

Touring bcn. We ended up in this church of great historical value while walking around the Gothic quarter. Interesting architecture but they charge 5 euros to get in and there is a store inside the church which I disapprove of greatly . It was ludicrously warm in it so might be good in the winter monthsDefinitely not a must see .
Beautiful Church. Breath taking ornate figures, beautiful stained glass.So peaceful and pray and light a candle and reconnect!an absolute must visit while in Barca!!!
Amazing. Visited this building as part of a day tour of Barcelona, beautiful building and so much history. Well worth seeing.
Beautiful church - go on a Sunday. We went to this church on Sunday morning and were lucky enough to hear the clergy sing and the organ play. It was magnificent! Highly recommend you see this church.
Pretty church. Visited here on a very hot afternoon, only €4 to have a look around. Very ornate figures, loved the stained glass windows.

Another magnifiicent Basilica. We stumbled across this one by accident & just loved it. The ornate structure & around every corner seemed to be something else to see. Lots of gold & ornate decoration give it a really wonderful quality. It wasn't too busy either so we had plenty of space to wander around at our own time. It is very centrally located so easy to find & a welcome from the heat outside

very beautiful such a peaceful place. We stumbled upon this cathedral as we strolled around the city. We had a leisurely brunch in the square and watched the people going in and coming out. We debated if we wanted to go inside because we noticed some people who were dressed in shorts were putting on long trousers/jogging bottoms. As we were dressed for the 35 degree heat we thought we would have to do the same which didn't appeal to be honest. Im so glad we decided to explore as it is beautiful inside. Im not a church person but even I could feel the calmness and experience the peace that the building emitted. A bonus is that there is no admission fee.
Even mor beautiful than online pictures. This church is definitely worth a stop on your stroll through Barcelona. Absolutely beautiful and well situated.
Very interesting and worth the stop. . Educating and very worth the time to swing by. Enjoyed the views and the architecture. We do walk into any church or basilica we pass.

Old Cathedral in the Gothic Quarter. Very grand architecture and well worth visiting. Ladies have to cover their shoulders and wear respectable skirts to enter. There was a service on the Sunday we visited, and access was restricted

We see why this is a favourite of Barcelona Christans. Lovely church with an intimate and spiritual feel. After the Cathedral and its 50+ side-chapels, the simplicity of this church plus its size and beauty made it well worth visiting

Nice roof views. While the inside of the church is very beautiful, I preferred the outside. Both the roof and the outdoor courtyard with the swans were very picturesque. I went when you had to pay - it was 7 euros. There are plenty of times when it's free. I think I would shoot for that next time.

Go before noon. It's free! Stopped during one of the free tours and was glad we were able to go inside and at no cost. It's free until noon.
Amazing to say the least. Beaty inside and out.

Must see. This is a beautiful church and should not be missed! There are interesting exhibits in an area off the right of the church that I found informative and enjoyable. I love to visit old churches and this is one didn't disappoint!
Beautiful and simple. Beautiful to see and very nice details in the windows of this church. Must: visit this church in the morning because in the afternoon you have to pay for it.

Impressive and massive Basilica.. After Vatican city - this is indeed very impressive Basilica. Its huge and very decorative.
The most important - it has the tomb of Columbus.
Another beautiful church. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is another example of beautiful architecture. We did not go inside, but it is worth taking a few photos of the exterior alone.

Beautiful with great history. In the old city, free to enter, though contributions are encouraged and well worth it. Beautiful art work and an inspirational story of a lady who gave up her wealth to help the poor. No queues just a helpful volunteer.

Beautiful basilica. A lovely basilica in the heart of the old city. Watch out for the long siesta in the middle of the day (closed from about 1pm to 5pm) but otherwise a great, and free, half hour in the shade with some surprising features
Not only Sagrada Familia. In Barcelona you don't have only Sagrada Familia. This piece of art is located in the old part of Barcelona and it is a must see location of the town

Stunning inside and out. This history linked with the building is as interesting as the building is beautiful. Full of surprises and worth spending time in. Every time you look at something you notice more detail. Read reviews of various tour guides and find someone knowledgeable in this area as there are a lot of stories to be told. I would definitely visit again to spend more time there.

One of the best churches in Barcelona. This church is fantastic and it's free. The stained glass is perfect particularly with the sun shining through. The peace and serenity of the whole place is a joy to behold certainly after the hustle and bustle of the Barcelona streets and traffic. See it for yourself and you won't be disappointed.
Nice Church. Very nice church with a lot of little chapels, courtyards, etc. You could spend a lot of time in here if you know what to look for; we just went in as a "target of opportunity".
Awesome. I only saw it from the outside but it was amazing all the figures that were there and they all meant one thing or the other. It is a sight to see and it is still not finished

If your in the Gothic quarter it's worth visiting. This Basilica was built by the people and has a simple exterior and interior with clean lines throughout giving a very spacious feeling with a high vaulted ceiling When we visited the church is free to visit till 1pm but charges in the afternoon.Afterwards visit the The Fossar de les Moreres memorial with its eternal flame adjacent to the church
fabulous!. We were staying round the corner and decided to visit during a rainfall. Mass was being celebrated and the organ added so much to our visit

Must-see. I live in Barcelona. I recommend you sincerely to visit Santa Maria del Mar, if possible by sunshine to see the colour effects of the vitrals inside. It's a very special place that invites to silence and beauty.

Old but Majestic!. I was anticipating to visit the Basilica de Santa Maria Del Mar. I had seen some pictures online that motivated me to see this church with my own eyes. I was not disappointed. It truly looks like an old basilica. It is quite rustic! After all it had been built in 1329. It is 687 years old. Way older than myself! It had so many statues and its pillars were humongous!There were a few worshipers and everything was peaceful. I enjoyed taking pictures and admiring all the art work. The inside is clearly the Gothic styleThe altar was covered with white flowers, surrounded with pillars. I liked that!The streets nearby this basilica are quite narrow and adventuresome! It is hard to take pictures in such circumstances. Still, it is quite beautiful!

Well worth a visit. If you're in the Gothic Quarter be sure not to miss this impressive historic building. Some visits we made didn't allow photography but this does. I found it very moving and atmosphericbeing in here.

Beautiful church worth the visit. We were surprised to find this church free entry on Monday when a charge was necessary in the Sunday. It is a magnificent basilica like so many in Spain with huge high ceiling and large pillars. Great photos!
loved it. must visit Gaudi's architectureall based on naturepalm treesvarious flowersnice mirror workpeaceful

Don't pass by without a visit.. This is simply magnificent. Bare and unadorned it could not be more unlike other Spanish churches I've visited. Endless pillars reaching heavenwards take one on a journey with them. You'll keep this church in your heart when you leave. Check out the history before you go.
Beautiful . What a beautiful church with such history. My kids even enjoyed it! I highly recommend this a must see in Barcelona.

The most amazing place in Barcelona. If you have ever read the book about Santa Maria del Mar by Ildefonso Falcones called Cathedral of the Sea (translated from Danish) you will like me every time you come to Barcelona want to visit Santa Maria del Mar. We always light some candles for lost relatives. The inside is so beautiful and takes you back to the book. See you next time we visit Barcelona.

Interesting. Santa Maria del Mar is a very interesting church in Barcelona, and is worth a visit. Walking around the old church is absolutely staggering, but when I visited there was no information available on any of the features of the building. It is a lovely building, with some very impressive features, but I wanted to find out more about it and couldn't.
a break from the heat. An interesting old church located in an old part of the city. . Worth a look if you are nearby . Something to break the heat of an August day.

It's okay. Staff were rude and abrupt. Some great Street performers outside.. We had no plans to see this church but has a spare few hours. We sat in the square listening to the performers, there were a few of them around and some very talented people. The church itself is very pretty, structurally very beautiful. It's a gothic treat and we really like the courtyard. However staff on the door were rude and practically threw our money back at us because they didn't want to give any change but since we had no details of prices till you get to the desk it's hard to plan the right money beforehand. We enjoyed the view from the roof.
Just another big WOW. How to absorb the beauty of this place in a short time. light a candle say a prayer a must visit whilst walking in the Gothic QTR
Old charm. This is beautiful because its ancient and looks the part. As there is lots to do in the area, it is nice and short stop for moment of stillness. And its free

Great English tour in Wonderful Basilica. We went here because the lines in most other places were too long, but were so glad we did. The English tour was wonderful, providing such the right amount of data. Walked to the top with wonderful views of the city. Church has an interesting history.

Heaven.. After a long ay of sightseeing in Barcelona my eyes were crying for a peaceful setting. Headed back from the beach to the hotel through the small backstreets and came across the Basiica. It was not on our agenda for the day. Entered the basilica and felt an instant feeling of peace and serenity. Have visited many basilicas, churches etc but this little gem beats them all! What struck me the most I guess was the beauty of the inside but also the outside, the connection which the basilica had to the city. The old town hugs the basilica in its' arms. Close to the heart.

Worth the walk. Defiantly worth walking to this magnificent Basilica. Entrance is free but guided tours are an added extra & you are given an hours talk including the history of construction. If you have the time this is very interesting. The tour takes you to the top of the building where there are magnificent views of Barcelona.

Stunning Basilica. I thought I was going to leave Barcelona without visiting the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar...out of luck my flight was delayed and took this opportunity to visit.The Basilica is hidden from the main road, on a side street. It is the only surviving Catalan Gothic architecture in Barcelona. Inside the church one will see the high horizontal pillars on all sides. I don't know much of Gothic architecture, but this church definitely has a different characteristics from other basilicas. Don't leave Barcelona without visiting this church...it is a site to see.

SANTA MARIA DEL MAR. Think that this Cathedral, is very interesting to know the history, that was pusblished buy a well know book, and now will be in a short time trough a movie-series,to understand how it was built, by Shipping workeks at the time and the reasons tat motivated that constructions, that without doubt is a place you cannot fail to visit at Barcelona
emotion. I read the book (from I Falcomes) - which I liked so much. So I just couldn't miss the opportunity to visit the basilica !

A hidden gem in Barcelona. We needed a place to celebrate Sunday mass and I am glad that we found this church. The church itself if beautiful and the parishioners were very welcoming. We attended the international mass at noon and it was a great experience. I would recommend this church to anyone looking for a place to worship on Sunday morning.
Beautifull church. One of the beautifull churches of Barcelona. A must combine with the nearby Picasso museum. Go have a prayer here.
Beautiful Gothic church. I am a big fan of cathedral architecture so this was a real treat. The history and ingenuity of these structures can't be beaten.
Take the tour. There's a guided tour available that's definitely worth the time and small expense. Great views of the city. Interesting history.

unforgettable. You can believe all you have heard about this astonishing unique and monumental church. There is even more to it than you expect (I was wrongly directed at first to the Crypt which is not part of the main tour but is special in itself). Turn up on spec and you probably won't get in (as I found) - so it is worth struggling through the on-line booking for a timetabled slot. The exhibition showing how the designs were worked up has the most advanced maths I have ever seen in a church...
Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Oh so beautiful fourteenth century basilica! A must-see in Barcelona. Intricate details and exquisite architecture.
Impressive architecture. I have been there as a visitor, and also attending concerts, and the place is amazing. The architecture is beautiful, and the acoustics for concerts are incredble!

My favorite church in Barcelona. I visit Barcelona every year,for the past 13 years and make an obligatory visit each time.This is the most ingrained church in the citizens of the city specially in the residents of the Borne district.The design is catalan gothic and it has so much history behind it.Do not miss it.

Beautiful and serene. This church is the only pure example of Catalan Gothic architecture. It is a must see in Barcelona and the best way to visit is to come and sit in the pew and just 'be'. It can be an incredible centering and spiritual experience. If you decide to attend a mass here, there are portions of it in other languages so as to include everyone. If you get a chance to read Cathedral by the Sea (Catedral del Mar) by Ildefonso Falcones, you will learn the history behind the construction of this amazing piece of architecture and why it is so important to the neighborhood.

Impressive Interior. I'm not a church goer. But after seeing la Sagrada Familia, all churches seems not comparable to la Sagrada Familia. It's still worth the visit due to the impressive interior and its age. After all, it's very well preserved from 13th century...

One of the best Gothic Basilica in the world. Santa Maria Del Mar is amazing. It is a large Gothic Basilica located in the neighborhood called "el Born". One of the most exciting places in Barcelona. The visit of the roof is highly recommended, excellent views over the city.

Nice church with excellent vies from its roof. A beautiful old church in the gothic quarter. You are even allowed to go inside for free! It has been built quite rapidly so there aren't that many architect styles mixed up. It has a beautiful round window. For 8 Euros you can climb to the roof where you get a fantastic view over Barcelona. Not many people seem to know so there was no waiting line. A guide will first tell you something about the church and then take you up to the roof where there is plenty of time to take in the view and take some photos.

Lovely exterior. But we weren't overly impressed with the interior of this Gothic 13th century church. On Sunday mornings there's limited access because of Mass, but on the front steps a band sets up and people hold hands to form a big circle and dance in the square. There's also a nice open air antique market. Behind the church is the best part of the church, in my opinion, where you'll find several small chapels and a pretty shady garden with tall palm trees and The Well of Geese. Since the Middle Ages geese have guarded the grounds. It's all free and makes for a memorable morning.
take the tour up the tower. We paid a small fee to go up the tower and the tour guide was great. Beautiful views over Barcelona. Well worth it.

A beautiful church. The inside of this church is stunning. Lots of little crypts dedicated to saints where you can worship and light a candle.The architecture is really something and the guilt and decoration is amazing.Note: this is a church that holds mass so you need to be suitably dressed - shoulders and knees covered.
Santa Maria del Mar. Superlatives do little to describe the Basilica. Tarry a while and enjoy this oasis of peace. The hustle and bustle of el Born seems a million miles away.
Beautiful church. You can enter the church without charge and it is wonderful inside. The windows are spectacular and there is an aura of calmness and warmth inside. I definitely recommend a visit.

Beautiful stained glass windows only one of which is modern. This is a place where families have come for generations. Like the cathedral is beautiful in a classic way. But, it is a distant second to La Sagrada Familia. The one feature that we found fascinating was the one window that was very modern in design. It was completely in contrast the the rest of the windows that are a classical stained glass. It is one of those that is good for less than an hour and it is conveniently close to the Picasso Museum.

Beautiful church, sad history.. The moment I stepped inside I was amazed by the size of this building. This is caused by the side naves only being 5m shorter than the central nave.Before the tour started I took my time walking around and exploring the church. Everything looked relatively new. There was even a window with a recent year in it. The guide later told us that this was the result of the Republicans burning this church for ten days straight during the civil war. Parts of the building still show signs of fire damage.If you buy a ticket for the tour, you get to go up the tower as well. It gives a pretty nice sight of the surrounding areas.Is definitely worth the visit, looking around is free, but the tour gives quite a bit of nice background information.

Barcelona's most beautify gothic church. Barcelona has a number of examples of gothic churches in the city centre/down town area. Forget the rest, just head to Santa Maria del Mar.. it is so tranquil and architecturally impressive. Plus you are in the heart of El Born, which is a great area to explore as well, for bars, restaurants, galleries and cute boutique shops.

Fantastic experience. Visited with Family and children. Excellent guided tour in English. Lovely Catherderal and fantastic if not troubled history. A great experience with fantastic views and informed knowledge imparted from staff about building and all of Spain. Well worth the 8 euros per adult (children free)Climb is high (115 steps) but view will relieve you of your breath more!!

What matters most to you?. I felt like I was embraced by centuries. This church speaks volumes about the deep values than have the power to endure over centuries. Whether you are Christian or not you too may access in this place the deeper values that not only produce an edifice like this, but the truth of those values, which has proven itself for centuries. Don't miss the side chapel where people today worship around an altar placed in the middle of the nave.

Stumbled on a wedding. You can wander in off the tiny streets that surround it without queues or paying and soak up the atmosphere. Worth a quick visit to marvel at the cavernous space and high ceilings.A wedding was going on when we were there to add to the experience.
Beautiful columns within a magnificent basilica. For cathedral goers, this is a must visit as it embodies all that is magnificent about Spanish cathedrals.

This is an engineering masterpiece. An absolute must see. Take time to sit and contemplate life and while away a few moments n the cool airs of the building. A beautiful church which shouldn't be missed.
Fantastic place. This place is a must. The columns that hold the structure are shaped like trees. you need at least an hour or two , too look at everything. The glass windows are beautiful

Absolute splendor and an integral part of the visit to the cathedral . What stands out are the palm trees and the geese - they seem out of place but are an integral part of this icon on the Barcelona landscape. It is definitely worth spending time at. There are often activities ( including dancing ) outside and there are several restaurants close by so you can plan to spend a few hours in the area

Wow (cover your shoulders). This is a massive cathedral with a lift to the roof- do go up. It's well worth a few hours stop. Make sure you have covered shoulders, that will save you renting a scarf and 3 euros.

Absolutely mesmerizing. We never get tired of visiting this amazing temple in gothic style. The columns are so high and stylish! No wonder this temple was chosen by the author of the best-selling novel "La catedral del mar". Very recommended.

Wonderful building. Take time to wander slowly around looking at the wonderful works of art and sculptures in the side crypts. Look up at the ceilings too!
A must do!
Austere but worth a visit.. This church is enormous. So high. However, it is grey, grey, grey which after the Sagrada Familia was a complete contrast!
Anniversary trip. This building is beautiful like so many in Barcelona. It has a peaceful ambiance and stunning architecture inside.

Such a large cathedral. We've been here several times over several years. Always impressed by the size and height. Watch for the small boats hanging down from the ceiling. Lovely acoustic for music for the services. Watch your bags and pockets here too, as there are pickpockets here at work!

A stunning Cathedral, not to be missed - don't miss the rooftop view. The Cathedral is located in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. The entrance fee is 7e. Well worth the cost. The courtyard is beautiful. The interior is stunningly beautiful. Such a wonder feel of old world Europe.We had no idea there was a rooftop viewing area. We found the entrance by chance. When looking at the altar, there is a small alcove to the left of the altar. We saw a short line in front of what appeared to be a little side chapel. When we got closer, we realized there was a small sign for the lift to the roof! Totally unexpected.We spent about 2 hours exploring the interior, rooftop and exterior (courtyard). There is a small gift shop off the courtyard as well.This is well worth a trip.

A masterpiece of Catalan Gothic arquitechture. Inside, it's impressive for the elegance of its columns and colourful vindiws.Admire the ceilings and think about the builders....Best if there's a concert !

Wonderful guide, beautiful historic church.. A beautiful historic church which was brought to life for us by an enthusiastic English speaking guide called Pol. The details he gave us about the origins and building of the church were fascinating, whilst the roof top views were magnificent. Well worth the modest 8 euros guide fee.

My favourite place in all Barcelona.. I am a regular visitor to Barcelona and always make an effort to visit this beautiful place. It's story, told in the 'Cathedral of the Sea' is very powerful in describing the church's importance to the Catalan people. There are also concerts held here and these are worth looking out for.

Loved this gem. What a wonderful Church steeped in history. Bought the guidebook and then used it to explain the various religious items in the Church. Returned for International Mass on Sunday which was a mistake. Long and basic.

A must stop in the Gothic Quarter. Beautiful church. The stained glass, the rose window, the artwork and the detail in the fixtures. Make time to visit while in the Gothic Quarter. The church use to be on the seaside before land was reclaimed to enlarge the city. Wonderful structure that we could not afford to build today. Nice place to sit in the pews and think if you do not pray.
Beautiful old church. Ducking into these old churches often feels like stepping back in time for a moment. Let you imagination grab the period.
Beautiful. A beautiful church to visit and appreciate the lovely stained glass windows. Some very good information as well around the church.
Breath taking. Spent 2 weeks in Europe, and saw lots of beautiful churches. This one is right at the top of them. A must see when in Barcelona.
Stunning church. The Basilica in the heart of El Born is definitely worth a visit. There is a remarkable peacefulness to this church.
The Tour is Definitely Worth It. Excellent tour guide. We counted 164 steps, about half on spiral staircases. But the history, architecture and views of the city are well worth it.

Heart of Barcelona . Throughout history santa Maria del mar (or the cathedral by the sea) has played a pivotal role in the life of Barcelona and even the modeling and development of the city. Also try to find the fc Barcelona emblem as part of the window decorations which was made as a thank you for the club's donations to the rebuild of the church.
Nothing amazing. If you have already saw some nice churches around Europe then you will not be impressed by this one, so just take a picture out and don't waste your money here.

A beautiful basilica. Worth a visit. For €1 you can light a candle and then take the time to admire the beauty of this building. Organist was playing when we visited, which was very beautiful. Note the basilica closes daily at siesta time.
Beautiful church . In the middle of the old city center of Barcelona you can find this beautiful church. Definitely worth a visit if you are around.

Not to be overlooked. With so many cathedrals in Barcelona, especially the famous Sagrada Familia, it is easy to miss this lesser known church in the heart of the city. Entryis free and the interior is beautiful and stunning. It should not be overlooked!
Beautiful Church inside!. Gothic Architecture and so many Art inside! One of the most beautiful Churches in Barcelona! It is worth to visit!

Beautiful Church . This church was right by our hotel.
Its well worth a visit.
Very peaceful and tranquil .
Very interesting historical place it feels very spiritual
Beautiful Church and wonderful area around it!. Its free and the location around it is something to see. Has a cafe in front and it's a lovely site to not miss .
