Impressively high !. A jewel of the finished Gothic architecture in the year 1383. This cathedral originally was owned by the sailors who lived in the neighborhood since the defrayed the work, either with money or with hundreds of hours of work, carrying the stones on their backs

I recommend the tour that takes you onto the roof. The cathedral itself is free to go into, and I recommend taking a look around if mass isn't going on.We paid to go on the rooftop tour. I recommend it. You have to go up some spiral staircases, which seems to be common in cathedrals. But you get to go out on the roof and look over the city of Barcelona. The roof is higher than the general cityscape around it so you can see for quite awhile and take some great pictures. You have to be prepared to do a little bit of climbing/high stepping at places on the roof, as it wasn't really intended for people to just be walking around and hanging out.They have lots of stained glass windows, including one for FC Barcelona. You can't escape it in that town. I don't think our tour guide was a big futbol fan.

a lot of history. There is a lot of history inside this church, the buildig itself it's fantastic and very famous for locals and for tourists also. If you can go for a classic music concert. The interior has excellent hearing.

Amazing church. With so many amazing churches in this city, you may ask yourself why would I go to another Basilica, and the answer is because it's here and it's beautiful and it's not far from wherever you are.

Make a point of visiting on Sunday for Mass. Sunday Mass at around 11 is a wonderful time to visit this historic and beautiful cathedral. I was pleasantly surprised with the full choir and small quintet that played and sang and guided the parishioner's voices during Mass. What heavenly music in a glorious setting.
Beautiful church. We happened to be walking around gothic quarter and stopped into this magnificent church and listened to the organ music.
Attractive mediaeval church. A handsome old church, worth a quick look if you're in the gothic area of Barcelona. If you're not, it is not worth making a special trip for.
Check beforehand!. Check the free entry times before you visit, and be sure to dress "modestly". Ie knees and shouldered covered, otherwise you'll likely be turned away.

Interesting. There was a mass service on at the time of my viewing so was unable to have a look at the alter area up close. Beautiful external architecture and free to enter. Spent 30 mins there having a look around. Worth a short visit if you have some free time

Breathtaking. I lived in Barcelona for 10 years and I never grew tired of visiting this Basilica. It is a must see regardless of your religious beliefs - just admiring the building inside and out and walking around the surrounding streets is a whole experience. Check the times to ensure a free visit (you have to pay at certain times, it is free at others) and just spend a few minutes taking it in. You want more insight? Grab a copy of the book "The Cathedral of the Sea".Enjoy.

Free & worth seeing, but attire rules enforced. This is an absolutely beautiful Basilica and is free to enter....however you must have knees and shoulders covered. Peddlers hawk pashminas for 2 euros, but depending on how tall/large you are, you may need to buy two to pass by security. They will require your shoulders and knees to be covered. It's a large and ornate Basilica and well worth the purchase of a pashmina to go in, if you don't have proper attire on.

My favourite place.. This is may favourite place. I'm not particularly religious but I would defy anyone not to be moved by Santa Maria del Mar church. It is stunning in every way. There is also a walk available around the ramparts. I would suggest that you first buy a book called The Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones, go to the church, then when you are finished go to one of the little bars beside the front doors of the church, sit down and see if you can see the small figurines attached to the doors. This marvellous book will tell their story and therefore the story of the church.
Words cannot describe this place!. Don't miss this while in Barcelona. There are many churches and cathedrals in Barcelona but this one is astounding!

Stunning. The entrance is free and is worths seeing. Among the most beautiful cathedrals i have ever seen. The sculptures of the Spanish saints are impressive. You can light up a candle and pray / meditate in a deep silence. It is free but make sure you have a scarf with you as all women have to cover their head. If you dont have one, you will find sellers at the entrance to buy from, for as little as 3€.

Just popped in. We took a walk in the neighbourhood and decided to pop in. Wow, we were really surprised. What a glorious piece of gothic engineering! Do visit and light a candle for someone you have loves. Guides tour takes you to the roof. We did not do that however.

Wow time to get quiet. Just go and sit and experience a great attraction. An attraction missed by many and not so impressive as other Basilicas but worth a visit. Make it part of your old town walking experience and spent a few minutes to indulge into the magic of something that was build in 1329 !

Beautiful building ruined by construction works. It's an amazing building and the colours are beautiful. We didn't have the guided tour so it was difficult to find where you could go and where you should go. We almost missed the museum that is underneath the Basilica!There were parts of the Basilica that were closed off due to renovations which did ruin it slightly for me, though I understand it's very important to maintain the building.A very important thing to note is that you MUST book online in order to guarantee you get tickets. We went without booking and they were sold out for the day and it was only 10am.

Solemn, subtle, honest. Built by poor dockworkers this cathedral is a quiet space whose humble beginnings are reflected in its sparse but solemn stonework. The stained glass is superb and the space is a quiet hub in the hustle and bustle of inner city Barca. Stop by and marvel, especially if you've read the book about the place.
Nice. Amazing place to see. You have to have shorts over the knees and something over your shoulder to get in.
History . You can see places...but it is not usual to feel history as in this place. Almost untouched from its origins. You should read 'la iglesia del Mar' before going!

Beatiful church. Very beautiful Church with a GREAT tour. The tour takes you to the roof which provides some fabulous views of Barcelona. We did the Spanish tour and although my Spanish is far from perfect, he guide was very clear and gave a great history lesson to accompany the explanation of the features in the church.

Historical visit in a trendy location. If you are in the area, this is worthwhile. Has burial markers still in place. Stain glass windows and history of replacement is cool (I won't spoil it). Nice cafes around. And free. Lost a star because it's really dark inside. Tough to see/navigate.

Religious art brought low key. This basilica is a beauty. We found it to be quiet and interesting, even for our twelve year old. Nice to be able to burn a candle and sit in silence for a while. Although we didn't know anything about this basilica, we could see the beautiful statues were from very different era's and artists. There are knowlegdeable guides around if you want. A pity we did nit have the time for a tour.
Beautiful . Absolutely stunning. Just make sure as a female you don't wear shorts and have your shoulders covered.

Great Basilica. Basilica Santa Maria del Mar is located in the gothic quarters so it is very easy to access it by walking. This is a very beautiful church with great stained glass. You can visit the church free during certain hours of the day.
Interesting thing to do . When we was there there was a wedding which was amazing. The Basilica inside it is very beautifully as well. I recommend it as one of the things to do in Barcelona

Decent Gothic Basilica. You may definitely consider stepping inside if you are passing by. It is a fine gothic basilica but there is not anything that stands out particularly. When we visited, there were performers outside the cathedral, we enjoyed sitting on the steps and watching the performers more.
Santa Maria Del Mar. There is a Black Madonna, the Templer's sign. Middle age catholic cathedral. Excellent impression. In the centre of Barcelona.
Fabulous. This is a special place to visit and we were dead lucky to have a personalised tour in English. Well worth the money and amazing amount of history about this wonderful City.

My favorite Basillica. I loved this church it was beautiful, It is free at certain times so I waited in the place for a bit and had a coffee. It was such a gorgeous place. I loved the surrounding area with all the windy streets. It was Just Magical

Quite nice. Nothing different . Pretty standard gothic church. Needs a bit of work. But simple and a thing to see in Barcelona.
Built in the 1300s in the great Catalan times of power. Fire in the early 1400s damaged part of it. However remains in good condition

Nice example of gothic architecture . A lovely break from walking around Barcelona on a hot day. Not too crowded, which gives you the space to enjoy the space.
Would recommend popping in if you are nearby but I would make it a specific destination.

Tremendous cathedral. This cathedral is impressive by its dimensions and by the history it holds. You can't miss if you go out at night to "Borne" area. Also read "La catedral del Mar" which talks about the history of cathedral in the Medieval Age.

Rose window. Pretty Gothic church with one of the largest rose windows in Europe. There is one more church around this area which is beautiful. The architectural style and story of ornamental addition seems very similar to Notre Dam.

Impressive bones of a treasure gutted in 1936. This awesome 14th century Bascilica was set on fire at the very beginning of the Spanish civil war in July 1936 and it burned for eleven days. Only a few of the upper stained glass windows are original and the skeleton of the church you can see through the glass doors.... So save the €5 for another venue.

Eh a FIVER!!!. After Arriving after 2pm i had to pay the €5 fee, its free before 2 and after 5. A Fiver for what? I suppose if I paid for the tower it would of been worth then but after climbing the tower at the Pi church I decided my auld knees werent up for it(plus im lazy). Theres not much to see in the cathedral, one really cool blue glass stained window, a crypt (with a bigger flat screen than mine at home :/ ). However, gothic churches are about lack of decorations and more open space i now feel. Worth the visit during free times.

A nice to place to mellow. I was pretty tired walking around the Gothic section of the city. I sat down in the church and listened to the organ music. Beautiful. A nice place for some quiet reflection.

Fabulous 13th century church. This is a gem of a church with a collection of the most beautiful stained glass windows I have seen in many a year. The church is in the Ribera district. It is really easy to miss as it is hemmed in by narrow street and not easy to find. It really is worth taking the time to go to this district and seek out the church. You will not be disappointed. The churches name means St Mary of the sea and it was built between 1329 - 1383 during the hight of Catalan Gothic period.

Beautiful, serene and calming Church. The Church is a piece of Art. You don't see such outstanding architecture in our modern buildings today. You may not be an architectural geek, but you will be astounded by what you see. Goose bumps were all over me as I walked into this beautiful Church. I felt a calm and sense of joy being here. Visiting Basicilla de Santa Maria del Mar is a wonderful experience for all. In the immediate vicinity you can visit the many good cafes and restaurants along Carrer de l'Argenteria and many small curio shops in the area. I was with my wife and two adult kids. A definite must visit in Barcelona not o be missed.

Beautiful!!. Beautiful, impressive Gothic church. Black baby Jesus and white baby Jesus are right next to each other, which was different and interesting, but I didn't have much time to investigate as it was closing time when I arrived. The outside is also beautiful
Superb. I could have stayed for hours, glorious paintings and architecture much larger I side than I anticipated. Please find time to visit.

Incredible find!. This basilica is majestic! Discovered it in an evening tour but it as closed, begged my private tour guide to see it during the day and it was gorgeous. The column, the stained glass, the unique rooms, the catacombs, the grave stones, all breath taking
very simple yet beautiful. great to walk around and enjoy the church inside and outside. There are also few cafe's in front of the entrance and we had coffee there to enjoy the views
Classic cathedral. Far from the most famous cathedral in town, this church holds its own with a towering ceiling and impressive gothic stone architecture.

Worth wandering.... This is an absolutely beautiful basilica and it's so amazing that this was built so long ago. Old world craftsmanship and talent are truly missing today. The stained glass windows here are gorgeous, the arches, the alcoves, the acoustics, the organ... just make sure to go see this place!

Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and even better inside. Visited the cathedral on a sunday and it was open as normalSome pictures here are showing saint eulalia / barcelona cathedral. they are close but very different - del mar has a circular stained glass window and almost flat roofing, saint eulalia/barcelona catedral has gothic spires and a gaggle of 13 swans in a courtyard

The cathedral of the sea. Entering the tour today I quickly realized I was not the only one there that had read the book of Falcones and kind of had to see the church.It was quit fun to listen to the facts of the church and the building of it and how it differs from the book. Nonetheless, some of the key notes are right on. The light in this church is special.The tour included a trip up to the roof of the building, which gave not only an insight to the building itself, but an excellent view of Barcelona.

Go here! And the neighborhood is great!. We accidentally came during a wedding but it was open to the public and just added to the experience. Very beautiful church and the neighborhood surrounding (El Born) is great to browse and spend and afternoon. Definitely stop by! Then go to tapas at Ziryab Fusion Tapas near by - small but fantastic place!

Better than the Cathedral. Less visited than the Cathedral in the Barcelona, but equally if not more beautiful, is the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. As the name suggests, it is near the ocean, and if one pays for a tour, you can climb to the top and see the ocean. I found this church to be very peaceful and a great place to stop, rest, and enjoy the surroundings. The Basilica has wonderful stained glass, and it is of interesting design since it doesn't have a transept.

A lovely Church. We explored this church almost by accident, as walking by saw it and went in. Its arched ceilings and stained glass windows magic. The first corner stone laid in 1838 and the last in 1889, if my memory serves me well, so its really old.

Beautiful Cathedral - not to miss. It is easy to get caught up in the majesty of the Barcelona Cathedral, but eqi-distant from the Jaume 1 metro to the east lies this wonderful structure. Graceful and elegant, the stained glass windows on the upper levels bring in beautiful light. There is no admission fee. This summer, hours were Monday to Saturday: 9:00am to 1:00pm and 5:00pm to 8:30pm. Sunday: 10:00am to 2:00pm and 5:00pm to 5:00pm.
Not like the Sagrada Familia but worth seeing. The church is very beautiful, is not like the Sagrada Familia if you expect something similar, but it´s worth seeing.

In and around a great part of the gothic quater.... Another must see, especuialy considering the book about the Basilica. And there are great places around like the Picasso Museum, and nice places to eat.

A must see in Barcelona. Located in the gothic area, near Ramblas and the coast, this was a great find we didn't expect to see. Wonderful stained glass, and a strong sense of peace and calm. Rest your puppies while taking in some incredible architecture.
Amazing - gorgeous architecture. Well worth seeing - we took lots of photos on our visit and the atmosphere was lovely :-)If you get the opportunity you should visit

Beautiful cathedral. Many cathedrals look like they are novels with many authors and I find them dark and a bit dingy, but this is an elegant cathedral, simple in concept and design in the old part of town that I thoroughly enjoyed in its simplicity. Probably the result of it having been built in only 80 years.
Super beautiful inside and outside. Great place especially during the christmas time. If you have read the book The Cathedral in Barcelona - you need to see this place!
Lovely!. For free entry and such an amazing church you would be silly not to go. Loved it! Guide tours are available and are cheap but it isn't essential for the visit. Very quiet and peaceful
Stunning. Beautiful Basilica that's fully operational! So if you time it right you could attend mass, or if you get lucky you could maybe catch a wedding!

Churches are always interesting. Unlike other cities, the churches in Barcelona are free to enter. Even though I'm a Humanist and not a Christian, churches are always interesting, even if it's just to see the obscene amount of money that has been spent on their construction. That and the stained glass windows .... I love stained glass windows.
Oasis of peace. Very quiet and peaceful atmosphere - as if the noise of the city cannot get in. At once you feel calm. Joyful and light interior.

Beautiful. After coming from Scandinavia it was nice to see a catholic cathedral again. This one does not disappoint. A lovely place with many art pieces and a great garden- if you look up from one corner you can even see the top of the basilica. Worth going to.

A special place, especially for Catholics. Spend some time and go to Mass if you can.. Did not expect to be so impressed with this church. Hard to say why, but it is so imposing and old and still in use. Many alcoves with various saints, priests buried underfoot, imposing organ that is played during Mass...Also it is free. Other churches were not and just don't agree with that. We stayed for mass in spanish, even though we did not understand most of it, what is great about Catholic services is that they are all the same formula so you get the gist. Great priest, animated and youngish. Light a candle and pray in the side chapel which is stunning behind the altar. Mass is in the small chapel during the week. Noon on Saturdays (or Sundays?) is the English international mass. Evening mass followed by a great dinner in the El Born area is highly recommended. Also do be respectful and don't set your camera noisily clicking panoramic photos over and over, or walk in in your bathing suit and a cover up, or have your small children running around, or sit and use the prayer pews as a hangout for teenagers. This is just so rude.
Amazing inside. Went in to the Basilica not sure what to expect but it takes your breath away, absolutely beautiful inside, a must visit especially as it is free
Space and light . This basilica was built to take advantage of light and space. It's simple and complex at the same time. Wonderful history and background. Sometimes I come in just to think.

Magnificent!. Perfectly gorgeous computer that deserves your time and attention. Grab a candle on your way in and pay your own and dedicated to someone you love. This is one church that you want to spend a little bit of time in. I enjoyed it thoroughly especially wandering slowly about. Loved it!!
It's great and FREE. It's good. It's free and very nice inside. There is someone who checks your clothes. So girls you can't wear tank tops.

Another amazing site to see when in Barcelona. Amazing, takes your breath away. Photography opportunities in every direction you turn and look. Long waiting lines makes it annoying though. If your time is limited, either dont go inside or do it quickly.
Great basilica. This basilica has Been taken care of and is worth the visit. There is no charge for admission and there are a lot of shops and restaurants all around it.

Sensational. From the outside this cathedral looks kind of dull and boring but from the minute you step inside it is alive with colours from the beautiful stained glass windows and the exquisite domed ceiling. There is such an aura of peace in this cathedral.
wonderful gothic church. truly a beautiful church full of stained glass and an aura of old world charm. A must see in Barcelona.
Beauty in Simplicity. The beauty of this church is its simplicity . If you are passing by- do step in. The crepes and icecream shop outside the church is worth a stop.

Beautiful Gem. We came across this at the end of our walking tour of the Gothic Quarter, and decided to check it out at the last second. We were glad we did! The interior is simple but beautiful, with soaring pillars and arches. Very quiet and peaceful. A hidden gem hidden among the hustle and bustle of the Gothic Quarter.

A great place to visit. We had a tour of the Basilica who was very informative and friendly. We were taken up to the roof for spectacular views over the city and enjoyed explanations not just about the architecture of the Santa Maria but other nearby buildings and attractions to.

Interesting church and good guiding.. This is one of the lesser costly activities in Barcelona. The entrancefee of 8€ (not 80€ as on other post here states) is worth it. If you have read the book Cathedral of the Sea by Spanish author Ildefonso Falcones - this is the church that is centred in the book. Visiting this site and listing to the guide gives you a new feel and understanding of the life in old Barcelona. Actually, what the guide could have done is play more on that book and tied everything even more together.

Peaceful and beautiful. We went on a day when there was a wedding ceremony in the basilica and it added to the atmosphere. The place is quite huge and is worth a visit even though its off the main sites.
Unusual Basilica. we discovered this basilica on our bike tour. we loved it as it was different than the other churches. Very beautiful and peaceful. A little oasis in the city

Stunning. This is a beautiful building , such stunning architecture and the stain glass is amazing. I know there are a lot of amazing churches and cathedrals in this city but this is a very fine example a real must see.

High ceilings make this a fine church. Tucked away, but still in the main tourist section of Barcelona, Santa Maria is remarkable for its long (plain) pillars and high ceilings. I do not recall previously seeing a gothic church with rose windows as part of the clerestory.
Beautiful experience . This basilica is beautiful, the vaults and ceilings add an air of elegance and mysticism. The basilica was busy and the inner courtyard was quiet and peaceful.

Wonderful experience. Unlike many other 'attractions' this one is free although only at certain times of the day. I possibly found my visit here more moving than that to La Sagrada in so far as it doesn't attract the hordes of tourists. Very much still a place of worship with absolutely stunning architecture and huge historical significance. I can't envisage not going here again if I find myself returning to Barcelona,

Grand. Beautiful gothic cathedral set tight in the old town of Barcelona lots to see inside and you have access to the roof via lift with good views over the City. 7 euros to enter ladies wear appropriate clothing if not then prepare to cover up. If in doubt ask male attendant at the door.

Very much alive. We were staying in the Banys Oriental Hotel just along Carrer de l'Argenteria from Placa de Santa Maria and went out for breakfast on a Sunday morning. We noticed a large crowd pouring down the street and followed it to a large church which we later learned was the famous Santa Maria del Mar. The place was packed with worshipers gathering for a special service and we slipped into the back of the packed nave and watched as costumed children walked up to the altar.We were unable to determine what was special about this service, but were delighted to be inside the beautiful soaring edifice when it was so full of life.
beautiful old facility. Churches are all over in Barcelona, and this one is lovely old and impressive with it's high columns and it's history

My Favorite!. I have visited many cathedrals all over Europe and this is my favorite. It's not too large; historically interesting (Gaudi got his inspiration for the Sagrada Familia columns from this cathedral and he frequently worshiped here.) This is a very spiritual space and "alive" with soul.
Beatiful church. We visited just the church and didnt take any tour. Visit is free, we just admired the interior and glass paintings.

Amazing.. This was one of the highlights of Barcelona. I loved the story of the Artist and viewing his work. It was under renovation when we were there but still found it fascinating and would go back.
Basilica Sants Maria del Mar. A nice Medieval church, but not particularly different than many other churches in Europe. It's free during certain times of the day. Needs a good restoration.
Pretty church. Very pretty church to visit. Not too busy even in June. Gothic style, the inside is amazing. 5 min walk from Jaume I metro station,

Beautiful church in El Born. Most walking tours will take you to this lovely church in El Born. An important stop for many reasons as Santa Maria del Mar is a beloved saint in Barcelona. Also, this church was built by the community for the community and only took 55 years to build. An interesting church to visit with a great story. If you're in the area its worth a stop.

Very glad we took the tour. We arrived at this church just in time for the English tour to start...what great timing. Our tour was led by a fellow named Pol and he was an excellent guide. The tour takes you to the very top of the building with stops on different levels as you are ascending. You will learn interesting things on each stop. Also from the very top Pol pointed out various other buildings around the town and talked about those as well. It was me, my wife, and our 17 year old daughter and all commented afterward that it was a great place to visit and an take a guided tour of.
Quiet, full of light, restuful. A gem, and a perfect place to sit and take in the play of light and stone, with the quiet necessary to savor the architecture.

Go to the Sunday service. The church is large and do not have much decoration due to an ancient fire. This gives a more rough look which I liked – different to many other old cathedrals and churches. We visited it a Sunday late afternoon and enjoyed part of the mass which can be recommended.

I found it awe inspiring. The Sagrada Familia gets all the attention and is a wonder of the world, but this beautiful basilica must not be missed. In the middle of a 'now' up and coming gorgeous area, this basilica was built and paid for by the working people in the area and you can somehow sense the history and reverence within the walls. One of my favorite places in Barcelona.

Beautiful - favourite church of Barcelona. This was my favourite church. Just sometime very understated and serene about it even when full of visitors. Free, as are all the main churches of Barcelona before 12 noon
nice old one. Nice old cathedral with nice arch. You can walk around and enjoy the art. Beside the spiritual vision it has.

Peaceful, beautiful church. A peaceful respite from the surrounding hustle and bustle, much simpler architecture than the cathedral and a wonderful history in its walls. Sometimes it feels like you just don't want to see one more church, but this one is definitely worth the visit. If I chose one in Barcelona, this would be it.
The one!. If you have read the book, you can't miss visiting it. You will feel transported in time and you will remember the whole story of generations dedicated to bouild it.

Ladies keep shoulders covered, or no entry allowed.. Nice old church. 3 or 4 beggars outside. About 7 euros to get in. Roof visit included by lift. Nice view on roof area. Lots of tourists with cameras, smart phones and selfie sticks. Women have to have shoulders covered for respect.
Beautiful. . Truly beautiful. Love the attention to detail. Great place to slow down after walking through the Gothic Quarter. Cost around 7 euros.
Lovely quarter. This lovely church is located on a lovely square surrounded by lovely boutiques and bars. A vibrant place.

Really worth a visit. We visited early evening around 6.30pm so our visit was free.
This church is beautiful and even though it was rather busy the atmosphere was wonderful.
So happy we took time to visit.
Nice building in fun district. Very nice architecture from the outside but also situated in area with great nightlife - bars and Tapas
Attend Sunday International Mass. Very beautiful church, blocked off tourist while we attended international mass at noon, beautiful organ music.
Understated beauty. A beautiful church, peaceful and understated yet impressive. A must see for visitors, and set in a lovely square for some great tapas
Peaceful. This is a fantastic place if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city life. Makes sure you purchase a candle!
Pretty. Beautiful basilica in the heart of Barcelona. Great walking areas around as well. We visited after 5PM when admission is free
Peace in the midst of a busting exciting city. We went to Mass in Catalan three times. The time is 7pm every day and it sets you up for dinner immediately afterwards

Love this cathedral. We visited twice; both at 9am and at 2pm with a guide. The visit at 9am was perfect, it was so serene and beautiful. The tour at 2pm was great; the guide was knowledgeable and keen to share. Would recommend.

Attended Mass. It was a good mass, and I attended the noon mass that was international where the priest spoke in a number of different languages (Catalan, Spanish, English), but seeing la Sagrada Familia before, this location while very nice does pale in comparison to la Sagrada Familia.

Lovely, calm cathderal. We took our daughters here to contrast the sagrada familiar, and were thoroughly pleased we did. It's a lovely cathedral, lots of beautifully decorated chapels, and some stunning stained glass. We were lucky to get the lift to the roof for €3 (children free) which only seems to run at certain times of day.The views over Barcelona were lovely, and made up for my daughter being too little to do the towers of the sagrada. Thoroughly recommended
One of a kind. Antoni Gaudi sure had a supremely distinctive style. It's quite apparent in everything he designed. This monument is a must visit.

Steep price good view. It costs 7€ to enter which I assume goes to the church/cathedral to help conserve it but still it seems very steep. There is a lack of information inside the church however it is a beautiful church and also has a nice garden with geese (living in not so clean conditions). The view from the roof is nice, they are currently restoring the roof so there isn't too much space up there but worth the lift ride to the top.
Beautiful. This church is very beautiful but is not very well mantained. Is free, i believe that's why. Old church but very nice done, in theyr style.
Worth a visit when walking around the La Rambla. We attended mass at the church during our recent visit to Barcelona. Interesting, historical basilica.
Don't miss the elevator to the top. Or the basilica. So much to take in. Really inspiring. Go on a Saturday late afternoon and stay for the dancing in the square.

Beautiful Gothic Basilica in the old quarter. Located near the Museo Picasso and a few streets off of Via Laietana is the Basilica of Santa Maria Del Mar. It's a beautiful example of a gothic church built in the 14th Century. It took over 50 years to complete. It's well worth the admission price of 5 euro's to see this wonderful old church.

Stunning. This is one of the most beautiful churches in BCN. Don't miss it! After hearing stories of the church during our excellent Runner Bean Old City walking tour, we decided to go inside Santa Maria del Mar, and we're very glad we did. It's a truly inspiring place:)

If. you think think the Basilica of the Sagrada is too modern, go an visit this Basilica. Impressive and traditional while at the same time showing the charm of hundreds of years, right in the middle of a very interesting neighborhood - probably the best Barcelona butcher right next door as well as the coffee, tea, nuts and Picasso museum not far away. Great architecture -- which I think Gaudi might have gotten some idea from :)

Yes to Flamenco at Basilica . So we saw these 3 awesome flamenco guitarists play here. It seemed like an unassuming gig and we weren't sure what to expect, but for about 20 euros a ticket we thought it was worth a pop. And wow. The show was great. 100 people. Super personal. Watching 3 incredible players smash you into next week with their playoff ability. It's a must. If you get the chance.

Wildly stunning. What can I say..? Gaudi was a genius. The tour we did gave us so much insight into his life and work; it was fascinating. The attention to detail and the inspiration from nature was so lovely.

A beautiful church full of history, peace and tranquility. To compare this with the Sagrada Familia would be wrong, but to me, this was a far more religious experience than the other was. And much is made of Gaudi's "tree" columns in the other church - well personally I think he got the idea from this church and the other Catholic one, the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Mar! Wonderful stain glass windows and altar piece. Definitely would recommend it.

Nice cathedral in a good location for outdoor eating. Came for tapas and wine, the cathedral was a nice added plus. It costs 5 euros to go inside so many tourists only make it to the doorway to peer in. Inside it is very nice but not so different from the many other European cathedrals.

Beautiful. Really worth seeing together with all the gothic quarter. Beautiful gothic church that proves the long history of the city. There is a time in the afternoon when you pay to enter but otherwise it is always free.

Stunning. This has to be one of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have ever seen. The original church was constructed in the 13 th century and has continued on until the 20th century . To the right side of the church is an open court yard with St Georges fountain and the geese that live there to the left hand side of the church is an elevator that will take you up to the Roof that overlooks the two bell towers , two gothic spires and the cimborio not to mention the view over this fabulous city . It will cost 7€ to get in but is worth it bring your camera .
Beautiful church. You must enter in this church, its a great way to know more about the Catalã architecture. The visit will surprises you.

Beautiful. A hidden gem in the small plaza - this cathedral is worth finding and checking out. It sits along the edge of a small plaza and is very large and quite beautiful. After seeing the cathedral, stroll any of the streets surrounding the plaza.

One of the oldest in town. Santa Maria del Mar is a beautiful catalan gothic cathedral, totally worth visiting.
Don't miss the opportunity, if you can, and enjoy the beautiful interior and its proportions.
Simple and elegant.
Dissapointed. As one of the main attractions this was so unorganised it took the shine from the holiday. Very long waiting times and the building itself covered in scaffolding and tarps
Magnificent. Beautiful and elegant, bathed in warm hues it is unmissable once inside the huge cathedral. For all lovers of church/cathedral interiors it is a good option.

Worth a Visit, Within the El Born Area. Not too far from our hotel, we stopped in and was totally amazed at the interior of this church. In a city with Sagrada Familia, this church doesn't stand out in the tourist books, but worth a visit.
Basilica Santa Maria deal Mar. This is a beautiful church, the workmanship that went into building this was magnificent. There are so many beautiful churches to see.
nice visit. not to special from outside but Nice inside and good Place to relax or find Peace when Things are busy outside.a Place for harmony and peace

Catedral del mar. Catedral del mar, read the book and than go to the streets around the chuch and than enter the church, sit down and let let your imagination go! It us a beautifull place to be. The construction started in the beginning of the 13th century......find someone who can tell you more and visit the roof!
Amazing. This medieval basilica is a must-see when you are in Barcelona. The vastness of the church is awe-inspiring.
Leave it alone! Don't come here!. Such a hidden gem in the centre of Barcelona. Not crowded so you have the time to appreciate its beauty! What's even more brilliant is it's free!
Lovely. It is beautiful!! You just dont expect to enjoy another church afther Sagrada Familia but this one is different. It is very nice, you wont regret it !
Beautiful gothic church. We stopped in this basilica while we were doing a tour of the neighborhood, and enjoyed seeing the Gotchic style architecture. Make this part of your visit.
Art and architecture. There is an entrance ticket between 1pm to 5pm. Otherwise free. Ticket includes rooftop entrance. Sunday masses are held.

Don't miss the guided "roof top" tour.. This is an impressive building, made even more interesting by the very skilled guide the took us to the "roof top". If you are going to visit one cathedral in Barcelona you must visit The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar.

One of the best churches i have been to. Did not purposely come to this church but chanced upon it and loved it! The church is not big but the interior was grand and gave a very intimate feeling. Maybe bring you closer to God possibly?There are alot of buskers and flea marts just outside the church so the atmosphere is very lively as well. A good venue to spend an evening. Kindly dress approriately when entering the church as a form of respect pls. Thanks!!! :)

Beautiful, old, gothic architecture. Enjoyed viewing this old Basilica with its gothic charm. It is free to the public. Please note: woman must wear longer shorts, pants or skirts to enter. As I was not aware of this, I was thankful that there was a vendor in the square selling scarves (for $2€) that I was able to buy and use as a wrap to make a skirt.

The peoples' church. This is an incredibly beautiful church. We went there to hear a concert, but want to go back to look more closely at the architecture. Check the hours, because there are often concerts on the weekends - and listening to an orchestra and choir there was a great way to experience the building as it has been used for centuries.For a fun introduction to the history of this church, read Ildefonso Falcones's Cathedral of the Sea (El Catedral del Mar).
Attractive Gothic church. A plain open plan relatively unadorned building due to a fire which destroyed pews and screens. Shoulders and knees need to be covered.

Basilica. One of the finest examples of gothic architecture ive seen.The interior is outstanding with an organist playing,adding to the atmosphere.A beautiful serene place which stands the test of time.

Beautiful . Lovely church.... What else can one say.
Must visit. Had some construction noise inside for an event which made the ambience less than pious- but that's nitpicking.
Stained glass windows and love the heavy doors

Simpler and beautiful. This is a smaller Basilica in El Born. Unlike the main Cathedral or the Sagrada Família, it is not massively ostentatious and is all the better for it. It is an excellent demonstration of the Catalan gothic style (wide, not high) with an amazing vaulted roof. Cool and quiet, it makes a good break from the heat and bustle outside.

Beautiful Gothic cathedral. This is not the main cathedral that we're talking about, but another one in the Barri Gotic. It is not huge and bulky; it's smaller, and the inside with its high ceilings and columns, it is beautiful and gives the impression of lightness and aspiration to the heavens. We sat in on part of a mass in Catalan; they also have masses in Spanish and an international mass. It's well worth a few minutes to look around if you are nearby.

Beautiful. It is free 0800-1245 Monday-Wednesday and charges €7 entrance per person there after - also modest clothing must be worn - for men and women no clothing above the knees and shoulders should be covered - they are very strict on this. They also don't like people sitting on their steps - however it is well worth getting up early to see it!

Great Basilica. This location is in the El Born area where we stayed. The inside and outside of the church are architectural wonders. We stopped here often as we moved about the neighborhood. It is open many times during the day and night too. These old churches like this in Barcelona are things of beauty.

One of the best. This is one of the best gothic cathedrals in Barcelona and acoording to the residents its the best. Free ot enter it is işnt El Born area, close to the sea. The tranquil environment of this cathedral makes it much different from the others.
Ok. We bobbed in here to have a quick look. It was ok but nothing spectacular. It was free when we went in.
Just Another Cathedral. Outside in nicer than the interior. Nothing special. Uninteresting art, typical gothic architecture, unremarkable crypt behind bars.

Don't miss this beautiful spot. We had just been to Sagrada Familia, but this church is very different. It has years of history, darkness where Sagrada has light, but feels worshipful in its own way. When we entered, organ music was playing, which really enhanced the atmosphere. We didn't take the tour, but I would have liked to. I did read the novel Cathedral of the Sea; if you're interested in Catalan history, don't miss this novel by Falcones.

Very pretty, but can't compare with Italy or some of the beautiful cathedrals.. The building style was beautiful and it has gorgeous windows. Do not expect gorgeous art and paintings here. It has very few. None the less, worth a visit if you are in the vicinity.

Beautiful Church with fantastic side altars!. This Church is easily accessible and has many beautiful side altars. There is one which has a replica of the Black Madonna, which looks the same to me as the one at Monserrat. If you can't make it there, this is a great alternative.

Beautiful Basilica. We happened upon this basilica while walking around Barcelona. We stepped inside to find a beautiful, old basilica.
There are many vestibules with features in them. There is also a smaller sanctuary contained within.
It is free to walk through and will take less than one hour.
Classic Beauty. This basilica is hundreds of years old and well restored. Tours are available at a modest price. Awe inspiring inside and it's in the Gothic Quarter.

Beautiful old church. This is a must see. I believe,this is the oldest church in Barcelona. It did not cost anything to go inside although there are only certain times it is open for visitors because of church services. The architecture is amazing. The huge stone blocks were carried from the rock quarry at Montjuic. The building was started in the mid 1300's. It had been damaged by a large earthquake as well as war. Do not miss visiting this church. The area around the church is great to walk around, dine, hang out, etc. Inside the church is a timeline with the history of the Basilica.

Steeped in history . This church was explained by our tour guide as a true act of commitment and faith. The church was hand built by the members of the community hundreds of years ago. Stones were dragged from a nearby mountain on the backs of people and animals for over 54 years. The interior of the church is quite plain given the nature of most catholic churches but that is intentional so I am told. It is also free until about 1 in the afternoon I believe!
Beautiful basilica. So many beautiful basilicas in Europe and this is another one of them... worth seeing and spending time in the area

Lovely. Stop in. . This is worth popping in. It's beautiful and simple & somehow moving. Maybe better to go before Sagrada Familia. There are hours when it's free if your budget is tight. Guided tour gets you access to the roof and beautiful views of the city. I thought it was worth it. If you're looking for a quiet place to meditate, pray or take a break this is a wonderful space.

Worth the walk in the neighborhood. The Basilica is very nice, but I think I enjoyed more the walk through the neighborhood that led me there. The small streets, the little cafes and shops, and then a few minutes of meditation inside. Pretty stained glass windows, old architecture, not too crowded, no fee to get in.
Great.... It's actually quite hidden from the streets of Rambla but never the less the beauty of the architecture was great. A must visit for history lovers.

Must see. One of my highlights in barcelona. Wow. What am amazing place. Location central and entry is free. Make sure to bring your camera. The detail was Devine and was one of my favourite sttractions
Magnificent. I love churches and this one does not disappoint. I could have sat in here for hours as it is beautiful and some much detail.

Magestic . Beautiful comforting spiritual visit
There were hundreds of people in and out but all so very respectful (quiet )of the church that one could enjoy everything

This place is a 'Must See' if you visit Barcelona. You must go to see the Basilica of Santa del mar. It is so large and rich with history and engineering mastering. You will appreciate waiting info the lines to see this most beautiful place of God.
It is not expensive and this place will capture everyone's attention.
Wow!!. This is over the top Gothic with lots of gold and silver. It's very impressive and huge. Yes it is beautiful but simplicity has been avoided at all costs.

It is a compulsatory visit in Barcelona. It is a gorgeus church. Not a cathedral...as some people think because of the novel. Read the real history in wikipedia and you will enjoy the visit for sure. Fantastic for all publics.

Very nice church. It is really nice architecture and atmosphere. As it is supposed to be, free of charge, and in Barcelona is not so common. With its neighborhood is definitely worthed more that a visit. You may pray too, also if is full of visitors.

Serene and charming. This basilica is a highlight when visiting the Gothic Quarter. The area is touristy, so one finds welcome respite inside this sacred space. Our tour guide explained how the local folk built this church with dedicated love, albeit with limited funds. The iconography on the exterior evidences this heartfelt labour. Catholics can light votives, and enjoy quiet moments of reflection.
Wow. What a surprise, breathtaking on the inside, understated exterior, must take the 2$ trip to the roof. We also had the pleasure to witness a military wedding, swords and flowers.

beautiful. Stunning basilica easy accessible from La Ramhkasnor stop no 2 on city bus tours. Small gift shop and museum nearbye with some fab art pieces in the grounds. Plenty of bars resturants and access to the gothic qtr shop. 10 min walk from La ramblas. Lots of street entertainers
Worth a visit. If you have spare time, pop in and walk around for half an hour. Not as impressive as Sagrada familia but still very nice.

Beautiful Basilica in Barcelona. The Catholic Church outdid itself in Spain with cathedrals and basilicas by the score.Barcelona is no exception.Just off La Rambla de Catalunya is the impressive Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar.The plain almost square box façade hides inside some amazing gothic architecture.The relics and chapels are impressive as are the gothic vaulted nave ceilings.Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing Architecture. The interior of this church is spectacular. I mean its just breath taking. I'm looking at the extremely high arches and domed ceilings and wondering how did the people build this thing. I love the location in the Gothic Quarter. The narrow streets and the Spanish style buildings are just stunning. A must see in my opinion.

Only Gothic Church in Barcelona. If you want to see a Gothic church in Barcelona you have to visit this church located in the Gotic Area, it has nice restaurants near it and it´s less crowded than the other Barcelona attractions. It has a really interesting history. Depend on the time you can get in for free. Good place for thoughts and relaxation.
Highly recommended. The most authentic gothic church, I liked it better than the cathedral because it is less a crowed and it still seems a church more than a chaotic market
Heart of the barrio gotic. Nice church with medieval architecture, can be very crowded and lines can be long, right in the heart of barrio gotic

A beautiful place for thoughts, inspiration and relaxation!. In your search through the Born & Gotic area this is really a place to stop by.From the outside during day time it seems nice - but step in and be surprised - simply amazing. Note the opening hours though!The inside of the this cathedral is stunning - unbelievable thinking about the time it was build.The mosaics are incredible - beaming colored lights towards the columns. We also stopped by on a Saturday evening to see the "church at work" - simply magnificent!We did not take the tour through the building - but it should be highly recommended.

A lovely place to hide from the rain, Atmospheric too. I was lucky enough to sneak in through a side door, which felt very intimate - not as busy as the main Cathedral but well worth a look round as well - pop inside for a few minutes to escape the hubbub and take in the incredible architecture and calming atmosphere - my pics aren't that good - but do have a look.

Visited near closing time. Whist the inside of the church was lovely the silence was shattered 5 minutes before closing when the man shouted everyone had to get out. I understand it was time to close but I think there may be a nicer way to get people to leave. It may be easier to close entry earlier and then by the actual closing time the church would be empty.
Just a glance. It was close by teh moment I was there. But is open to the public for a price . Definitely a beautiful masterpiece you must visit

Good gothic cathedral. It is a nice cathedral to see but not the most amazing one i've seen. The catedral is more beautiful, but this one is in the middle of small streets that are nice to stroll down

Beautiful church. Beautiful church, can stop by on the way to the Gothic Quarters. Entry is free after 3pm. The church does not have a ramp or elevators, so you have to carry the stroller on a short flight of stairs.
very pretty. very beautiful church.. nestled in the small streets of the gothic square, i stumbled on it by accident but I'm glad i went inside.
Lovely, easy walk, stop by each chapel. A lovely gothic church with no entry free. Worth seeing and it is in the heart of the Gothic district.

Finally!. On the last trip to Barcelona I had really wanted to view this basilica, but alas it was closed and it was raining - so I had to wait nearly three years. It was worth the wait. It is an austerely grand masterpiece.

Majestic church. This church is really majestic and big. The story of the church is quite unique so try reading about it before visiting. Surrounded by the streets of the Born district it is worth the visit.

Just Amazing, when you know the history. This church is located in the old medieval district. The history of how it was built in just 54 years by local working residents is nothing short of amazing. It is plain, clean and elegant all the same time. It lacks all the glamour of the Gaudi works, but the beauty in this church is all about the personal hands that built it stone by stone.

Standard looking gothic church. Barcelona's gothic churches tend to be unremarkable and this one is no different. It's big but there are many, many larger gothic churches. Its architecture is fairly bare and devoid of interesting details both inside and out. The interior space is large and impressive and the rose window is nice, but neither are spectacular. The interior is bare stone, dimly lit and with very little light coming in though the small stained glass windows. You will see no frescoes or no detailed gothic sculpture. Very bare and minimalistic, which, to be fair, can be impressive in a way. Overall the church is an OK attraction for a 10 minute visit, but will not be a mind shattering experience for anyone.
The best in Barcelona. Amazing gothig church, pure and naked stone. Elegant and yet sophisticated. My favorite in the city. Located in the old medieval district, A great walk.

A Not-So-Gaudi basilica. Lacking the ornate showiness of Gaudi's more famous work, the beauty here is in the history and the simplicity. Even if you're neither a devout Christian nor serious architecture or history buff, you should stop by.

really good free attraction. the basilica is wonderful inside , when we visited an organ recital was taking place , it is not open at night but the illuminated bell towers are a stand out feature of the old town
Catalan Gothic at its best. Loved simplicity and beauty of this church, immense feeling of peace and tranquility it offers should be experienced.

A look into the history . This church is a living peace of Barcelona's history. It is a very imminent building, worth the visit, and I recommend also not miss the memorial in it's back: pay respect for one of the saddest days of Cataluña.

Loved the pillars around the altar. Casually eating lunch at a cafe outside the not too imposing front doors. We took a look inside, absolutely stunning in its gothic simplicity. Only 5 Euros to enter but surprisingly quiet and empty, take the opportunity to appreciate the peace you will find here as well as enjoy the stunning architecture. It's worth taking the few steps up to the gallery behind the altar to take a couple of different views
City trip Barvelona. The cathadraal is beautiful. You pay 7 euro but it is very nice. Afther 14.00 you can go the roof than you have very good vieuw of Barcelona.
Pretty church , go when free. Check their site as the church has free hours and i would not value this worth the entrance fee. Nice area to walk in regardless if u only peak in through the glass.

Beautiful. A beautiful Basililca and worthy of a visit. It is a working church and therefore respect is required, no shorts, etc. The Bishops Palace is right next door. This gothic area is full of surprises.

Gothic at it's best!. So, once you've seen one Basilica you've seen the rest… not true. Admire this lovely peaceful place, and spend a few moments in a busy city gathering your thoughts. Worth a few minutes of anyone's time.

It only worth if you read the book.... The church itself has nothing appealing and if you never read the book "The Cathedral of the Sea" from Ildefonso Falcones, don't waist your time and specially money....

Magical!. Everyone visits La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona - they should also visit Santa Maria del Mar. This interesting Church was built by local people and is very simple and plain - but all the more beautiful for that. The stained glass is lovely and the proportions in the church are very graceful.
Very good old gothic church. . Well worthy a quick visit here. Not overly ornate but this place has an atmosphere missing in some of the other churches. Quite old and very high in the gothic style.

Must see!. Felt like we were in a truly holy place. The building was astounding and we felt this really outshone La Sagrada Familia - it felt like a place of worship rather than a tourist attraction. It was also free!Definitely worth a visit as it's much quieter than most other places we visited but one of the most memorable. Most people covered their shoulders (saw two with vest tops on) and all covered their knees.
Another Beautiful Church in Barcelona. This is a beautiful church although not as large as the nearby Catedral nor that impressive but it is still a magnificent church and definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful architecture. Lovely medieval church, good to have Wikipedia to hand as you look around as there isn't much signage. Not a Gaudi building (built 400 years before he lived!), think the reviewer below got confused with La Sagrada Familia.
A must see in Barcelona. Entering the Basilica brings a peace to your soul. That's the best way to describe how I felt.It is a beautiful sight t see.

Elegant simplicity. I enjoyed a few moments of quiet contemplation in Santa Maria del Mar. Completed in only about 50 years, this church has a clean architectural style that doesn't seem jumbled. Santa Maria del Mar incorporates the typical Catalan style of having the organ on the side, rather than at the rear of the church. There used to be more elaborate decor inside, but it was burned during a war.

Less Gaudy Than Gaudi.. A massive but peaceful space, dark but illuminated by stained glass windows, capable of accommodating worshippers, sightseers and passers-by, such as myself, who found it by accident and found in it some moments of peace and respite from the busy city outside.
El Bon Area. This is a beautiful little church in the heart of the avant-garde and upcoming El Bon Area. Do not miss this hidden delight.
My favorite basilica. Beautiful, calm and always worth a visit. Typical gothic architecture in the middle of charming El Born. Lots of restaurants, cafes, bars and shopping just outside.
Stunning. Again, an amazing work of devotion. Beautiful detail and the stained glass windows in the right light are amazing.

Most amazing place i have been!. It would have been easy to spend atleast one hour there. When i was stepping in, my mouth was just dropping open. Hard to understand how human hands can have been doing that place. So many amazing targets especially if you love to take fotos. Unforgettable must visit place. You can make beautiful potrets in your home of those glassworks in cathedral. If you have just time for one place to see, its this.

gotic style church. very nice cathedral with concerts and folk dances on sundays with a lot cafe-bars around walking distance-30 min from catalonia placa . by the way . who is afraid of public transport - taxi very cheap inside center 5-6 euro. max. that we paid 10 euro to the park guell-gaudi airport round 30 euro.
Gorgeus!!. You can not miss it when visiting Barcelona. I worth visiting the roof. The area were is located is also a great place to walk.

Awe inspiring history.. Built in the 14th century, this beautiful majestic church will not disappoint those who love history. Hidden in the old crowded alley ways, you just turn a corner and there it is ; massive! We walked around inside and out and also visited at night. There are tours availble althought we were just happy doing our own thing.

Beautiful gothic architecture and stained glass windows. This is worth a stop-in for sure! We happened to be there when a choir was practicing and the sound was amazing. I love the contrast of the stained glass with the old stone. The little chapels weren't the most amazing ones ever, it's worth it more for walking in and seeing the entire thing from the back.

Massive inside. Nice historic building but nothing mind blowing. It does seem to go on forever inside as there are lots of different areas to look around. Highlight for me was the 12th century throne on show in a secured room. Well worth visiting as part of a trip to the Gothic Quarter.

Beautiful and serene. We only had a quick look here, but walking around the outside of this basilica was enough if you only have a short amount of time to spend here. The basilicas in Spain are amazing.

Lovely church. I'm a fan of visiting churches whenever I travel. The Basilica was a beautiful and solemn church that filled me with awe upon my entrance. I said a short prayer, walked around the impressive interior and left with a lighter heart. Go see this church!

Basilica pass through. You can't see Spain or Barcelona without taking a look at the Catholic past that formed their history. This Gothic cathedral is a nice relaxing place to meditate in the rear of the church, after viewing the various side chapels and overlooking the city from the rooftop

Beautiful. . Absolutely loved the experience. Firstly this is a beautiful spiritual place that is a joy to step into from the hustle and bustle of the tourists outside. Secondly there is not a charge to enter and it is just as impressive as the Barcelona Cathedral. Plus they have real candles rather than the battery ones.
Beautiful Basilica. Beautiful Basilica in a beautiful square. It is huge. Walking distance from Las Ramblas. Well worth a visit

Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Cathedral in the Ribera district. A beautiful example of Catalan gothic architecture. Built in the 14th century. Not the biggest cathedral around but there are many side altars with ornate features - worth a visit.
Small. If you plan on only hitting one church dont do this one. Beautiful but it is small and not as impressive as others

STUNNING. This church is worth a visit. It's location in a part of Barcelona that is not so much visited will take you on a great journey to beautiful streets, small bars and restaurants, streets that will remind you of Italy, and that this church. It took my breath away!!! True gothic church, dark inside, free to walk around - time machine to 15th century.

Beautiful piece of Architecture. A wonderful church to wander through. There are many small side chapels to visit in addition to the main part of the church, where the scale is simply staggering! Make sure that you include the roof trip on your tour. A little extra but very well worth it for some staggering views of Barcelona. Very reasonable at c 7euros for the whole experience.
a beautiful church close to the marina. a gothic ,solemn place where sometimes concerts-although with poor acustics-are being held.stroll around to enjoy this peaceful place

Fascinating History!. We bought the tour tickets to go on top of the church and it was well worth timing our visit to see the roof and the bell tower. The view is impressive, especially once the guide tells you what the coast would have looked like when the church was first built and what role the church played. We love history and churches in particular for the role they played in European development, and this one did not disappoint. The rose and its history was also fascinating. Don't miss the guild crypts in the floor!

Pay the extra $$$ and take the tour up to the top!. We had the intention of going here, but we didn't know we could do a tour. It cost us about 8 Euro's each. The guide who took uS was very passionate about their history which made the tour even better. We got to go up the bell tower and then out onto a section of the rooftop. The view was fantastic. Here you could see a panaromic view of Barcelona. We stood outside of the rose window whilst the guide told us the history of this place. Don't be put off by the stairs, it's well worth the effort!
impressive basilica. It was impressive to hear that this basilica was sponsored and built by the people who lived and worked at the port area. It's beautiful and historic.
beautiful. Better than the cathedral, much more beautiful and atmospheric. Also much quieter, and no entrance charge.
Amazing. So beautiful. Don't miss this. The architecture and serenity is very calming. It will take your breath away.

Not just for connoisseurs!. Notre Dame can wait! This Gothic basilica is definitely worth visiting. It has the classical magical-fantastical gothic architecture with a touch of the Catalan take on it. Admirable both from the outside and the inside. Impressive glass work, exceptional columns, filled with architectural details and an overall mystic experience. Well worth a visit for a Mass, some individual prayer, or just for walking through it and admiring it from top to bottom and from side to side, inside and out. Definitely worth checking out its history before going for a full understanding of its magical beauty. The most romantic couples know to get married there. Just captivating.

Beautiful; enchanting. Located in the heart of El Born, next to the Gothic Quarter, this Basilica took my breath away. It is revered by the locals, and so it should be. Built in the Middle Ages, and with a fascinating story surrounding its foundation, you will feel enraptured in its magic mystic qualities. If for some reason you cannot make it to the Cathedral, this Basilica will easily take its place. You should also check is there is any concert scheduled, since the acoustics are wonderful.

Can I say.... ...that this is the most beautiful Church I have ever seen in my life? Yes I can...Santa Maria del Mar, deserves to be visited and admired. The Church of the people, built in only 54 years with contribution and effort from everybody was living in Barcelona in the middle age. STUNNING!
Gothic cathedral. Beautiful Gathic cathedral in close by walking distance off the Gothic Quarter district, very impressive!
Church visited by Saints. Being a Catholic I enjoyed visiting this church. It has a great gift shop and history. Many saints have visited and received sacraments here.
beautiful. Beautiful make sure you go after five as its free to get in and walk around. Before five you have to pay

Must Visit. I have seen many churches but this one was exceptional. It is in heart of Barcelona. It is surrounded by very artistic streets. Local musicians funtastic songs make the environment more beautiful.

Quick and Easy Sight. There's a good chance you'll just stumble upon Santa Maria Del Mar because its tucked away in one of the cities oldest and most lively center neighborhoods. It's a stunning example of gothic architecture. There's usually no line and you can walk right in and enjoy the splendor of the building without lines and hoards of peoples. Be sure to check out the history of the building at the back of the church.
Beautiful . Worth a quick walk through while enjoying the Gothic Quarter. Well preserved basilica with Medieval iron doors that you have to step over to enter.
Wonderful. What a beautiful place and tour. So much knowledge was gained throughout the time there and the rooftop views of the city were awesome.

Quiet and peaceful visit . Impressive and peaceful. The Basilica was hosting a choir at the time we visited which added to the ambience within the sanctuary. Incredible acoustics and beautiful old leaded stained glass allowed the sun to fill the space with colourful light.

Awe-Inspiring Church. While not being travelers to spend a lot of time touring churches, this was a recommendation we found quite positive. Centuries-old architecture and soaring spires inspire a hushed silence upon entering. There is a 5euro fee to get in that is waived after 1700. The placa adjacent to the church featured quaint shops and restaurants, and street performers were there a couple of times when we walked through.

A must see in Barcelona. It becomes difficult to decice what to visit just because there are so much history and beautiful structures/churches/builldings in Barcelona. Make sure not to miss this one.Fantastic structure with a pious atmosphere. Graves from old Catalonian families. Beautiful coloured glass and high columns make this cathedral special.
Really beautiful. Entry fee just 5 € / person. Building is really charming and calm with beautifull stained glasses...

Beatiful. Might be less popular than the other famous churches in Barcelona but the interior is beautiful. To take a few silent moment inside was enriching for me. We noticed that no ticket was necessary to enter and at 20h00 the door was closed.
Peaceful. A beautiful, humble church. My favourite by far. Peaceful, wonderful space for solace. Dress conservative to be able to gain access. Spend some time to explore this beautiful gem.

Lots of History Here.. After reading the book "CATHEDRAL BY THE SEA" Its a must place to visit. felt the hard work the laborers put into the Church. Not the Best looking in Barcelona or Europe for that matter, but lots of history. A must see is the red tile on the floor where over 100 people are buried and the saying "No Traitors Buried Here" as they defended Barcelona to the death.
Lovely. make sure you check what time of the day you are visiting, between certain hours its free to enter :-)
Another great Cathedral. Europe is full of great Cathedrals and this one is just as grand albeit a bit in the shadow of Segrada Familia.

Something very spiritual. This Basilica left us in total awe. Every corner was more breathtaking. It was a bit strange to see Geese on the grounds (inside gated section). Definitely light a candle and do a prayer for loved ones. As we completed the visit, we were strolling outside only to be faced with a beautiful singer who was filling the streets with lyrics to "Ave Maria" - perfect ending!!

Attending Mass in Barcelona. On our recent trip to Barcelona, we wanted to attend an English-speaking mass, if possible. The hotel staff at Oliva Balmes found this Basilica that had an international mass on Sundays at 12 noon. We attended the service in this very beautiful space, and the priest presented parts of the mass in five languages (including English). We spoke to him afterward - very warm and friendly. Great experience!
Expensive ticket. Can only see outside, the ticket was 15€, it's the most expensive ticket of church in Spain. The others only 5. Unless Sagrada Familia that is 22€.
amazing. love this church plus i have a special attachment to it, my parents got married in it over 60 years ago. love it.
Beautiful! . Beautiful place! Free entry, absolutely breath taking when you get inside. They could definitely charge entry for this!

Traditional. Called "La Catedral del Mar". Originally this church was located by the sea and rocks were carried on the shoulders of men to build it. There is a book by Ildefonso Falcones about how the church was built and about life in medieval Barcelona.

Perfection, and FREE. So wonderful to step in here for a rest. One of the most beautiful sights to see in Barcelona.. and if I'm totally honest a rival to the Sagrada Familia in regards to beauty. Love that its free, hope it stays that way.
must see. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is in gothic quarter. It is very nice from outside&inside. Entrance is free.
Breathtaking . I don't even know what to say!! It was amazing from the start; it is a stunningly beautiful building and just so peaceful inside. Everything about it is gorgeous. It can't be missed.

Least interesting of the churches. We saw lots of fabulous churches in Barcelona, but we would take this off the list of must-sees. The interior was dark and the architecture was meh after Sagrada, Gothic, and Montserrat.
Such a beautiful place. I went at 8am and found a most beautiful, stunning setting.The cloisters/ garden is a must see with its palms and geese all in attendance!A must see in a great city!

Family walk. Pleasant to explore on a warm day in Barcelona. Very beautiful but rather crowded.
Worth visiting and wondering through the area.
Amazing cathedral . Absolutely one of the most basilicas / cathedrals around. Beautiful in all it simplicity. Free entrance until 1 pm.
Forget the Cathedral. This is the place if you like mediaeval churches. If you get the opportunity to go to a concert here you will discover amazing acoustics.

A very relaxing place to sit down and soak in the atmosphere.. While we didn't enter the Basilica we sat down on a bench facing it for about 30 minutes to soak up the sun, and the surrounding atmosphere. There were throngs of people milling around and a group of buskers entertaining them. This was during 'siesta time' so maybe we should have entered to cool down but it was really enjoyable sitting out in the sun. Two days before we flew to Barcelona we had had a late blast of snow in Scotland with overnight temperatures falling below zero so the heat of the sun was very welcome.

Gorgeous. I wasn't so sure about the line and cost to see another Church in Europe. I'm so thankful my husband encouraged me to stick around. It is so beautiful and different in style than any I've ever seen.

They believed!. When I see or have possibility to touch such churches, temples or cathedrals, I have a strong feeling that people who built them were believing without fail. They had a faith. That's impossible to do it without an inspiration.So, this one more prove.Sincerely yours,Artur
Super. Well I liked very much, it is better if you have a guide that explains everything.There is gorgeous altars,and outside you can find shops and restaruants R
Nice. We enjoyed our stop at he Basilica, it was beautiful and quiet. We all loved the architecture. The price is reasonable, and besure to pay the little bit more and go on the roof.
relax!. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is beutiful place where to find a peace and get the rest in center of Barcelona city...go! enjoy the wonderful architecture!

Great example of the finest gothic architecture, a must in Barcelona!. This magnificient gothic church is probably the most beautiful monument in a city full of astonishing architecture. Take a few minutes to walk the place in silence and admire the way the high archs seem to float in the air and how the light flows between the columns.

A historical church and very nice architecture... A historical church. Very nice architecture..This church has survied serveral wars eventhough some tried to burn it down during war. Extremly high ceilings with great windows that are decorated in diferent colors. Really a sight. Lot of sculptures with Santa Maria in the middle. This church is really a sight but needs renovation.

Impressive OLD Cathedral. As I was in the process of reading Cathedral by the Sea, this cathedral was intriguing to visit. It is hard to imagine that it was built almost 700 years ago! It is still very beautiful. The stained glass windows were incredible, most "old-style" but a few modern replacements. We had hoped to go up to the roof, having read that you could do so in the morning. However, the guide (who was on her phone the whole time we were at the cathedral) told us we had to go on the English guided tour, which wasn't for another 2 hours.

Excellent guided walk with access to the roof top.. I'm glad I payed the extra 2 € for a guide and a chance to walk up the stairs to the roof and the balcony over the little square. I had a magnificent view over the city and it was interesting to see how most of the close by buildings utilize their roofs. The guide shared some historic moments and explained whats special about this Gothic Basilica. Overall I'm very happy with the visit
Wonderful Basilica. It was the second best church in Barcelona according to me. Its enchanting. Its a must see and easily approachable by public transport.
Beautiful . A high light to see such beautiful architecture. Anyone can appreciate it. Lots to read and learn about. Good for on a rainy day
Fantastic . A fantastic, beautiful church with great, friendly staff. Definitely worth paying more to go on the roof for the views.

Amazing. In short this place is amazing.The most impressive building in barcelona and it is everything the sagrada de famillia is trying to be but it's only 5 euro to get in and it's so quiet without a million tourists

Peaceful . The basilica of Santa Maria del Mar in Barcelona also known as the Cathedral of La Ribera is one of the most perfect examples of Gothic style architecture due to its harmonious proportions and serenity of the ensemble.

My favourite place in Bcn. I'm deeply in love with this church. I recomment the guide tour to know all about Santa Maria or you can just stay sitting there for few minutes to think. The entrance is free.
Another Beautiful Church. The Basilica is a very atmospheric church you can almost smell & feel the past in its interior well worth a visit
Really lovely !. Very helpful staff - small admission - and fascinating that it only took 56 years to build - very light and beautiful .
The most beautiful church of Barcelona from inside. The most beautiful gothic church of Barcelona to me. A very underrated city attraction that is worth a visit.
Beautiful basilique gothic style. This is one of most beautiful churches in Barcelona. Sometimes you can attend religious music concerts, quite atmosphere, and very well conserved.
Beautiful, peaceful stop in our day. This is a lovely place to stop that is not so crowded as the more well-known cathedrals. The interior is just as spectacular as the exterior.

Serene Beauty!. This beautiful church is a contemplative wonder. Leave behind the hustle and bustle of busy Barcelona and enter another age. It is hauntingly beautiful! I had somehow missed this beauty on my previous visits to Barcelona but I'll never miss it again. If possible, read Ildefonso Falcones' "Cathedral of the Sea" before visiting!
Extremely pretty church. This church has a lovely, peaceful atmosphere and is very pretty. I found the wheelchair access very good.

Beautiful building with wonderful views. . Stunning cathedral with a lovely atmosphere , however it can get extremely busy with tourists. The option to pay to go up to the roof is well worth the money (3-7 euro depending on when you go).You get lovely views and see the architecture of the gothic quarter in a whole new way.

Free entry at certain times, worth a visit. The cathedral is free to look round at certain times of day (check in advance as it varies). Very ornate, traditional decoration. The crypt was a bit different - with its pond and geese. I just wandered around and read the written descriptions, but would like to do an audio tour next time.
Beautiful church. We stayed right next to this church and so popped in. It's very impressive and free. Good to pop your head in and walk around.
Mmm .... A classic church ... you can find attendees,beggars and tourists. The place is surrounded by restaurants for those who like to eat and observe.

Amazing-highly recommend tour to top with guide!. Was lucky to be able to join a recently started tour to the top led by an english speaking guide who did an amazing job of explaining the architecture (gothic), the surroundings of the cathedral (there are 4 gothic cathedrals in this area which is an amazing #-due to Barcelona's high standing at that time in history. He explained how the Rose window had to be replaced in the 15th century (versus the 14th century original construction) and showed us the ventilation pipes and how they are protected from the rain, as well as providing interesting historical context that made our visit that much more interesting.
