After the tour, I was able to tour the cathedral itself which is also just breathtakingly beautiful, and as one who has read the fictional novel-Santa Maria del Mar-it was fun to speak with the guide about how that book described life and culture at the time the cathedral was being built. This is a must see plus touring the small boutiques and restaurants that abound around the cathedral makes for time that is fun and satifyingly spent.

A real WOW. What a gorgeous cathedral! We happened upon it by accident and were so glad we did. We were going to the Gaudi museum and ended up exploring this place instead. There is so much to see in Barcelona, but this should be on your list. Fantastic.
Fabulous. Second time visitng this Cathedral which is just outstanding. A beautiful place to visit. Exterior and interior WOW
Beautiful Cathedral. Visited after 1715 hrs when it was free to enter the cathedral, a beautiful cathedral with lots of history. Well worth visiting
Completely under-rated. This isn't the first cathedral that comes to mine when visiting Barcelona, however, it is a definite must-see with it's quiet beauty.

Beautiful church! Get to the top for a great view.. This was one of the first buildings we visited in Barcelona and it did not disappoint. Beautifully designed. Get to the top of the church and enjoy the great views around. Admission 14 Euro, children are free.
Nice but nothing special. After all you want to see it and it is peace full, we enjoyed it because we walked by, I wouldn't go especially to it

Very beautiful and historical Church. This is very Nice Catalan Gothic architecture church building. It was built between1329 to 1383.There are many history events happen on this Santa Maria Del Mar for the past 633 years!

Read Cathedral of the Sea before you visit to make this come alive. One of the most impressive Catalan Gothic buildings and a monument to the 14th century sense of religious wonder. In my view the catastrophic fire that removed much of the interior decorations has created one of the most spectacular interiors in the world. Read Ildefonso Falcones epic novel first and you will want to come by here again and again to live the history. They have adopted to the interest by offering guided tours, but at my last visit they were not up and running. Do however make the effort to climb to the interior balcony to give you impressive views of the interior.
very nice. it is located very near the bed and breakfast. It is very beautiful and very big. If you stay in Barcelona you cannot miss it.
Very beautiful. I'm not a big fan of cathedrals or churches but this one is really beautiful. Very nice, sleek pillars and pretty decorations.
Basic ancient church, beautiful with out much frills, Holy place. We stumbled over where this church is and were delighted to go in and experience what an old church should be like

Must see. . Stopped in with a private tour guide as part of our walking tour. The history behind this beautiful building and the design and architecture alone were amazing. So happy we had this experience.
Beautiful church. Lovely church big but had lots of separate chapels , really enjoyed wandering about and taking in the atmosphere.
Incredible. The beauty of this church compares to no other. It is simple and inviting. They say it is the most important church for the people, I felt peace while praying.

You Must Go Inside. This church forms one of the hubs of El Born but my partner and I only really went inside because it had started to rain!
It was quite a spectacle...massive inside and quite ponderous to behold. In spite of the number of people, it was also peaceful and serene.
Well worth a visit.
Interesting experience. Love that they have got rid of the scaffolding at the front and that you can now buy timed tickets for entry.

Beautiful place with historical weight. Really worth a visit, beautiful building where the history is tangible. I took the lift to the rooftop for 3 euro and it was really nice to see the Gothic quarter from that side too.

Lovely cathedral steeped in history. This is a beautiful church with amazing history. As you walk through if you look on the ground you can see the hand inscribed details of crypts that lay below. The nooks each have a different story and significance. This cathedral is free too visit and in the heart of the Gothic Quarter.

Beautiful!!. This is a beautiful beautiful place. It sortve captures you and makes you stop from when you first walk by, especially if stumbling upon it by accident like I did! There are certain times to go in & its 7€ so I'm not sure why I've seen it as free. The architecture, like so much of Barri Gótica, is so breathtakingly beautiful. They may not allow people in wearing cut offs or short skirts/shorts, per a sign outside. There are people begging for money outside the cathedral..certainly not violent people who will accost u, but just older folks who've had a clearly tough lot in life. I highly recommended activity seeing this cathedral..the area is beautiful too to just sit outside on its steps or enjoy a drink from a cafe across the street. Also, there are certain times during which people are allowed in, so make sure you look at that prior to your visit. When I went (around 12:15) they weren't letting people in until 1. Well worth the visit.
Stunningly beautiful. It's a truly moving experience and stunningly beautiful in a very natural way. It's a must see if in Barcelona!
Another must-see. I am at a loss for words to describe the holy feelings that wash over me when I go in a place like this one. It didn't feel touristy like others. Just incredibly beautiful.

Nice Place , Actually the icon of the city. there is construction going on for almost 12o years and still not completed. It is worth it , to pay to visit inside but make sure you get the ticket a head of time. do it online or by your hotel.

The best Gothic Architecture. I was living near the Basilica for two years and used to go there almost every day.I am not a religious person, bat as a former Architect, I´ve always liked Gothict style and this church is the best exemple in Spain and one of the most beautiful in the world. After two fire (one by the crazy Spanish franco soldiers and the first one some centuries ago, the stone works are perfect. Only the wood benches and the altar "retábulo" were destroyed; they made it all again and by now it is there, a beautiful piece of art, made by hand workers, stones that came from the rock mountains near the city of Barcelona by the effort of its inhabitants.By now I live not so near the temple and I go there once in a while, just to feel the Peace and look at that beauty.

Beautiful but not exactly free. We were expecting this church to be free as this was advertised as a free activity on many sites. However, you need to pay 8 euros between 12pm and 5pm...We were unlucky enough to come during the afternoon. We wish we had known this before, so I hope this will help others.

A dream. I read A book written by Zafon and I was curious about Santa Maria del Mar. I was so exited. A very very beautiful Cathedral. I strongly suggest to visit it because it's a great place to visit.
Amazing. Breathtaking! Cant imagine from outside the glory that lies inside. Magnificent! Plan a visit keeping in mind the service times, in order not to miss out viewing it entirely from inside.

Classic Cathedral. We visited this church early in the morning on a Saturday. There were no tourists, a huge difference from most of the other attractions in Barcelona. Great example of well maintained, classic cathedral.

Exquisite Gothic church . The church is very near the Barcelona cathedral, but was for the common people rather than the aristocracy. It has clean Gothic lines and is quite free of later baroque interior clutter.

Gorgeous, stately historic church. Not to be missed, the church is an essential part of Barcelona's cultural, architectural and religious history. Even more, it is a welcoming community. I especially recommend the international service.

Charming church. If you are not a church person but want to visit one for free, this is the one to go for. It is not as imposing as the Cathedral and...free! The back window is amazing and the church gives you a welcome break from the bustle outside. It is central to the Gothic Quarter and totally fits into your impressions of those.

Excellent Old Church. Not as heavily visited as the cathedral, so a better feel for an ancient church. Get a real feel for what it must have been like in medieval times. Not as interesting architechitally as many European churches.

You can feel some special energy. in this pace, have very particular atmosphere and you can't help yourself to dive into it. Really even just to have sit and watch it its make you feel something indescribable. Feel this moment, don't miss it !

Beautiful Cathedral. Very beautiful Cathedral. Gothic style with very high ceilings and lots of artwork. Situated close to the Picasso Museum. Definitely a church you'll want to add to your itinerary if it's not already there.
Average. Nice church, especially in the outside, carved in the middle of the old town, worth a visit but not comparable to Sagrada Familia

One of the most beautiful churches in Europe.. Visit this church with lots of time to take in the stark beauty. It's not full of ornate decorations like the cathedral or the basilica. The tall columns are amazing. Find the figures cut into the wood on the front door. These represent the men who carried the stone from the quarry to build the "church of the people". Sit for a while and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
A church on the way to Picasso. A large high ceiling church that is quite different form other churches I have experienced.They offer tours in English and Spanish!

Hidden wonder. We used our last morning to travel between some of the free attactions and were delighted to have found this place. A short walk from the Jaume metro station; the Basilica is somewhat hidden down some narrow streets. The interior is spectcaular and it is also possible to do a rooftop visit although you have to book same. There is access through the main door but also a ramp access to the side; something we didnt realise until after carrying the buggy up the few steps.
Very beautiful. The only place in Barcelona with decent prices for candles, for example. Beautiful architecture, free to visit, full of beggars.
Oasis in the middle of the City. Beautiful church, fantastic place to spend hours admiring some great artists artwork. Seat in a bench and let your eyes take you in a long journey back in the past.
Very impressive. Free entrance, a nice choice to spent some time in the gothic area. Many sculptures, not that crowded.

An Inspired Place of Worship. La Sagrada takes some of its inspiration from here I think! An old church which shows the skills of the artisans. Nice and quiet and not at all crowded. Pray if you want in absolute peace.
A nice church. This is a a great stop in to see the pretty architecture if you are strolling though this part of town.
Such a wonderful basilica. Just wonderful!! A gem!! Definitely worth a visit (plus it was free when I got there and there was a ceremony, so it was twice as interesting)

Impressive!. It's just that - very impressive. It is more impressive upon knowing a bit more of the history of Santa Maria del Mar, and how the stones were carried all the way from Montjuic, etc. Its one of the few visits left in Barcelona at no cost, which makes this worthwhile to include in plans to see the sites in Barcelona

Great church. The church has free entrance on certain hours only. During free entry hours its crowded, so take a call between few people or no money.. Don't forget to go up the stairs at the back of the altar. It leads to the second level behind the altar which presents a different perspective of the church.

Moving experience. We were overwhelmed by the feel of this exquisite cathedral. The sense of spirituality and prayer was tangible...we had to return the next day just to check and nothing changed! A must for those needing to feel like there is something out there.

A beautiful building. As churches go, it is stunning. I guess that due to the popularity of the Sagrada Familia this beautiful building gets overlooked. I would definitely recommend it, and the steps outside are a fabulous sun trap for eating a sandwich or two!

Magnificent Gothic tranquility . Re-opens at 5 pm which is when we went. Fantastic sense of space as you get with all Gothic cathedrals but this lacked the adornments that sometimes distract. Well worth a visit.
Stunning. This is a stunning church. I was there for the night before Easter and there was a beautiful procession.

Nice perspective of the church from the back of the altar.. The church has free entrance on certain hours only. We opted to pay to get in because we could not wait 2 more hours just to have free entry. This was the best decision we made because there were very few people inside the church making it easier to photograph the place without the usual crowd of tourists marring the view.Don't forget to go up the stairs at the back of the altar. It leads to the second level behind the altar which presents a different perspective of the church.

STUNNING. We viewed the Basilica -Pi - whilst strolling one evening and eating in Pi Square - then on a walking tour we were shown this beautiful place but we did not go in. We were informed it was free to enter after a certain time. Then on returning from a meal in the evening (Easter Saturday) we went in and there was actually a service taking place, which sounded beautiful. Then a young lady got up and started to sing - she sounded like an Angel - the whole building is stunning - breath taking - this was the finale to our trip - A must see fabulous building in a lovely square and the history lesson with the walking tour was extremely useful and interesting
nice to see. a nice church in the gothic quarters and near by a lot of food shops/restaurants and near by Piccasso museum

Beautiful Basilica Easy to Visit While in Barri Gotic. There are many religious places of worship in the Barri Gotic. Likely the largest are the Cathedral, which was used largely by the nobility and the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar (St. Mary of the Sea), which was built by merchants. Santa Maria del Mar is easy to find and if you are simply exploring the Barri Gotic or returning from the beach area, you may simply stumble across it as we did.The structure is enormous and packed with religious statues and imagery, including approximately a dozen ornate chapels around the perimeter. Also note the painted bosses on the ceiling.You will find a number of surprising details. On the darker side, there are some graves on the floor simply with a skull, apparently marking victims of the plague, which wiped out something like 60% of Barcelona's population. Please note the Madonna and child statue in the apse with a ship in front as it is "St. Mary of the Sea" and its patrons relied on the sea trade for their livings.This is a beautiful structure and all the more amazing considering that it was built with technology from centuries ago.

Quick visit on easter sunday.. Imposing building from the outside although lots of buildings round about make it not stand out.Inside is impressive; relatively plain but worth seeing. I didn't pay for a tour
Amazing Windows . A beautiful gothic Basilica with outstanding stain glass windows. Well worth a visit if you are in the old gothic quarter.

Wow what more can we say !. i had visited it before about 8 years ago this time we went into the basilica as they have finished the interior venetian glass. I have never seen such incredible colours anywhere in the world. many visitors go there every day so to pre book in the season is a must ! you also need a good guide as there are so many different aspects of the basiilica that only a good guide can advise you both internally and on the outside so much to take in ! Gaudi you have left a gem !

beautiful historic church int eh gothic section. Ten years ago we were pick-pocketed in this church.. today it is a totally different experience. In a historic area, central to the Gothic section of Barcelona, this church and this part of the city are rich with history and architecture and the reason Barcelona still exists as a vibrant city. They have a rooftop tour you can schedule for a fabulous view of the city. Ot side the main doors is a lovely square full of coffee shops and restaurants and shopping. A great place to pause, put your feet up and enjoy.

Nice gothic church. This church is the visual representation of gothic art style. Decoration is dim but the dimensions and style is superb. After La Sagrada Familia, it is another very important church to visit.
pretty church. Pretty Church found in a back street when wandering around while others at the Picasso musuem , visit after 5pm for free entry

A jewel of gothic architecture. The Basílica of Santa Maria del Mar is an extraordinary example of Catalan Gothic architecture. If you visit it after having read 'The cathedral of the sea' by Falcones, you will have the chance to fill all those spaces with the novel's stories and characters.
Breathtaking. Not to be missed. So beautiful! Be ready to spend some time and take it all in! This is such a beautiful place that it takes your breath away! Take the time to hear the angels!

Impressive. Went there on our walking tour in the ghotic area as well on our biking trip. Church is quite impressive and as you might know it was restored with the financial support FCB, have a look at the ¨FCB window" in the upper left corner

Not as grand, but worth seeing. The gothic architecture is not as grand as the cathedral de Barcelona, but this is still a large, impressive church and the story of its history and the pride in the neighbourhood that were required to pull it together is impressive. There are some times of the day when admission is free and some times when there is an admission fee.

Very beautiful and worth paying the fee.. When we arrived at Santa Maria del Mar we did not realize that there was an entry fee during certain hours (5 Euros). At first we thought we would kill an hour and wait for the free entry, but then decided we would rather just pay the money. It was so worth it to have the church almost to ourselves for the hour before the free entry. There were very few people in the huge space and it was so quiet it was a pleasure to look at every little chapel and read the brochure that described the statues and stained glass windows. When the church opened to the public a huge crowd flooded in and that made us appreciate the time we had to ourselves even more!
Really beautiful. We loved this place. There were many beautiful statues and you could light candles. We were able to explore quite a bit.
Nice. Very beautiful cathedral in the barri gotic in Barcelona. Entrance is free. Going to the top is not worth the entrance price.
Impressive. Very large and impressive basilica in the heart of the Gothic district but not far from the Ramblas.Great height and stunning stained glass windows.
Must see. It is definitely worth any penny! This is one of the most beautiful churches in Europe. You must see this and if you go in the morning before 10 am, you might get to visit it for free!
Beautiful. I went to a mozarts requiem concert here, it was amazing, I loved the atmosphere and how good the acustic was.
Beautiful church. Very unique church. Different architecture. Just amazing sight. A must see if in Barcelona, you won't be disappointed.

Nice. Sat in front of the church and enjoyed the sun for a while. To make sure I didn't miss out on anything, I went inside.
It was a nice suprise. The windows are special when the sun is shining through.
Disappointing. Disappointing. I was very pleased that we arrived at one of the periods when you could enter this church for free. It was very plain, And I did not find it at all interesting.
Worth visiting!. Very impressive gothic cathedral. I really enjoyed visiting it and I would definetely visit it again.
Absolutely beautiful.. Visited Santa Maria after seeing the cathedral--if your time is limited have a look here, forget the cathedral which is a bit dull by comparison.
Old Town Highlight. A great historic icon located in the Old Town section of Barcelona, Spain. It is best to see it twice - once in the daylight hours and again at night.

Wow. I wanted to visit this place after reading the novel about it's building. Wow ir was worth the walk. So nice from the outside and charming inside. We didn't attend But inside the church they organize classical music concerts

Forget La Sagrada Familia This is where architecture happened.. This Gothic church, formerly Barcelona's Cathedral, is by far the best example of a rare style that took place locally the Catalan Gothic. In it, the style changes its obsession for height and spectacularity for a more intimate, spiritual feeling. Even an Atheist such as myself finds solace within. A must see for anyone with a taste for culture.

Wonderful to visit. This is a beautiful church with a wonderful atmosphere. I had hoped to visit anyway but learned more about it on a walking tour of the Gothic Quarter (Runnerbean tours, highly recommended). It's in a lovely area if the city & we visited at dusk, so lovely & peaceful. Cannot wait to return
Pretty Church. Interesting that there is a statue of Mary behind the high alter that is actually in a chamber you can visit by going up stairs.

Go to the Cathedral!. Unless you're a real gothic church fan, I would skip this church. It was set up for a concert when we went, and it was difficult to see everything, but compared to the cathedral it's not so interesting.

Beautiful!. If you stop here, make sure you knees are covered. They do provide coverups if you happen to be wearing shorts.
The Basicilica was beautiful! They still have much of the ornate decor, so it is worth a walk through. The courtyard area if beautiful.
A14th century church. The church was built in 14 th century and has remained largely in the original gothic format with minor modifications.
Basilica Trip. This is a stunningly beautiful church and completely different from Sagrada Familia, but equally valuable for the architecture and historical significance.
Found it randomly and absolutely enjoyed it!. The Basilica is a beauty to go inside. What a spectacular view. I found this randomly while walking around the gothic area and loved it.

A Cathedral for the People. Locals visit this cathedral, which was a nice change from the more stately (read: empty) structures. The area is perfect for walking and shopping, so it makes sense this is a high-traffic cathedral. Stained glass in blues and greens, echoing the ocean. Close proximity to other sites.

amazing church, except it's never opened!. This church is incredibly beautiful, really amazing, and the square around it as well! For those who read the book about it and knows the history behind it, it's even mor interesting.
The thing is, it seems to be always closed! hahaha be sure to check if the cathedral will be open at the time you pay a visit!

Église Sainte-Marie-de-la-Mer. Construction begins March 25, 1329, on the site of an existing church on an ancient place of Christian worship. A Roman-Christian necropolis was revealed by the excavations carried out in 1960-61 under the church.We establish that the work should have belong to parishioners, only hardware officials temple; the rule is all the more remarkable that it is even applied. It seems that everyone in the Ribera actively participated in the construction; a fundamental contribution was made by longshoremen ( "bastaixos") from the port of La Ribera, who transported the stone blocks, one by one, the Montjuïc quarry or beach where the boats unloaded to the site of the 'church.The cathedral of La Seu, the official cathedral represented the monarchy, authority, wealth, high clergy. The church Santa Maria del Mar was in turn to be the symbol of humility and faith of the fishermen who were building.Around 1350 the walls, the side chapels and the facade were completed. In 1379, about to complete the arch of the fourth bay, scaffolding caught fire and the stones were seriously damaged. Finally, the last cornerstone was placed November 3, 1383 and the day of the feast of the Assumption of the following year (15 August 1384) was celebrated the inaugural mass.In 1428 an earthquake caused the collapse of the rosette. A new rose window in Gothic style, was completed in the year 1459 and laying vitraux1 completed the following year.The baroque altar and most of the ornaments and imagery added over the centuries were burned by the fire of 19 to 20 July 1936, during the Spanish civil war.The church [edit | modify the code]The church is open to visitors from Monday to Sunday, from 9 am to 13 h 30 and 16 h 30 to 20 hours.Exterior [change | modify the code]Exterior The building has a solid and robust appearance, which does not reflect what you will find inside. The dominance of horizontal lines and walls without large openings nor decorations is total. the visual impression was of a compact block, without the skirts of different depths typical of European Gothic walls.The main façade is punctuated by two octagonal towers (the same form that have columns inside) and two powerful buttresses around the rose and give the feeling of the magnitude of the inner vault. two horizontal sections is observed, clearly marked by moldings, whereas in the towers horizontality is emphasized by galleries. The lower part is centered on the portal, while in the top of the rose was at his side two large windows placed between the buttresses and towers.The austerity feeling is even seen in the side walls, walls without decorations that fill the space between the buttresses (allowing the presence of the interior chapels). The design is quite different from that of French Gothic slender, with a complete lack here of flying buttresses. Horizontally, clearly we see three floors. The lower level corresponds to the side chapels, with narrow windows, one for each chapel, three windows between the buttresses.Two doors open on the sides, the door Sombrerers and that of the Moreres. A door was then opened in the apse, the door of the Born.Interior [change | modify the code]The interior has three naves with ambulatory and without cross. Although we are in the presence of three naves, it seems that the architect had wanted to experience the same feeling of space we would have with a single nave. To give this impression, he departed the pillars (15 meters away) and limited the height difference between the naves (the height of the aisles is 7 / 8ths of the nave).The nave is lit by oculi open between the galleries and the central aisle. These oculi become windows between the columns of the presbytery, which almost entirely occupy the space available and help strengthen the effect of columns with a light semicircle. The aisles receive light windows (one per span), not too large, which contribute to the lighting of the nave.

Gorgeous basilica with incredible architecture. While I'm not much of a tourist and rarely visit church's, the Basilica of Santa Maria was a standout. You'd never know how spectacular it is inside by just looking at the outside, and I particularly enjoyed being able to take the elevator to the roof to explore the rooftops and get a spectacular view of the city. Well worth the price of admission.

Barcelona's cathedral.. A lovely place to explore in calm surroundings. The architecture is wonderful. I enjoyed the choir stalls particularly, with their misericords and decorated stall backs. Lovely acoustic - there was a visiting choir from the USA rehearsing.Visit the geese in the cloister!
Get There. Unbelievable from the outside - spectacular from the inside. Book on line to save queuing - booked whilst outside! Tours needed pre booking however.

Keep coming back. This is my favorite church in Barcelona. It is in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods and free to visit. Its simple internal decor looks almost Protestant, very different from other Catholic churches I've seen. Beautiful inspiring architecture creates a huge space inside.

Unexpected. I didn `t think this attraction would be so amazing.
Is not as famous as Sagrada Familia or la Catedral but is the one we enjoyed the most.
Super recommended

Beautiful cathedral in need of maintenance. We wandered in here on a Sunday afternoon when mass was going on. We had hoped to find the Catalonian dancers on the plaza, but just missed them. It's a gorgeous cathedral, but we couldn't help notice how dirty and in poor repair the structure is. Quite a contrast to some other cathedrals we visited. Hope it can get some help to preserve it.

This is the only old church I remembered from Barcelona - very beautifyl. I can't quite explain why, but this is the church I like the most in the Old town. It's close to las ramblas and the main cathedral is nearby, but the cathedral was big and formal and somewhat confusing, while this church was beautiful. It's full of history, harmony and peace.As other people mentioned, if you can - go in the evening so you don't have to pay the entrance fee (I think it's after 5:30 or so, but you should doublecheck).

It's a beautiful historical building in a great part of town, so definitely worth seeing. It's beautiful on the inside and holds a magnificent aura. It is an imposing church in the Ribera district of Barcelona, built between 1329 and 1383 at the height of Catalonia's maritime and mercantile preeminence. It is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic, with a purity and unity of style that is very unusual in large medieval buildings. Go see it, not to be missed!
Well worth a gawk. very serene and well laid out lots of history recommend it. No noisy tourists or Gopros on selfie sticks.
Beautiful Basilica and Peaceful. Great to visit this wonderful basilica church. its so peaceful .You pay 5 Euro to visit during day until 6 pm . free to visit after 6 .You can take photos there.
A beautiful Basilica. The Basilica inh the middle of the Gothic quarter. Take a tour if you can and learn a lot about the history, art and architecture of the basilica. It is a must. Yona s.
Beautiful . A truly beautiful and moving basilica. There is a stairway that leads to a balcony area which provides a great view of the interior and a sense of the enormity of the building.
Fantastic. Amazing architecture inside and out. Well worth a visit just off las ramblas. Definitely recommend visiting it as it is truly beautiful.
Looks fabulous but didn't want to pay to go inside. Had a look from outside but looks a fabulous place. Think it was7 euros to go inside,so didn't bother

Beautiful Gothic Church. This building is located in the cener of "Barrio Gotico" in Barcelona. It is a beautiful church that shows another style to what most people know (Sagrada Familia and Barcelona Cathedral, very near by the way). You go back in time 600 years watching this building and indoors is even deeper that feeling. An amazing place to visit when staying in Barcelona (not everything in here is about sun...)

Visit after 5.30pm for free entry. The interior of this basilica is quite stunning. As an engineer, I marvelled at the height and slenderness of the main structural columns.You can visit during the day, but in the evening it is free entry and the interior lighting is quite sympathetic to the interior.

Enchanting.. This is such an enchanting basilica. There is a peaceful feeling, which envelopes you when you enter and see the almost eerie play of light and shadow playing on the intricate web designs of the ceiling. You can almost hear the angels singing. Earlier, we visited the Sagrada Familia, which is completely out of this world in its architectural design. Seeing this basilica, brought me back to something familiar, yet very special and extraordinary. This must be seen and experienced.
Beautiful. Wow! Stunning architecture, beautiful artifacts, statues etc and the peaceful tranquility associated with buildings of this sort. A must visit if you're in Barcelona.

Awesome. Went the day after Sagrada. Totally different but similar in that both places are mind blowing. We salute Sagrada for its uniqueness but this church built centuries before is unique in its own way.well worth a visit and cheap to get in.
beautiful. beautiful interior and amazing treasures inside. this church show you the history as you walk through.

Beautiful. This cathedral is a stunning piece of architecture. It can't be compared to La Sagrada Familia as they are both so different. It is really peaceful and relaxing inside and don't miss the opportunity to go up the lift to the top, the views are stunning.
A very special place. There is something very special and magical about this basilica, no words can explain the sensation I felt when I visited it. Possibly its location and history.
A must for all architecture lovers. Beautiful old basilica and a must to be seen. Very friendly helpful staff. Like a lot of the old buildings in Barcelona this is one that should be visited

14th Century gothic marvel is worth seeing. Such a beautiful church, a impressive historical building.This basilica is beautiful with amazing high ceilings . A beautiful cathedral, fantastic architecture and a lovely oasis of calm

Simple interior with nice stained glass windows. Entry was free. The interior was quite simple - with stained glass windows that were beautiful. Many Catholic school groups were there when we visited - teaching the history of the basilica.
Before you visit .... Ensure that you read Ildefonso Falcones' Cathedral of the Sea... it really sets the scene. The interior is wonderfully simplistic. An architectural gem.

Fantastic. A joy to see this church. Really magical and relaxing. Sta maria del mar is the soul of the born
One of the jewels of barcelona.
Visit the stores around the church, great
Worth finding. We kept missing this one, as we were wandering down the streets surrounding. When we did find it was definitely worth the visit
Beautiful Church. This was recommended to us by the hotel and we were not disappointed. Second in stature only to La Sagrada Familia.

spot the animals. We visited the Cathedral and found that it was wonderfully done.We also accessed the tower and found a huge snail carving on the tower and beautiful view of the town. It was fun for our children (14,14,9) to play spot the animals on the towers and the roof. We so far found the above mentioned snail (interesting story behind it), a unicorn, a sheep, a jaguar, a dog and a dragon.When we were there, there was a couple of musicians playing the sithar just outside of the cathedral, beautiful music.
Impressive. This 14th Century gothic marvel is worth seeing. Information on its construction is displayed but in catalan. A quartet played while I was there. Reeks of history. Do stop by!

Historic church in the Born. The Basilica dates from the Medieval period and offers a historic space. It architecture impressives with its church tower and interior. While the area is full of restaurants and stores, it is good to be reminded of the religious traditions that shaped Catalan culture. Do not miss this oasis in the midst of shopping and eating.

Best place in Barcelona. As a Barcelona citizen, I consider this place its bests. Not as known as other places (therefore not as crowded) this cathedral was built many thousands of years ago mostly by fishermen who carried the stones on their backs from Montjuic to there. Impressive, I would not miss it!
Worth visiting. Only had 15 min to tour and wish I had an hour or two. Lots of details to take in. Very impressive historical building.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful church, not expensive to get in and massive. Really calm and good just to walk around and relax
It's a church . Not more, not less. Is supposed to have the largest glass window of its kind in Europe. Also, we had a nice guitar concert in a smaller chamber.

Beautiful, a little piece of tranquility in a busy area. This basilica is beautiful with amazing high ceilings and a lot of details on the sides. Great stained windows as well. When you get into the church, make sure you turn around at some point and look up. There is a huge and beautiful round stained window! I was also impressed by the ceilings which have shields (I think) which are small paintings by itself. This is also a place where not everything is gated off so you really can get a good look.The area around it also has some nice terraces with a good view of the basilica.

Free to enter and a real joy to visit. We wandered through the old city of Barcelona when we found the basilica. It was stunning and we enjoyed the visit here. We also paid a few euro's for the elevator to the roof. The view was nice but not worth the pay. If you want a view, visit Montjuic.

Unexpected find. Visiting this church was recommended by a guide on another trip. What a beautiful find. We pause the 8 euro to have access to the rooftops. Little did we know this was a guiding tour given by Pol. He expertly pointed out the important elements of the church much rebuilt over the ages due to several warsThe highlight was the walk up the spiral staircase, first 70 steps to the first level, then 50 steps to the second level and then another 20 steps for the final level. Each stop was a breathtaking view.
Must see. I asked about the building and its history and was even more impressed. It is beautiful, a highlight of the trip.
Quiet and Beautiful Gem. Beautiful and serene basilica that feels a little more off the beaten track in Barcelona. Good place to get away from the crowds in the Gothic Quarter.

Quiet Peaceful place of Calm. I love Santa Maria del Mar and the area surrounding it is my favourite district of Barca. Great for bars, tapas and chilling out. I am not religious but this is a beautiful cathedral, fantastic architecture and a lovely oasis of calm to come and contemplate and feel the history.

Gothic Grandeur. We stumbled in here our first night and was blown away. It has to be seen to be believed! Breathtaking architecture, simple but serene. The live organ music was a lucky touch. We came back again the next night and there was a ceremony going on. This is indeed a real working church, but one that tourists like us are welcome to come in for jaw-dropping view.
OK for a quick visit. An impressive cathedral that is worth popping in for its impressive scale. The surrounding area is worth visiting as it is surrounded by tempting eateries and shops.
Nice. When we got in the basilica there was someone playing on the org. The acoustic is very nice and I truly recommend to stay and listen to the free "concert" if you have the opportunity!

Special place. This church has a special place in my heart - its absolutely beautiful. Huge, but not overwhelming. I want to be married here, because although I am not a believer, I believe in something when I am here.
Very authentic . Was burned during the civil war so no painting or sculpture but still amazingly built. Has a very nice history, check Wikipedia for more details...

Lovely inside and out. I finally popped for the eight euro fee that includes going up into one of the towers and a wee wander around the roof. It is the most boring roof I've ever seen, but the views of Barcelona are splendid, and our tour guide (yes, you have to) was very intelligent--that is, she just talked about this and that, not as if wedded to a script. So that was nice. And the towers are cool to see up close, of course.Since the fee goes to a good cause, I recommend paying it, even if you've been to Santa Maria del Pi, which has a great view from its tower, too. The views from each Basilica are different. I recommend seeing both. And the inside of Santa Maria del Mar is gorgeous.
Lovely outside. at least a two hour queue to get a ticket - could not afford the wait on a limited time to visit. Wish I knew you could book a ticket online before the visit!

Beautiful gothic Basilica in the Born. Beautiful gothic Church in the Born neighborhood. Beautiful stained glass rose window. You can usually walk in and visit with no problem, unlike the Cathedral. IT truly is an awe inspiring view.

Beautiful Cathedral in the Gothic Quarters. This cathedral was free to visit when we were there. It is a beautiful cathedral, with very large columns, bright, and well kept up. The acoustics are awesome. We stumbled upon a free choir concert one evening which was a real treat.

Gorgeous setting for evening Mass during your trip!. I checked their website for concerts and was disappointed that no events were scheduled in February, so I instead went to daily mass at 1930 in Spanish. Incredible setting with awesome acoustics.

Take your time. Undervalued precious church.
Maybe it was "L'esglèsia del Mar" from Idelfonso Falcones, but the history, the legend, and the beautiful architecture mix in an unexpected location right next to the Barcelona sea.
Peaceful. I liked this church mor than the cathedral, more open more light. It gives you a strong sense of peace.

Great church. I been to several churches, this is one of the few that allows to take an elevator ride up to the roof. The view of Barcelona city was beautiful "well worth it" Although the entrance fee is a little pricey, but worth the visit if you are a church lover.

Beautiful buildin. Beautiful building and a nice place to visit if you have the time. It is quite unusual. My boyfriend and I love visiting churches and cathedrals and this has been one of my favourites. It's free and there was a Christmas market on at the time in November which was lovely.

Hidden Gem. We stumbled across this on a Sunday... Seriously beautiful and I actually preferred it to Sagrada Familia. Free entry & was breathtaking. I paid €1 to light a candle for relatives. A very relaxing & peaceful place.

Nice, everyman's church. We visited this church located in the Barri Gotic. It is a nice church and certainly different than the cathedral and the Sagrada Familia (everything is different than the SF). This is listed in guide books as the church for the working people of the Barri Gotic. That is the way it appeared. Nevertheless, very nice. It is free admission in the morning until 1:00 and again sometime in the afternoon. I would pop in when it is free as it is not really worth the price they charge to see it. If you feel the need, leave a donation.

Beautiful Catalan-style church. Less ornate and less icons in the chapels compared to the bigger Cathedrals. However, the simplicity allowed one to focus on the individual for whom the chapel was named. The stained glass is very stunning especially the Rose window.  This church may have been affected by the Civil War and could have been ransacked. The ornamentation may have been loss because of the anarchists. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful gothic church. Santa Maria del Mar is situated in the heart of the old city. The breaths history and gas beautiful vaults and a rose window. We paid for the English tour, which I highly recommend, since the guide provides you with information about the history of the church, the neighbourhood and the city. The best part is that, with a guide, you can climbe the tower and walk on the rooftop, where there is a amazing view over the city.
Fishermens church. Built for the fishermen of the area and their families.We came across this Basilica by chance and it is certainly worth a visit. We thought it more inspiring than the Cathedral.

Nice Cathedral. A very nice cathedral. A mass was underway when we visited so we couldn't get up to the altar or behind it. Found it fascinating that the sides of the nave had multiple flat screen TVs along the sides. It is an interesting stop but not a fabulous church in any way.
Interesting church. We enjoyed our visit here. It is worth a look if you are nearby in this area. It is a very high building with an interesting interior.
Stunning place. One word to describe: Gorgeous! El born- the heart of Barcelona with the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar are a must see things to do.

A must see . It is €7 to enter and worth every cent. It's a current place of worship. Was built in 1298 and is beautiful and amazing. W took an elevator to the roof of the basilica. Wonderful views.
It has maybe 15-20 side chapels, all fantastic carved wood and paintings. A must see!
Beautiful and few visitors . Beautiful and few visitors at this time of year. Was nice to have a moment. Great to wander around and see at own pace. Recommended

You, too, can be closer to God. Mostly now visited to climb the tower for the great view over Barcelona, the church is also an event space and anchors exhibitions in the surrounding plazas. The bistros in the plazas are reasonably priced for a beer.

Magical. It's worth the hunt as you need to weave your way there and it's a very intimate plaza once you arrive, but so worth it. Stop at Bobu for cafe and pastries and sit outside and enjoy the church. Very special.
Silent and spiritual. I love this place - it is so silent and so beautiful. The front desk staff are courteous and this makes the visit even better.
A must visit when in Barcelona..... Relatively easy to get to there, short train ride out of Barcelona, 14 euros return. Wow view. A must

Beautiful church -- worth a quick visit. This is a nice church and worth a visit while in Barcelona. Compared to the grand churches in Europe, this is not quite as impressive, but that is not to diminish the beauty and history of this church at all. A service was going on when I visited, so I didn't get to see all of the church, but what I did see of the church was beautiful.

Amazing architecture with incredible detail. In just about every city that I have been blessed to visit there has been a cathedral or basilica and this one is is right up there at the top with the ones that I have seen. Take the time to view it and I do not think you will be disappointed.

This is a fabulous place!!. Guided tour by the most knowledgable guide. She was amazing and the climb to the top of the tower to look out over the city by night was so worth it.
We were lucky enough to enjoy the peaceful surroundings before leaving and it is a truly spiritual place full of amazing architecture.
Religious visit. Went in the evening and I think should have done during the day. All and all good religious place to visit
Unbelievable. It is breathtaking, along with the cathedral. If you are Catholic you can not miss the chance to pray in this church and if you are not you can't miss this architectural wonder!

Beautiful. This is a must see for everyone from all religions simply because the moment you enter, you see the ceilings that are the highest I've probably ever seen, and if you walk to the front and look at the gated seating area that is no longer being used, you'll see the incredible wood carvings over the seats and be amazed at their intricate designs. They are a work of art.
Nice view from roof. View from the roof is amazing. I really liked also about lighting in the church. Beatiful place to visit. This is something which you should not miss.

Great cathedral. While Sagrada Familia gets a lot of the ecclesiastical love in Barcelona, this cathedral hidden away in the Gothic quarter is spectacular. We turned up just in time for an English speaking tour of the building, which was really interesting and engaging, giving us a good sense of the history of the city as well as the church (plus we got to go up onto the room and get a spectacular view on the city). Well worth visiting if you're in the area!
Great cathedral in a great neighborhood.... We stumbled upon this beautiful gothic cathedral while exploring el born. It was very quiet (we're in January) and intimate moment... and it's free!
Santa Maria del Mar. It's a grand Gothic basilica dating back to the 14th century. The interior is elaborately lit and stained glass windows are beautiful.
Very soothing. This is a wonderful church and is very atmospheric. The stain glass windows are fabulous. It's worth a visit

Great architecture!. The structure and the bones of the Basilica are quite similar to other Barcelona`s cathedrals, but it has some different vibe. It has very special, incredible atmosphere, peaceful and thrilling at the same time.

Lovely Cathedral. Wandered in during the evening, access is free after 5pm, and was impressed by the simple but beautiful lay-out and architecture. Extremely picturesque and once outside it seems to meld into the Gothic with ease. A must see in Barcelona.
Beautiful. We wandered into a Sunday evening service. The church and the service were wonderful even though we didn't understand most of it.

Gorgeous. Stunning cathedral in the middle of the city - worth taking time to walk through and light a candle. We stood at the back of the cathedral while mass was going on - listening to the hymns and the organ - highly recommended.
.. Although you can just walk in and have a wander around, I would recommend the tour, as you get to see other parts of the Cathedral

Beautiful Cathedral in Heart of City. This smaller cathedral is well worth a quick visit to see the statues, artwork depicting religious scenes and figures.
There are free entry times that should be checked online - typically before noon.
Would recommend a 20 - 30 minute walk through - nearby the larger and more impressive Cathedral.
Great free site. If you enjoy Gothic architecture this church is worth a few minutes to explore. It is free to enter, so take a peak inside if you are in the area.

Read the book- wanted to see the cathedral. Read the novel, Cathedral of the Sea, a few years ago & loved it. So this was on my to do list. Found it by accident one night after dinner, at a nearby restaurant, Pork. But it was closed. We came back the next day & was glad that it was open. Enjoyed some quiet time there.

Beautiful Gothic church. The interior of the Church offers a relaxed ambiance and a good place for a rest and mediation. Adds to its attractive the fact that is surrounded by good options of restauration
Loved the architecture . Went with my family I am not religious but the architecture is just amazing the windows are amazing too and the garden is magnificent

Amazing peaceful and a must see. Walked through the Basilica and was truly impressed from the time I entered until we left over an hour later. Take the time and see for yourself that this landmark is impressive almost gothic like. The plaza that surrounds the Basilica is like the frame for the picture, a true fit. A must see for everyone.

Bright and elegant interior. For me, this is the finest Gothic building in the city, a real gem made with perfection. The church was built at the site of a Roman cemetery and the remains of St. Eulalia were buried here before they were transferred to the Cathedral. The construction of this building lasted from 1329 to 1383. The church is a bit “squeezed” in the narrow streets and it is not easy to perceive its harmonious, clean-lined and geometrically perfect design. The interior of the church is stunningly bright and the central space is supported by slender, octagonal columns with no architectural boundaries between its three aisles.

Barcelona sunset from the roof. Example of gothic style in Barcelona. I recommend the guided tour to the roof with a stunning view of the city.I suggest to take the last tour to get the sunset with its beautiful colors (at least in winter)

Most beautiful Church , a must see. The feeling you get inside when looking to the ceiling is much more than excitement because it is so high that you feel totally insignificant . If you read the novel about this church you can not miss the experience .
The Cathedral of the Sea. When I need a moment of loneliness with myself..I go there. The most beautiful Church. The Church of the workers, built by the workers. Of stunning beauty.

Free and more beautiful at night!. We stumbled upon this place whilst walking through the Gothic Quarter and it was so beautiful! Especially at night, the whole basilica simply lights up the area, as well as being ridiculously tall. Some lovely works of architecture in Barcelona; this is one of the greats. It's beauty parallels that of the Sagrada, but it is not under construction and costs significantly less [at night], as well as having slightly less tourists!

Lovely church. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is a beautiful church, but I found it nowhere near as impressive as the Cathedral. We hoped to go up the tower as recommended by others, but its only possible to visit on a guided tour, and we didn't have time to wait for the tour.
MOST BEAUTIFUL CHURCH. Amazing church so beautiful took my breath away. The Church is in a lovely district of Barcelona well worth an explore.
Incredible. Magic atmosphere. You wouldnt beleive how tall it is untill you are inside! Spectacular. After 5 pm is free to enter. Absolutely worth it!
I liked it More than Sagrada Familia. I loved this Basilica, i saw more than 30 churches on my long Euro Trip, this is the one of the best ones.

A wonderful stone cathedral in the heart of old Barcelona. An imposing structure at the edge of the Gothic Quarter, this church may not appear like much on the exterior, but the interior is an impressive display of stone architecture on the scale of something from Lord of the Rings.
Typical Basilica of its period. Beautiful exterior with superb architectural features. The interior is typical of the period with extensive and beautifully designed stained glass windows.
A must to see when in Barcelona. Im not in to visiting churches but this architectural materpiece is a must to visit when you are visiting Barcelona.

made by people from Born. Nice church, which was built by and for the people of Born.
It is a romanescue church with a bold interior. Nice to know that the christian art is also -mainly- made by artist from Born.
entrance is free
Beautiful. Only down side you need to pay for all the basilicas! Very historic. You can visit small museum which has ancient pictures and sculptures.

The most beautiful. I had heard about Santa Maria del Mar, and had wanted to go for quite some time. I expected a small church, don't know why. This is a large, beautiful, fantastic church. I just have to go some day for a service. Now we visited just short in the evening, among a lot of other tourists.

must visit. fabulously beautiful
grandiose architectural creation
an incredible feeling inside
a sense of connection with the world and through the time
breathtaking beauty

A tall and luminous gothic church. Santa María del Mar is the #2 Gothic church to visit at the old Barcelona quarter. Very tall and full of light during the day, a stunning example of Catalan gothic style. It has less artwork and imagery than most Spanish churches, as many were lost during the Civil War. There is an alternative to go up the towers and see dowtown Barcelona from there. Definitely a must see during your visit.

Interesting place to go. A nice cathedral, that you can visit it easily , spenind less than an hour.As it is inside the Gothic Quarter and Born area you will pass outside anyway, so go inside to watch it.

The most beautiful basilica in Barcelona!. Walk around the gothic quarter in the early evening through Placa del Rei, el Fossar de les Moreres and then set foot in this beautiful and intimate church. The dim light and the smell of candles will transport you straight to the Barcelona of the middle ages. There are classical music concert regularly at a good price worth trying.

Wonderful church. I visited this church because it was described in the book of Ildefonso Falcones and it was really amazing. This church has a great coloured glasses and columns. It's the best church I've ever seen.
Great architecture. This church is beautiful! It is a must visit in Barcelona. The architecture is just beautiful! And it is free! It is located close to many attractions!

Gorgeous church in Barcelona. Using the paid entry allowed us to enter the raised choir areas behind the altar, worth every penny with the available views of the church's windows, structure, etc. A brief exhibit near the entry point provided great explanations of the history of the church. It felt very welcoming despite its size and grandeur.

A peaceful place.. I know we had to pay to visit this Basilica but when inside you lose yourself with history, age and the beauty of the place. If by any chance others have the chance to visit please don't hurry...a wonder of this world. After that go and sit in the square and have a coffee.
Amazing Place. Really interesting place. The stain glass windows were incredible especially when the light shines through. Busy, touristy but well work a visit!
Possibly the wonder of Barcelona. If York Minster is one of the wonders of England then this is one of the wonders of Spain and definitely of Barcelona

Stunning!. We didn't actually plan a visit to the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar, we passed it whilst we were lost at night and I am so happy that we had a look inside. There's something quite magical about this building. Very beautiful and peaceful inside.
Common. Well another cathedral .. if you visited one.. you will stop another one .. is the same for all.. be creative????
Must see. This church is not much mentioned in the guides but it is worth a visit: it is a little hidden treasure.

One of the most beautiful in Spain. This one is really special. It is close to the water and was built with funds from sailors and men and women who make their living from the sea. I have been told by the locals that this church is the most beloved in Barcelona. Take your time and walk all around the exterior before going inside-- to get a sense of the size. It is also nice to sit on the steps and people watch.

Beautiful small basilica ........ a must to see. Peaceful, special place of prayer and reflection in centre of Barcelona. Well worth a visit. This is located in the heart of the city among tapas bars in a beautiful plaza. It's small but retains a unique, simple character in it's layout without the ornate decorative features associated with churches and cathedrals. Something special here in the quietness. Visit late evening as it tends to get crowded during the day. We arrived just in time for the end of Mass in small chapel. It was beautiful.
Too much. Too much pomp for my taste, with all the poor people here and homeless sleeping on the street, rather have all this glorification going to help citizens

My favorite sight in Barcelona. I think this place is underrated. Entry was free (made a donation), and went in the evening. It was absolutely breathtaking inside. Been to six European countries this year, and this was one of the top basilica/cathedrals I've seen.

Beautiful Basilica. We visited this beautiful Basilica after visiting both the Cathedral of Barcelona and Sagrada Familia - and found this still amazing. The oldest of the Cathedral, the architecture is truly stunning. We loved the visit and were impressed with the size and structure. Recommend!

Plain, but powerful. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is plain, not ornate at all unlike other renaissance churches, particularly thanks to fire damage. However, with the strong gothic style, and the history of being built from direct efforts of the people of the city, it still invokes power. A good attraction.
Midnight Christmas mass. A very unique cultural experience. Beautiful basilica. Magical. A must for any traveler to experience.

Lovely Minor Basilica. This is very near the Picasso museum. We stopped in for a quick look and stayed for thirty minutes or so. The basilica is gorgeous and very old, dating to the 1300s. Be sure to walk all the way around the back of the altar to the small chapel which is a quiet place to pray. The many side chapels appear to be quite old and each is worth more than a passing glance.Just a quick additional note, we stopped for a coffee on the square just outside the main entrance. The server advised us to be careful with our bags and cameras. Right after that, four police officers stopped four young women on the steps of the church. The server commented that they are "known pick-pockets in this area."

What wonderful discovery in the Gothic Quarter. My wife and I stumbled on this wonderful discovery as we were roaming around the narrow cobblestone streets of the Gothic Quarter and well worth the visit. A simple construction with incredible symmetry and wonderful stain glass windows.

Hauntingly beautiful. The bare interior of this Basilica is the result of fire damage that was never restored but this leaves in incredibly striking interior. This attraction was free to enter and whilst I was visiting there was a wonderful classical performance that was also free of charge.Whilst one cannot spend much time here it is work taking a look around if you are in the area.

A relative small beautiful church that is often ignored. Since this church is located close to the Cathedral of Barcelona, it is probably one of the overlooked attraction. It is relatively small but still is amazing and it is one of the oldest churches in Barcelona. It is much much less crowded that the Cathedral.
Christmas Mass. Lovely International Christmas Mass at this beautiful Basilica in El Gotic. Would definitely recommend if staying in Barcelona.

Breathtaking. This attraction cost 7euro's (roughly $10.00 Cnd.) but was woth every penny. The ceilings and the sheer size of this church was astounding. Much to see within the church and a lovely. little gift shop on the premises. I could have sat inside there for hours. Amazing workmanship.

Oh, so beautiful!. I was told that it was gorgeous. The church is a bit mystical, it gives you a sense of serenity. Yes, it is visited by many people, but it is not as crowded as other sites, the acces is simple, the surroundings are worth seeing, and the architecture is outstanding. Highly recommended.

7 Euros well spent. My trip in to the Basilica was well worth the 7 Euro admittance fee. The general atmosphere took me back in time. You could sense the history in the facility. I wasn't able to get through the entire Basilica and I would be happy to spend more time during my next visit to Barcelona.

Beautiful Church. The Basilica is a beautiful church and well worth seeing if you're in the area. I would recommend timing this in with a day around the gothic quarter.
If you have children, check out the cloisters and gardens. They're really beautiful. Also, the roof top offers great views of Barcelona and was accessible for 3 Euros.
A very grand Basilica!. We visited this Basilica and left just as mass was beginning. It is a good representation of Gothic style in the heart of Barcelona.

Nice!!. This churh is my favourite.
After reading the book written by Idelfonso Falcone I had to se it in real life.
And it is a fantastic experience.

Preference over the sagrada familia one. Free, majestic, impressive and less tourist trap in my opinion.
Located in a lovely neighborhood, with lots of things to see close.
Beautiful!. This is another beautiful basilica. The Christmas markets are right out front, which we really enjoyed.
WOW.. Don`t miss this it`s a Must See. Its an artistic and spiritual experience. We had tears as we entered. We booked tickets before arriving on the web - you should too.
Wow!. This was quite an impressive Basilica to visit. The architecture is quite different than Sagrada Familia and certainly worth a visit.

Time for reflection. This is the only place which I constantly return to at my visits to Barcelona. A gothic cathedral, and the attraction is the size and serenity it is has. A place for reflection.
Visit for free after 5 pm.
a nice experince. I saw many Basilic in the word.in this one we receive simplicity and a very special architecture . to arrive until 11.30 am or after 5.30 pm to receive a free entrance.
Impressive!. Impressive Basilica, close by the Gothic Quarter and the jewish area, worth a visit if you are staying in Barcelona.

Amazing experience!. We got here in just in time for the service on a Sunday evening. I am not religious at all but it was a beautiful experience, especially the singing. It also allowed us to rest our feet after a day of walking a lot. I later saw that you can visit the roof top, i will definitely do that on my next visit.

Long clothes to go in!. They have rules!And I respect that! Is breath take the inside, I love the outside construction also, what I love about it is that is not cue to go in I also love the story behind the history about this Basilica.
Fantastic. Make sure you get the headphones telling you about the building, paintings, etc.. Well worth going to visit this it is amazing

Very Impressive medieval church.. I really enjoyed chilling out on a pew here for while. Taking it all in. The grand proportions of this medieval church are indeed very impressive. It certainly gives you an idea just how important and wealthy this city on the Mediterranean has been down through the ages.

A hidden-beautiful religious place.. Happen to be in Barcelona for sometimes. Came here for a "meet-up" with the god and join the locals for the misa. It was very memorable. The surroundings are just amazing and huge! It's actually more than that, but i can't explain further. Enjoy yourself there, it's a two-way stop, of religious & sightseeing. A perfect combination.
Fantastic architecture. Stunning location. Old cathedral in total contrast to sagrada familia. All the traditional features high altar nave etc. marvel at its age ,complexity and longevity.
Nice Gothic Church. When we visited this church, there were organ music played. The acustics were amazing. The church itself is a typical gothic church, and admisiion is free.
A must when touring the gothic town. One of the oldest churches in town will. A visit will send you centuries back when Barcelona was truly a main hub in the mediterranean trade.

One of the jewels of Barcelona. I know some of the back story of the place and read a book about it as well so my visit was personal. However, it is a really nice Basilica full of Barcelona's history and culture. A must see on your visit to this wonderful city.

Catalan Gothic. Go visit the interior for free after 5:30 p.m.. The Catalans build wide rather than vertical, quite a feat of achievement considering that stone is very resistant on vertical and weak in tension.
TIP If you want to visit the site for free(except the terraces) go after 5:30 p.m.
Perfect Evening.. A perfect setting for a wonderful evening of guitar music. The acoustics within this magnificent church only go to enhance the performance of the players.

Gothic Beauty - Equally Beautiful inside and out!. It is interesting to just stand there and enjoy the details of the outside of the cathedral. At sunset when the sun goes down it cast a interesting look on it. Look up to the top to see the angels, prophets and all the details.There is local musicians playing Spanish music on the steps of the Cathedral which is beautiful and reminds you of where you are - and puts you in awe. Go inside and look at the details inside as they are equally beautiful. If you go later in the evening the box office where they charge you closes and you can go in for free. As well the line up is down. Well worth visiting for the architecture
Another must see.. It's a spiritual place. You can feel the energy pulsate through your body. Try to catch a sermon. Once again, like nearly all places in Barcelona, the architecture is amazing.

Beautifully, Darkly Gothic!. An oasis of quiet and contemplation. Deeply darkly majestically gothic - with soaring breathtaking arches. The cloisters were particularly beautiful - especially the fountain, with it's ferns, clear pools - from which to drink from and refresh the mind.

Worth taking a look. This church is in one of the most cozy neighborhoods in Barcelona. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby and if you are in the neighborhood it is definitely worth taking a look inside the church.
Gorgeous Elegance!. Stunning historical cathedral. Amazing architecture and a must see when visiting this remarkable city of Barcelona!
Beautiful. Very beautiful church. One of the best I have ever seen. Cold and authentic. Great location to explore the Gothic quarter!

Lovely place. The best part of this building is the location. Historical and multicultural place. The basilica is not very big but the visit is completely worth and a must in Barcelona. The surroundings are even better.

Stunning architecture. Beautiful old building in the heart of Barcelona. Quite difficult to find down all the narrow streets and alleys, but worth the find! Free entry to the courtyard and chambers dedicated to various saints. Particularly moving when visiting at night.

Incredible Gothic Church. Take the tour that includes the roof. Worth a full visit for all the history and views of the city. View of the city from the roof was spectacular and you get a closeup look at the bells.

a wonderful surprise. visited the Basilica while we randomly walk around the streets of the Gothic quarter. It has a very old and grand aura upon entering it. There was a mass ongoing which gave the Basilica an even more grandeur feel to it.

Quietness in El Born. On a wrm day, we came into the Basilica Santa Maria del Mar. The exterior is not specially striking but the inside is beautiful, nice stained glass window and compared to a lot of Spanish churches not over loaded with gold.

Beautiful place, free to enter. Cheap guided tour and free entry here, and our tour guide (didn't catch his name) was excellent.
I'm not keen on heights so the trip onto the roof was nervy but worth it for spectacular sunset views of the city.
not worth the admission fee. This basilica is definitely not worth the admission fee. After visiting the basilica of sagrada familia, visiting the rest is trivial.

A beautiful stumble. This was something we had not necessarily planned to do but something we stumbled upon. Again it was a place where you had to cover yourself before entering but it is certainly worth it and its free so why not. It really is beautiful in its own right and I would recommend a stumble in amongst your planned shopping trip.

Stunning at night. We happened in at the endo of a mass on evening. (not photos allowed at that time). There was an organ playing as the mass ended and we sat in the back to take it all in. Beautiful and moving.
Pretty Amazing.. This church looks so old inside and has a real grand feel about it. Seems like it has alot more history than he sagrada familia.

Stunning. A beautiful gothic church. They held a Sunday International Mass every Sunday. The priest is very friendly and the Mass is partly in Castillano (what we generally call Spanish), partly in Catalan, with some bits in English, French, German and Italian. A special experience is to attend one of the concerts they held quite frequently in the Basilica. Check the church bulletin to know if you are luchy and can attend one during your stay.
a beauty to behold. on our tour we stopped and marveled at this church- it is quite big and ornate- It is amazing the learn the facts here- take a tour-

Make sure you visit the roof. We like to wander around cathedrals, admiring the architecture, and the history. The Basilica is one of the smaller cathedrals we have visited but has some unusual and lovely features that are worth seeing. Do take the lift to the rooftop, where you get a great view of the city and can see the spires and bell towers close up. Be warned though if you are not good with heights the walkways are scaffolding platforms, and not for the faint hearted. At 2euros each its also much cheaper than the Sagrada Familia, which you can see in the distance. There is also an unusual crypt that looks like a theatre, with steps going down to it in the middle of the church. And lastly the beautiful cloister, complete with fountain, pond, geese and palm trees, unexpected and quite magical.
A solemn quiet place. This basilica Is tucked away in the old part of the city, but if you happen to pass by, be sure to enter it and take a look at every sculpture you see there. It's uplifting.
Europe trip 2015. Great place to visit surprise beautiful and meaningfull art works. Few Euro to get in but it worth its. Can use the hope on and hope off to visit this area.
Beautiful church.. A lovely church with a very calm, spiritual atmosphere. It was a contrast with the busy tourist areas in the Old Town. Well worth a visit if you are in Barcelona!
A Barcelona Gem. If you enjoy cathedrals it is well worth visiting. Quite beautiful. It is not easy to find but worth the trip.

Breath Taking All Around!. What an amazing structure! Let the pictures speak for themselves because words cannot begin to describe what's here. One hint, make sure you head up to the rooftop for some views across the city!
Lovely church in El Born District. This is an absolutely stunning church with beautiful glass artwork windows by a lovely square with some nice cafes. Definitely worth a visit - it's free!

Fabulous. Visited here after the Sagrada Familia, and found the similarities and the contrasts fascinating. The Basilica is impressively spacious and symmetric, with beautiful columns and stained glass windows. Didn't go up to the terraces although that is now an option. Well worth a visit - easy to get to and find.

Worth a Look. I wouldn't say this is a must see, but if you're in the Gothic Quarter & passing by it's worth taking a look inside. There are plenty of cafes right outside to sit down & have some food or drink while passing by.
Interesting church. It is worth seeing and it is quite beautiful. Each of the chapels was quite interesting. We considered not going in but it was well worth the visit.

outstanding. very old buildings all around, which you can see better if you book your guided tour where you can actually go on top of the church . . . the views are spectacular.
impressive interior columns and colored windows

The architecture is amazing!. The inside of this Basilica is one of the best examples of gothic architecture. Make sure to check when the doors open for "free entrance". It's mind boggling that this church used to stand at the shores of the Mediterranean Sea!
Must visit for its history significance. Beautiful statues and architecture. Historical and cultural significance not to be missed. remember to light a candle

Beautiful. The structure inspires a majesty, quite different from that of La Sagrada Familia, but a grand one all its own. But more than that, the church evokes a peace and stillness, allowing one commune with whomever gods they believe. I liked being able to just sit in the pews and just be still. I loved the feel of the centuries just settled in the bones of this old church. I visited at the end of the day, so while there presumably may have been more light earlier in the day, the gloaming gave the inside of the church a different kind of beauty.

Nice gothic church. Santa Maria del Mar is a nice gothic church. I believe entrance is free after 5;00 pm. There is something extra for FB Barcelona fans. One of the stained-glass window has small FC Barcelona logo in it but it's not easy to find it.

The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is a must to see!. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is near the Rambla en El Born.This basilica is very beautifull and an must to see when you visit Barcelona. Also around this basilica you have many good restaurants and ordinary shops.

Beautiful. We got here on the hop on off bus this was one of the most amazing Churches we have visited worth paying extra to go to the top for stunning views, ladies remember to cover up and finish the tour off by finding a a Tapas bar nearby

My visit to the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar in Barcelona. As my wife and I walked the streets of the beautiful city of Barcelona we came across the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar and it was very beautiful as must see! We only had a small map which we did not look at very much. Our tours are the beauty we find by suprise in all our travels, we find that best. We explore.......... try it!!

Fine Gothic Basilica, but needs a bit of love. The Basilica is well worth a visit. Massive columns rise to heaven, but ones eyes are drawn to the dampness and damage being done to the ceiling. It will take a lot of money to restore the building. Unfortunately, there is little art of note in this Basilica. The beauty is in the enduring life and quality of the stonework. Behind the main alter is a little chapel where we attended Mass, which is celebrated each evening at 7.30 p.m.When I'm in Barcelona again, I will visit again.
Classic. Structurally fascinating. A lovely building both inside and out. Set in a pretty square in the heart of town.Another Barcelona must-see.
Look up!. Enter the Basilica and look up at the ceiling. You'll love the details on the arcades! The basilica is impressive and full of statues and paintings that you might like.
Beautifully situated. We have enjoyed visiting the Baslica in the old city. The heart of BCN. Terraces with nice food and drinks opposite to the church. Very nice. Try the Sangria's.

Beautiful gothic church. This was well worth a visit and the entry fee. I can understand travellers on a budget may not wish to pay to go in but it is worth it to see the interior. Definitely worth a visit.
So Beautiful. We were staying very near this beautiful building, and spent our whole trip trying to finds the time to visit,So glad that we did, a very traditional Gothic building, we loved it.
Beautiful church. A very serene peaceful place with high roof, giving a feel of space and some interesting details both inside and out.

A refreshing contrast with other attractions. We wandered in mid-evening as part of our pre-dinner stroll. The calm and simplicity of the place was an interesting and welcome contrast to other Barcelona attractions - as was the feeling that we were in working church. (Their TripAdvisor certificate of excellence is displayed next to the notice encouraging local kids to attend their catechism group.)

Breathtaking!. You would think after seeing one or two cathedrals, you would become blasé about seeing yet another. However, there is something magical about this one. Not only for serentity, the beauty and the sheer wonderful of this very grand structure.

Atmospheric, precious and beautiful. If you want to enjoy the atmosphere of a mediaeval cathedral without the distraction of too much baroque tat, then this is the place for you. I do not think it will disappoint. It is truly a Cathedral of and for the people. Largely funded by craftsmen, fishermen and their guilds in the Middle Ages, before wealthier patrons put their hands into their coffers it is still a living church for real people. Incidentally, many of the stonemasons and other craftsmen dedicated their scarce free time to the building of this special Cathedral.

Catalan Gothic at its upmost. I just love this church. It is, in my opinion and of many lovers of art, the most impressive of the "great" religious buildings in Barcelona. Catalan Gothic is not made of concrete or cement, but of stones put together like bricks. It is the result of the work of the people of historic Barcelona, the men who carried the stones from the sea.
