It is also one of the privileged places for chamber music and chorals, as its acoustic is superb. You can visit the cathedral and the Sagrada Familia, but most of all, don't forget to visit Santa Maria del Mar. It is the most beloved architectural treasure for Barcelona's people.
Lovely cathedral. It's a very large cathedral with geese in it. It's free to go in and look around. Beautiful. Well worth visiting.

Our First Barcelona. After reading the novel "Cathedral by the Sea" I planned our trip to Barcelona to begin with this church visit and end with a visit (tickets purchased beforehand on Internet to avoid the long lines) of the Sagrada Familia. We were not disappointed in our choice to start our stay in this fascinating city! The entire El Born area is filled with interesting winding and narrow streets, shops, cafes and restaurants. We spent about four hours simply wondering in the area. The history of the construction of the church in only 60 years provided a pure Catalan style. Knowing the background of the local workers and wealthy shipping investors made the visit so much more interesting. Also interesting is the still evident effects on the ceiling from damage during the Spanish Civil War.If you enjoy history and learning about Catalan identity, this church should not be missed. Reading the novel helps greatly in setting history to the place.
Beautiful. Located at Placa Santa Maria in the Gothic Quarter. Beautiful architecture. Very impressive building. You can go in for free.
A Beautiful Building. Well worth a visit, the workmanship is amazing, beautiful windows and there are many beautiful small chapels to admire, very calming after a visit to Les Ramblas.
In Awe.. The church is so majestic,open, with works of art often seen in those huge table art books.Loved seeing architecture that is several hundred years old.

Baroque Spanish Cathedral. Best part is the small garden attached to the cathedral with beautiful trees and swans, tranquil. Interior of cathedral is over-the-top baroque Spanish, too much gold leaf, one can see where all the gold from the new world went.
Majestic. Impressive scale and detail. A cool respite on a hot day. Quite a contrast to other Cathedrals and well located not far from Picasso museum

One of the great churches of the world. This is a magnificent church and it really stuns the visitor. I would recommend to read the Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones to really get the feel for the period. The catacombs are a bit disappointing, though.
Amazing church. My favorite church (beside Sagrada) in BCN - The location is great shaping the neighborhood. Do not miss to have a coffee or a drink in one of the surrounding bars.
Nice. However, i wasn't able to go in... I should have... That's why its better to go on your own or with the free walking tour than buying a package with our sites..
Beautiful stained glass windows.. This Basilica is so classic and peaceful, with beautiful stained glass windows and long slender columns.

Very nice Church at El Borne. El Borne is the new hip neighborhood as the Soho in NYC used to be. Bohemian in nature yet trendy, it is increasingly becoming more visited and relevant. Santa maria del Mar is adjacent to El Borne at the Gothic Hood.

One of my favorite churches in Barcelona. After going to Segrada Familia (which is beautiful and interesting, but crowded) and Cathedral Barcelona (which seemed a little commerical), the Basilica was very peaceful and quite beautiful in a much simpler way. We took the tour up to the top, which was very nice. A lot of interesting history, and hey, it got finished in only 50 years. For those familiar with the Jesuits, Ignatius went to church there.

A perfect example of medieval architecture. Construction of this Basilica started in 1329, and lasted for around 50 years. Having suffered a devastating fire in 1936, the baroque altar and iconography were destroyed. The rebuilding has returned the Church to its stark, Gothic style.Construction of the Church is symmetrical, with each side altar being 10 feet deep, each side aisle double that, and the central aisle four times as wide. The interior is very stark, but make sure you also visit at night, when the interior takes on a completely different aura. Entry is free from 5.30 until 8.00pm.Make time to visit this Basilica, in addition to the Barcelona Cathedral, a nearby 15 minute walk.
Lovely place to see. We didn't actually go in as there was an event taking place. There were lots of people outside who were waiting to go in when the concert finished.
Would like to go back. One of the sacred place i have ever been. you will enjoyed. Nice place. Walkways. long line to see the statue of Santa maria. Sometimes Organ music

A stunning jewel--Barcelona's only gothic cathedral. Incredible, glorious, awe-inspiring--these are only a few of the adjectives I could use to describe this magnificent gothic cathedral. Not to detract from the genius of Gaudi, this structure is what comes to my mind when I think of the word "cathedral." I just did a walk-through on my own, rather than taking a tour, because we were on our way to something else when we stopped here. I wish I had taken a tour because the structure has such an interesting history (which I learned after the fact), and there were many features of this magnificent church that I overlooked. There are some informational displays in the back of the church providing facts related to its construction. They're not in English, alas, but you can figure out the basics. I took photos of the information so I could try to do some translating when I got home. Anyway, the columns soar to an incredible height, and in doing so, while you know you're surrounded by stone, you also get the feeling of openness. As a side note, when you've had enough of the glorious architecture, you can walk back outside and possibly be entertained by assorted street performers. When we left the church, we encountered a lively group of acrobat-type performers from South America. There's no doubt that Barcelona is a city of contrasts!

A favourite place to pause and recover from the bustle of life.. We have visited Barcelona several times, always staying in Borne, close to Santa Maria del Mar so it has become a familiar place. We also visited the cathedral and the contrast is stark. The basilica is high, wide and relatively uncluttered so you can feel the space around you. Every side chapel at the cathedral is decorated, almost excessively but the basilica relies upon its stonemasons for both its grandure and its decoration. I am anti-religon but Santa Maria del Mar is a lovely place to sit and contemplate while one's spirits recover from the rush of the day.There are various formal tours and it is possible to visit the roof but so far I have not tried any of those.
Gaudi's inspiration. Visit this beautiful basilica and understand how this became a source of inspiration for Gaudi, when he conceived the idea behind the architecture of Sagrada Familia.

Awesome. Very moving. Not as ornate as the cathedral. Some interesting replicas.
Refreshments outside pricey.

Gem tucked away. This is not the Basilica of the Sagrada Familia, but given that, it is worth a trip to see something slightly different. If you are going to the Picasso museum anyway, it's right near there so pop on in!

The storie of the church. It is not so beutyfull church and I have seeing more beutyfull, but the story of how it was built and how it changet the life for so many for 7-800 years ago is very tutching. THe statue of Virgin Mary and baby Jesus is so poverfull you can feal the kindness glancing from it when you are there.

wonderful. full of atmosphere and a 'sense of place'. Free to enter and given a welcome on arrival. Was not busy at end of day, and was able to sit, relax and take in site and what was seen during the day.

One Of Our Favorite Basilicas We have Seen. We have visited many many basilicas in Spain, Greece, and Italy. This is one of my favorites. The color of the stone with the unique lighting makes it awe-inspiring. It feels truly ancient and is one of the must sees in Barcelona.

It was great to see the subject of the recent novel. We read "Cathedral of the Sea" and really wanted to include Santa Maria del Mar on our itinerary. It is an impressive church, with a history perhaps somewhat out of the ordinary. There are informative displays.

All Saints Day mass. We went to Santa Maria del Mar for the mass on All Saints Day, and it was a delight. It was given in Spanish, with a single woman singing the musical parts. The atmosphere in the basilica is well preserved and is a really great worship space.

Beautiful Basilica. I'm not religious but I loved this Basilica. I walked around taking pictures of the Basilica interiors, the statues and the beautiful Gothic architecture for atleast 3 hours. I sat inside peacefully for almost an hour during my 3 day tour to Barcelona. If you love Gothic architecture, give this place atleast 3 hours. City tour buses have a stop very close to this Basilica.

Stunning architecture. The Basilica of Santa Maria de Mar was recommended by our walking guide as having some of the best gothic architecture and we were not disappointed. When we visited on Saturday evening we were lucky enough to hear a choir rehearsing in there which was beautiful. A great place for some quiet contemplation, see some amazing architecture and to rest your weary feet for a little while!

A place in history. Would never have found this without our guide for the dayHe gave us a history lesson and a tour of this beautiful building I'm not religious but being in here made me feel different. I could not take my eyes off the architecture, the gold decoration, and the whole feel of the place was specialTo anyone travelling to Barcelona I would advise them to give this a couple of hours out of their day to visit this Basillica
great place to visit. wonderful place, almost a counterpoint to sagrada familia, very glad that i took the time to find this place and the area around it. very worth the time

One you really should see. This is not the most amazing Cathedral in a city full of amazingness but it is worth it for two reason. Firstly it is the only (I may be wrong here) Cathedral ever to be started and finished in a single century so it is built in a single "style" of Gothic.Secondly the atworks around the central cavern are very beautiful and this is a working Cathedral but alo tucked away in the North Western corner is a modern stained glass window from 1995 by a glass artist called Jose Fernandez Castrillo: Truly stunning piece of work and fits into the Gothic architecture beautifully
Majestic. The church is located in the middle of busy pedestrian streets and impresses more when you enter the church, that looks rather smaller from outside.
Quite unusual.. The little chapels inside the church are full of beautiful artwork. Quite different to Sagrada Familia.
Beautiful building. We just made it though the door before they shut....was beautiful...free to enter which was a bonus.

Marvellous: a must-see. I know I'm biased because I sang in this huge church with my choir but this is the outstanding Gothic church of the city and rivals the cathedral in every way. Try to catch some music here because the acoustics are wonderful. The present clergy are wonderful too, very relaxed and friendly. I'm not religious but this is a fabulous, spiritual and moving place.

A historic church in a historic district.. Just getting to this church is an experience. Enjoy the streets and alleyways along the way and then enjoy the church. Look up to ceiling and you will see the soot from the fire that almost destroyed it during the Spanish civil war in 36. Many of the artwork was taken to local museums and saved. Unfortunately, most of it has not been returned. Look for the small wooden ship by the Virgin.

One of the best. This is a wonderful basilica and not to be missed when visiting Barcelona. It is a feast for the eyes with the most ornate trappings throughout. It is also close to the main tourist centre of Barcelona so fonts in nicely with otter tourist attractions.

The paradigm of gothic art in Barcelona. It's silent atmosphere, religious environment, it's vertical design, higher and higher, shows the thousands of years of the coast, middle aged city.I'm proud that I was married here.

Not terribly distinctive Gothic-type cathedral. A 14th century cathedral that doesn't particularly stand out. Most of what you see today dates to after 1936, when the cathedral was set on fire during the Spanish Civil War and burned for 11 days. Definitely worth popping in if you are in the area.
The Workers' Church. Built by the workers of the El Born district, this is a Gothic gem. Visit in the morning for a free entry

A huge gothic masterpiece. As a conoisseur of ecclesiastical architecture, this place was a must for me. The soaring stonework is a sight to behold and the stained glass is magnificent, their light enhanced by the gloom of the dark-walled interior.

Been here several times, always worthwhile. This is considered the best example of Calatan Gothic architecture. Any visit is a pleasure, but learning some history adds a great deal of depth. We've come across weddings and funerals during visits, and it is heartening to know the church is alive and embraced by residents.

Go early. Has a street market here so it’s best to arrive at first light to get clean un-cluttered photos of this perfect examples of Gothic style architecture. Besides the inside walk round the whole outside of the building the curves and angles of the stone work are amazing.
As always buy you ticket on line.

Gold city. We were on a guided tour and this church was part of the recommended attractions. It is the main cathedral of Barcelona and is located in the Gothic quarter not far from and in easy walking distance from the avenue Las Ramblas.The Cathedral is most impressive and in fact whilst not being a religious person is probably the most impressive piece of church real estate we have seen. The gold is all over the place, not just behind the alter as would be normal.Entrance is free but you must wear appropriate clothing out of respect.Well worth the walk.Incidentally, if you exit the Cathedral and turn immediately left at the top of the steps and then visit the Moorish house on the right you will find a little gem. Inside the house, past the courtyard, ignore the museum and turn left. Here is a little gangway that allows you to see the original city wall. Marvellous.
Gorgeous. Must see if visiting the Barri Gotic.Beautiful. Free entry. Nice cafes around, and some decent tapas restaurants.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful churches I've seen. We were there just in time for mass so we sat in. Lovely service..

Classic chruch in el Gotico. Discovered this Basilica by walking around the Gothic quarters, and found it full of character. It's a shame the front part is always full of beggars, skaters and other charlatans, but worth a look inside if you are in the area.

Beautiful example of gothic church and free to enter. Strolling back from the beach through the old town, we arrived at this large 14th C church, dedicated to the patron saint of sailors. Apparently the most popular for weddings. Catalan Gothic style, simple features but with a beautiful stained glass rose window. It is free to enter but we were all chased out just before 1pm by a man waving keys - must have been lunchtime...........

Hidden beauty. Hidden away in the gothic quarter the Basilica is a beautiful building and well worth a visitEntry from the side allows access to the courtyard (including geese pond)We were lucky to hear a choir rehearsing and it created a magical experience

Not looking but found. We weren't looking for this place and were just walking around the gothic quarter and found it, lots of beggers around, difficult to get full effect as streets are small however worth it.
Beautiful church. Really nice church, we visited here while touring around Spain. Would recommend if you are in the area.

Stunning seaman' church.. The scale of this is amazing - you'd think it was a cathedral. Great for a little peace and quiet while contemplating how they managed to build it prior to the availability of modern cranes and scaffolding.

must see. its part of the visit to Barcelona. Beautiful cathedral. We didn't pay to get in but the next day when we went back they were charging. But it is worth it. We were warned about the pick pockets round this area so be warned.

Unexpected Surprise. When looking for the Picasso museum Me and my girlfriend stumbled upon this magnificent church after taking a wrong turn.
The size and thought of how it must of been constructed is amazing.

Gothic, bare-bones, somber.. I love this basilica, and live right next to it. It was bombed during the civil war, and a fire gutted its insides. So what you get are dark stone walls, lit by the fires of patrons' prayers, long columns off-keel, thin and loaded, no massive alter in the center blocking the view of the entirety of the great hall, few decorations, few side alters. It's a magnificent building.
A must see.. This was one of the first basilicas that we saw. We were pleasantly surprised at how much our 3 boys observed inside.

An excellent example of Catalan Gothic. The Basilica is a great example of Gothic architecture in Barcelona, from the arched doorways and roof trusses to the stained glass windows and the hushed reverence you feel while inside, if you like Gothic churches you will love this.

Beauty hidden within. This imposing building is stark and austere on the outside, but walk through the huge wooden doors into a beautiful, calm, and serene place. The church isn't huge and it doesn't take long to walk around but take time to look at the intricate carvings and highly ornate chapels. The geese in the cloisters are lovely even though a little strange to have them there.

Beautiful interior makes this worth a visit. The guide book has this as a top ten site for Barcelona. We passed the outside a few times and weren't sure. On our final morning it was open as we strolled past so popped in....and glad we did! Like a tardis, this vast gothic interior seems much bigger and grander than the outside suggests. Very atmospheric.

Beautiful moving experience. Our hotel was just around the corner. I wanted to take a phot without anyone being there so snuck out early one morning and got the photo. Later that day I returned to find a stage had been erected in front of the couch. The inside is amazing, another world awaits you. Surprise inside were the geese in a little courtyard next door. It's in the heart of the gothic centre don't miss it.

Back in time. The basilica is in the Gothic area of Barcelona. With the winding streets that lead you to this wonderful church you can imagine what it may have been like when you would hear the pounding of horses hooves. Built in the 14th century you can appreciate the skill of the everyone that built the church. There is a small square where you can soak up the vibe outside of the church. It does have that touristy feel around this church with all the shops, but it is what it is. There is a charge during the day, at night we walked right in. During the day you can pay a little extra and take the tour to the top of the church. If you are in the area it is a must.

An interesting Cathedral. We visited this Cathedral and enjoyed it. The price of your entrance also includes the lift onto the roof of the Cathedral which has a walkway on it, you get some good views of the city. There is also a small museum in the courtyard which your ticket gives you entry to.
Like the same . This one is located in old and nice place which on should check in Barcelona, but inside is Look like the same as other Cathedral.

Amazing Architecture. First thing I thought when I entered the church was wow! The high ceilings make you wonder how they built it. The architecture is amazing definitely something I've never seen before.Well worth a visit if you're in Barcelona!

Beautiful cathedral in the center of Barcelona. The cathedral is in the heart of Barcelona so its impossible to miss it. Entrance is free so I advice everyone to visit this marvelous construction that hides a beautiful interior courtyard. It's definitely worth a visit! It is surrounded with plenty of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants and it is accessible from different directions.
Impressive church. Impressive church in the middle of a busy commercial neighborhood, beautiful stain class windows with simple benches and not overly ornate, free to enter but no pictures allowed

Breathtaking and peaceful place!. To round up a fabulous cruise in the Mediterranean, I made the decision to visit the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar and by accident coincided with a wedding was taking place. What a great opportunity to visit this place!

Church. I've read La catedral del mar in the past and I've visited the church in the past also but the did not have a desent camera with me. So I went to the church with a plan to take some pictures. The church is in Barri gothic so it is thightly packed and unless you have wide agle lens good pictures are not possible. To my shock it you need a ticket to get inside these days. In the past it has been free entry.

Impressive Cathedral. We found the The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar to be very impressive. Both exterior and interior are beautiful. We, however, visited on St. George and the crowds were very large. It would have been better to visit on a 'normal day'.
Great Basilica, Just Beautiful. We recently visited this Basilica and we were very impressed, just breath taking in the interior. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

The true church of Barcelona. In the heart of Born, one of the most beauty zones in Barcelona, this is one of the really important things to see in the city, not only the church, the Born too.This church have a great acoustic and presence and is a important part of the history of the city.Remonended!
A must see :-). This is a fantastic space to see and explore. The entrance is free. The area around the church is a place to stay; restaurants and nice boutiques. I definitely will be back!

Beautiful:). Huge and nice basilica.We did came in during the mass but we still could watch the 12 stations...At night Basilica is a very nice light up and around is a lots of places to seat down and relax.
A quiet oasis. The church has many interesting features- side chapels, stained glass etc. The interior looks much better when fully lit - a wedding was about to take place.
Quiet church in Born. worth popping in to admire the architecture whilst in the Born district. many cafes nearby. about 15 min walk to Barcoleneta

Beautiful basilica of the people. The guide on our Sandeman's walking tour told us the history of this wonderful basilica in the Born area of the city (the artists quarter). We'd visited the Sagrada Familia the day before, which was a stark contrast to this basilica. Inside Santa Maria del Mar it is simple, but beautiful, and a haven from the bustling streets. Worth taking a bit of time to sit inside and just soak up the atmosphere.

Hnnnnnnn. A very impressive gothic style building. It is a huge and formidable building and it is worth a visit.However, I am not particularly religious but wanted to light a candle for personal reasons. I handed over my 2.50 euros to an extremely rude man who was talking on his mobile phone and held out his hand and took my money without even looking at me let alone saying thank you!It left me feeling extremely irritated by his rudeness and actually, sadly, a poor example in representing his church.

A beautiful church and lovely sunday Mass. We were lucky enough to be able to attend high Mass here on a sunday with a choir singing many parts of the service. It was a wonderful experience. The church itself is also lovely, and a haven of peace in a bustling city.
Nice church. Beautiful and serene church. Visit in the evening to save yourself from the entrance costs that they charge during the day
Beautiful!. Don't forget to take the elevator up to see the city views of Barcelona. Breathtaking!! A beautiful church with rich history.
Beautiful architecture . Stunning church, busy yet still amazingly peaceful. Stumbled across it while going from the parc de la ciutadella to the ramblas and was glad we stopped for a look.

Lovely basilica!!!!. I just loved it.. the architecture is amazing!!!!! Remember youre in Barcelona and it will be VERY CROWDED, but is well worth a visit. In addition, you MUST RESPECT WHILE INSIDE! Many tourists will be talking and laughing inside... is a temple, and even though is for everyone, also should be respected.

Lovely Basilica. Lovely Basilica! On the day we were there, we experienced a special treat, as we happened to come across singers performing in the Nave. The acoustics and sound was "heavenly" for want of a better word. Really special moment.

Best church in the city!. I keep visiting this place over and over since I discovered it in high school. It is astonishing, to me much better than the cathedral, it has strength and personality). The problem is that often is crowded but early in the morning you can step in and feel the silence and see the sunlight playing with the coloured glasses. Also the quartier, el Born, is one of the nicest in the whole city.

Nice basilica in the middle of everything. We went to visit this basilica after going to the Picasso museum. The Basilica was nice and peaceful inside. We didn't have the opportunity to follow the guided tour (which I think is 6 Euros), but you could still appreciate the architecture inside.

This is Barcelona's people's cathedral. You will find this gothic cathedral at the heart of the Barri Gotìc (Gothic Quarter). A very quaint cathedral that was built by the working people of Barcelona. Please take the tour and go up the tower, the tour guide will be giving you more than the history of the cathedral by explaining how it is part of the history of the common people of Barcelona. You will see, from the tower, all the other key landmarks of the city and the guide will explain how they came to be and when from the point of inside the walls. An interesting look at the Old Barcelona. A must see one day your visiting the Gothic Quarter, to which this square is one of the main gathering points.

Wonderful guided tour. We arrived at this Basilica around 12:45 and saw a sign to ask about the guided tour that goes up to the roof. We asked about it and were very happy to find out that the tour would be taking place at 1:15pm and was held in spanish and english. We are so happy we signed up! We got to experience the basilica with very few other people inside which was spectacular. Also we got to climb up to see the wonderful rose window close up and then go all the way to the roof. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and catered to both the spanish and english speakers very well. I think the tour cost 8 euros per person and it was well worth it. Also, read the novel Cathedral by the Sea before visiting!
Visit is a must!. This place is definitely worth a visit - very interesting and magnificent architecture - a wonderful place to walk around. Would like to go back again one day.
Amazing. Ladies - you must be dressed appropriately ... no shorts or short skirts. Saw some women who were turned away.
Well worth finding. Lovely place to escape the hustle and bustle of Barcelona. Most restaurants nearby are tourist traps, so beware.

A reference point in the medieval city. More than just visiting this monument is the whereabouts, the markets, the culture that can be felt on its surroundings. There are "free" tours that you may arrange by only tipping the person you meet, recommended choice.
Beautiful. Beautiful setting, peaceful inside. very busy with tourists but I loved that. We ate at a cafe looking onto it.
Beautiful. This was a gem found in the el born area. Just a beautiful very old church that has preserved itself nicely. It was open to the public and there was no charge to walk through.

Too late to see inside. This is a beautiful church building in the middle of Barcelona. We got there at 5 after 8. So we didn't get to see the inside of it. Also there were festivals going on and right in front of it was an orchestra so we couldn't get good pictures of the outside either.

Church. All the Churches we visited in Barcelona were beautiful. This Church included. The architecture of this period in history was amazing. Do light a candle and take the time to remember all those people who came before us and have made these lovely building available to us to still enjoy and find peace and tranquility.

A beautiful church, great stained glass. A lovely contrast to the light and busy atmosphere of the Sagrada Familia. Such a different Gothic style- the vertical columns soar upwards but are very simple. Lovely stained glass, some modern, some very old. Very peaceful and quiet.
Stunning. Loved the magnificent space and light. Thr side chapels were stark compared with other cathedrals but still held a beauty's their own.
Lovely Church. When we visited there was a mass going on but it is a beautiful building used for the purpose it was built for!
beautiful. A beautiful building but have a map as a little bit hidden and please show respect if people are praying. Some tourists are rude at time. Hats off on entering too.

Sunday morning visit. We originally planned to attend Mass here at 10:30 am on Sunday in order to hear the chamber choir. However, that did not seem possible with many places blocked off to the public. We heard a bit of the choir and had a look around. Outside a band started up, in the early afternoon, and people began to do circle dances to the music in the very crowded plaza. Also, a small market set up with many trinkets, religious and other, for sale.

Worth the visit. Initially not on our visiting list, but found it while walking towards the Gothic Quartier and the impressive facade convinced us to go in. Nice interior, invcluding a small garden and chance to get a glimpse of Barcelona from above.

Beautiful church...and worth the visit.. This is one of the many gorgeous churches in the Gothic Quarter. Check the times so you don't get shut out and visit. Depending on what you are looking for I would take a tour of only one or two of the churches.

Different. The basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is not one of those churches ful of frescoes and rich ornaments, ... This basilica is much more simple and that is what makes it so different (in a good way).Although there are very beautiful windows of stained glass. Entry is for free.
Gothic architecture. Beautiful building set in a lovely little square with restaurants which we just came across one evening. Worth a visit.

Don't miss this. We had read that this was Barcelona's favourite church and it is certainly both charming and impressive at the same time. Its smaller and plainer than the Old Cathedral but has a lovely open feel.
Beautiful. Lovely church - didnt get to see a lot of it as there was a wedding on the day we attended.Would definitely like to revisit
Great area. Whatever about going inside, the surrounding area is great to sit outside and watch the world go bye.

Less is More Serene. Having been in and out of many Gothic cathedrals in Spain which seemed dark, heavy and gloomy, it was refreshing to visit Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. The decision to keep it simple after its fire ealy in the 20th century gives it a very different aire, more serene than other churches. Do not miss the beautiful modern stained glass window in the wall to the left of the main altar. It is simply stunning.
Worth seeing. It's a beautiful building and one of the few normal looking "attractions" in Barcelona. It's worth putting in an itinerary. We didn't go inside.

Beautiful inside. I visited the Basillica on a Tuesday afternoon and spent 30 minutes exploring it. I thought it was beautiful. Although it dates back to the 1300s much of it was destroyed in the Spanish civil war. However it has been wonderfully restored. The outside is nice but the inside was a surprise. Its very beautiful. I would recommend visiting the Basillica.

Not to be missed.. Do your homework on this before you go in. The history if very interesting. The church is lovely and well worth the time. It is in the middle of many of the attractions in Barcelona, so easy to find.

Worth a visit to this wonderful Basilica. Simply wonderful! This Gothic style Basilica is worth a visit. Very, very beautiful! This was the cathedral for the poor people in the area back in the 13th Century, and it is much more sober.
One of the three Gothics on the list to see.. In the guidebooks, and worth a visit- only a short distance from a stop on the red route of Bus Turistic. Good Sangria at Buba, right outside!

A beautiful church. Although not filled with massive frescoes and stunning artwork, there was something about this church which was enigmatic! There are huge vaulted ceilings and towering pillars which made me feel awestruck. I would highly recommend just sitting at a pew and having a few minutes just to take it all in from one perspective.

Awesome bascilica . Well worth a visit. Simply huge with great stained glass windows and is a magnificent example of the gothic style. If you only have a little time make sure you go inside it's free for much of the day. This bascilica was built in 54 years by local people of the then fishing and port community. Stunning achievement. Lots of decent eateries close by.

Beautiful, stately gothic cathedral. Pretty awe-inspiring cathedral, with beautiful, high sweeping arches. This amazing gothic cathedral with it's grand simplicity (relatively speaking) and stunning stained glass should not be missed.

Great views from the roof. We really enjoyed seeing this church and took the tour as we wanted to go to the roof. Great and informative guide with amazing views from the roof. It can be busy though and we found middle of the afternoon to be a good time to go.
Lovely!. We stopped in as part of a Runnerbean tour of the Barri Gotic, so we didn't spend a great deal of time--but it's a beautiful basilica that is worth seeing.
Stunning church. This is one of the churches that asks for an entry fee. One way to avoid it is to find out when Mass is being celebrated, and attend Mass. Be dressed appropriately, though.

Loved Barcelona. Actual trip April, 2013 but they asked me for review. Stayed 1 block from here at Barcelona Cathedral Hotel. Church was beautiful. It sits on a plaza. There were street performers. Groups. People sitting on the steps playing a guitar. It is located in Old town with marvelous winding street. You can have perfume made just for you. When I went, an opera singer was singing in back of church and the sound echoed off the old walls. Located right off bus stops. Easy access to other parts of city. This hotel and the Sagrada Familia are the two churches to visit. In the vicinity is Hotel Colon (across from church) and Oola about 2 blocks. Located within walking distance of Palacio de Musica which is another marvel. I was not lucky enough to be there for a performance.

A typical Mideviel Cathedral. A beautiful Cathedral in the middle of the Placa of the Gothic area. Beautiful details, windows and from each angle a different scene. I actually was on a tour of the Jewish Section, but was able to stop and see this too.

Spiritual journey. Beautiful architecture and a wonderful window into history and spirituality. This Holy place is a marvel in art, culture and gothic construction. Even though we witness it at Sagrada Familia it is still hard to imagine multiple generation of artisans and craftsmen working on this structure an entire working lifetime.

Beautiful. Cathedral that you want and you should not miss when you walking through this part of the city. Beautiful facade and interior will give you satisfaction while you enjoying the view after long walking through this city quarter.

Beautiful Church hidden away in the Gothic Quarter. We stumbled upon thi beautiful church whilst cycling through the winding streets of Barcelona's Gothic quarter. Beautifully built and even more interesting on the inside. Well worth a visit!

One of the most beautiful!. We attended a concert in the small chapel here, and was just blown away with it! The acoustics were great, it was intimate and comfortable. They have concerts several times a week, so check them out. The Basilica is also one of the prettiest I've been to. Worth the visit.

Beautiful Gothic Architecture.. We visited Basilica Santa Maria, on or recent visit to Barcelona. Built between 1329-1383 it is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic style, it was built with money donated by merchants and shipbuilders.We enjoy our visit, the ceiling is amazing.
Pretty Good. Not as dramatic as churches in Italy and Malta but worth the visit. Barca cathedral better. But you cant miss out on a good Basilica so defo pop in.

Nice place. as many churches in the world this one is amazing, the architecture is beautiful as something you would expect from churches in barcelona, it is a really quiet place and if you go on sundays it is free and you can take as many pictures as you want.

Sublime. A wonderful church, my favourite of those we visited in Barcelona. A perfect example of Catalan Gothic, with a monumental elegance that I don't think I've seen anywhere else. I was lucky enough to visit during a wedding and it was great to see the church actually used. More impressive than the Cathedral, and also much less crowded. Find a seat and take in the grandeur!

Amazing building. Considering the time it was originally built, this place is astounding on the inside. Get in and look how high it is up to the ceiling and marvel how in the heck they built this 700+ years ago. 6 Euro charge to get in is a bit high, but I think the interior is worth it. Beware of panhandlers and pickpockets in the tight square right outside.

Wonderful tour / amazing roof views. Maybe isn't a 'must' visit among other landmarks, but a really interesting and informative tour that takes you all the way to the terrace and then the roof is a really great experience a fabulous photo op. You get a marvelous view of the sea, cathedrals, Agbar and, in an especially nice touch, rooftops of the surrounding buildings showing life as is: roof decks, clothes lines, patios, etc. Nice taste of life.

Mass on Sunday. An international mass is available on Sunday done in Catalan with a couple of sections in English. Father was very welcoming and went out of his way to greet everyone at mass during the sharing of Peace. Basilica is very beautiful.

Beauty abounds. This church is a must for lovers of gothic architrecture. We were lucky enough to see a wedding on our visit. Make sure you do the guided tour to the roof, it only costs 8 euro and well worth it.
beautiful. One of the best basilicas I ever been in. Almost no ornaments inside – the building speaks for itself: Airy, floating feeling…

Not impressive. This church is not impressive,but it is right at the beginig of barri gothic so you cannot miss it.It is not like Sagrada familia or La Seu,the shapes are much more soft and surely is not as big.Overall,it is a part of Barcelona that you should see.
Wow!!!. This is a beautiful Basilica! Our guide was most knowledgeable. We really enjoyed the visit! The interior is beautiful in a wonderful location.

Stunning church. A very beautiful church with fabulous stained glass windows. It must be the tallest church I have come across, its vast in height which makes it all the more impressive. Visited a couple of times as its so peaceful and even though there was wedding taking place visitors were still allowed in at the back, very special

Bright and airy. While you're in the Born district visiting the Picasso Museum or the Born Market you should spare ten minutes to have a look inside this lovely Gothic cathedral. It's unusually light and airy interior (perhaps because apparently much of the choir stalls and the like were destroyed during various troubles in the 20th century) and exceptionally slender columns. Also go around the side of the cathedral to see the sloping plaza with its eternal flame to the martyrs which is the centre of the Catalan independence movement. The whole Born area is so full of history and is worth reading about.
classic catalan. simple and calm gothic cathedral.beautiful coloured glass windows.outside, on the eastern side, the memorial of catalan ressistance of 1714.

Unmissable…. The Basílica de Santa Maria del Mar is a magnificent building and, for me, far more interesting architecturally than Barcelona Cathedral. Some tourists were balking at paying an entrance fee although I consider €8 for the entrance - which also included a guided roof tour – very reasonable. Pol, the guide on the roof, was an entertaining and informative guide who pointed out the views, the history of the surrounding streets and buildings as well as giving us a detailed explanation of the church, its architecture and the bells. What impressed me was the centrally illuminated stone spiral staircase which led to the roof. The church itself has a remarkable cohesion architecturally but its outstanding feature in the forest of columns in the apse – a brilliant piece of design and engineering in stone. It is possible to climb another spiral staircase behind the apse to view the church from the triforium. A special treat which many English cathedrals could adopt. Situated so close to the Born Cultural Centre, you should not miss this outstanding building. Whilst Pol was a gem of a guide on the roof it was the welcome from Pedro on the door who also made visiting worthwhile especially as he spoke with warmth and a great depth of knowledge displaying his evident love of the church. That fact that his English was so good was a bonus. Unmissable…N.B. The excellent leaflet that you get on entry has a plan so as not to miss any of the features. However it states that the basilica is “80 meters (or 100 feet) long”. Don’t undersell the building… 80 metres is just over 262 feet which emphasises its cathedral-esque proportions!

beautiful gothic cathedral!!. I came here after reading la catedral del mar... it was amazing the feeling i got after this book, i was super connected to it. the down thing is that you gotta pay to enter, wish it was free but anyways... a must see in Barcelona!

Fabulous roof views. You need to make sure you are not werind a short skirt of shorts to get in here. I had to buy a sarong for 3 Euros but it was worth it.You have to pay 3 euros and go on the roof. It was one of my highlights.
The Cathedral. Beautiful Gothic building just off La Rambla. There are many side chapels (about 30) There's an elevator to the roof of the Cathedral, well worth a trip.
Beautiful church. Beautiful church with free entrance. It is possible to get guided tours (with a fee)- but we didn't get this as we randomly came a cross the church.

Beautiful church.. Beautiful church. It was recommended by a local to go and see for the wonderful stained glass. A real antidote to the Sagrada Familia which is beautiful but hectic. A peaceful oasis where you can light a candle and be quiet.
Beautiful!. We took a walking tour in Barcelona and were taken back with the beauty of this Basilica. You must visit this to see it's beauty.

An Oasis of Tranquility in Bustling Barcelona. Hemmed in amidst the bustle and hubbub of Barcelona's Ribera district sits the imposing 14th Century Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. The Basilica is huge and in marked contrast to the narrow, busy streets outside, and and dates from a time when Barcelona was a very rich maritime power. It is built in the gothic style, with tall pillars supporting vaulted ceilings.There are some very beautiful stained glass windows, and one gets a feeling of great space when inside. From an entirely secular point of view I enjoyed my visit despite the lack of internal decoration such as tapestries and paintings.A word to the wise, many reviewers have stated that the Basilica is free to enter; that is true but only partially. On the day I visited I parted with €5 to get in. Only after I left did I learn that had I waited 15 minutes until 5PM, the visit would be free. Time your visit accordingly.
beautiful church. It is really nice and worth to pay a visit while you are in Barcelona. It is very close to the city centre and easy to access and it is free.
Definetly worth to visit. Its a good place to visit when you are in the Gothic quarter. Also its a goo place to visit if you are on a budget since its free.

A magnificently beautiful church. Just beautiful. If you love a nice, old-looking church with great interiors and decorations, this is an amazing place. I visited this place very late at night and the lighting inside was very pretty; this warm yellow shining through the white bricks of the pillars and walls. Sometimes church could be boring you know, but this place is just great. For me who loves old style European architecture, this was a real eye candy.This place is not very far from Picasso Museum, and me and my friends went here after a visit to Picasso Museum, so you might want to plan for these two attractions on the same day!
Beautiful cathedral. I would say worth a visit. Nice shopping area here and also as you walk up to Jaume. Cathedral is very beautiful and entrance is free.
Historical. If you have the time and you are ok with heights, then do the roof top tour. Great views from the roof top and you get to hear the history.

Hidden Gem. Accidentally stumbled across this beautiful church. Well worth popping inside as its breathtaking. Free to enter and a piece of tranquility in amongst the throng of hustle and bustle outside.

Peaceful visit, wonderful building and rooftop view. I had a busy day touring the city and my trip to the Basilica was a highlight. It was quiet and peaceful, making for a good place to stop and think. It was a stunning building and taking the lift to the roof is a must, as you get great views of Barcelona.

Don't be fooled by the outside -. entering this basilica was a WOW. Such an impressive place of worship. It was even more meaningful after reading "Cathedral By the Sea" and learning about the construction (as part of a fictional story). We went in the morning when it is free to enter and the light was good for seeing the stained glass. The openness in the sanctuary as compared to the cathedral made it a favorite place.
Gorgeous!. It was right in front of our hotel, so we got to see this beautiful Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar every day. It is gorgeous!

Simple easy to visit in the middle of Barri Gotic. I just 'stuck my head in" one night when walking to restaurant - so many things to see in barcelona and this one was just sitting there so casually in the Barri Gotic that I almost missed it. No crowds and an other stunning example of what makes this area so nice to visit.

Do not miss, sit down at nearby bars, very nice atmosphere of the location. Much nicer than the Cathedral Barcelona, modern monument for the victims of Catalunyan freedom matching the old church, very impressive little square with tiny restaurants

Nice church but congested. You could come around a corner and run into this church by accident as it was hidden in a plaza. It had some odd hours so be sure and check what time it is open. It was not the most glamorous church we visited in Spain but it was worth a quick tour for us. With the Sagrada Familia there to view it is tough for any cathedral to compare.
lovely basilica. well worth a visit to basilica and surrounding district. beautiful both inside and out. Great history too in interesting part of town.
Big round window. Didn't go in but a beautiful building. We we're short of time was told the round window is biggest in Europe

Like Italy. I attend a mass here it was simply magical..... the cathedral is beautiful and large, but warm and inviting at the same time. it made me feel almost as I was in Italy. a must see in a quiet little village with great shops and cafe's

Gothic wonder in Bari Gotico. This vast and beautiful gothic edifice, ablaze with votive candles at various shrines, is a haven in the Bari Gotico of Barcelona. Despite the vivacity of the bars and restaurants on the plaza outside the west doors, inside the church is a haven of quiet, peopled by tourists and by pilgrims and worshippers. The space is vast. Take a seat on one of the pews near the west doors, and let the height and distance take you in. Then walk around, light a candle, say a prayer, and be grateful for such a gorgeous ancient church in the middle of this bustling and wonderful city.

Best cathedral I have visited in a long time. Fantastic Cathedral. The variety and quality of the fittings in the small sanctuaries is superb. The building is awe inspiring and has a unique atmosphere.

Basilica Santa Maria del Mar. I absolutely love historical sites, and this one was amazing! Seeing the sheer magnitude of the building and the beauty it contained gave me goose bumps. Just envisioning the history that occurred within its walls truly is mind blowing. The beauty and age of the alters inside this basilica is almost overwhelming, but it is a site that you simply canNOT miss!

Great Raw Beast of a Building. This is the people's church. To get an appreciation for it, read "Cathedral of the Sea" (not 100% accurate, but the sentiment is there). It is relatively un-glamorous by Spanish cathedral standards, but it more than makes up for it with its raw presence and historical significance.
Beautiful. Hidden gem and absolutely beautiful interior, colossal once inside and lovely stained glass. Great to nip into if you're in the Gothic quarter.
Nice church. Beautiful church, but apart from the colourful windows not that interesting or special. And with all the coming and going of tourists it lacks the spirit of a holy place.
Very nice. It was a bit crowded because it was a Saturday, and we could not see the whole place. I recommend going just on a different day.

Marvelous Architecture....!!!. It is a beautiful Gothic Church with some impressive dimensions inside.
Especially the stained glass windows and historical significance .
It's situated in the Gothic Quarter and is well worth a visit.
The visit is free of charge and the neighborhood is worth visiting.
Beautiful church. This is a gorgeous Gothic church with amazing stain glass art work and saint statues. Very busy when we visited, because there was a wedding going on that Saturday afternoon.

One church with multiple deities. I had difficulty to reach this place as I did not speak spanish and was asking people for Basilica...People got it when I just inquired for Santa Maria del Mar. It is not very far from the cathedral and only 10 mins walking distance. The interior is very peaceful and the inner walls have many partitions with each being a temple for one deity or saint. I did not take the tour of the tower.
Beautiful. Must see while visiting old town Bari Gothic. Beautiful setting and interiors not to be missed in Barcelona.

A real hidden gem!. What a wonderful place hidden in small streets! I enjoyed my visit to this beautiful basilica.. The spacious inside with the high pillars gives the feeling of greatness, every single detail is fantastic.. There is not an english description of the architecture of the church inside it but you can google and discover out its history and architecture during the visit.. Dont miss that wonderful place

Very impresive. Very majestic cathedral there is a live band and the seniors dance the night away. A must see. Take your time inside to soak up the religious sceneries. Get an icecream sit and enjoy the music and the grand square.
Don't miss roof. Make sure you do roof top tour best views of Barcelona. Amazing but not well publicized. Not to be missed

A beautiful experience. The Basilica was at the end of the street we stayed in which delighted me because I would call by there to sit for 10 minutes each morning. Initially we visited one afternoon and paid the admission charge. From my observation most tourists visit outside these dedicated hours and don't pay the charge because they come when it's open for worship. I was happy to pay the fee but to ensure the admission charge is paid all the other doors are closed which made the Basilica very warm. It is less grand than the Cathedral but lovelier. It was a highlight of my trip to Barcelona.

Lovely Stained glass Windows. We visited on a Saturday evening and there was a service going on, the windows are very colourful. There are a lot of people outside trying to sell you things. Not certain if normally free but it was at this time.
If you are nearby, stop.. The basilica is a brief stop, if you are in the neighborhood. It's history is more interesting than the site itself.
Lovely church in El Born. Gorgeous little church in the district of EL Born Barcelona. Beautiful architecture. It was a short walk from our B&B Casa Marcelo and well worth the visit.

Stunning views from the tower. We took a guided tour of this church which was informative and interesting. the highligt was walking up to the top of the tower - not for the faint hearted - with fantastic views right across the city. lovely.

Sunset walk thru. We had just finished having our desert before dinner and found this church was still open. We were not able to stay long, as they were about to close soon, but seeing the stain glass in the church grow dimmer from the sun setting was a site to see. The different areas to light the candles to the different saints was not something I had seen in person before, and it was beautiful.
Beautiful church. If you are interested in churches built with the Gothic rhythm you should visit Santa Maria del Mar. You can see beautiful vitro and sculptures.

Well worth a visit. This is well worth a wander around if you are in the area. There are no charges to get in, and the doors are open most of the time. Beware the odd person who stands at the door waving a cup around as though he is collecting donations for the church - they are for him and not the church. The inside is spectacularly beautiful and the stained glass superb. In the evening the atmosphere is peaceful while the buzz develops around the area as everybody comes out to eat in the tapas bars surrounding it.

Amazing Basilica try to ignore the armed police parked outside. Another fabulous church with awesome architecture and finish.Freely accessible in an area where there is lots to see, but beware pickpockets and muggers, who appear undeterred by the police carrying automatic rifles standing outside!

Guided tour essential. The guided terrace walk (an extra 3 Euros on the entry price at time of writing) elevates it (quite literally) into a must see attraction in Barcelona. A brief but very informative talk is given on the key aspects of the church's history and architectural significance, and you get to enjoy some superb views of the surrounding city from the rooftop. Not great for those who are afraid of heights though!
Beautiful rooftop view!. If you have enough time book the tour going up the spiral stairs leading to the rooftop. Amazing view of the city. And the inside of the church is absolutely stunning!
Beautiful stained glass. I never get tired at looking through churches. This one is no exception incredible stained glass and mind boggling ceilings, how on earth did they build them that high???
make a tour on the top that offers in the entrance. Very good tour offers in this attraction. Don't just go in the church, make a tour on the top that offers in the entrance.

A landmark in Barcelona, this Beautiful Gothic Church Worth seeing. Located in the middle of the La Ribera district this Beautiful 14th century Gothic church - with it's gorgeous stained windows, beautiful design and high towers, made it unique for it's time. It was built in record time...only 54/55 years. Surrounded by narrow streets - you really need more distance to take in it's full beauty. Construction started in 1329, with Berenguer de Montagut and Ramon Despuig being the architects in charge. Inside the church is spacious - simplistic. It is said that the apostle James had preached there. Definitely worth the visit.

Absolutely stunning. First time we went it was absolutely pouring with rain so we didn't really enjoy it, when we went back in 2013 it was so much better! The cathedral is stunning! It takes a good hour to walk around and appreciate it's beauty. Some places you can't take pictures but it just gives you more time to appreciate what's there.

Beautiful old cathedral. Beautiful old cathedral, with a lot of character, right on the edge of the Gotic quarter. Well worth a visit, but go in the morning as entry is free. The cloister is beautiful and most unusual. Strangely Geese are kept in the cloister!

Built by the people for the people. This church is worth a visit...both for its natural beauty and history and also in recognition of the achievement of the working class who lived around it...and built the church themselves. Apparently they built this very quickly...in 56years, much faster than sone of the other churches in Barcelona. The stevedores would finish work for the day, then walk to the quarry and carry back stone for the building in their backs, that is why you see them on the front door. It is a lovely building...made more so by the beauty of the commitment behind it.
Beautiful basilica. It is smaller than others in the city but has a great charm and beauty. You would not miss it while walking around the streets of El Born neighborhood. Its just gorgeous
Hidden Jem. A must see while exploring the gothic quarter. Worth the walk through the narrow streets and alleyways.

Hidden jewel. Though we had previously been in Barcelona, we had never visited this beautiful church before. We had to ask several times for directions and when we found it, it was a wow! experience. When you walk through the very narrowly laid out Gothic Barrio, to suddenly find this incredibly beautiful church, is nothing but amazing. Do not miss the interior either.

Nice church, not especially unique. It was a very nice visit and had some nice windows and all. Worth the small fee. But I've seen so many cathedrals and churches across Europe it wasn't that spectacular. If you aren't burnt out on every church in every city - it's a great place to go. I recommend it if you have the time.

Entered by accident, left in awe. We were walking in the neighbourhood, not knowing the history of this church or that it was open for the public to enter. We had passed it once again over the previous days, but this time we saw the door open and we entered. We were impressed by the architecture, how old it was and the history that characterized it. Definitely worth a visit. Shouldn't be missed.
Worth a stop here!. Another cathedral worth visiting! I liked this one as much as any in Europe. It still amazes me how these places were built so long ago and are still standing!

Gothic church for the people. My husband and I wandered into this basilica, observing part of a wedding. It was neat to see a religious building actively used (even though we felt a little weird about it), and this particular building was very approachable and felt less pretentious. Our guide said that it was built by the working class over a period of 60 years. It's clearly less regal than the Barcelona Cathedral, but is more accessible. Definitely worth a stop to see a gothic beauty.

Dark and beautiful church. Such a beautiful church with interesting story. There is an entrance fee between 12 to 4PM if i'm not mistaken. There is a nice area in front of the church where you can admire its facade and rest. A high number of walking tour groups stop there to give history before entering the church; we got to listen in.

Built for the people by the people. A lovely spot in the afternoon... A drink in the square, listening to some great buskers. Very atmospheric, in front of the church built for the people by the people.

Classic, but still beautyfull. Main cathedral in Barcelona, a classical architectual type of the building.Yet, because of its vastness and splendid exterior, it is a must see.Tip: pay a ticket for a elevator ride to the top of the building, you will be rewarded with a beautyfull view of the city.
Historical Church. It's an ancient roman church built in the Gothic quarter of Barcelona city. the history smells out of its building and walls. Beautiful architecture dating back to the Roman reign.

A real gem! . The Sagrada Familia gets all the attention but this basilica is superb. It was amazing inside and had that quiet serenity places of worship have. I have been a couple of times now and really enjoy the peace it offers. One of my favourites.

Great piece of history. This place is actually the only cathedral in Barcelona and it's located in the gothic quarter. The building was constructed in the 13 th century and near it are some remains of roman walls built in the 4th century. We were more at awe with this site than the Sagrada Familia as it has more interesting history. A must see!

Dark, mysterious with a great story... oh so beautifull. This is the opposite of the Sagrada Familia but not less beautifull. Dark very ancient Roman Church with a great historic story behind it : build by the people of Barcelona in order to ask Santa Maria del Mar for good prosperity for the fisherman. Read the book The Cathedral of The Sea and you will understand the fascination I have for this cathedral. I'm not catholic but I always light a candle in this church. It always sit down to reflect on myself in this dark mysterious churchTIP : Church is taking siesta :) between 13 and 17 the church is closed. No entrance to pay, onlyto pay if you want to visit the top

Lovely Church. This is what we expected the Sagrada Familia to be like on the inside! Very traditional looking, lovely garden areas out the back. Be warned, when visiting in the summer, cover your shoulders and knees as we had to return the next day to be let inside!!!

interesting tour around roof top of the church. this is a tour of the church, climbing the stairs to the church roof top I would advise to wear walking shoes as its a long way to the top. Bring your camera as the views form the roof top are amazing where you can see all over Barcelona.
Beautiful church. Plain exterior but very beautiful inside plus you can visit whilst services are in progress, a cool and serene refuge from the bustle outside.
Barcelona like a 1000 years ago. After reading the book: Cathedral of the Sea - it is a must to visit this church. An amazing story told about this temple.
Charming, moving. It is very well located, and it has a beautiful lighting, ideal for a religious place.The arquitecture is really different to other churchs and it has a very interesting history.

Very Spiritual for me. Nice walk from our hotel, entering was a very spiritual moment for me. quiet, reflective. Ladies, be sure to bring your own scarf to cover your head, and have another one to cover your legs to the knee (if you wear shorts)... there are many "sellers" waiting for you to sell you a scarf.....A beautiful historic church, there is a separate area you can pay to enter to light a candle in the garden...
The chuch of the people. Not a big fan of churches but despite the beuty..the history..built by the nobles money and the sea workers labor....

Spanish Guitar Concerts - Worth visiting!. We came across it as we were having a stroll. Narrow streets in that area and a bit claustrophobic, it came as a pleasant surprise.It is another impressive, great example of Catalan-Gothic architecture.Spanish guitar concerts take place by famous musicians at a side chapel. We intended to book actually and watch the concert but the time did not really suit us. Some tourists who watched the concert urged us to have on light clothes as it really gets hot inside, but unfortunately missed the concert.In all, it is a serene place of worship built by true artisans and craftsmen.

Worth a stop but pick your time. Far more impressive on the inside than the exterior would suggest. In addition to the usual architectural features of churches there is an opportunity to climb up behind the altar for an impressive view down the length of the church. A modern window dedicated to the Olympics and an unusual statue of an older looking Mary at the crucifixion were notable. We were charged an entry fee on our first day but much of the time seemed to be free, even outside the times of services.

Another massive church yet it is really pretty & free admission. Double check the opening times of this place!!! We went according to the lonely planet guide book and we got there before it actually opened as it opened from 5pm onwards, not 4.45pm as advised in the guide. Hilariously, we walked around the basilica a couple of times and we were like wheres the way in??? not realising the actual opening time is 5pm! We got back to the front of the basilica where there were people hovering around and boom the door opened, and there was a massive gush of people inwards.I do like the fact that it is free admission. You don't get a lot of places in BCN that is free. Considering its such a large monument - I was expecting to pay a fee to enter.The basilica is stunning. I'm glad I visited. I'm not a big fan of churches but I still enjoyed the visit. I just like the size of it and you get to see the architecture etc. For the people who don't like churches - its just another church but you should visit this anyway...

WOW!. WOW! That was my reaction on entering this beautiful Gothic church . Full of atmosphere and amazing architecture. Stunning stained glass windows. Situated in a really pretty area. Nice to sit in the sun outside too.

A gem in the gothic quarter. The gothic architecture is absolutely breathtaking. If you can't make it inside, it's just as beautiful to walk around the surrounding area at night - romantic gothic stroll.
Ancient and amazing. This was awe inspiring. You enter an just feel the ambience and the peace and tranquility. It was a very pleasant experience
Beautiful.. We loved visiting this Basilica. We also got a lovely family photo in front of it. it's off the street, slightly, you have to be careful not to miss the turn. :)
Spiritual AWE. Beautiful inside and out. Bring your camera and look for times when admission is free. Every alter and shrine inside is a work of art.
there is siesta time in the afternoon. Just bear in mind that there is siesta time in the afternoon, if you are visiting this church in afternoon during summer time.
U must go . Either u r beleiver or not , either u r ART fan or not u will be very happy and impressed to be here .. do not miss that chance
Nice. Doorways need reconfiguring as people come in and out the same tiny door and it's almost impossible to photograph. But still worth seeing,

Amazing . Amazing cathedral with great history and architecture ... the place is so spirtual with it's quitness ... i love every corner ... u have to spend time to feel and contemplate everything ... espicaly the entrances ... i really love it .
The Basilica. Nice old basilica in the center of Barcelona, with beautiful entrance and magnificent stained-glass windows.

Magical place. There is a novel called The Cathedral of the sea by Ildefonso Falcones that talks about how this church was built. It is a historical novel, but the main story is based in real facts. If you are thinking of visiting Barcelona, and of course you have time, I highly recommend reading this novel and The shadow of the wind by Carlos Ruíz Zafón. Both of these books will give you an idea of what Barcelona and the Barcelonians are. Of course, have in mind that this idea will be just a slightly tiny introduction, but it is better than nothing.Santa Maria del Mar is a must in Barcelona! See it during the day and at night. Sometimes there are concerts in it. If so, buy tickets and go. The acoustic is perfect and the ambiance magical!;-) Enjoy!
quite alright. quite alright to spend an hour or so, it is free anyways. what I did not like were the LED candles... I am not religious but this looked rather cheap and tacky
Beautiful. Beautiful church in atmospheric part of Barcelona. It's a serene place of worship that was built by true artisans and craftsmen.
nice church. another beautiful church in the city. There's also some history behind this church so it's always interesting to listen to tour guides when explaining the different historical sites.
Interesting Gothic Church. There are a lot of gothic churces in Barcelona,you will bump into this one as you stroll around & definitely it is worth a visit.
Beautiful church. Lovely architecture and beautiful story behind this historic cathedral. There was no queue and it was easy to reach using public transport.

Impressive church with a long history. I don't really know the history of it but this church still has amazing detail for its age since the construction started in 998. For a Gothic church it looks very calm and peaceful. The interior is very impressive as well. Worth a walk through.

History worth experiencing. A very old and amazing place. Steeped in history. There many saints displayed in their own alcoves. There is a central courtyard with more saints celebrated around it. There is a museum containing some very old paintings and artifacts. Well worth the 7 euros fee.

The most amazing experience of La Catedral del Mar. If you read the novel "La Catedral del Mar", you must visit the real Cathedral. It is unbelievable the accuracy in every single detail between the book and the reality! You may think you are living in the very same moment of the action.  I was very exited when I got there, and saw the facade of that magnificent Cathedral, and the thrill of being inside and imagine what I've read, was amazing. Don't miss this unbelievable visit!
Nice views. Nice views from the bell tower but sure if it's worth 8 euros especially since you can get the view for free elsewhere in Barcelona

The people's cathedral. i have always believed that this church is the second most stunning one in Barcelona (first being La Sagrada Familia) as much at the Cathedral is beautiful, not just the building but it's surroundings, the story behind Santa Maria Del Mar makes it stand out.If you are really interested in history a guided tour is the way to go, they tell you funny facts and how/why it was built, it has seen it's fair share of problems (in construction) and disasters (earthquakes, civil war, accidents..) There are also visits to the roof of the building that is worth the walk up (not recommended for people with claustrophobia) , you get to see the stained windows close up, it's cool and practical ventilation system from 1329/83 when it was built, the bells and stunning views of the city!you can also take advantage and spend the whole day around in the area just getting lost, there are many places close by to vist like the passeig del Born, CC Born, museo Picasso... and you're surrounded by bars, restaurants, shops... also at night it's extremely beautiful.

BEST GOTHIC CHURCH IN EUROPE. Santa Maria del Mar is one of the purest Gothic churches in the world.It is rare to find a church with this Gothic style , so pure, so graceful. When you enter this church a feeling of peace of mind surrounds you and you are overwhelmed by its beauty.I was married in this church 16 years ago. Since I was a teenager I knew that would be the church of my wedding. It is a must see in Barcelona.Located in the Born area, the old fishermen neighborhood, it was built during 13th century thanks to the funds of the fishermen.

Spanish Guitar Concert at Santa Maria del Mar. A great example of Catalan-Gothic architecture, built in the 1300s
It has a side chapel where we attended a Spanish guitar concert by 4 famous players. The concert was wonderful, but during the second part of it, the temperature raised to intolerable levels. I recommend to bring a hand held fan and light clothes.
Classic beautiful church. Definitely worth visiting to see the wonderful structure from both inside and outside. A classic design.

Impressive and worth a stop. Apart from the impressive dimensions inside, the church is located in a nice neighbourhood that is worth exploring. So when you're near, hop in, and enjoy this (free to visit) jewel

Beautiful Gothic Church. On a recent trip to Barcelona we stayed in a hotel El Jardi it overlooks the square this church is located on.We visited on our second day and were not disappointed.It is a beautiful Gothic Church with some lovely features.Especially the stained glass windows and historical significance .It's situated in the Gothic Quarter and is well worth a visit.

A must see. I'm from Barcelona and took lots of friends to the Basilica. It's amazing historical place not only for religious people. Its beauty is incredible and it's located in the Barri Gotic, the most beautiful quarter in Barcelona.

Nice church to check out in Barcelona. Massive church. Definitely impressive to see up close. I highly recommend taking a walk inside and exploring it. I been on a tour thru Europe and this church is the largest I've seen.

Quintessential Gothic Church. Spectacular high gothic structure. Covered shoulders required and no short short skirts or shorts allowed. Begun in the late 12th century, it is an amazing example of what can be done with will power and a lever.

Simply amazing. I'm this kind of people who prefer the facade, in not an interior lover regarding religions buildings, even less if they're Catholic, but I have to admit that this building is different and if you have time you should get inside. Remember to book in advance so you won't spend too much time buying the tickets.There are few days during September when the entrance is free if you book it in advance, the reason is La Merce festivity.
Staggering. Must see. No question. Just do it. Tripadvisor requires more words but honestly words can't do justice. This is the real deal.

Peaceful with a meaningful story. It is a memorable place, very peaceful inside. Not so much crowded, so you can be by yourself living the atmosphere. I'm especially touched by its story of how it is built and the story of the statue just in front of the church. I leave it to you to learn.

Fun and Good Exploration. We enjoyed the guided tour. It was a spur of the moment, but the guided tour was educational and quite interesting. the guide provided a good history of Barcelona, and you are able to climb to the top of the tower to see the rest of the city -- and picture what it was like in the olden days during the civil war. If you like GoT, this is a good tour to understand Churches, the history, the defenses, etc. The view at the top is quite nice, and the climb was quite vigorous. Definitely be careful if you're older or pregnant... the tower is about 5 levels high and the stairs are very narrow.

Beautiful and so peaceful.. Beautiful church. Take the time to visit, ladies are required to cover shoulders and men remove hats. It is probably not worth taking a tour, the visual experience is adequate. We were not required to pay an entry fee, but chose to leave a donation as we left. Worth a visit no matter what your religion.
Must visit!. Amazing architecture. A must see when visiting Barcelona. Views are amazing when you get out onto the roof.

Visit if you're passing by . Located in El Born, we passed this church many times before actually going inside. We ended up going on our last evening in Barcelona. We tried going the day before, but found out they charge during the day. (There are also tours you can pay for during the day, but we opted out of a tour.). Instead of paying during the day, we went Sunday evening and it was free! This was not clear on the site, or on some of the other TA reviews. You might need to do a walk by to see what days and times are free. Pretty church, but we only spent five minutes inside. I'm sure there was a lot more to observe in this church, but our quick visit was enough for us! (By the way, I had on a sundress, with exposed shoulders and I was allowed inside.)
Beautiful. old, beautiful church, you must be careful with clothing, legs and shoulders must be covered. don't miss, it's even more fantastic on the inside.

A very tranquil place to visit in the heat of summer. The Basilica is a memorable visit even if you have no religious persuasion whatsoever. The cloister to the rear is a haven of tranquility and offers a welcome respite to the searing summer sun.

Quaint church. .... Worth a qyick stop on your stroll to see the first Gothic church in Barcelona. .. the rose window and interior are good for a quick stop out of tbe sun. ... The artwork is lovely and lots of history is there. .. in need of restoration. .. so if you can spare a couple of euros it will help!!

Peaceful. The Gaudi church (Sagrada Familia) is the most obvious (and essential) church to visit in Barcelona, but it's not as peaceful as this one. There are less people, and although it's less grand, it's got an atmosphere that is serene and beautiful in it's own right. Try and visit this before Sagrada Familia if you intend to visit both.Standard entrance is €5 and easily purchased at the door.
Worth walking into. It's free. Beautiful. Interesting history. It is actually a gothic church unlike the it's near neighbor. We popped in briefly to admire the architecture.

Amazing experience --- Mind blowing and beautiful. This was one of the great highlights of our time in Barcelona! Beautiful....must see. We also did the tour into one of the towers which was incredible.

A must visit Basilica. Often overlooked but this is a beautiful Basilica which for 8 euros per person includes a trip to the top of the bell tower up a narrow and winding spiral staircase (not for people who don't like confined spaces) but the view from the top is spectacular - we nearly didn't do this but are so glad we did!

Nice experience. a beautiful basilica and also worth to visit especial when you read the book of Ildefonso Falcones "La cathedral del mar" about the construction of this church it is even more worth to visit

Love it.. For some reason I don't know how to describe the surrounding of this church, there is not much space from the steps to the cafe outside with somebody singing to the tune of the Bee Gees. Why?The interior is totally a different story. I can easily forget the outside world. Inside is just beautiful. Cool, airy, quiet and the feel that I want of an old church.

Beautiful cathedral and tragic story. We were introduced to this on a walking tour of Barcelona (highly recommend!) and it is simply beautiful.Entrance is free after 5pm and this is when you can see the gorgeous colours of the stained glass artwork. Worth popping in if you are nearby.

Chatedral built by the people. This chatedral was built by the people from barcelona with the stones from the mountain of Mountjuich. It's a very special chatedral with a very special architecture. It's a pleasure to walk inside and be amazed by the tall walls and the perfect light. A must to visit in Barcelona!
Gothic. Did not understand the mass, just a few words here and there as it was in Spanish but the place is so serene. Gothic style and truly quiet once inside.
