Great site to see. Great site at El Born. The basilica is magnificent but so is the surrounding streets and restaurants.

A beautiful, but actively used,cathedral. We had the pleasure of renting a flat on the fourth floor overlooking this beautiful cathedral. Located in the midst of the El Born neighborhood, it is surrounded by plazas containing stores, restaurants and out door eating. Tours are given of the cathedral, including the roof. Our flat had decks overlooking the cathedral and enjoying the beautiful music played during weddings and services. We went into the cathedral almost every day, and especially when there was a wedding taking place; where you could sit in the back and enjoy the music, the beautiful stained windows and the majesty of the building. There was no charge to enter the church.
Historic church. Beautiful church worth finding. In a nice part of town, but can be dicey with "dippers". Plenty of cops nearby with SMGs :)
Beatiful. peaceful, serene atmosphere, a must see if you like history and architecture. Very close to major hotels.

Beautiful building. Whilst probably not as well known as other landmarks, this church is well worth a visit.Impressive architecture and a wonderful atmosphere. Lovely surrounding area too. So glad we came across this church.

Elegant and austere Catalan Gothic basilica. Must visit!. The main characteristic of this paradigm of Catalan Gothic is its serene and elegant austerity; a far cry from other, more known, churches in Barcelona. Though the present basilica was started in the XIV century, some documents from the IV century already mention the church of Santa María del Mar. Indeed, it is a historically and culturally important temple and it is even the silent main character of bestselling historical novel "La Catedral del Mar" (Cathedral of the Sea) by Ildefonso Falcones. Interestingly, Santa María del Mar offers concerts on a regular basis.

Visit if you are nearby. A beautiful church, and you should definitely take a look inside, if you are in the neighbourhood. The highlights for me were the window above the entrance and the courtyard. But for me half an hour was enough time to see it all.

very quiet place. It's a very quiet place and you can feel the atmosphere of old times. When I was there, I could see the fountain and geese around it, I was really surprised to see them. Be aware that you will have to wear something on your shoulders, because sometimes the security there is very strict, although I could see some people there walking in shorts and bare shoulders and I thought it wasn't fare :) By the way, the entrance is free
Classic Gothic Church. Santa Maria probably doesn't get the attention of Sagrada or Barcelona, but this church has some great Gothic architecture to take in. Highly recommended.
Beautiful. Beautiful church. Worth a visit and the shops and restaurants are off the main Las Ramblas and the square is beautiful
You must see it... Very beautiful, with an incredible sound of silence inside. A big space with coloured lights entering trough big coloured windows...
Impressive church in heart of old Barcelona. Impressive church, very simple, but extremely beautiful.Stained-glass windows are amazing and their play with outer light is great!
Intricately Gothic cathedral. Very beautiful cathedral hidden in the back streets of the Gothic quarter, we didn't get an opportunity to see the famed cloisters but the interior was lovely in itself.
A taste of history. A beautiful landmark very much worth a visit though my daughters sat this one out after the many other places we visited in Spain.
Mommy and daughter. EXcelletn! you have to go here, it is a beautiful church totally worth the money, if not go after 3 pm and its free!

Awesome architecture!. Never been a huge fan of religious buildings but some you just have to go and see. This enormous cathedral has such a dominant façade, I found myself drawn to it and when inside the huge door, the interior does does not disappoint! The lighting through the stain glass and the huge vaulted ceiling supported by gothic pillars is breathtaking. It's free to enter and is a fully working place of worship so respect needs to be given with consideration to dress attire (ie: strapless dresses or vest tops and skimpy shorts will be turned away)A must see, even if only for half an hour and some excellent photography.

Superbe Monument. We went last Sunday for the celebration of the Mass. It was a unique experience. Very religious atmosphere, very welcome people, nice architecture...I like more this than the Sagrada Familia.Must be there.
Even its not famous. This church isnt famous enough for people to hear from others but it really should be. Even I dont like visiting attractions like this, it is really fascinating.

Majestic must see spot in Barcelona. Beautiful and awe inspiring architecture. One of my favorite spots in Barcelona. There were considerable crowds waiting to visit - but it was so worth the stop on the tour.
Hidden gem, best stained glass in Barcelona.. The most amazing stained glass in Barcelona. Positively drab fascade hides a stunning interior. Must see for a contrast to the modernista movement.

Worth a Quick Visit. It's not the most famous church, or the biggest, or the most impressive. But it has it's own story and the inside hosts impressive decor. It's calm and relaxed, in another world from the street outside.

Gorgeous. This Basilica in the Gothic Barrio is gorgeous no doubt. It's a great summary of what th neighbourhood is all about. I didn't get a chance to go inside, but the exterior was stunning, but not unlike most other basilicas you may have seen across Europe - it's nothing special in that regard.

Beautiful night or day~. This basilica is really beautiful and easy to get to. Make sure you dress appropriately to go in (covered shoulders and covered knees). There is plenty of space to enjoy it from the outside. It's on a good route to see other things as well.

Second Most Beautiful Church in Europe. This Catalon Gothic church is, to my way of thinking, the second most beautiful church in all of Europe. The soaring interior spaces are beautifully refined/simple and compelling. Built in just 55 years it is set in the oldest part of Barcelona, originally in a location by the water. Lots of references to the porters (starting with the reliefs on the front doors) who carried the stones on their backs as their "contribution" to the work. Gorgeous rose shaped stained glass window. Simple, restained and elegant in its simplicity.

A great example of Catalan Gothic. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is a great example of the Catalan Gothic. You can go into without paying a fee. It is nice to enter, sit and take your time to enjoy the monument (don't miss the keystones).
Beautiful place . Very beautiful place. U can find nice interesting things around the cathedral. So many small streets that u can walk through.
Lovely history. Amazing architecture and history worth a visit on a quiet day, it was great to have time to go round and go up on the roof.
Beautiful basilica in the middle of the Gothic Quarter. Stumbled upon this while walking through the Gothic quarter. Beautiful basilica, worth it to check out.

Don't miss this! . We stopped in here briefly on our Crusing Barcelona Bike Tour (definitely do a bike tour with these guys while visiting Barcelona!). The Basilica de Santa Maria del Mar was an unexpected and exquisite Gothic masterpiece! Built by the people for the people it's enormous and had a great story. Free entry and somewhere you can pop in to for as long or short as you like but definitely worth a stop!
A highligh in El Gotic. Wonderful basilica in El Gotic. Free entrance and dispite the amount of people there is a lot of rest inside.
Very beautiful. This cathedral is really beautiful, and especially with its location, in the Barri Gothic where everything is gothic and so do the cathedral. I recommend!

Worth visiting, place to calm down.... Very beatiful and worth visiting. At the time of my visit there vas sort of a concert taking place. This is a place for peace and harmony despite of crowds of people around.
a special church. .This is a very special church, make a point to visit. It is a little hard to find but worth the adventure.

Beautiful. I enjoyed this basilica, and I have visited many. I was informed by a guide book that this is especially beautiful at night, as the stained glass is illuminated. I stopped by three nights in a row and never saw this phenomenon. Still, it's worth a day visit. Enjoy the musicians that play in the surrounding area.

Spectacular Cathedral ! Definitely one of the must visit spots !. Visited back in 2000 and again this month. Make sure you time your visits to the churches and museums. These close for holidays and Sundays at 3pm. They are all totally closed on Mondays. Beautiful church, don't miss it!

Very sobre and beautiful church. What a beautiful church. the interior is very sober and down to the basics of the architecture. It forces you to have a self-reflection and admiration of what was achieved.
Very nice small basilica. It is a rather small basilica. It can be covered in a hour or a bit more if you want to stop and absorb the atmosphere (I enjoyed it).
Unique!. It is the first Gothic Church that I've seen with with so beautiful columns and stained-glass windows. Awesome Santuary!
So Beautiful. This is a must see. We just stumbled upon it as we strolled around the Barrio Gotic . It is so lovely and they hold concerts there each evening .,which we are definitely going to.
Stunning. Stunning basilica. Built in a short period of time 54 years, I believe. The neighborhood is filled with shops, sites and restaurants. The Picasso Museum is nearby, and much more.
Beautiful Basilica. The history behind this basilica is worth the trip - it's interesting to compare/contrast the different cathedrals in the city.
Beautiful Basilica. This was better than the Gothic cathedral. Beautiful rose window and lovely carvings. Worth looking at the eternal flame in front of the south front.
beautiful architecture. WOW, What a breathtaking architecture. situated in the middle of the town and close to shopping with many restaurants nearby.

Beautiful building. Architecture is beautiful outside and in. Make sure if you are going to visit you have your shoulders covered and you are wearing something that isn't too short or you will be refused entry. There are usually people outside selling shawls to cover your shoulders if you forget and really want to go inside

a gem in Mediterranean gothic style. Barcelona has the uniqueness of owning 2 gothic cathedrals, built almost simultaneously but in 2 different styles. While the main one is European gothic, Santa Maria del Mar is an example of the rare so-called Mediterranean gothic, which embraces simplicity and plays with heights and levels in order to provide a luminous effect. This is a must-see in the city for those who like architecture, and for those who like medieval heritage. Go and see both, compare their styles, understand their different paths to represent divinity. Its duality may very well symbolize two simultaneous currents of thought in a time of darkness. And they're barely 10 minutes away from each other by foot!

If you want to visit a church and pray go here!. Lovely place! so different from the Cathredal just 4 block away. It has the atmosphere of a church and not of a shopping like cathedral has. I recommend you to go!
Worth a visit. stunning church in the working class fishermans neighbourhood.free to enter. near to great shops and the Gothic area

nice place to look around. It is one of those churches which make you small and humble. not only large, It has delicate touches on the wall. couldn't enter the church because it was late, but I'm sure it's beautiful inside, too.

try the Hostel Culture tour!. I did the Hostel Culture free tour and loved it! Everyday at 10:30 and 3pm look for the blue umbrella to join the tour. The guides are really enthusiastic about the places they show!
A Must See. Have you already read Cathedral of the Sea? (La catedral del mar de Ildefonso Falcones), No? Well, anyway that is a 'must-see' at Born.

Majestic church!. I ate breakfast right next to Santa Maria del Mar almost every day. I loved looking at the church and a grand plaza that lays in front of it. Inside the church is just as beautiful as it is on the outside. It is special! It's big, beautiful.. in one word: stunning!
Worth a visit.. Worth a visit to this lovely gothic cathedral. Take your time to walk around and enjoy all of the details. Worth a visit for sure.
Impressive. Impressive curch and I like how it has been build by volnteer builders from the area. Please make sure you see the tribute to all the men WHO dragged the stores there on the front door.
Catalan Gothic church. A Catalan Gothic church that was built by the locals in the 1300's. I like churches and the contrast between this simply designed Basilica and the Sagrada was startling.

Peaceful area among the busy. Peaceful church in the clouded city.
It was amazing church in city center surrounding with all busy environment.

Beautiful church. It was a surprise to see such gorgeous church stuck in the old Barcelona....it was more of a surprise as expectations were much lower. Absolutely worth visiting and I truly recommend it!
Beautiful church in the midst of the city. Gorgeous catholic temple, right in the city center. It's surrounded by restaurants and little shops with plenty to do within walking distance.

My favourite church in Barcelona . Located in the heart of Barcelona, it's very easy to spot it and go inside for a visit to check out. Also what i appreciated is not over pricing the entrance ticket because after all it is a place of worship and not commercial business. The interior is with taking it all in and appreciating the work that goes into it.My favourite part is going up the roof of the church and appreciation the top view of Barcelona from there. Although the wait for the elevator was kind of a pain but it was manageable. The outdoor area near the church with he cute fountain is honestly so adorable and mesmerising. I just loved it

A place of peaceful serenity. We could see the Bascillica lit up at night from our hotel and I desperately wanted to go there. All I can say it that it had something so peaceful and magical about it. You should definitely visit.

Basilica Santa Maria del Mar. Beautiful Church, We stayed in this areaWe found it to be a great location , lovely little Cafes for Breakfast, Great Bar which served Sangria while people watching and in the evening down Alexandria Lane - Great tapas

The best place in Barcelona. Seriously, just go! It's absolutely stunning and if you go at the right times, free! I was lucky enough to see the church at night aswell, and I was there when the lights inside were turned on- the stained glass windows were magical!
A hidden gem!. Quite hidden away, we stumbled upon this by accident! it has a stunning interior and was a very special place to visit.
Beautiful. This is beautiful. If you like to visit old Basilica's, you should not miss this one. Make sure you use a guide or can speak the language.

Beautiful Cathedral. The stain glass windows are stunning, and its a pretty big cathedral as well. Right in front is a huge square and at night this is pretty active with music and entertainment. Beware of pick pockets.

Beautiful place, great tour. We bought tickets at the door to see the ground floor and the terraces at the top as well. We didn't realise we would get a tour guide too! We joined an English speaking tour with a really lovely, funny woman who was very well informed. She had great English and was great at answering questions. It is unlike the other Gothic churches in the area due to an earthquake and fires that destroyed much of the interior. It has the outer look of a Gothic church with a more modern interior. This is all explained on the tour. We walked up the steps to the terraces on two levels. The view is stunning and you learn a lot from the tour!
Nice to visit if you are passing. We were in the area as we were waiting for our time to go in the Picasso museum. It was a nice quiet church to visit.

A dream come to life. This is one of the most remarkable churches, a dream was made here . If you think about the tools, craftsmanship that went into this a architectureal wonder you will never again think of our historical past in the same way. PICTURE THE PEOPLE WORKING THEN!
The tour was great. This place is a must when in Barcelona. The tour of the roof was very informative about the history of the church and the surrounding buildings and areas
An unexpected surprise. Its such a beautiful church. I was just wandering arround with my girlfriend in old Barcelona when I found this chuch. I was completely amazed.

Cathedral worth a visit. This is a lovely cathedral in a beautiful square, as someone else described it - it truly is a hidden gem. I went in a sleeveless top and had to buy a scarf to cover my arms / shoulders, so ladies don't forget something to cover yourself. Also in the square on the day we visited was an old man playing a trumpet alongside a younger man playing a piano, they were brilliant. After we visited the cathedral we wanted to go back to Port Vell for food and there were a few rickshaws waiting for hire, we paid 10 Euros and had a brilliant trip through the narrow streets of Barri Goti down to the port. Highly recommend
Hidden gem. You walk from a narrow walkway into this splendid square only a short walk from the main road. Gorgeous architecture surrounds this square and inside the church is a delight too.
Wander around.. Must have wander around this area...magnificent building....lots of nooks and crannies to explore around here.

A very beautiful church.. We passed by here on a walking tour and decided to return. We returned on a Sunday, when there was a mass on. We sat and followed the proceedings. Unfortunately some people failed to understand and continued to take pictures during the service, something they are asked not to do.(Show some respect please.)The church is big and beautiful. Lots of beautifully decorated windows & it's own black Madonna and child like the one in Montserrat monastery. Lots of art work to admire as you walk around. Lots to see and enjoy in this peaceful place.

A good place for quiet moments away from the crowds.. Beautiful church in a quiet plaza. I stayed nearby and could hear the bells on the hour. Noon on Sunday you will find an international mass being said.

A shrine within a busy city. We did not really plan to visit this church - rather we stumbled upon it while meandering through the city. What a treasure! Arguably, it deserves a higher profile - but that might detract from what makes it such a special place, if it became as busy as La Catedral. Further, admission is free, whatever time you visit. The outside gives little idea of the scale of what the interior is like. Hopefully, when you visit you will have time to sit down and experience the atmosphere of this place; after all, it is a functioning church, not a tourist attraction. While here, locate El Fossar de les Moreres, the monument with the eternal flame, just nearby.
Another cathedral in europe. Go after 17:30 and entrance is free. This is a gothic architecture example and apparently a popular place to get married.

Religion and amazing views. Great place, it was recommended by a very good friend from Barcelona. I liked it and went also on the top roof where it was absolutely amazing. Not to say more about the interesting history of this church and the amazing panorama from the roof. It is a must see in Barcelona!

The beautiful and beautifully preserved church. This beautiful and spiritual place lets you understand Gaudi's Familia Segrata in context. Both together make for a great understanding of church architecture.

Simple beauty. Nice piece of Barcelona history. It mentioned in a few guide books. It simple and understated. It is a nice alternative to the Barcelona Cathedral (which had a long line to enter during our visit). It also would serve as a nice start for the Gothic quarter walk.

Cultural Day Out. A great place to visit and what a beautiful basilica, with stunning architecture! You can capture a great atmosphere of Barcelona when walking around here. I enjoyed viewing various artists paintings here and noticed a few shady areas, perfect for a scorching hot day.
Architecture and passionate Catalonians. Even though I stayed in Barcelona for 6 days, there is so much to see and do. The city needs to be absorbed, enjoyed and experienced.
Loved it!. I loved everything about the Basilica. Great architecture with beautiful accents throughout. I suggest visiting during the free time.
Excellent Catholic Art. One of the churches along a walk of the Gothic Quarter. An easy place to stop and visit including a beautiful courtyard with fountains and geese.
Pretty Cathedral. This is a really pretty cathedral with stunning architecture and wonderful stained glass windows. I recommend visiting during the free times!

Excellent experience, loved the views and history. Love the rooftops and the balconies. The guide that I got was spanish but with a really nice english accent. Loved to talk and explain cultural details. Is certainly a must do!
Beatifull church. Beautiful old gothic church from the times when Barcelona was a major player in the Mediterenean, nice area around the church.
Awsome. We didt go inside, but the view from outside is really astonishing, its a great place to get a nice picture and it is really worth seeing

Another beautiful Basilica.. Having just finished a 12 day cruise and seeing many Basilicas we thought we were done. On a random stroll we came upon this one. We were glad we went inside. Another beautiful Basilica.

A beautiful cathedral to visit with lesser tourist.. There is an entrance fee but if you like visiting cathedrals then it's definitely worth paying! Beware you need to be covered appropriately to enter. Some female in line were in mini skirts/shorts and they were refused entry.
Beautiful!!!. Just a amazing place to be! Beautiful and peaceful. A lot of things to see, a lot of people to talk.
A beauty, but do not prioritize. Nice location, nice site, why only average? Because Barcelona is so rich and nice place, it simply does not stand out. Still, definitely take a trip there.

A Unique Cathedral. It has the breathtaking scenery as many other cathedrals but what's different i that it has it's unique architecture and Gothic style. It's location is in the heart of the Gothic quarter of the city and it is surrounded by a variety of amazing shops and restaurants. Even the walk there is interesting as you walk through the narrow streets of the area and pass by the shops. Enjoy!

Amazing church, go during the free times to get the best deal. This church was beautiful. We went to the door about 15 minutes before the "free times" and they were charging something like 7 or 8 euro. Then they closed the doors. About 20 minutes later they opened the doors and it was free! The stained glass was very pretty.

Santa Maria del Mar Church is truly spectacular!. Our family visited during summer and some of our kids had complained they had seen one too many churches. However, when we stepped into this old church, it was jaw dropping. We all said it was absolutely magnificent. It is a true definition of an old basilica church. It is authentic and a true representation of an ancient Spanish Church. We felt la Sagrada Familia was tourist museum even though its was an actual church, and compared to this church not authentic feeling. The Santa maria del Mar church did not have a million tourists inside and services were being held and the reverance required inside a holy place was in place. The architecture is amazingly beautiful. This was a DO NOT MISS in my book. Its in a side street and was a little difficult to locate, but so very worth the wait. We used the hop on hope off touristic bus to get there and also to visit the magic fountain that evening. Best day spent in Barcelona, truly magical.

Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Beautiful church, every detail on all the artifacts and architecture was beautiful. Must spend some quiet time alone to pray, just sit there and look around the church, then walk around and really look at the works people put in years and years ago, it's one of the nicest church I've ever seen and been to.

Nicest church in Barcelona . I got married here. What else should I say?
Tall, elegant, simple, bright, luminous, in the heart of the old quarter.

A trip back to visit the Basilica.. I had visited the Basilica in 2006 when my son lived in that neighborhood. Last Christmas my son gave me the book, Cathedral of the Sea, the best-selling historical fiction novel written by I. Falcones. It tells the story of the construction of the Basilica. I was thrilled to be able to see the Basilica again last week.....I could almost "feel" the presence of all of those men who were involved in carrying those huge stones, on their backs, from the Royal Quarry. It's a must see in Barcelona!!!
lovely, ancient. look closely, amazing, it interested me than I thought it would, very old and pretty, easy to get to off Las Ramblas

A very special place. In very few places I've felt something really special. I don't mean like the so called Stendhal syndrome, but something deeper. This happened to me for example in the cathedral of Aachen or Hagia Sofia. In the case of Santa María del Mar, it was barely different but still made me feel I was in a very very special place, with walls transmiting History, making you feel in a real exceptional and privileged position.For book lovers, if you are planning a trip to Barcelona, I recommend to read the book La catedral del Mar by Ildefonso Falcones. It will make your visit a totally different experience.
very nice. love the catedral del mar. very nice church. love the quietness and it is free, unusual. you even have tours , but you have to pay.

A must in Barcelona. Built in the 14th century this Basilica has amazing glass murals, and astonishing architecture. As a tip you are not able to visit during mass hours but in between you may for a 5 Euro fee.
Worth a visit. Hard to find but well worth a visit. We did a walking tour and were given all the info on the area but returned later on oour own to look inside the church. It was amazing
Is another ancient church. Audio guides help understand the finer details and historical significance of the place. The architecture is interesting but after a while all churches seem alike.
Worth a visit. Beautiful church with amazing murals. We stumbled on it quite by accident and were glad we dod. There were no queues and with less crowds, allowed for a time of quiet refection.
Nice old church. Nice old church... You can take lot of nice pictures inside... Outside is great also. I recommend to everybody

Read the Book First. I had never hard of this particular church until I read the book "Cathedral of the Sea" written by Falcones. This piece of historical fiction paints a picture of medieval Barcelona centered around the construction of this church. Sitting at a café outside the church it is not hard to imagine what it was like under construction.

Things to see and do in Barcelona. I would recommend taking the hop on hop off bus, to get an overview of the city. The Mercado off Rambla is a food market of stalls with Spanish delicacies and makes for an interesting walkabout. The flamenco theater on Rambla is rather a touristy fare. A trip to the Monastery of Montserrat is a must which is an hours drive from Barcelona and also accessible by train.The La Sagrada Familia is worth a visit to see Gaudi's work.
Stunning. This is a beautiful building. The interior is understated but it has fabulous stained glass windows.

Nice place to visit while walking through El Born. We visited it twice , once in the mid morning after giving up on the waiting line for the Picasso museum and the other on Sunday morning during mass.Free access and ensconced in the dense El Born district, you can walk around only on 2 sides and view the facade from a small square with a couple of terrace restaurants.Inside, this is an impressive basilica built very quickly (60 years) in the middle ages. There is an interesting chapel on the back right side worth visiting. It is a quiet cool place to sit for a while.You can tour the roof line but we did not find it interesting enough. Not far on the East side, you can walk through a small rambla going to the Cultural center. On sunday, we had a nice lunch outdoors, next to the cultural center front square where they were building these impressive human pyramids in a competition with uplifting music

seen better.. very average cathedral have seen better elsewhere.also mthe catelonian dancers supposed to perform outside the cathederal turned out to be a social gathering of politically active pensioners.

Great but there is a very big BUT. Very beautiful, but, unfortunately one of my traveling companions had her purse stolen on the way out. We were momentarily distracted by the security guard on the way out and this is when it happened. All too quick to point the finger but ! It's a fabulous city but everyone seems to be trying to take advantage of the tourist. Enjoy but be paranoid about your belongings

Lovely Church. This Crch is situated in Barri Gothic. Very simple outside structure in comparison to other cathedrals but the inside has a serenity and awe in terms of the interior architecture. Nice place to sit and reflect.

La catedral del mar. This church is worth seeing if you read the book "La catedral del Mar" where it describes what people had to do to build it, Otherwise it is one more of the multiple churches of Spain.

Quite and Serene. We loved the architecture of the church. It is dark, Gothic and stunning. Not as busy as other churches in Barcelona. It is located in a beautiful neighborhood. The interior is pretty with stained glasses, a dream for photographers!
Worth seeing. I really enjoyed architecture of this church. Because of great light/shadow I did a lot of nice pictures there. Highly recommend for photographers.
A beautiful gothic style church. Incredibly beautiful gothic church. We enjoyed spending time inside . You would never know how ornate the interior is based on the plain exterior.

A serene and quiet place. It's located in the El born neighbourhood and is not as busy as other churches in this area are. However it's still a nice place to go in and sit quietly away from all the noise and heat. In front of the church there are places to eat where you can eat while admiring it's views. I would recommend visiting it if you are around the El born area.

A great old church. This church/Basilica was located near the hotel that we stayed in in Barcelona, we visited it as part of a tour in the city and was almost told to go away by a person that was manning the doors. We ignored that person and went in and was glad we did. The interior was beautiful even when it was crowd. When we left an hour later, the person was no way to be found...funny experience..
Quiet and charming. A quiet and charming church. Good place to sit for a while and collect thoughts. Not as busy as other churches in the area
Beautiful structure. Free entrance, not that crowded. Also the surrounding area is a great place to wander around. Great ambiance of the church.
Nice and serene. If you can cat there, when it is not full of tourists it would be an incredible experience, there is a sense of serenity in it, that is just amazing. It simplicity is so beautiful.
Dark and tranquil. A lot of history to this church that needs to be read first to fully appreciate this otherwise dark building squeezed into the heart of the Born area

Beautiful. This church is in the El Born district of Barcelona, which in itself is a delightful place to explore its passageways and sights.Its jewel in the crown must be the Basillica of Santa Maria del Mar.You come across it almost by accident, situated as it is but once inside, wow. The stained glass is something to behold, especially a modern creation on the left hand trancept, fantastic.I am no religious zealot but I can appreciate the spiritual atmosphere that oozes from every stone of the building and every gram of the air inside. Simply wonderful

Beautiful. We ran across this beautiful church while exploring the area. The church was lovely inside and very different from the other basilica's we had visited. We enjoyed dining across from it and watching all of the people walk by.

Breathtaking. The church is splendid. It takes your breath away when you enter. It's squeezed in between the old buildings around, so you don't see how beautiful it is until you enter. It's free to go inside, and you should. I've seen hundreds of churches, yet this was special.

Beautiful spot to stop. We didn't pay to go inside but it's well worth it to sit on the drinking fountain just opposite or grab a drink in the square and watch out for tour guides. If you listen carefully you can get a fully history and interesting info about the church from the tour guides for free! After a pause in the shade of the church you can wander through the little streets of the Gothic Quarter towards the Picasso museum.
Beautiful church. It was interesting to see the church, that plays such an important role in Ildefonso Falcones' novel "La Catedral del Mar". Worth a visit.
Beautiful church with a history. Beautiful church and very interesting if you have read Ildefonso Falcones book, La catedral del mar.

A wonderful place to pause. This church is tucked away and was definitely worth a visit. It is 5 euro to visit, whereas some books say it is free but it is a beautiful sacred space with a rich heritage and a clearly expressed desire to be a church and place of worship which serves its neighbourhood. Staff were welcoming and it was quiet enough to allow reflection but busy enough to not feel conspicuous. Unlike some tourist churches, you are always aware that this is a place of worship and a house of prayer - a definite must see if you are in the Born quart or the old town.
Gorgeous church. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is stunning! Large volumes, beautiful stained windows... there is just a serence atmosphere.
Beautiful Basillica. Definetly a place to stop off at in Barcelona! The building itself was stunning, just remember to cover up if you want to go inside.

Must see in Barcelona. This was my favourite visit of the trip to Barcelona, the staff were very polite and helpful and the church is absolutely beautiful. Pick up a free pamphlet to guide you around the church and it's beautiful stained class windows.

My favourite church in the world!. With its trim Gothic lines and bare stone walls, Santa María del Mar is a beautiful church that prompts introspection and reflection precisely because of its simplicity. The austerity of its interior I find is much more beautiful and impressive than that of its ornate and baroque counterparts. Located in the Born quarter of the old city, it presides solemnly over the surrounding maze of narrow streets, near the sea. The protagonist of "La catedral del mar," it is no wonder it has inspired many such works of literature.

The best representation of beauty!. What surprise you the most is the location, you can walk from the city center to the Born quartier and in one of the streets, ta-da! There it is, the most powerful church, the representation of beauty with a sublime architecture. Weddings are very common, so flowers and music make it a better scenario.
Summer Fun. Peaceful- you can almost feel your self being pulled towards the deep rich history of the church. You are easily relaxed !
Beautiful gothic church. From the outside the church doesn't seem of much, but when it comes to the inside it's really shows it's beauty. You get the feelling that you are at holly place.
Impressive. Well worth the visit. Great architecture and stained glass, plus a cool haven in the atmospheric El Born district of the city. No charge for entry - donations optional.

Just beautiful. I am an architecture buff so I can tell you the beauty of this place will leave you breathless....We were there when a wedding was being conducted and the reverence of this place affirms one's faith....

Impressive. My favourite place on earth, absolute best. It was a bit hard to find because it's not in the centre of the Gothic District, and it doesn't look awesome from the outside. It is great inside. I went there twice: a few years ago and this year and I found out that it is no longer free of charge, but costs a lot to enter, which is a shame.
the cathedral by the sea. in addition to the fact that this basilica is famous there is also a novel about the building of it "the cathedral by the sea" recomnded

What a wonderful Church. Not only this church is located in the most wonderful neighborhood in Barcelona, it is also an architectural jewel itself. We attended mass and their pipe organ, and some live choirs made the experience sublime.

Nice for a quick visit. We were in the area and stumbles across this Basilica and decided to go inside. There wasn't any information about the basilica inside but it was really nice to walk around. The area was nice too.
Wow! Awsome place!. Highly recommended!! You can´t leave Barcelona without visiting the Basilica! it is a "Must" visit place.

If you think it's beautiful outside, go in for a visit. Saw a lot of churches in Barcelona. This one is beautiful, just like all the others. It's actually very easy to while away a couple of hours exploring here- there are so many amazing statues. Plus I saw a great-big group of nuns visiting, and they asked someone to take their picture then all excitedly posed together- it was very sweet to see their enthusiasm and everyone stopped to let them get their picture! Make sure you meet the entry requirements- there's a sign outside outlining their dress requirements. It's nothing drastic, but they will stop you going in if they feel you're dressed inappropriately. Maybe have a look the day before as it is an operating religious building and you will be expected to show some respect.
Chuch. Been Seval times this time was great no work going on out side only this time it was very hot so go in the morning or late in the Atfernoon but it was all way busy
a must see. In a touristic tour ın Barca you see this Cathedral naturally...To walk on the streets of Barcelona lead you to all the Cathedrals.The art work is a must see

Enjoyable but better churches in Barcelona. We made a special trip here to visit the El Born neighborhood. My wife and kids went to the Picasso museum and I visited the church. The primary reason to visit is the discussion of the Catalan Gothic architecture which is based on a horizontal line as opposed to vertical like elsewhere in Europe. It is a very plain church, part of the Catalan style. Still I liked both the Cathedral and Santa Maria de Pi better. The cathedral, ignore the entrance facade add in the 1800s, has the same architecture with more inside and Santa Marie de Pi is almost identical in design but it also has the tour you can climb. With that said I still liked my visit and I enjoyed the Catalan Gothic, I just think there are other churches that deserve a visit and more time including Sagrada Familia. Also there is a great memorial to the Catalans who lost their life in the rebellion just to the south of the church where hundreds were buried.
Calming and Peaceful. Wheelchair accessibility was good. Once inside the gothic interior is majestic and imposing in its simplicity. The stained glass is beautiful.
unbelievable. You will not believe the architecture of this place. You will never see anything like it anywhere....ever. It's a must see.

beautiful cathedral but HOT!. Beautiful cathedral close to downtown...it is amazing to see the workmanship in every cathedral, but I know now the penance eachperson pays to view it. The heat was oppressive but the view incredible. Will take roughly 1/2 hour to go through it and it is free admission.
Fantastic art. Many little chapels filled with 15th to 18th century altarpieces. About ten museums worth! And pop out to the fabulous Bubo bar for a cake afterwards. http://bubo.es

Quiet and breathtaking. The Basillica of Santa Maria del Mar appears in all travel guides but is generally lower on the list. I got pulled towards it after having read about it in Robert Hughes' book 'Barcelona- The Enchantress'. If you are like me, and want to run away from the throngs of tourists, this is the place for you. On the outside, it may seem a lot more basic in its Gothic architecture but inside it is absolutely breathtaking. When we went there, it was just before 1.30pm (closing time for the afternoon). After having been to Santa Maria del Mar first, the Cathedral seemed pale (to me) in comparison.

This is worth a visit, mae sure you go to the room. It would be a 5 but the displays are all behind bars. It's still a beautiful place and I would recommend it. If the weather is good and not too windy, you can pay an extra fee and go to the roof, worth it!
Free in the evening. We just finished the historical museum of Barcelona next door when the Basilica reached its free period so we stepped in. It was very impressive and worth a quick 30 minutes.
Awe inspiring church . One of the most beautiful old churches I visited. Quite dramatic inside. Worth the few euro entrance fee.
Especially if you read Cathedral of the Sea. There is even a stone showing the bastaches carrying the stones for the cathedral. Maybe not the best site in Barcelona but special.
lovely. Ended up here after a walk, didn't go in as large queue, however it was amazing on the outside. So beautiful
Catalan Gothic. Beautiful church, so peaceful despite the many visitors. An agnostic friend told me he almost believes in God when he visits this church.
Loved this church. I loved this church, even more than the Cathedral. Not your ordinary gothic church. Quite beautiful, I recommend a visit.
Awe Inspiring. An absolute 'must see'. Close to the Picasso Museum in the atmospheric El Born district. A true hidden gem.

unexpected neat find. This was a great unexpected find. We were just out strolling through barri gotic and saw the doors open. Inside is an amazing step back in time. For the spiritual inclined great ambience. Free. Neat architecture and art.

Enjoy and relax. It was somehow tricky to find this church as this part of Barcelona is full of little streets crossing each other, but undoubtlessly it was the path we took to get there that made this church even more pretty. Very classical gothic style, it wont disappoint you with its beautifulness outside and inside. As it is made out of rocks, it's super chilly inside, where you can have a break of the shinny sun outside.In front of the main façade you can sit down and have something to eat and also enjoy street artists playing music and singing. It is for sure a relaxing place to be, after spending hours touristing around in a super sunny day!

Very beautiful church. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is a gorgeous Medieval Church in the classical style. It has stunning mosaics and stained glass along with a beautiful layout and architecture. It's a must if you're in the area and interested in classic churches.

Beautiful Cathedral, Great Price. Few things in Barcelona come without a hefty price tag, but the Basilica of Santa Maria is one exception.Granted, it's not the grandest of cathedrals (e.g. Sagrada Familia and the Gotic), however, it is a beautiful gothic cathedral in it's own right.The price to get in is only 5 Euros. If you spring for an extra 3 Euros they throw in a tour that takes you up to the roof for a spectacular view of the city (well worth the price).If you're a cathedral buff, don't miss out on this one.
Historic Church. It is a beautiful church and wonderful decorated windows.We didn´t walk up on the roof but it would be a great view from the top.

I love this little church. It sits in the middle of a medieval neighborhood. An excellent example of an early Catalan Gothic architecture. The bars, etc, in the neighborhood are over run by tourists, so be aware.
I visited it every trip for Barcelona.
Must see attraction. Amazing basilica, worth a visit, walking distance from Las Ramblas and the Metro. Great architecture, very peaceful, next to many nice restaurants.

Hidden Gem. What a beautiful basilica. Join the tour to get the history and a chance to go up to the roof. If I remember correctly, Antoni Gaudi used to come here for mass and you can see how the palm tree like columns could have inspired Gaudi in his later work.

historic church of the poor fishermen. Old historic church with a beautiful back story art on the outside of the church tell of the story of the poor neighborhood that pitched in to build the church stone by stone
Worth a visit. We didn't go in, but we loved the outside of the building. The church is beautiful. the square is great for relaxing and people watching after a busy day of sightseeing.

Worth a visit. most of these attractions, you will visit when wandering around the streets. we don't actually visit inside places of worship, but this is an interesting building from the outside and is placed in a very pretty square with statue. Pretty
Place of tranquility in the midst of bustling neighbourhood.. An architectural beauty. Well preserved sculptures right up to the ceiling. Peacefully quiet, place where some people come to reflect.

Beautiful Barcelona that offers a bounty for visitors. We vacationed in 6 countries in Europe and Barcelona provided so much to enjoy. There is so much to see and to do. We saw many churches, beautiful buildings and monuments, and old towns (historical centres as they are referred to in Spain). What makes this Basilica stand out is its location in the Plaça de Santa Maria. It is a vibrant, historic area filled with so much to see and absorb. The Cathedral has an interesting design in its blue coloured roof. This is also evident in other historic buildings in Barcelona. That the time to visit this beautiful Basilica.

Fishermans' Church. Our concierge insisted we visit here. "There are so many churches in Barcelona, this one can't be missed" He felt this one was for the poor, working class and poured their heart into it, so the beauty was in the artworks and love of the church. Beautiful Great places to have food, drinks and nibbles nearby.

Wow, just wow!. If you have never traveled abroad then I could highly recommend this as a destination. The beauty of the architecture is amazing when you consider that most is older than anything in the USA. Have fun exploring this beautiful sanctuary and the surrounding area!
Gothic Cathedral. Beautiful basilica on a charming square. Stunning inside and out. It would be much nicer if woman weren't soliciting carnations though.

Beautiful. My son and his fiance chose to be married here. They had beeb to Barcelona a few time and apparently fell in love with the church. After a year of paper work the wedding was last week. The whole family from NY flew over. It was beautiful. Certainly I have a special reason to love the Basilica , however it is a stunning building with a lot of history and well worth seeing. The area around the church is also prime for sightseeing
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful medieval church. You should visit if you're in Barcelona. The architecture is incredible.

Amazing in the simplicity. This is a marvelous example of Catalan architecture at its best. An incredible structure with so much history. The burning of the interior during the civil war in 1936 probably helped in that we can see the true structure of the building without the paraphenelia of most great churches in Spain!well worth a visit.
Interesting. Really beautiful place, peaceful in the gardens. Very interesting. Free at certain times. We got there early and it was really busy., but it is so big it didn't seem crowded.

Nice church. Neat architecture, beautiful stained glass windows. The plaza it sits in is nice, and had a small flea market (this was on Sunday). There was also a live band out front playing classical music.

Medieval is always great to see. The Santa Mria Del Mar is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic architecture with a purity and unity of style that is unusual in large Medieval buildings.This church has a serious claim to have the slenderest stone built columns in the World.A great deal of natural light enters the inside by tall clerestory windows.Both the exterior and interior are exemplary.

Such a surprising Basilica. I had been wandering the streets of Ribera after visiting the Picasso Museum and I actually didn't realise that I was entering the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar (Our Lady of the Sea), what an absolute delight it was. I had entered at the alter end of the church and was mesmerised by the massive stone columns in front of me which were at the back of the alter, they transported me back to Santuario di Santo Stefano in Bologna, Italy for awhile.Santa Maria del Mar was constructed in the 14th century and only took 55 years to build. The architectural style is Catalan Gothic and it has such beautiful symmetry. The stone columns seem so tall, there is a good amount of natural lighting that shines through the many stain glassed windows. It is a well preserved and peaceful oasis in a busy city.

Take the guided tour. This is a beautiful Basilica to visit. The architecture of it is absolutely stunning! Make sure that you take the guided tour. The guided have so much information to share and you leave not only going to the top of the Basilica (which gives you amazing views of Barcelona) but you also know so much about the history of the area and the Basilica.

A beautiful sight to stumble upon. A gorgeous site. There were dancers performing out front when we went by. We didn't go in for a lookor anything but it's in a busy square in the daytime, nice place to eator have a rest.
Pray and Relax. Beautiful place to pray and relax with the beautiful energy of the church. You can learn how was built and it is incredible.

Beautifull. Il start by saying make sure you cover up your shoulders and don't wear vest tops or you won't be able to enter. It's very cheap to get in and it's beautiful inside but can get very busy. The only thing which I wish I had done was get a private guide to take you around as there is so much that you will miss.

Quite a site for church architecture lovers. Really neat building from the perspective of someone who loves to see churches, especially big, expansive ones! Nothing frilly since it has not been kept up as well as others, but still a place to see if you are close. Using your imagination to go back in time when there was actually a strong Catholic faith in the city would allow you to see the love and devotion for Christ of the builders and planners.
Well worth a visit!. If you like wonderful churches then this one is a lovely spot to visit! Cool and darkish on the inside it is a restful, thoughtful place of beauty.
lovely building. Wonderful Basilica and not as ornate as usual. Not much from the outside but inside makes up for it with its typically Spanish style spaciousness.

Beautiful Gothic Church. Our family thoroughly enjoyed this visit. Its a large, Gothic, church that is unlike what we have in the USA. The scale and scope are massive and as Protestants, the European Catholic churches are very nice to visit.

Very nice. This is a very nice basilica to come and visit away from the madding crowd. Unfortunately, we were asked to restrict our visit due to a mass starting soon after we arrived, but what we could see we were impressed with.
My wedding. Gorgeous church I was so lucky to be married in back in October 2005 x it was one of the few churches in Barcelona that you could get married in with an English ceremony....amazing church

Amazingly Beautiful. The Basilica Santa Maria Del Mar is amazingly beautiful. There is so much to see; you can easily spend a couple hours or more taking in the various views. The architecture, the art, and the ambiance are all amazing.... Take a few minutes to walk around the building and through nearby streets to absorb your surroundings.
Basilica Santa Maria del Mar. You must go inside this beautiful church! It is stunning, as is most of Barcelona. The architecture is unbelievable. See all of Barcelona!

Wonderful church away from La Rambla sights. Visiting this basilica came as a very big surprise to me because as I looked at the outside I figured it would be old and somewhat in need of repairs. I was not at all prepared for the wonders I saw. It was huge and in very good condition. It is full of a lot of smaller chapels or niches with saints. The altar is magnificent. It's worth taking the 10 minute walk over to check it out.
Gorgeous church. Beautiful and surprisingly large church tucked in el born. Services were happening when we visited. Free to enter and gorgeous naves and stained glass windows.
You have to see it... We read the book and had to see the result. a very nice chuch in a very charming area of the town. Recomended..

Romantic and amzaing. For me personally its the most beautiful church I have visited its romantic and mystic, beautiful but simple. As it was build by ordinary people and not by powerful feudals, the beautiful spirit is still in and around the church.
Beautiful. Admission is worthwhile. Wwe decided for the variant without a guide. Think you do not need leadership. Great Church.
Pillars of the earth. When you walk in to the Church , its like you walked into the book . Even if God isn't in your good book it really is quite an architectural feat well worth a short visit
Beautiful!. Like many of the other basilicas in Barcelona, this is just as beautiful and filled with history. However it's not necessarily a must see in my opinion

Beautiful details. I felt that a visit here was like visiting lots of churches all at once. It's a prominent location and very busy with tourists as a result. There are so many features in the Many alcoves in this church, fonts, altars and many other icons from the church. Free to enter but made a donation. I went here because I was staying in the area, not sure I would haveMade a special trip forIt.

Beautiful. This is a must do on the Barri Gotic itinerary. It features a beautiful nave and a small courtyard. On the outside of the building is a small remnant of a Roman Aqueduct; nice to have a reminder of Roman Barcino right next to a monument of Barcelona's medieval past. From the top of the cathedral you have some nice views of Barcelona and the rest of Barri Gotic.

14thC Gothic Cathedral. When walking into the square this amazing cathedral reveals itself and makes a very big impression. We were able to go in and the interior is also beautiful.
When you leave pop into Bubo for a dessert - front and slightly to the left of the square.
Santa Maria Del Mar. A very beautiful church. When we arrived the service started with organ and choir music, very nice to experience as well.
Church like many others. It's free to enter, so if you're in the neighbourhoud it's nice to visit. Nothing really special though.
Worth a quick visit. An austere but surprisingly large basilica tucked into the densely populated Born. Never a lineup, no burkha patrol.

Unexpected find. Randomly stumbled into this place early one evening whilst wandering around the Gothic Quarter a choir recital was taking place, which was free to enter drew us inside to discover truly stunning architecture and an incredible atmosphere. Some research is probably required before going to discover its actual opening times as several times later in my stay i passed by this place and it appeared to be closed.

Lovely old church in a nice square. Located in the Gothic quarter we went to mass here on a Sunday morning. Very nice old church where apparantly the Barcelona team come after winning a trophy to dedicate it to Our Lady.

Unexpected Find. I came across this Basilica while wandering through the Gothic area. It was not on my list of things to see but I am glad that I came across it. My favourite part was the inner court yard complete with swans.
A beautiful church in the Gothic Quarter. Great appeal - the peoples church. Beautiful stained glass and interior. Fantastic surrounding area for walking, eating and exploring

Bigger on the inside. Our tour guide told us it was like the Tardis from Doctor Who - bigger on the inside. I was skeptical to his claim, but when I went back later that day to verify it, it was indeed true. What a magnificent building. The history behind the church - built by the people, for the people, is truly inspiring and shows the true resilience and determination of the Catalan people. Awe inspiring.
Great church. History, beauty and spirit. In the middle of the Gothic quarter and walking distance from La Rambla, we love that church with it has to offer.

Awesum place. Its an awesome place to visit. Clicked a lot of Pictures. But that day it was too hot. Lots of people swarmed that area and were clicking pics and selfie's too. An enjoyable place to chill out.

A beautiful cathedral with lots of history. Its not the most magnificent but the history of how it was built is incredible. You should read the book La cathedral del Mar to understand its full history. Very nice
not open at all times. We only got lucky after passing it three times, a very complicated timetable posted outside the cathedral.. Fantastic interior, the building is breathing the medeaval history..
Special. When you know the story of this place it gets even more special. It is free. Try to do a tour in that neighbourhood (el Born), you will learn a lot!

Great history, but also visit Santa Maria del Pi. The basilica was restored after a case of arson in the twentieth century, so not as good as Santa Maria del Pi in my opinion, but I would not skip it.
beautiful. a lovely, calm, unadorned place. very down to earth and warm interior w/ out the usual flourish found in most European churches and cathedrals.

Beautiful early Gothic architecture. This is an imposing structure. It is quite a contrast to a number of the city's modern buildings. It is difficult to describe the feeling one has inside such an old and magnificent church.

Location, location, location.... I love the location of this Basilica, in the hart of "El Born". You can spend a hole afternoon walking arround the gothic like streets and having a great time. I love the way the SUN illuminates this place. I love the light in Barcelona in general.

Do not miss this small gem. Located in the Ribera District in the heart of the medieval maritime trading area, the very beautiful Church of Santa Maria del Mar is about a 10 minute walk from the Picasso Museum and close to the Cathedral. This 14th c Catalan Gothic Church was built by the merchant class and fisherman--it has 16 octangular pillars and arches that are 52 ft high. The nave was supposedly the inspiration for Gaudi's Sagrada Famiia.
Visit. Visited with friend as didnt see this previous visit to sagrada familiar. Lovely building and architecture. Not too busy the dsy we were there.
Beautiful building. I went to barcelona on 2014 and it was amazing! and i really recommend you to visit the basilica of santa del mar!
Amazing church. This one i liked again. A lot more quiet and a lot more respectful than sagrada familia. Here you can learn a lot more about the history and meaning

A pretty church - worth it if you're in the area. This church is beautiful, but when compared to the Sagrada or the Cathedral that we'd seen earlier in the day, it paled a bit in comparison. It has a neat story to it though (check out the charred ceiling).
We spent about 30 minutes here.
Great Historical Church. We took at Guided Tour which took you to the Roof of the Church and you get to see a great view of Barcelona
Visit to The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is quite beautiful. We enjoyed taking pictures and viewing the architecture.

Beautiful inside and out. I am so glad we booked the full guided tour for this wonderful Basilica. Our guide explained this beautiful example of 14th Century Catalan Gothic architecture and it's place in History with much passion and told the story through the ages. From it's beginnings through the political and social turmoil and the destruction when it was set on fire and burned for 11 days in 1936, the blackened roofs are still visible.We were lucky as part of the tour to be taken up to the roof and view the amazing stained glass window from the roof space and what a view of Barcelona - wonderful. The inside of the Basilica is just so peaceful and the stained glass windows are stunning. There are so many of them, the round stained glass window is beautiful viewed from the Balcony above the main altar.I could have spent much longer here taking many many more photographs!

The beautiful Gothic church by the sea. It's really a beautiful church to see while walking through the streets of Ribera. There's not a whole lot of room to get the full picture of the exterior façade, but it's the details surrounding the doorway that drew me in. The beautiful colored stones and the images of Jesus with Mary and St. John over the doorway are something to see. Do pay attention to the door as well. There are 2 laborers that are carrying the stones of the church (one by one). You don't see that on many old doors of that time. That alone makes this church unique as it tells us a story of how it was built long ago.
A peaceful beautiful place. Not as lavish as some buildings in Barcelona, but well worth a visit for quiet contemplation. Go early morning to avoid school groups
Impressive Basilica. This is a very old but impressive building that go no doubt tell a story or two from its 600 year history. Peaceful and full of charm.

Barcelona's Best Basilica. After a week in Barcelona seeing a wide variety of churches, including La Sagrada Familia, Santa Maria del Pi, and the Cathedral, my wife and I can both state with ease that Santa Maria del Mar is by far our favorite from this trip. What sets the basilica apart is the wide aisles which really open up the church and allow in a ton of light (even for a building as densely surrounded as this).

Old cathedral with a lot of history. Read the book "La Catedral del mar". I like everything.
Old cathedral with a lot of history. Read the book "La Catedral del mar".
My wife and i enjoy, some of our family members were in town and they visit us with no problem had a great time.
Marvellous. This is a church, where you can spend hours to see all the details. One of the best examples of 15. century Catalan gothic.

Beautiful old Cathedral in an interesting area.. Lovely old cathedral with niches round the outside for a variety of saints.
Very peaceful and holy space and an interesting area nearby.
Will visit again.. We visited during a practice choir. The were preparing for upcoming festivities. Just enhanced our visit. Sat and listened for an hour. Beautiful.
Beautiful & Near To a delicious delicatessen. The church is beautiful and beside is "La Botifarreria de Santa Maria", a great place to buy Chorizo, Ham, and 100000 other delicious delicatessen!
Born town jewel. Outstanding and historical place, atonishing temple to visit, get lost into it found among its many details.

Should be on your list.. This fine example of 14th century Catalan Gothic architecture should be on your must see list. The geometric proportions of the church delight the senses and the stained glass, much of which survived the Spanish Civil War, provides light and color that are also pleasing. The neighborhood, La Ribera, in which the church is located invites leisurely strolls past charming shops (find the tea shop and the house-roasted nut shop!) and offers some good restaurants. This is a great half-day experience.

Another great institution. Stunning architecture and fascinating history, it was one of many churches we visited during a two week holiday in Spain. Each one has its own distinguishing features and this one was up there with the best

A hidden treasure, well worth a tour. Our English-speaking tour guide was fabulous -- incredibly knowledgeable not just about the Basilica, but about the city's history and other landmarks. A special treat is that you get to walk up to the exterior roofline of the cathedral to look out over the neighborhood and city, with wonderful views -- just make sure that you are capable of climbing 120 steps before you sign on for the journey. This is not an ornate, ostentatious cathedral, but one that is humble and spiritual; you will be inspired.

Santa Maria del Mar - mystical, beautiful setting to begin Semana Santa. This is a beautiful church tucked away from the crowds at the very different and famous Sagrada Familia. I had read the best seller "Cathedral by the Sea" 5 years ago, but did not connect the novel to this church for several days.I was fortunate to attend an evening performance of Mozart's "Requiem Mass " during the week-end of Palm Sunday. The acoustics were amazing in such a spiritual setting. The Cathedral was full and all were inspired.The blessing of the palms by the Cardinal at the main Cathedral of Barcelona before mid morning Mass on Palm Sunday was very moving when all waved their palms as holy water was showered upon them. Such awe inspiring experiences as a prelude to the processions in the evening.

Beautiful city. A trip with friends around Spain. We was stationed in Germany and went on a week trip. This city is full of life! So much to see and do. The food was amazing, and this church was amazing! Tons of people to deal with, but worth it all.
Stunning. Don't miss this absolutely beautiful church. Amazing architecture. Was one of my highlights during my barcelona visit. Lovely area to wander around

lovely church like many others. while lovely, there is no other to compare with Sagrada Familia! After a month of touring and visiting many beautiful churches and cathedrals around Europe, this one paled in comparison to the mother of all churches in this fabulous city
Lovely gothic building. Beautiful arches. Stands majestic and tall. Lovely little cafes just outside the basilica to buy an ice cream and marvel at the amazing architecture.

The Virgin Mary. Even if you have read the name of this church, you will be surprised of how much presence The Madonna is in this - her own church. We experienced that untill 13 hrs the entrance was free. After 13 hrs the Price was 5 Euros.

Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. A bit different form most basilicas I have seen. Simpler and more in keeping with the time. It wasn't "just another church". It is also positioned in what is now a very interesting area to peruse.

Church tour is a great orientation to the city. Wonderful church! I highly recommend the guided tour which takes you up into the towers, then outside for a 360 degree view of Barcelona. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable about Gothic architecture, history and the city's urbanization. This is also an important church for those interested in Ignatius of Loyola.

Worth the visit. This was a highlight of our visit to Barcelona. It's a beautiful church with fabulous architecture.
Do yourself a favor and go on a paid tour as there's so much history and you will be very interested as the tour guide was just great

Take the tour. We were just going to check out this church in La Ribera - having heard read about it's unique architecture, but decided to take the tour because we were allowed on the roof of the building. The interior did not disappoint and the views from the top were beautiful as well. Highly recommended.

Read the Cathedral of the Sea and then visit!. After reading the Cathedral of the Sea, which is about the building of this church, it was extremely moving to visit here and sit in the pews on a Sunday morning. Just beautiful, and my favorite church in Barcelona.

Moved beyond belief. I was in Barcelona for the first time, to watch Barca v Valencia, on my todd. We won on the Saturday and on sunday I walked into the port. As I arrived , I texted my uncle, a priest, who has worked in south america and travelled widely; he said if I was near, I should visit his "favourite church in the whole world" and told me of the Basilica. I looked at the map and Lo! my eyes fell on it ... it was a few hundred metres from my intended destination and I had never heard of the Basilica before. I arrived at 11.56 and did not expect to find a Mass starting. I found myself in the midst of the front seated congregation and stayed for the Mass. It was joyous, the singing was angelic, the ambience gentle, the translation of the readings into English helpful and the priest coming to shake the hand of every person in the Mass seats was a lovely touch and he even waved to the tourists who chose to remain at the back of the church. I was moved to tears and I thank God for my faith. The church has a lovely acoustic, the ten pillars around the altar coalesce at the ceiling in a vault of Heaven. It is a gothic-esque masterpiece which is small enough to feel cosy but grand enough to elevate the soul.I do not recognise the church or attitude that the earlier reviewer summarised. Maybe her skirt was just not short in the right way, but there were plenty of lovely human beings in that church, lovely in every way, and the beauty of life radiated from everyone. You go to a Mosque or Synagogue you are expected to show respect but people cant have a pop at Muslims or Jews so they keep having a go at Catholics or Christianity in general. fair enough, que sera, sera.You make sure to visit this church if you find yourself within 50 miles of it yet alone 50 metres and you will not be disappointed.

Beautiful Church, Not to Be Missed.. This church is as beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside. Unlike many other churches in Spain, it is not overly ornate on the inside and more true to the Gothic form. The rose window at the rear of the church is outstanding. And one can take pictures on the inside.Be prepared to be hustled by street musicians who are pretty dreadful.
not allowed in.. yes. I'm a woman. its hot. i wore a skirt. my brother had shorts. he was allowed in. silly religion.

Beautiful and very large basilica. On a previous visit to Barcelona, we had walked by this basilica on a walking tour but finally got a chance to go inside. The basilica is very large and beautifully decorated. There is no grand altar as in some churches but there are beautiful stained glass windows. We spent probably an hour just walking around and enjoying the basilica. Definitely worth a stop when you're in Barcelona.

Special. This church always gives me a feeling of calm when I visit it. The unpainted walls dating back to damage from the civil war in contrast to the beautiful chapels make a stark contrast.A lovely place to spend some quiet contemplation
Very old cathedral. The acustics are outstanding, there were a group of ladies from Denmark that sang in front of the alter and it was wonderful to heR them, so beautiful.
a little gem. again many times to Barcelona but never visited the Basilica. a haven of peace in a very busy city. Sit a while and cool down and meditate if you wish but do visit

Easy visit. If you are in Barcelona/old city, sooner or later you will walk by the Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. Easy to get into and a worthwhile visit. Considering how hard it is to get into the wonderful Sagrada Familia, take 20 minutes to enjoy this one. There is much to see in B, and if you have seen many religious sites, this may not be worth a special trip. But if you are exploring B, you will find yourself in front of it.

Guided tour. A church rich in history and frescos, 13geese in courtyard was a lovely surprise. Guided tour is really good as they can tell you exactly what everything is and from what period. Photos are allowed to be taken inside church.

Never judge a book by its cover. We found this church by chance. Its very plain on the outside, you could almost overlook it. Once inside though, be prepared for a Gothic wonder. So much light and space. Its a simple but stunning design without much glitter or ornamentation. If you look up at the ceiling, you can see signs of the fire's lit during the Civil War that failed to overcome this wonderful church!

a gothic church with a difference. go on the guided tour - you will not be dissapointed. to be honest we didnt walk around inside the church as there was an ongoing event in the church but the guided tour up the towers had us discovering many interesting facts.

Overrated without the visit to the roof. After all the great reviews on trip advisor we made a detour to find this church at the end of a long day and were quite disappointed. The church itself is ok but not as spectacular as a lot of the others in Barcelona.The windows are nice enough and the church is quite open and not as dark as some. But the chapels are not as ostentatious or opulent as some. Our opinion may have been a lot different if we had made it to the roof but we were too late for the tour and the English tours were only early in the afternoon (while we would be elsewhere) - if only they would run them at other times in the day.Contrary to some of the reviews and photos there is no garden/cloister attached - there is no room for it. That is in a very different church.

Beautiful. Beautiful Basilica, worth visiting. Plus the neighborhood is great to get lost in. Make sure to go early, before 1pm, since they charge in entrance after that hour, 5 euro per person. At least that was in our case. Not sure if it applies for everyday. Still worth the visit!

A hidden gem in Barcelona. Beautiful! . All I heard about prior to my visit to Barcelona was the Sagrada Familia. We went there and really weren't that impressed, because it wasn't a beautiful traditional church. Then one night we were walking around and stumbled upon this church. It is hidden in the alleys near El Born district. It was big, beautiful, gothic, with great stained windows and fabulous arches. I was really amazed by this church, and even stayed to hear the organist play. We enjoyed it very much. You can even go to the rooftop terrace for great views of the city.
truly gothic church. This is a grand yet simple gothic basilica worth visiting. It is situated in a lovely square where you can then sit,eat,drink and soak up the atmosphere.
This has such a great story. the architecture is so ahead of its time, it is amazing. And the story of this church, with its survival through the centuries is truly amazing. Check it out.
Beautiful. Love this cathedral, and all that must have happened within its walls. You don't have to be religious to appreciate the relish the beauty.

Beautiful church. I attended to the saturday morning mass and it was enlightening, not really cater to foreigners. I do speak a little spanish and I was able to follow. There are classic recitals at some Saturday nights. the church sits in a beautiful quarter with ice cream shops and restaurants around it.

Wow!. Having seen lots of basilicas around Europe, this one was among the best! It's gothic features blew my mind, it is absolutely a must-see. If you're lucky, you can also join a rite and experience a different kind of culture (being an atheist, it was interesting for me).

Dress code enforced. Beautiful in the middle of the old town. I have never seen geese in a church before, but it seemed to add to the charm. Note: when we were there a very strict dress code was enforced - no shorts, bare shoulders (unlike Sagrada Familia where everything is acceptable).
Gothic church. Quite a contrast to Sagrada Familia and well worth a visit, although it seemed rather dark inside. It's what RC churches were like before they became overdecorated.

Worth it. This is an amazing place and the tour was well worth it.The tour guide knew his stuff, and we got to go up to the roof and look at the views of Barcelona - worth it for that alone!There is an amazing fiction book written about this place that is well worth a read. It is called Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones. Beautiful place and would go again.

Not sure I can see the attraction. It's a church. Not much different to other churches other than it being very old. I can't see what the attraction is and 4 euros entry was a bit odd considering it didn't include the tower (had to pay extra for that). If you like churches then it's for you, otherwise I'd avoid.
Gorgeous cathedral. With super interesting art in situ and history. After we visited the basilica we enjoyed fideu paella and sangria outside and looking up at this historic site.

BEAUTIFUL and totally worth a visit!!. We saw pictures of the Basilica online before we left on our trip and knew we had to visit. It was of course more than we could have imagined through pictures once we arrived. I would go back here every time we visit. It's a must do on my list!!

Stunned. To this day, I am still stunned with The architecture of this building, looking up at the ceiling and looking at the art work was hard work! I just wanted to lie on the floor and look up but I want allowed!If you want to go inside, please bear in mind that you must ensure they you are wearing appropriate clothing, shirt not a vest also no short shorts I.e must cover you knees

Interesting architecture. Definitely worth a visit. There was a huge line up so we unfortunately didn't go in. The Place in front of the church is very crowded, be aware of pickpockets. Also theres a double decker bus that leaves from there. I think they charge something like 30 Euros or so if you're into that.
If your interested in Gothic basilicas, go fo it.. Steep entrance fee of 10 Euro a head. Great example of the Catalunyan gothic style in a church that dates form the 14th century
BEAUTIFUL GOTHIC ARQUITECTURE. This is a Gothic cathedral built in the 14th century .Magnificent structure leaves you in awe. Amazing how it has stood through wars and time so beautifully

Beautiful!!. You totally have to visit. I enjoyed being in this church. So glad I was able to make it because I wasn't sure if I was gonna get inside. If you're into visiting churches, I would say a definite stop.

Beautiful. It was an absolutely stunning cathedral and a great contrast after being in Sagrada Familia (Both are amazing but for different reasons). Make sure to go into the courtyard and see the swans!
Big and beautiful!. This church did more to me than the Sagrada. The inside is beautiful, very high and with impressive arches.
What a building. This building has got all the wow factors outside so read up before your visit as it will help when you when you see it. Due to wet weather we were unable to get on the roof.

Really quite wonderful. Another soaring interior space. Well worth a visit. I love the feel you get as you wander around and absorb the quality of the space and how some of these buildings soar to the sky.
Gorgeous!. Old style cathedral that I could have spent hours in. Just looking at the stained glass was an experience.

Easily the Most Beautiful Church in Barcelona (and that's saying a lot!.
