Santa Maria del Mar stands out in at least two ways: it was built in less than 100 years, an unusually short time for such projects (on account of which, it has a design coherence that many Barcelona churches lack); and, it's exceptionally clean of line and beautiful. We came to tour but ended up simply sitting and contemplating the peace and beauty for nearly an hour. Beautiful stained glass windows everywhere; exceptionally lovely naves; interesting carvings on the doors and front. And the staff are friendly and helpful. You couldn't ask for more.

Nice simple church. I have to admit that I have probably seen too many churches. If you love viewing them don't fallow me. There is so much to see around Barcelona. Enjoy every experience. Even this little church.
So beautiful!. So beautiful on the inside! The artistry of the different altars (paintings, sculptures, murals,etc...) is outstanding. A definite must see!
Beautiful!. What can you say? It's absolutely stunning and worth visiting!I am always overwhelmed by the detail in these churches.

Virgin Veneration. Idolatory through the ages is a fascinating and disturbing spectacle. But you cannot but be gobsmacked by the soaring architectural grandeur and the vaulting aspirations of the designers. Certainly an important box to tick in this magnificent city.
Not a great church tourist but this was impressive. The Basilica was quite impressive, especially the ceiling and the area around it well worth a wander.
Stunning. It was something worth seeing, I loved Barcelona my best ever city break. It's sunny.the restaurants and hotel was fab. Harbour and beach were lovely too.

You will be impressed!. You will obtain felling of ages here. Huge church not visually restored with real touch of middle ages... You will enjoy calm and cool atmosphere here instead of hot air outside. Relax and stay in peace!
Very old. Great Bascilica. We were fortunate enough to attend a concert there at night in the side chappel, fantastic, do it. Enjoy this very old building.

La Catedral del Mar. If you read this book dont miss it, this is the real thing! It is a very ancient cathedral very diferent from the one in the Barri Gotic. The construction took about 17 years in the 1200

Spectacular. Built in the early 14th century, this church still has the power to take one's breath away. Soaring roofs and vivid stained glass enhance the dignity of the old stone; the many chapels remind the viewer of the role played in Barcelona's history by the Church and its saints. There used to be a model of a ship suspended over the main altar; it is now on the altar, perhaps too frail to remain in the air. Note that the church is closed for the early afternoon. No charge for admission.

Uau!. Barcelona is known for the football team, for Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell, and so many more things. But this church is one of those places where you will not find those big amounts of people and you will love the place. It is a beautiful church. It has beautiful window panes and when you sit in one of its bank, you can feel you are about to rise up to the sky. Normally there is a toursit tax to get it, but there are some free hours. Go there. Go!!

Surprisingly a lot to do. When arriving, i was expecting to see just the basilica. But in addition to admiring the interior architecture, there is also an elevator that leads to the roof, a beautiful courtyard with fountains, and a small museum. I was expecting to take no longer than 30 minutes, but i ended up staying much longer.
A beautiful church... . With its unique and exceptional design... It's ONE beautiful place that is definitely worth visiting... Located in a beautiful area as well...it's a must see
Lovely Church. Beautiful church off a lovely square. Soaring spaces. Nice places outside to have some cava and tapas and contemplate beautiful exterior before going inside.

Imposing and moving church. We visited the church during the Good Friday celebrations. The church was packed with people attending the services and by Tourists ( who should have waited before visiting the church). Still, it was a very nice experience: the architecture is great and the decorations are simple but effective. A must in Barcelona.
as awesome as Sagrada. Great guided tour and less busy than Sagrada . Great rooftop views.The Gothic history is really interesting.

Catalan Gothic. Interesting Catalan Gothic architecture. The desk clerk at our hotel told us about a best-selling novel revolving around this cathedral. naturally the gift shop there had copies in several languages to sell, and of course I had to buy a copy. Haven't read it yet, but it looks reminiscent of Ken Follett's "Pillars of the Earth."

beautiful. typical of every place in Barcelona, overrun with disrespectful heathens and rude tourists. The building is beautiful, an active parish, and free to get into. I'm delighted to think all the atheists pay to get in.

Great stop. No visit to the Gothic quarter would be complete without at least viewing of the Basilica. Its a sight to be seen! Very ornate and beautiful. You can go in but for a fee. The area surrounding this is truly amazing including some Roman ruins dating back thousands of years. This area is also full or open air market and many people dancing, playing.
must see!. A must see in Barcelona. Especially the stunning leafy courtyard. Go late in the afternoon, the atmosphere is mesmerizing.
Beautiful Basilica. Definitely worth a visit and schedule into your time table . A great Basilica , fantastic history and just superb . You can go to the crypt and really neat plaza at the front .

well worth visit. it's a better choice and more beautiful than the overrated sagrada familia. and it's free admission. behind the church is gothic quarter where you can continue your journey after the church

Unbelievable architectural gem. This is a centuries old cathedral open to the public without admission cost. Majestic spires and stained glass windows. There are art works dating to the 1400s. Walk slowly and absorb everything including people interred in the floor.

This is the neighborhood church in the Gothic Quarter. There was a wedding just concluding when we visited. This church really does feel it is the heart and soul of the neighborhood. Beautiful inside and peaceful. Just go in, take a seat, look around, and enjoy the serenity.

Take time out and experience . The basilica is at walking distance from Jaume I station and the Gothic quarter. It looks big from outside and you will realize why is it so when you enter in. The tall pillars, the architecture, the stained glass is beautiful to check out. If you get a chance to stay back for the mass I would recommend it

holy place with great architecture. that place have great architects and amazing statues and that things give you anidea of how these people of barcelona love their churches in the past, this place give you a chance to pray in deep for few min. during your journey.

Free Entry. The sheer scale of the building is so impressive. Unlike some religious buildings in the UK, this was free entry and we were able to take photos with no hassle at all. Well worth a visit, even if you are not particularly religious. It also provides some welcome respite from the baking Spanish sun!!!
Beautiful. Lovely stonework and beautiful stained glass windows. well worth a stop and look. Take a pew and admire the craftsmanship of the ceiling
Beautiful surprise. This is a stunning and unexpected church with its tall columns and beautiful light. It's on the way to the beach

JUST GET YOUR MIND AND SOUL IN "THE ZEN MODE" AND WALK IN.. Nothing High Tech here, that's for sure!
Didn't planned to visit it, just stumbled upon.
Authentic Catalan atmosphere and beautiful art.

Mass Sat evening April 25, 2015. Although the Mass was in Spanish, it was obvious the priest was very welcoming and aware of tourists present as he would put in greetings and words of prayer in German, French, and English where appropriate. Lovely experience. The church itself is very historic and the pews are of such beautiful wood and design. If you haven't been to Mass, come back and see.
Excelent. Excelent Basilica. without the luxury of the catedral but you can really feel the hard work putted there by the citizens. Build by the people and for the people. Amazing how the did it

Beautiful Example of 14th Century Catalan Gothic. This simple and stunning basilica located in the Ribera neighborhood of Barcelona is a beautiful example of the Catalan expression of gothic architecture. While the outside of the building appears massive, the interior is light, airy and austere. Strangely, there is one stained glass window that seems ultra-modern. This is definitely a place to take your time, relax and marvel at the architecture of 600 years ago. The back of the church opens into El Born and, if you were to turn to the left onto Carrer Montcada you will find one of the best bars (El Xampanyet) and the Museu Picasso de Barcelona.

The 'People's Cathedral', worth a visit!. The history of this basilica is quite interesting. Local fishermen, artisans and workers build this church by themselves because there was no money to let a contractor (or however they called them back then) build it. They got all the stones of from Montjuic, mined and carried by hand, piece by piece, whilst the women took care of the men.The church is build with naked rock, also on the inside, with only a few murals applied onto the bare rock. This is a true place of worship, barren stones, no pompous statues, gold ornaments... just an altar to look at and to pray on one of the benches. Liked it very much, it's simplicity has done it good!Be sure to visit when you're in Barcelona (El Born).

History in a modern City. I was "getting lost" in Barcelona and came upon this massive church.The architecture is called Catalan Gothic and the style is austere and simple. Built in the 14C, with additional changes in the 15 & 19C.Because the city built itself around the church, it's very hard to get an idea of scale, until you go inside.(One note: if you go to Port Vell and walk along Barceloneta, the church's dome and the statue dominate the skyline.)The interior space is cavern like. The walls and ceiling are unadorned, no statues or plaster. The columns, the support the roof, are these slender structures. There's a sense of peace and tranquility when you enter the church, which is in a basilica style, so no nave or transepts.The windows are from various periods and the rose window is beautiful.You will notice black soot on the ceiling, some of that is due to candles but some is surely due to the fire on 1936, which destroyed the altar.There's a desk, once you enter that provides information and will sell you a candle (various sizes) that you can place in front of the various chapels that border the space. I lit one for my Dad.Not to be missed, for its severe beauty and simplicity.

Amazing church, one look and you realize why it's the locals' favourite. Visiting this church gave me a feeling of serenity. The exterior and interior is gorgeous, and either because it's rather big inside (or for some rather reason), it's not stuffy when you get in. There's actually a lot space to sit down or look around!Also, I'm pretty sure there's a fee but I didn't pay anything because I went there in the afternoon. Make sure to check if there's that option :D
beautiful art. As usual, the churches in europe are full of amazing art. Santa Maria del Mar was no exception. Steeped in the history and struggles of the people.

If Your Into Historic Buildings. If you're into historic churches it will probably make you happy but not anything more than you'll see all over Europe. We a bit put off by the charges to enter and the number of beggars around the entrance.

Spectacular Inside. It is fairly bland on the outside but the inside has massive high sand stone columns and outstanding stained glass. It is a typical Christian church but it is open to the public and is quite beautiful The streets around are also filled with interesting restaurants and up market shops.

One of Barcelona's most beautiful. One of the only examples of Catalan Gothic architecture remaining, this basilica is one of the most beautiful in town. The interior has a special character and makes you feel at peace somehow.

Read Cathedral by the Sea. Read Cathedral by the Sea, and this Basilica will come alive for you. Realizing that each stone in these churches had to be carried from the quarries on back is just the beginning of how to appreciate the craftsmen that built them.

The 1936 fire still casts a pall. This is a structurally interesting church but much of the detail was sadly destroyed by fire in 1936. Some earlier stained glass (and some later additions of course) remain and in particular the rose window is vivid and original in design.

Whatever your faith, what a beautiful and peaceful place to visit.. I have no faith and absolutely no interest in religious history, but what I do have is a huge appreciation for stunning architecture and a very clear sense of peace and inner calm and for these reasons, The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is simply a very edifying and wonderful place to visit for an hour or so whilst in Barcelona. I'd thoroughly recommend a trip there.
quiet and atmospheric. Gorgeous stained glass and a fascinating 700 year history made this one of my favourite places in Barcelona.
Was this an inspiration to gaudi?. Amazing and beautiful church, with soaring roof and tall columns. A surprise and delight. Mostly fourteenth century but nicely plain as well.

A grand, majestic haven!. After having visited the cathedrals of Segovia, Toledo, the element of awe and surprise was less but still strikingly memorable. Waited in cue to take the elevator up to see the view - unfortunately, construction was in progress so was not the grand view I had expected. Still, memorable just the same.

for the people by the people. This is a building that deserves a visit to Barcelona in its own right. It is an unusual gothic cathedral built with contributions and labor of the people and for the people. This middle ages monument was built in a record time. Indeed, shorter that is taking in modern times to build the bizarre Sagrada Familia.Just visit it and get inmersed in the construction with its tall inward columns and then sit outside the plaza for a drink, tapas and people watching.

real gothic church. the church looks quite hard and solid from the outside, like not very special. But inside it is really nice, if you like the clean architecture of the catalan gothic. There are not so many people and you can sit inside and enjoy the dim light and the silence there is.

Santa Maria Del Mar. One of the most beautiful and atmospheric churches in the Catalan region. Austere after the fires of the Civil War in 1936, this church is stripped back and simple in appearance. The arcades and sheer size of the church are stunning - and the rose window at the West end a shimmering display of medieval architecture at its best.
nice. It's really worth to visit that basilica if you are in Barcelona. Very nice :) Good place easy to find
Beautiful stained glass work. The cathedral comes out of nowhere in the middle of the El Born district. From outside it is not so impressive but the work inside is gorgeous.
Beautiful basilica. Quiet haven amid the hustle and bustle of Barcelona, in a beautiful square. It is free to enter later in the day, after 5pm I think.

even if you are not particularly religious.... beautiful Gothic style church. same applies to the many stained-glass windows (one of which is modern and abstract) Good to light a candle for whichever reason an reflect in this atmospheric building. (not religious by the way). If there is a wedding taking place..it's worth sitting at a neaarby cafe to watch the guests etc in their finery. On one occasion it made me smile when the refuse truck took priority over the wedding guests standing outside and who made way for it to negociate the narrow street in front!
A beautiful Cathedral.. I read Cathedral of the Sea, a historical fiction novel about the building of the cathedral in the 1300's. It made the cathedral come to life. It is beautiful.

Amazing. My dream come through because I read the book about the church and the story is just amazing. I just don't like that is a little bit ignore because people don't know what it took to build this place. If you read the book (La Catedral del Mar) will understand what I'm talking about.
Worth a stop. Well worth seeing this cathedral. I love ancient architecture and while this site doesn't qualify as ancient it was a nice cathedral.
Typical. A typical religious building with nice architectural detailing. We were glad to see it before Sagrada Familia as nothing can beat it.
Beautiful Architecture. No cost to enter the building and not overly crowded. Finished in a single century so its design is all one style, gothic.

Go for it. It is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic, with a purity and unity of style that is very unusual in large medieval buildings. It is an imposing church in the Ribera district of Barcelona

Closed to view. Very nice from outside and from the little I saw of the inside - unfortunately unable to go in as there was a sunday service but we had to queue before finding that out. 5 euros to go inside which seemed a bit steep
Absolutely marvelous!. Gorgeous architecture which boggles the mind as to how the devil did they construct the church without the use of modern technology. Definitely not to be missed!
The history and the inside. You would love the history behind the construction of this magnificent church and the inside is magnificent.

Extraordinary church. This church is pure and simply amazing! It's a pure catalan gothic style and is by far one of the best architectures that I ever seen. I used to go there 2 or 3 times a month just to appreciate the beauty of this place. This is by far what I most miss from Barcelona.
Gothic Cathedral. It is a special place... Massive and impressive! There is also a statuette of Black Madonna, located in Montserrat monastery.
Early Gothic. Early gothic style is much less ornate than than the Barcelona Cathedral nearby. A good contrast to view both.

Beautiful church at the heart of El Born. Beautiful large church. We were lucky enough to pass by as a choral concert was in progress and along with other tourists popped in to listen. Great experience.
Stunning. Beautiful, you also have to read the book with the same name. The neiborhood is so beautiful. Beautiful streets and restaurants everywhere.

Requiem for Mozart. Performed by the Orquestra Filharmonia de Barcelona
Exquisite surrounds to hear this amazing work performed!

A working church that is fabulous.. Lucky enough to see a wedding taking place and it was exquisite to watch.
The displays of Saints around the church are amazing.
Take the small lift to the rooftop for 3Euros each, for spectacular views of Barcelona.
A brilliant visit and a must!

Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. This was very different to the cathedral, but beautiful none the less. It is very old and set out like so many early churches with small areas given over to particular people of importance.
The stained glass is beautiful in this church, and to me was the best part of this building.
open gothic. slendar columns give this an open feeling sour with angels light airy easy to see one of the best in barcelona
Beautiful traditional Gothic church. Beautiful church in traditional Gothic style. It is not super spectacular or unusual, but it is a lovely example of the Gothic style well preserved.

Airy Gothic, worth the visit. Happened upon the basilica looking for a different church. Very different in scale and layout from other examples in the area.
Well worth the visit.

Interesting. An interesting, if not spectacular, gothic church with an exceptionally wide nave (easier to see since the anarchists in the civil war burned out the decorations). With its multiple very thin pillars it did help me understand some of the inspiration for the Sagrada Familia interior. Pretty stained glass and fun decorations on the door. But for a European gothic cathedral, not of the first rank.

Very beautiful. This Basilica is hardly mentioned but deserves more attention. I think it is very beautiful.
To me it is a typical Catholic church you find in these Southern European areas but has more elaborate artworks than others

Just beutiful. located in a quitter area, one must walk to find its location....but once you get there it is a sight to behold. The inside is gracious and usually has a lot of people praying an older church in a middle class environment, near the water as the name implies

It is a must visit.. For me it is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. Made by seafarers, during their off hours brought the stones of the quarry of Montjuïc to the Born. Imposing Gothic style inside is impressive. The greatness of the church makes us feel small. It is a must visit.

14th C Gothic at its best. This Basilica feels so very different to many of the other great cathedrals of Spain. Open, spacious, airy...despite its Gothic style.It has survived deliberate attempts at destruction, as recent as 1936 when it was set on fire and burned for 11 days! Make sure you climb the stairs at the east end of the Basilica for a wonderful view back towards the entrance.
Meaningful & Beautiful. A grand basilica built by the people carries so much more meaning than a grand Cathedral built by the Church or the State. Not as ornate as the Cathedral but beautiful.
Nice Gothic Church. I enjoyed being there. its in old town Barcelona close to beach. There is also nice concerts held in the place.

Overwhelmingly spectacular. Santa María del Mar is, and I'm not very much into churches, certainly a mystical place. Its height, its thick stone walls, incense and the damp cold that seems coming out of the depths of the earth give me chills. All these aspects come together in almost all the churches, I am aware. But personally, this is different, you are transported to the Barcelona walls.
A wonderful Gothic Architecture. A must visit church, you can enjoy lovely concert everyday. This is the best church depicting the Gothic architecture.

Highlight. The highlight of Barcelona. very expensive though and you will loose most of your day waiting to get in. i am not sure if it worth the time and the money but for sure you need to pass by to have a look at this mastr piece

interesting. Its facade very difficult to photograph because of the proximity of the narrow streets surrounding the church but at the same time give a special charm to the area ..It is nota church where light plays through his glasses but has a flat light throughoutthe day, but at some point yes you can see the sunlight penetrate inside.
Amazing Architecture. Its an amazing experience. If you get a chance, take the elevator to the top and you can see Barcelona from a birds eye view. Its so beautiful to see.

a must see. Situated in the barium Ribera is a must see in Barcelona. This Gothic church was built between 1329 and 1383.Despite being a fairly large and majestic building inside is very austere but not surprising, really is beautiful and interesting architecture. It is best to take a guided tour to find out either its history and its artiquetectura.
beautiful peaceful church. try and find this church to see the beautiful architecture and stained glass windows. Not busy so a peaceful experience in a busy chaotic part of this beautiful city.

Makes you feel welcome. Here, you get a rare unifying feeling you don't necessarily experience in many other sacred places.
The neighbourhood is also magnificent.
Beautiful. Beautiful church in pretty surroundings, close to the beach and to the city center. Beautiful light filters through the stained-glass windows.

Little Gem, easy to miss. We nearly missed this as we were taking photos of the square and I thought I would pop my head in. Its a lovely example of catholic architecture. Very little tourist activity so you can take your time exploring and taking pics. Please be respectful though as it is still a place of worship for many locals.

Beautiful basilica, must-see in Barcelona. The exterior and interior are both gorgeous. It is good to visit the basilica on any day, maybe only inconvenienced by services. Photos are allowed as long as you don't make annoying click sounds, and probably no flash, but I did see people having flash on anyway. A great opportunity for photographers.
Lovely place. We always visit when we are in barcelona....its a gorgeous serene place with a special ambience..especially in the evening when the lights come to life...its a must to visit

Among my favourite places in Barcelona. There is something magical about this space. If you love churches and enjoy the sacred spaces, take a few minutes and stop into this glorious place. I like to be there at sunset or at dusk, the interior lighting is spectacular in capturing the spirit of this place. Check to see if there is an organ or music program, it makes the visit even that much more wonderful
Beautiful building. Loved this cathedral. It was very busy over the Easter break so I assume it would be packed out during summer season. Well worth a visit.

Glorious. I return here every visit. It feels spiritual and special. I a always light a candle and view the amazing stain glass windows and alters. some work underway but takes nothing away. Went to Mass on Easter Sunday felt special. Just remember be respectful it is a Church.....
Impressively large. This place is much bigger on the inside than it looks. Worth a quick look inside if you're in the area. It's a nice area to walk around.

A most special cathedral. Read "The Cathedral of the Sea" ahead. It was financed by jibes but buit byte abortion of the poor workers and all worshipped together. Check out the boat in front of the crucifix. We went to Easter mass here and felt so welcome when the celebrant greeted all in Catalan, Spanish, French, German and English! Later he invited us to say the Lord's Prayer in our own language.

Oldest and most beautiful church in old part of city. Do visit this really nice and old church in oldest part of city. Try to avoid crowd if you want quite time in the church , go little early in the morning.Surrounding of the church is also nice to explore. There is a roman wall nearbyhttp://vikramvi-ideas.blogspot.de/2015/04/barcelona-and-costa-brava-7-days-in.html
Pretty Church. This is a sweet smaller church that is worth a quick visit. There were no fees to enter when we visited, but we've been told that is not always the case.

Spectacular Gothic Church from 14th Century. I was lucky enough to attend a concert of Mozart's Requiem in this magnificent venue, what could have been better than this! A Church built by the people and artisans of Barcelona to rival the cathedral which was built by the nobility. The height of the church and it simplicity is very striking and one wonders how they managed to build such a stunning building in those days without modern equipment. Definitely worth a visit I highly recommend it.

Huge gothic church. Beautiful gothic architecture, pillars, arches, stain windows, high ceiling etc. really excellent example of the genre and serene atmosphere, it's well worth a visit. Take your camera.

Happy accidental discovery. Like some others, we stumbled into this lovely cathedral by accident. We were tired and couldn't believe our luck that the pews were open for seating and that a string ensemble was playing! Unfortunately, this little bit of luck ended quickly as everyone was ushered out due to some scheduled event. Still, a beautiful place and a great memory.

Breathtaken, every time a visit Santa Maria del Mar. if you have read the book "The Catedral by the sea", then you understand my titel for this review.I dont like the fact that it's now an admissionfee in o the basilica, but it's worth every cent...

A Gothic Church. We went here by accident, but glad that it happened. This was a very interesting church with a very unique Gothic architecture. There are few art installment / monument outside that is pretty interesting too. The square in front of the church is vary happening too, as in many people doing many activities.

Beautiful. We didn't go looking for this, we actually came upon it whilst looking for a place to eat, the square where this cathedral is set is truly beautiful, whith numerous tapas restaurants, we ate in a restaurant outside the main entrance of the cathedral, the food was great and it was a special birthday treat for me, then we spent a good hour in this lovely cathedral, hundreds of people were inside, it was huge and stunning, it is definitely a must to visit and FREE!!!

100% must see in Barcelona. Very good organ. My impression is that this church is 100% must see in Barcelona, the atmosphere inside is really special. I have visited a lot of churches all over the Europe and so be sure that I know what I am talking about, this place is special. Very good organ, sound is not really too loud but perfect.

Closest to BCN's Heart. this Church is the one closest to the people of Barcelona's hearts. It was build and paid by the people. There is a great novel called "La catedral del Mar that tells the story about this Church. It was an honor for the people of the Town to carry the stones to build this Church.

Gorgeous gothic. I couldn't believe how hidden this basilica was, we walked right past it the first time! Get to the front and enter into the beautiful building. The architecture is purely gothic due to the timely construction. Enjoy every inch of it!
Nice. Have been there, very nice church. very big and more interesting is to see and think- how those people did it without the technology of today? very very nice! infront of it you've got a market!

Gothic architecture. Gothic, that's what's missing modern architecture. Just a few hours we spent there, but it was enough to leave an impression on all life, high arches, stained glass windows and authentic interior ... it is super, I advise you to go see)

Hidden Jem. I am not religious but always visit this place while in Barcelona . I find the architecture Inspiring taken into account this is place is 10 centuries old . I had the pleasure to attend a performance of Handel's Messiah with orchestra, choir and soloist . The acoustics were fantastic and made the whole performance something rather special
Beautiful little sancuary in the Barri Gotic.. Lovely church and so well preserved. An oasis of calm and peace as the hustle and bustle of the city goes on around it. Well worth a visit.

Gothic church in good shopping area. We strolled the side streets of Barcelona and stumbled over this small church. There was a small fee to go inside (maybe 3 Euros) but the restored church was nice. Not crowed and the stained glass windows were beautiful. Nice little outside sitting area to relax and reflect. There was a good display (in Spanish only) of the restoration of the church after it burned.

Worth popping-in. We popped in after dinner one dark rainy evening. This basilica had an ambience to match - in a good way! The inside was cavernous, dimly lit, and austere, which really gave it a neat feeling. It is amazing to think of all the labour it must have taken to erect such a structure. We enjoyed just sitting in the pews in quiet reflexion.
Beautiful and free entry. Beautiful church, spacious and peaceful, not as ornate as many other catholic churches and cathedrals but I like that!
Nice church. Nice gothic style church hidden away near the port. Lots of confusion and congestion at the entrance as they were charging to get in when I understand its normally free.
lovely neighborhood. Great old church. They have concerts here. Enjoyed hot chocolate out front. Explore the area. Good shopping.

Make sure you visit. The space inside is huge. When you look from the outside, it's misleading because inside it's cavernous.
Lovely, bustling area outside and so calm and peaceful inside. If you're a church-lover, miss out the SagradaFamilia and come here instead.

Nice church with clean gothic architecture, very austere. This is a church exhibiting clean Gothic architecture and it is very austere, probably in part due to a massive fire many years ago. It is nice to walk through and get an appreciation of the style which is clearly displayed due to the bare stonework

A Splendid, Well Proportioned Church that's Lived Life to the Full.. We visited the Basilica as apart of our tour of the Gothic Quarter. I was particularly struck by the open airiness. Internally, we learned of the place's history including the damage wrought by major fires and the civil war. There was no entry fee, which is refreshing these days.
Beautiful. There are a lot of pretty churches in Barcelona. This one is gorgeous and a fun place to walk to. If you're in the area, go see it!

Santa Maria Del Mar. Stunning Gothic Cathedral among many others in Barcelona with amazing architecture and beautiful stained glass windows and Gothic sculptures inside. Loved it a lot. Those who are inclined to Gothical architecture and historical monuments should absolutely go there.
For churchlovers!. Defiantly a must if you love old churches and architecture, and its one of the few things that is free!

Nice church... Worth the experience. Had the great pleasure to have visited the church. Stunning architecture, peaceful and claim brought to mind when you entered the place. Worth visiting even you if are not religious.

Nice Church. much smaller than most churches but interesting. There is a small charge to get in but it is lovely to look around. There is a free toilet at the back near the courtyard. Most of the exhibitions are in Spanish only. If you wish to light a real candle (as opposed to a plastic light) but one at the counter before you go in.
a gem. In the heart of le ramble a gem of a building plus free entry. A proper cathedral type building. Some wonderful alter work and elaborate deciration
Gothic church in central barcelona. The church was easy to get into, despite the crowds. The building is tall but not huge but has a great atmosphere even for a non believer like me.
Really peaceful and beautiful. You should do it. Very peaceful - not ornate but impressive. They have a really nice upper viewing deck to see the beach and harbor - you cannot beat it.

Beautiful example of early Gothic architecture. Though it was not on our walking tour of the city, guide recommended that we take time on our own to view it. Glad we added it to the list of churches we viewed in Barcelona. The contrast with still in-process Sagrada Familia made the centuries old work even more interesting.

A lovely quiet refuge. I discovered this place whilst walking through the gothic quarter. Thankfully it was in the daytime, so was free to visit. Some evenings there are concerts in the building, and then you have to pay.Whilst I was there, there was a choir being rehearsed. It was magical.

Beautiful church. This really took me by surprise. it's nestled in the middle of small alleyways but it's just special. Every piece of it has a statue or painting that are incredible works of art, a must see!

Cathedral of the Sea. The columns in this church inspired Gaudi's Sagrada Famila. There is a piazza outside the front door with several restaurants and outdoor seating where you can sit and admire the facade of this 14th century beauty.
Worth a 20 min stop. 20 min walk through will do you - enjoy the organ music and the construction details but don't plan to spend substantial time here.
Good surprise. Very beautiful gotic church with a good surprise: if you visit it at night and you’re lucky you could have free concerts, very cool !

A really lovely church. This really lovely 14th century church has so much atmosphere
and is a peaceful haven. It is particularly lovely in the early
evening.
Beautiful. I find the basilica interior more beautiful than the cathedral in the simplicity of its décor and gorgeous structure.
Wow!. I understand there was a fire at one time, but the size and scale of this basilica brings God to mind.... I wish I had heard music in there.

WOW, I love this Church. The architecture is incredible, this is an absolute gem. I love taking pictures of the vitals and candles.
The gargoyles are very different from some of the traditional you can see in notre dame and most french churches but very cool none the less.
Charming. Sometimes it is hard to recognize that the sea is pretty important in the history of the people of Barcelona. This is a peaceful reminder.

Beautiful. Worth seeing if you are in the area. This church is generally open to the public, and worth stopping in. Not the best in Barcelona, but if you are in the Born district (which you should be at some point in your trip to the city!), take a few minutes to go inside and admire the gothic architecture and stained glass.

Beautiful. Big and impressive church. Certainly go inside of it, because interior is more beautiful than exterior. On evenings there are candles burned on and it is so special atmosphere to sit and relax there.
Gothic Barcelona. From outside not so impressive, but the inside shows a good example of gothic architecture. Free entry till 1 o'clock. Then a fee and the possibility to climb on the roof.

Catalan Gothic. Is the nicest representation of Catalan gothin i Barcelna. is magnificient and stonish. Also the neighboorhood of Born are wherre the churs is, is a very nice experience to be arround thereNot miss it
You should go there!. This building evokes a feeling of incredible strength and power. Delightful stained glass windows impessed me!

Best building in Barcelona. Absolutely loved this building. Very simple but spectacular. Bigger on the inside! Although it is more traditional, I liked it better than many of the other grander buildings

Beautiful (and free!). We happened on this place by accident, but we had been told that the interior was the most beautiful in Barcelona by a resident. The interior arch is apparently the biggest in any gothic design in the world.The church roof still shows the burn marks from the destruction in 1936. We stopped by at night which gave it a new beautiful aspect to it.

Beautiful, simple and peaceful. We stumbled across this lovely place by accident as we were exploring the El Born district. It's well worth a visit. It's simple yet dramatic and when we stepped inside from the busy bustle of the street outside we were quite awed at the peaceful atmosphere and unexpected way the space opens up. Well worth a visit if you admire older buildings and different styles of architecture. It is an active place of worship and reflection however so please be quiet and discreet.
Beautiful architecture. We walked by this lovely structure so many times, and each time, a different light, a change in the weather, made it more fantastic to see.

beautiful site,not to be missed. time it right and attend a service. Beautiful carvings on the outside and ornate. Check out the ceiling stone work. Busy place so time it early. Whilst there we were ushered out without explanation.

Unforgettable. Authentic beauty with a warm atmosphere in a Dickensian Christmas carol setting of intimate bars and streets. Truly special and worth finding. Walking in to the cathedral is a memorable experience - a moment to treasure. I will never forget it.

Beautiful church especially in the evening.. Spacious, airy, slender example of Catalan gothic. We loved it for its purity and simplicity. Come in the evening before the closure when most tourists are gone and enjoy the atmosphere of the church with red candles lit.... Leave through the door leading to Psg del Born..... Eat in the squares around the church.

Dont forget this too. everyone goes to Sagrada Familia...this is a beautiful cathedrale. very simple but impressive..unfortunately it is largely used for concerts which means that it is not open very often....pity

One of many!. There are so many churches to see in Barcelona, this is just one more to add to your list! It's is a big church, yet it's grand with simplicities, not the great expenditures we see in so many Catholic Churches.

The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is another jaw dropping-ly beautiful church found in Barcelona. It seems unfair that once single city should have such a wealth of beauty, architecture & history. This church is in the Barri Gothic, Old City area and is definitely worth a visit. Most highly recommended.

A very lovely Basilica from 1329. This is an interesting maritime-community Basilica dating from 1329. The history of the place is amazing and you can find information about the locals ship-building industry. Due to destruction in the 1930s, much of the church is new/restored. This is a great example of 14th century Catalan Gothic architecture and the history of the local community. A pleasant place but it lacks the overwhelming sense of awe that you get at some of the other larger Basilicas.

Stunning Trade Guild Basilica!. The Catalan Gothic Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar in La Ribela was built by the trade guilds instead of the nobility between1329-1383. The bell towers were added in 1496 and 1902. Much of the interior except for the upper level was destroyed by fire in 1936. The stained glass windows are gorgeous as they fill the church with light during the day.The main altar is from 1965. The basilica is 80 m. long, 33 m wide, 33 m high and the three soaring naves are supported by 16 octagonal columns each 1.6 m thick that reach the ceiling. The five keystones in the vault are also impressive and colorful. There are 34 chapels around the sides. Guided visits to the towers and rooftops are available daily.
Old church. When you have visited the sagrada the difference is huge. Its is an old church with a very dark interior. But it has a pleasant atmosfere.
stunning. beautiful and in a great location, stunning inside and out and we could see the turrets from our hotel

Cathedral by the Sea. This cathedral is not the flashiest or biggest in Barcelona. But if you have read the book or know any of its history, you know how special it is. Also, the inside of Santa Maria del Mar serves as the inspiration for La Sagrada Familia, with its "trees". A nice afternoon at this cathedral is work the visit.

Stunning!. This Basilica is just gorgeous! The architecture brilliant as well as stunning. They have finished the stained glass window and the light that is cast is amazing. The details outside is unbelievable! I would highly recommend going up at least one of the towers (by elevator) for some great views of Barcelona. Going down was a bit scary and by the end my legs were shaking. Its a long winding staircase. If your not up to it, you can go up and down the elevator. Plan to spend about 3-4 hours here if you want to do the tour and go up the tower. But, don't miss seeing this Church!
Impressive church. this church is more impressive than the "Catedral", and you can now walk the "terraces" (paid visit), which provides a nice view over the old city.

Austere and magnificent. I'm a cathedral buff, and I have to say that this is one of my favorites anywhere. The architecture is austere, but the soaring ceiling is magnificent and the atmosphere is magical. Swing by in the evening to see the cathedral's towers catch the last rays of the setting sun (you can enjoy a glass of wine on the plaza outside as you do).
BEAUTIFUL. Great architecture, from the entrance looks so big, when at the altar if you look back it's not that big, tremendous type of trompe l'oeil, great architecture
lovely. Great basilica! Not big but really stunning especially at night it feels like you went back in time inside. Busy outside as lots of shops and restaurants around but inside is very solemn.

One of the Best. This church is utterly beautiful in all ways. It a must to visit as there plenty to view. Try to go as late as possible in the day as it's give you a different feeling.
Easy to find and lots of small shops and restaurants.

Another great Basilica in the Heart of Barcelona. we only got a bit of time here .. but it was a gorgeous church .. right in the center of Barcelona. Only church I was ever kicked out of .. lol .. because they were having a mass at 1 pm when we were there.

Charming and beautiful. Beautiful stained glass, very interesting ceiling and mural. Is not big but you just want to walk along the aisle or have a moment of quietness here. Recommended, no charge..enjoy it.
lovely place.... exterior and interior are quite interesting....area around this place is quite pleasant as well.....

Should have spent more time here, and will return to do just that.. Was on a quick walking tour of Barcelona and the Gothic area, and found this purely by chance. It is a stunning church, and deserves a lot more than the cursory inspection that our time allowed. There are various tours etc that can be done, but we were there Sunday morning when there was a mass being celebrated, so didn't wish to intrude, and so have it on my list of things to do next visit to Barcelona. It is a hidden gem, and such a stunning church that it needs a lot of time to wander around and take time out to enjoy. I will be back.

Lovely church. If you get to this church before 1pm, you get in for free... After, it will cost you 8€! loads of beggars around, and this is definitely the place where you need to watch your bags. There are bars across from this church, and we sat back after our visit and watched the world go past!
Beautiful. That is wow! Amassing place which gives inspiration! The best example of Catalan gothic. Highly recommended.
Very interesting. Beautiful Basilica. Gorgeous chandeliers, wonderful baptisimal font, huge, intriguing nooks. Must see.

Cozy Spirituality in Santa Maria del Mar Church. This Church built by fishermen with their own money and effort is not only one of the best examples of Catalan Gothic, it is one of the hidden jewels in Barcelona. With a privileged location in the Borne neighbourhood (surrounded with nice and authentic terraces and bars) and its cozy, balanced interiors, Santa Maria del Mar is an experience you should´t miss if you'd like connect with something else while resting and enjoying your sight with aesthetic pleasure. Some evenings you might get the chance to visit whilst the organ is being played and then I can tell you that, wether you are a believer or not, you will feel like touching heaven... don´t miss the history behind the construction and concept of the church.. it's really remarkable..

Beautiful Space and Light. A sombre and spare interior highlights the beautiful design. The roof tour gives added perspectives to the church's origins. Whether you have read The Cathedral of the Sea or not, put this church on your list when you visit Barcelona.

Yet another beautiful church in a beautiful city. Nothing to dislike. Its beautiful, there was a service going on, so you were reminded that it wasn't just a stunning building but a chuch and very much filled with local worshippers.

Spiritual. Even if im not religious i went in and feel a very good Vivrations
the story of the Church is autentich and really interesting

Beautiful church both inside and outside. This church was recommended to me to visit by locals. It is a very beautiful church located in the older part of Barcelona with interesting interiors. There is an entrance free if you go during daylight hours (forgot the closing hours though) but it's free for all after 6pm. A bit dim inside during the winter months if you go in the evenings though.

Only Just Made It Before It Closed. The church itself was absolutely stunning & definitely worth seeing, the area around has interesting shops, cafes & restaurants and isn't too far from La Rambla. Be aware, it closes between 1pm & 5pm.

Gothic Jewel. So much more beautiful than the Barcelona cathedral, this basilica envelopes you on a human scale while lifting your spirit at the same time by its elegance atmosphere. The acoustics are lovely, and you can attend concerts of all types--gospel, flamenco, classical, jazz. Read Idelfonso Falcones' "The Cathedral of the Sea" (an epic novel) to learn about its construction and the fascinating history of Barcelona during the 14th century. Then walk outside to a wine bar or have some tapas on Calle Moncada around the corner!
Beautiful local church. A good place to pay a visit. But not worth bending your travel plan to come here. However, being in El Born neighbourhood, you will walk by somehow while in Barcelona!

Breathtaking. One of the most beautiful cathedrals in Barcelona. The architecture is just amazing. We happened upon this gem and it was definitely a sight to see. A must-see for anyone visiting Barcelona.
Gorgeous church. Excellent example of Catalan Gothic architecture. Definitely recommend dropping by. Make sure you check the times it's open.

Serene. It is a beautiful cathedral right in the center of the gothic quarters. The architecture of the cathedral stands out and looks amazing. Even inside the church you feel peaceful and completely amazed by the beauty of this cathedral.

Great church in the middle of the Born district. We stopped by this church on the way to the Picasso museum because it is only about 10 minute walk from the museum. You will need about 40 min to see the church and there is no charge to enter. Also between Picasso and the church is where we found the best gift shops and we walked all over Barcelona so we saw a lot. Next to the church are some amazing little cafe where you can eat for two and have a craft of wind for about $30 U.S. Dollars.

Lovely church, worth a visit. We came here on our recent trip to Barcelona and didn't understand why we hadn't come here on our first visit two years ago. It is a lovely church, with a breathtaking interior. In some ways, it is far better than the Cathedral or the Sagrada Familia - more intimate with soaring columns and stained glass. It doesn't have the overbearing 'bleeding cherubs' that you see in some Spanish churches and there's a dignity about it that is very appealing.
A really lovely building to visit. We walked through and it is a really lovely building, glad that we found it by chance. Right in the centre of the city for easy access.
Beautiful Gothic cathedral. We visited in the afternoon when we paid a small fee. Worth it to have the cathedral basically to ourselves. Lovely!

Amazing place, my personal favorite in all Barcelona. This church is amazing in many ways:1. Located and surrounded by new retail store and shopping area is this cathedral. You walk in and is captured by the stories they present to you on many display. You walk around and just feel the history and thoughtfulness of people who built this. The best part is you can take an elevator to the roof top, and have a view of Barcelona. It's worth it to check this place out, don't miss it!

A Gothic Treasure. One of the first stops during our trip to Barcelona - make sure you spend the low fee to take the elevator to the roof top. The view helps in orientating any visitor to the city. Easy to get to with by bus - we took the V15.
local church. we tried to enter the church at 4.45 and were told by the people at the door that if we waited till 5.00 we would not have to pay as it was the time of worship.
did not enter. door was open, when having a look and asking what it cost to visit the warden closed the door at our face. decided not to visit.
nice. in my opinion better than sagrada familia. it is small but very nice. not much hassle and in a quiet area

A gothic treasure .... BCN's rich architectural scenery is both heavily ornamented and widely varied. While exploring the gothic quarter is very easy to find several churches, all with an adorned doors , high ceilings and embellished arches . Definitely worth planning a visit to if you are walking around the gothic quarter !

Gothic church with a twist. Another church on your tour around the city? Make it more exciting by reading the novel "La catedral del mar" (there´s an english edition) by author Ildefonso Falcones before you enter. The novel tells you in a very exciting way about the construccion of the cathedral in the XIV centuary, along with other interesting stories from medieval Barcelona!
Recommend the Guided Tour. Young guide was very knowledgeable about the church and surrounding area. Got to go on the rooftop to see around the area and understand how this place came to be.

Another gem hidden away.. Another magnificent religious building off the beaten track, hidden away in a small corner. It really is important to turn off the main streets and go down the small side streets, you really never know what you will find.
Amazing church in the heart of Barcelona. We visited on the recommendation of a tour guide and were not disappointed. If you pop in after 5pm, it's free!

Lovely old church. This is a church for praying. The soaring arches are beautiful with nothing to distract you. Very little ornamentation. If I had the time I could of stayed there for hours. It is a beautiful church that doesn't hide behind ornate trappings. Don't miss it!
A landmark not to be missed. Walking through the gothic quarter, you will find this great expression of such architecture. Let yourself go, if there are choirs, sit down and enjoy.
Another cathedral. A beautiful one to view. The outside, is good for pictures, the inside is, well, another cathedral. So, you will see it since there is no way of avoiding it.

Another cathedral of excellence. This cathedral was free to visit, the inside is spectacular but once again the crowds of people stop you seeing the architecture. There were beggars on the steps leading up to the main entrance but I almost expected this due to the volume of visitors.

Catalan Gothic. For those of us schooled in the Gothic of France and central Europe, this church is an eye-opener. Its great height (even the lateral naves are tall) and airy vaulting contrast with the solidity of the piers and dark bulk of the church's exterior. It's all quite beautiful after you've spent a few minutes looking at it, and unlike any preconception you might have of a large Gothic church.
Bus tour. amazing building a must if your in Barcelona, really took my breath away. Although still not finished.

Nice, quiet, great views from the top. We went on a Monday in January so predictability it was very quiet but still beautiful. ?5 gets you in or ?8 includes a guided tour up to the top of the tower, which is definitely worth it in my opinion. The views across the rooftops to the mountains and sea, as well as the history of the church and Barcelona itself from the guide, made it well worth a visit. The interior of the church has striking stained glass windows and helpful information sheets so you can find your way around.

A very personal church. A romantic neighborhood church, having been built with stone carried from the hills above Barcelona by stevedores from the docks in the old port in 14th century. There is a beautiful, simple Virgen and Child.

Elegant in it's simplicity.. Santa Maria del Mar is one of the oldest churches in BCN. And one of the most beautiful; the soaring naves and widely spaced columns give it a more airy feeling than is found in many of the other churches.

Beautiful. Worth a detour to see this magnificent church. Achingly beautiful and in the now revitalised area of el Born.
A must see
worth having a look inside. acutally my favourite church in town although I don´t know them all. you can really feel that this place is full of history
El Cant de la Sibella. If you are gere on Christmas Eve, there is a performance of the uniquely Catalan Chant of the Sybil at about 11PM. A unique and ancient piece of folk religion

Also a must in Barcelona. This is an medieval Church - filled with art, with worship and with beauty. Here you can 'rest' - your eyes, your soul and your mind - silently walking around to obtain some of the 'air' from the past - and from today. The surroundings are also worth while to explore. Try to imagine life here some hundred years ago!

Quiet, beautiful basilica. Compare with Sagrada Familia this is surely a very traditional one, but in a good way: Very quiet, Elegant stain glass and rose window, and meditating atmosphere. Nice place to chill down in the lively city.

Lovely Church. Situated in the oldest part of Barcelona. We appreciated this church because of its very plain and unobstrusive interior and exterior architecture. We loved this imposing church.
Situated not far from Las Ramblas.
Cute. this church is a nice and cute little church in the heart of Barri Gotic. it has a beautiful and antique structure.
Calming place. What a beautiful church....very relaxing and calming, with beautiful features. Lots of areas for you to light candles in memory of loved ones.....well worth a visit

Plain, simple and dignified. I didn't realise until after we'd visited it that this basilica, which lies at the heart of the Born "artisan" district, is in fact recommended by many guides as a "must see". Large and plainly decorated, this medieval church evokes a dignified atmosphere which many lesser specimens do not and is a silently eloquent testament to the many thousands of people who must have worshipped here in the past. Its location, immediately adjacent to the "Place of the Martyrs", too, lends a certain poignancy to the atmosphere of the church. And it's completely free to visit!
What a church. if you love old amazing church buildings, this is it. You can even join in on a service.... If you understand Spanish/Catolan.
best church in Barcelona. Fantastic gothic architecture, for me the most amazing church in Barcelona, elegant, open, ...Check firts timetable, it's not all the time open to visit but try

Great tour of the roof. we had a short guided tour of the roof by a charming guide who was very knowledgeable and clearly loved the building . The church is beautiful with a lovely atmosphere  informative

A favourite. This is definitely worth a visit when in the Gothic Quarter. It is well hidden in the narrow streets and the inside is an amazing demonstration of the architectural beauty of such a structure.

This is the most beautiful Gothic church in the city. You should definitely come and visit it. 14th century Catalan Gothic architecture. I love the building: a visit here always raises my spirits. The novel "La Catedral del Mar" was written about the construction of this church (not a cathedral: there is only one cathedral in a city). Definitely spend a few minutes inside here. You'll remember the stark stone beauty.The área around here, especially the Passeig del Born, is notable for its nightlife; you might want to drop by in the evening.WARNING: There are a lot of pickpockets in the Old City of Barcelona. Don't carry valuables and be careful.

Stripped of its later decoration. During the Civil War the interior was stripped of the sort of decoration and statuary that prevails in so many southern European churches, allowing you to see its interesting architecture better. Its present appearance sits better with Protestant consciousness than most souther European Catholic churches.
Beautiful church. Looks like a simple church from the outside bit the inside is quite impressive with amazing stonework.
Very intricate carvings. The cathedral was huge and there's something about it that intrigues me. The Christmas market in front of it was really great.

Breathtaking!. The Gothic Quarter is certainly a must when visiting Barcelona and this cathedral is a centre piece. Very evocative and indeed imposing. Filled with visual treasures and steeped in so much history there really is something for everyone here. Surrounded by a lovely court yard which contains a little antiques market and lined by cafes this really is a special place.
Has to be seen.. A different take on the religious experiences afforded in Barcelona. Would try to see Sagrada, Santa Maria del Mar, and the Cathedral at a minimum. Impressive.
Incredible. The Basilica was beautiful, a great place for self-reflection and the Christmas Market was located just outside church property.

A wonder. One of the most magnificent cathedrals in Europe and certainly my favourite in Catalonia. In the heart of the amazing gothic neighbourhood and with an incredible history behind it. Read La Catedral de Mar and you will know what I mean.
beautiful cathedral. this cathedral is located at the GOTHIC QUARTER,,,,,,just beautiful,,,worth looking for !!! try to go before 1pm, when it is still open to manage to go inside.....
Interesting but traditional. If you're in the Gothic Quarter you'll definitely go here. After all the modernist architecture the basilica seems frozen in time. Still worth a visit. - Rob & Jeanne

Simple but beautiful cathedral. Simple cathedral compared to the major cathedral. However we loved the story behind the building and got to see the inside when it was dark outside. Very beautiful with the lighting.

Peaceful Gothic style Basillica. This was yet another place we were introduced to by our Discover Walks guide. It is a beautiful building and in an area that is worthwhile visiting to see more of Gothic section of Barcelona.
be sure to visit. i really enjoy all the old churches that are so different from each other.it is beautiful and well worth the visit.
incredible.. went there on Christmas`eve. There was a concert (singers and dancers from south america). the acoustic is great.

Breathtaking. A great gothic church, without being too overdone, there is a purity of line and design here that is very pleasing to the eye. The building was done in the 14th century, and the magnificent stained glass was added in the 15th to 18th centuries. I also heard that it's a great place for concerts. Probably my favourite church in Barcelona, and there is many.. it is great to relax here, just smelling the candles burning. Admission is free also, a miracle in Barcelona
VERY SPIRITUAL!!!. This Basilica is very beautiful but very spiritual in the sense that it is amidst so many shops, restaurants, etc...It is a place for contemplation!!!
Beautiful Church. I love this beautiful church. It's so nice. It's really important place for me also because of the book I read about it.

Worth your time!. So many cathedrals, so little time. Make time for this one! It's in an active neighborhood surrounded by great shopping and restaurants. We found this monumental structure to be a common meeting point for our group, and discovered new places each day that we were in the area. Go see it!

Second largest painted glass. We were told that the Basilica has the second largest stained glass mirror. It was supposed to be built by the commoners of the city. It is built on Catalunyan Gothic style. Nice to visit.

Spectacular structure. We didn't get the chance to go in but our tour guide from Runner Beans Tours gave us an insight to the whos whats and wheres of the building. Its a neo gothic and very different from the original building but one would never know. Definitely worth a visit and just next to it you will see the old roman town walls still standing.

see vernacular architecture with bare bones. Due to the damage done during the Spanish Civil War, the interior of this large church is simple, bare, showing clearly the "bones" of the building, very ancient and yet very modern.

Visit late in the day.... you will have a few tourists around and will not be forced to pay an expensive ticket. Sometimes you will be lucky and the basilica's organist will practice in the church offering an unexpected organ concert.
Wonderful. A marvellous church with colourful windows, very popular because is magic and there is a very known novel based in this church
The end of our road.. This was at the end of our road and formed one side of the many squares in the gothic area. Nice to sit outside with a glass of vino blanco

Lovely old gothic church...... Nestled in the heart of the Barri Gothic and just a short walk from the older and more famous sister, The Barcelona Cathedral..... Is this more quiet and demure younger sister. A little colder and darker, but not less beautiful. With amazing altar and beautiful doors. It's a great site and a great place to catch your breath after walking the barrio all day long. Say your prayers and then head up to the tower to get a nice look at the Barrio Gothico...... As all old churches, this one too is a beauty.... Don't miss it!

Lovely and simple!. We love seeing old churches and basilicas, and Santa Maria del Mar was lovely. Very simple in design, and easy to walk through in a short visit. Entrance fees are reasonable, and you can even go up to the second level and look down on the rest of the church. Definitely worth a visit if you enjoy Gothic architecture.
Santa maria del mar. An other beautiful gotthic style church at barcelona with a nice ethrion in the middle and a small fountain. Free entrance and available priests if you need a confession...

Go see for yourself. . Been past so many times over the years that I have been visiting Barcelona and I have now ventured inside.
What a wonderful, peaceful place.
Go inside and see, its beautiful I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Magnificent. This is one of the older cathedrals in the gothic quarter near the port. Absolutely breathtaking. To think that they cathedral builders achieved this magnificence hundreds of years ago is mind boggling.

Calming Effect. Visited here near the end of the day. Church doors opened at 5:00 pm. Beautiful and peaceful interior. The interior had the apealing smell of burning candles. There were many stations along the sides which was dedicated to the Saints. The columns and dated stained glasses were a sight to see. A short visit to settle the mind and kick - start the evening activities.

Lovely old cathederal. A bit of a surprise tucked away in Born. From certain parts of the exterior it doesn't look too grand until you make your way around to the front. The Stained glass windows were beautiful and the carvings and use of wood fascinating. The interior had a truly spiritual feel about it and was quite inspiring. The Cathedral is surrounded by fabulous cafes and little cobbled streets with some wonderful shops so there is plenty else to meander around.

In many ways more impressive than the Catedral. Interesting piece of Catalan Gothic architecture, clever lighting makes the interior quite impressive. Statues of local saints abound. All in all an impressive space right in the middle of the lively Born neighbourhood great for dinner or tapas.

An exquisite cathedral, in the Gothic Quarter. Thoroughly enjoyed visiting this cathedral (and I've seen a few around the world), the detail and the intricacy of the craftsmanship are amazing, particularly the choir stalls. The cloisters were lovely and the rain on the day we visited added, if anything to the atmosphere.

Extremely deceptive Church tucked away in the Bari Gothic area. We stumbled across this truly lovely church hemmed in by buildings practically all around it, in the Bari Gothic section of Barcelona. The outside was quite impressive but the inside was TOTALLY mindblowing. Huge tall columns, lovely stained glass windows. A truly lovely respite for a few moments to wonder at and just enjoy.
Worth a visit. This is the people's church. It's in the center of a very interesting area of Barcelona. There are lots of cool restaurants in that area and the church is worth a look.

Lovely church. This church was unexpected find in wandering through the Gothic Quarter. Great to look at externally and even better inside . we were also able to pass by the church at night when the dome on the roof was lit up.

One of a kind. Santa Maria del Mar (Our Lady of the Sea) is a rare gem. It was built entirely through donations -of money, materials and workforce- in record time for a church of that size, a mere 50 years. Because of that swiftness, it boosts the same Catalan Gothic style from foundation to spires. Catalan Gothic is more austere than its European counterparts, providing a roomy, minimalistic and welcoming interior, unobstructed of ornaments; statues of saints and Virgin Marys are niched in the side chapels. (The only discordant note is the Eucharist chapel, an adjacent baroque aberration, thankfully is only seeable if you walk in).When you do go to Barcelona, do yourself a favour and read Ildefonso Falcones' book "The Cathedral of the Sea". Not only it revolves around the building of this Church, but many of the places it mentions are still there today. TIP: go in the morning or after 5 pm to avoid entrance fees.
Worth a visit. The facade alone is worth going to look at, absolutely beautiful! Inside is also very lovely - definitely worth it, especially as it's in the middle of the Gothic Quarter.
Worth a quick look. A nice church in Barcelona. Much more interesting cathedrals in Europe but this is worth a quick tour.
Beautiful. You must take in the basilica and sit outside to enjoy Tapas and the people watch. A historic Gem inside and out, it's not to be missed.

Impressive. Oldest church in Barcelona, built for the poor and it shows. No overly glamorous paintings, statues, etc. Instead a truly great gothic church, stripped to the bone to reveal all! Worth a visit!
Beautiful. I could have sat peacefully and admired this church for hours. The interior was awesome and made me feel very blessed that i could be inside such an edifice
Gorgeous; Go at Night. I only saw this at night and feel this is probably the optimal time of day to visit this. Great atmosphere.
Tucked back off the Main Street.. The charge is 5 Euros to go insideVery pretty churchBeautiful Rose Window - steep narrow stairs to choir loft - best view of window

Excellent. I had the privilege of staying in a penthouse right beside this beautiful church (If you walked the roof in july you may have even caught me sunbathing next door!) and it was stunning both outside and in. My friends and I returned from lunch one day and as we walked by heard a choir singing so decided to pop in and listen. We didn't expect it to be so large and remarkable inside, the architecture was breathtaking. I returned alone the next day and had a proper walk around, it really is worth seeing; if you can go along when there's a choir because that really made it a much more spiritual experience.
A nicer alternative to the Cathedral. Altogether less Roman Catholic "bling" in this building than the Cathedral not far away. Lovely atmosphere and quiet too.
beautifully beautiful. I suggest visiting it in the last moments of the day, so that there still lights through the vitreaux windows, yet dark inside to appreciate its amazing inner lighting.

Beautiful. Lovely cathedral to visit and you can go up to the roof which gives you wonderful views over Barcelona. Small fee to enter. Worth it as it takes a while to walk around and there is a museum with some lovely picture and artefacts to see. Very good
Worth see even from outside. The catedral looks great from outside but unfortunatley we couldn't get inside. It was closed on Sunday afternoon.

Beautiful cathedral. Before my visit to Barcelona, a friend recommended that I read Cathedral by the Sea. The book is definitely for beach reading and very entertaining. One of the things I loved about it was that the central landmark of the book actually exists. I was really excited to visit the Cathedral once I arrived in Barcelona and was not disappointed. The imposing Gothic structure is gorgeous on the inside and worth the entrance fee. I spent over an hour wandering around and was in total awe that the cathedral was initially constructed in the 14th century. Definitely worth a visit. Enjoy!

Simple but Elegant. This Basilica does not contain the many adorations of so many European churches. It was stripped of many during the Spanish Civil War when the Catholic Church supported Franco. It was built by and for the common people. During our visit, a wedding was taking place in the Basilica. It was beautiful.

Impressive... I have not visited so many cathedrals in my life as I did in those 4 days in Barcelona. Being a non Christian, the interest in the same is more historic and architectural than religious. So when I saw on the map that a beautiful gothic structure is situated just 5 minutes away from my hotel ( Duquesa De Cardona ), I simply could not resist.It's a beautiful Cathedral. Due to paucity if time, I could not go inside, but chose to admire the Basilica from outside. I would recommend that if you are staying in a hotel in Barri Gotic or La Ramblas, you definitely should come here and pay a visit. Seeped in years of history and devotion.
Gothic Cathedral. A friend of mine suggest me to visit this Cathedral and the little square in front of it. Delightful atmosphere.

Not for me.... Very large church, but quite simply was not worth visiting. There were few interesting things to see there. It was challenging to find this church in the congested area. The inside of the church was not maintained well, and it was so dark inside we could hardly see anything. Save your time and energy for the Barcelona Cathedral.

Lovely and endearing. this church is the jewel of Barcelona; you will travel in time when visiting; please take time to admire the many details of the work ; built in the 14th century by the ''sea workers''; lovely and unique ;

Beautiful !. This is a beautiful piece off art.
the fee to visit this cathedral was not that much.
We could visit the top roof with an elevator and so whe did.
Great view from there.

Wow!. Catalan Gothic Church that you must visit at your stay in BCN. It's in the quarter of La Ribera, and you should preferable go there when it gets dark outside. It's my daughters favorite place, besides the beaches (she's 9 years old).

Wonderful space but time your trip to avoid the charges. Santa Maria is austere but its isolation from the the bustle of the Bourne and sheer size make it an oasis of peace and beauty. Well worth a visit to appreciate it. But when I went recently (Nov 2014) they were only allowing entrance after paying e8 for a "tour". Apparently this policy operates between 1PM and 5PM - unfortunately peak visiting hours. It's a pity to see BCN getting tourist unfriendly. You don't need a tour to appreciate this space. Just sit in a pew and wonder at it.

The Basilica of Santa Maria de Mar. Gothic church in Barcelona in the historic quarter of La Ribera. Santa Maria del Mar is an outstanding example of Catalan Gothic Church. Built in 1329-1383, respectively, in the heyday of Catalonia trade and navigation.
basilica. Very interesting building, interior columns are somewhat similar to the Sagrada Inside forget about worldliness and problems. Do not want to go out.
Beautiful Church. I really liked this church especially the stained glass windows, both modern and traditional. I found it more interesting than the Cathedral.
Beautiful church. A must see in the old town.....an old Gothic Cathedral with an amazing ceiling. This was built in the Middle Ages....in 55 years.
Lovely old church. In the heart of the Barri Gotic, this church is such a stalwart friend, still an active worshiping community and a great place for concerts.

Beautiful church. This was a must visit for us as we had read the brilliant book Cathedral of the Sea. Read the book and then go and marvel at the church. Look for the stone carriers on the door and inside.A lovely place to visit.
Stunning. Beautiful, tranquil amazing place to sit quietly and reflect. Not as fancy as some churches, but beautiful.
Beautiful church. Beautifull church near the seaside, very calming and peaceful. High ceiling and overall atmosphere give this church a truly special feeling. I would recommend it.
Unexpected jewel. The Basilica is on the hop on-hop off route so it's very easily accessible. It is a beautiful structure and a lovely place of worship inside.
Amazing. This is an amazing must see when in Barcelona, it may not be as big or popular as Sagrada Familia, but for real is worth looking at. Just impressive

Beautiful Building and View. This is a very beautiful church that is overshadowed (as it should be) by La Sagrada Familia. That is not to say that one should skip it. It is a beautiful building and if you take the tour, which I highly recommend, you get some excellent views of medieval Barcelona and the sea.

A beautiful place. I liked everything, the surrouding is nice and the church is beautiful. If you have read the book "Die Kathedrale des Meeres" from Ildefonso Falcones, you have a new sight to this church

Hidden treasure. It is a beautiful church in which you can attend a ceremony. I love to go there at Sunday morning and lit a candle for my loved ones in heaven and the ones which are with me. The are around it is also very nice, if you are already in the neighborhood give it a shot and try Bubo as well best pastries ever!

Most Lovely Church in the City. I love this church; it has historical significance for the people of Barcelona - and it is really beautiful. Plus, the neighborhood around it is lovely and a wonderful place to stroll, shop and have lunch. The church was not busy when I was there, but outside of it was. Spent the time in this little place and you will fall in love with its beauty and history. Kudos to those who realized it was free after 5:00.

Beautiful place to visit!. This Basilica was bigger and more impressive than expected. Outside its a great building, inside there are some wonderful icons and windows and you can walk up a level and look down on the altar. It was a nice place to appreciate and take some quiet time too. Entrance is €5 and photos are allowed, I'd recommend this as a place to spend half an hour and afterwards there are some nice cafes surrounding.

Large but Dark Cathedral. The church is very large and impressive and it has a long interesting history, but having recently toured the cathedrals in Toledo and Burgos, I couldn't get fired up about this one. Too dark and chopped up.

Best church to visit in Barcelona. What? Even better than the cathedral or sagrada familia? Well, different... It's a small roman church, way less touristic than the others and incredibly romantic, well maintained and so spiritual...So, I highly recommend you to visit it, as it is in the gothic quarter...

A 'Must Visit'. Santa Maria del Mar is really worth a visit. Its history is unique in the medieval period (mid 1300s): it was built and paid for primarily by the common people of Barcelona rather than the Catholic church or the nobility, it is the prime example of Catalan Gothic architecture--very spacious inside with lower arches to accommodate as many people as possible, and it was built in an unheard of 55 years for that period. Be sure to look on the front doors for the carving of a porter in commemoration of those who carried enormous blocks of stone from the quarry to the church site in their free time as a lob or of devotion.If you like historical novels, be sure to read Ildefonso Falcones' "Cathedral of the Sea" which is centered around the building of Santa Maria del Mar. This made our visit here come alive.
