quiet place to reflect. Obviously visit early when it is quiet and the cruise ships are not docked or pax disembarked! 4 euros to enter. Would have liked more info in English to understand the ornate chapels. Some heart breaking history evident and credit for the refurbishment of the building.
Historical. Very busy but worth the visit especially after 5 when it is free. A lot to see and read, the place definitely speaks for its past and feeds into the city's religious history!

Worth a visit. We have all said 'seen one church seen a 100'…the appeal of this significant church is in its simplicity and use of wood. Amazing ceiling and buttresses.Whilst in the area pop in and view a less ornate church.

Beautiful church. This is a beautiful church with many interesting pieces of art and stained glass windows. It has unique architecture and multiple chapels with different themes. It would be good to have a written description of the inside or a guide to help learn about the structure.

Have seen much better. Unfortunately, we went during mess, so the visit is limited to the back 1/4 of the basilica. Although it is interesting, Europe is full of churches, cathedrals and basilicas that surpass this by far. Still, worth to see. Mind the mess time.

Stunning. Amazing church situated in the middle of the born area. I visited on a Tuesday morning and there were very few people around, I can imagine it would be very busier later on and at weekends . The church itself both inside and outside was stunning. Lots of bars and restaurants around if you need to take five!
Great experience. We really liked the atmosphere and beauty of this basilica. Not to miss in Barcelona! It was a nice escape from rather busy El Born.

Short and Squat. This church is short and squat, but oh so lovely inside. It is a little expensive to see the inside, but in the end I thought it was worth it. My hotel was right down the street and this church was an excellent landmark, plus I enjoyed seeing it every morning and every evening...

Worth a visit. This lovely 14th century basilica was built with funds donated by the wealthy residents of La Ribera many of whom made their fortunes from shipbuilding or fishing. The Civil War led to the destruction of the ornate and richly historic interior decorations due to fire but the incredible interior shell is still a gothic masterpiece. We toured on our own and we enjoyed the beauty of this place as well as the sense of history and community one can still experience as this is also a local church serving the local community. When you wander out of the church do take some time to stroll the community, perhaps stopping at one of the many cafes or tapas bars along the way. All this and no admission fee!
Wonderful Gothic Church. This is a wonderful example of a Gothic Church. Very peaceful and just a nice place to reflect. Would recommend a visit, even if you aren't religious.

Wish I went in!. This cathedral is stunning! I hadn't anticipated the entrance fee so had no cash on me, so only caught a quick look from the entrance way, but it looks spectacular on the inside, a real example of Gothic architecture.
Wonderful, pure gothic. Excellent example of Gothic art. Must see. Come inside. Go along, Sit for a few minutes and try to think about people who built it, people who prayed in this place.

Cool Gothicness! Amazing at night lit up!. Stunning if you like gothic buildings must see. Better to see at night when it is lit up. Good to pass a few minutes of sight seeing. Even if youre not into churches particularly or even religious you can appreciate it.

Gorgeous basicila. Truly an amazing place. We caught a glimpse of the choir singing at this Basilica. The acoustics were amazing. It's truly a gem in the city of Barcelona and worth paying a visit to see the Gothic architecture.

Great Gothic Church. Loved this church! Not as grand as the Chathedral, but there were not many people here so it was very peaceful. Also, they have real votive candles instead of the electronic ones you see in the larger churches. 3 euros entry fee.
Even better on the inside!. Stunning church. Be sure to pay the small fee to go on the roof for views of the city. Would love to go to a service!

Sursum corda. I have an affinity for the Gothic period and this is one of those very old Gothic churches that almost literally lifts up my heart the moment I come in. And fortunately, the first time I came in, it was fairly early on Sunday morning; there was no entrance fee and there were few people in the church. I only wished I could have stayed longer but I was with friends who hurried me along. When i had a chance to come by for another look, the place was swarming with people but that time I mainly wanted to see the exterior, which I hadn't had a good look at before.Be that as it may, the church inspired me to get a copy of "The Cathedral by the Sea" at the first bookshop I found and am enjoying reading it to get some kind of an idea of what the situation was like when the church was built.
We saw a lot of churches. And this one was the most unique, more simple than many of the others, the ceiling just soared, a neighborhood church that is very impressive
Beautiful interior. It is more impressive from the inside than from the outside - huge with beautiful stained glass windows. There was an actual service going on when we visited.

Breathtaking. the heart of barcelona, the architecture complements the stained glass windows. You could sit in here all day if it was quiet, but at the time I visited there was hundreds of people in and waiting to get in.

Gothic beauty. This church, which is nestled in one of the oldest sections of town, is an excellent example of gothic architecture. Well worth visiting. While there, walk the surrounding streets which have great charm and quaint little boutiques.

Classic Catalan Cathedral! Beautiful. Loved everything about Santa Maria. The colourful stained glass is a wonderful contrast to the simple but impressive lines of the architecture. We visited on a first communion day so lots of very well dressed families were milling about outside. It is in an area that we loved...we had lunch at the Caputxes café beside the cathedral which was a great end to our visit. I'm really not sure why someone would think it needs "renovation"????

The basilica that lost it soul. The first time in Barcelona I was amazed about all the candles, the quiet and half-dark content of this basillika. Now, all lights are changed by - hold on - battery cadles! Looks artificial. Put a coin in the Box and a New battery lamp will light. The building is in desperate need of a full renovation. If you are to choose ONE cathedral, pick La Sagrada Familia!

"wonderful stained glass windows". The cathedral impressed me with its size, it was hard to believe that it was built on citizens' money. When I went inside I was marveled at its amazing stained glass windows. In my opinion, they aren't worse than in Notre Dame de Paris.

The Grandeur of Barcelona. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar is one of the oldest cathedral in Barcelona . The structure outside is very gothic and detailed . Didn't go inside though but the view outside is more than enough for me.

Courtyard . Simply beautiful, but what really truly brought me in was the courtyard. It was stunning. It was my favorite part. It's so peaceful & the attitude changes completely from inside-out. It was 5 euros to get in when I was there.
A Beautiful Church. Take the tour up the 70 or so narrow stairs and see part of Barcelona from high above.The beauty of this old church is in it's flowing design inside and out.

Beautiful Church in Barcelona. this is a beautiful Cathedral in the middle of the El Born area of Barcelona. You should pop into the cathedral on your way to dinner in one of the many amazing restaurants this area has to offer.

Lovely. It's hard, after a point, to write reviews of Roman Catholic churches and cathedrals that aren't dull to me, as they all have so much in common. This one was a bit more majestic than some, and much less exuberant than many of its confreres.

Hides it light under a bushel...... From the outside this basilica looks very plain and simple, and then you come inside......WOW! An enormous expanse with some quite beautiful windows, some are repaired , the general atmosphere is just wonderful. Loved the small square it is on, a very special place.

feel the history of Catalonia in a glimpse. I thorougly reccommend, if you are interested in history, the reading of "The sea Cathedral" which is the story of a guy involved with the construction of this iconic temple. Great surroundings, trendy bars and restaurants, but the grandeur of Barcelona in the XV century can be breath through every single corner of the area.
Angelic Evening. My first visit here was Dec. 2011. That time we went after dark; I recommend this. The church is particularly beautiful at night in the soft glow of the lights.

A different sort of Cathedral.. Most tourists will walk or pass by Santa Maria del Mar. It is a unique buliding a bit Gothic a bit Renaissance. If you have time , get in and enjoy, I love the sense of light not as splendorous as Gothic but more real. It is a great example of transition between two Ages in History therefore it is vibrant and alive.

Read the book by Zafon. Before you visit this Church, read the book by Luis Zafon, La Catedral del Mar (The Sea Cathedral?, or the Cathedral of the Sea).Beautiful, a Basilica built by the very poor to be able to attend their own cathedral to pray. This is a must

A Delightful Surprise. My wife and I both read "Cathedral of the Sea" and put Santa Maria del Mar on our "to see" list in Barcelona because of it. From the outside it was unimpressive compared to may other European cathedrals, and we almost skipped it. I'm glad we didn't. Built in "only" 55 years, it is a pure gothic structure, not the mix of Gothic, Baroque, Neo-Gothic and Romanesque of Barcelona Cathedral. Lovely interior, even with all the fire damage. Not a place to spend a whole lot of time, but don't walk past it if you are in the Gothic Quarter.

Boring place and rude staff. Went there and it was boring. The security man in the front stopped a young girl before entering and said she couldnt enter because her skirt was to short. Her skirt was almost to her knees! What a ridicilous thing to witness at this time and age. Security was rude when we asked if the elevator to the top was open. Answered in a harsh voice NO! And gave us a stare as he thought we were breaking the piece by speaking in the church. Dont get me wrong the church is beatyfull and the relics are cool to see. But in general its plain boring religion stuff and way to serious once inside. And yes dont wear a skirt if you go. Maybe they should recommend a burka for woman to get admittance compared to the rudeness i witness to the young girl who was so unfortunate to wear a skirt that showed her knees. I dont recommend this place and there are way more beatyfull sites to see in Barcelona.
An excellent church to visit. I liked being able to visit an active parish in a very old neighborhood. There are no long lines to get in which makes it even more appealing.

A slightly different basilica. Of course there are many churches in Europe, but this one was a bit different in that it had a most lovely garden/fountain with 13 white geese to reflect a patron saint - a sad and interesting story. And within the open/garden grounds were small enclaves of beautiful sculptures and work of art. I recommend it for a slightly different, yet very beautiful church to see in Europe.

Beautiful. first site to visit after landing in Barcelona. Stunning Gothic-style church with grand stained- glass windows, amazing. No fees. Nice surrounding where you can get tapas and drinks and chill out, before or after the visit this beautiful church. And did I mentioned the geese?

Beautifull Gothic Architecture. The history if the church is somewhat sad -- it was burnt for 7 days straight under the Franco regime, I think? -- and thus a lot of the gold and glitter of the church does not exist anymore. What is left, however, is the bare-boned and impressive structure of a Gothic church. The lack of ornamental glitter allows the structure to be admired in its own right.A nice and quiet place, where one can rest ones weary feet.

A nice walk.. I had read that this was the official Catalan Cathedral, that the people in Barcelona, held dear. We were staying off the Ramblas, on nou Rambla. This was a delightful walk to the Cathedral and seeing a different part of the city. From the Ramblas, we walked to Clave, turned left and pretty much, it's a straight shot there. We passed so many delicious looking bakeries, and food shops. I couldn't wait to walk back home that way, to grab a sandwich and some goodies. The church itself is very pretty. There were several school groups there being instructed on the Cathedral. You could tell there is an importance there. When exiting the church from the back, you simply make a left onto Montcada and it takes you right to the Picasso Museum.

Ancient. Beautiful old cathedral propped on a corner ... dappled light and delicate stained glass ... a quiet repose that takes you back in time ... surrounded by good cafes and shopping ... not the high street brands but rather boutiques ... a great area ... a fabulous church ... worth a visit
Nice Cathedral. When we were there , a group musician were playing , was very nice.... people just seat around enjoyed the music...
impressive church. We went on a Saturday and saw a few weddings taking place. This is a lovely church, huge and lively, and is worth a trip here.

Very peaceful cathedral. There is something about the architecture that sets The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar apart from other cathedrals. The ceiling is glorious and it has such a fantastic history which we had learned from a free walking tour. The cathedral is free to enter after 4:30pm and although you don't need to spend a lot of time there, make sure to appreciate the details and work that went in to making such a wonderful place of worship. Tip for women: make sure to have your shoulders and above the knee covered or else you will not be permitted to enter.
Very Impressive!. Make a point of visiting Santa Maria as it has a great feel. Sagrada gets all of the attention but this basilica is very worth the trip.

Spmething Different. There was something different to the experience of this cathedral - perhaps because of the fact that St Eulalia was buried there. The 13 geese in the courtyard support this feeling. One gets the distinct feeling of many epochs playing out here

the only church in Barcelona built entirely on Catalan gothic style. This is the most used church by Barcelonians & has huge gothic arches & beautiful stained glass windows. the acoustics in this church are superb & concerts are also held here

Do the tour with the visit to the roof!. Because of the fires set in the church in 1936, at the beginning of the Spanish Civil War, the interior is much like you might have found when it was first built - sparse and awe inspiring. Well worth it to get the tour (they have it in English) - cost was $6 Euros for regular adults and a bit cheaper for seniors. The tour allows one to take the stairs up to the roof and get a birds eye view of much of Barcelona in this area. Let me give a big shout out to Martha, our tour guide getting her Ph.D in history at Barcelona University, she was amazing! You might also want to pick up a copy of the novel Cathedral by the Sea and read it ahead of time, a historical novel set around the building of this most amazing of Basilicas back in the 13th century. I would also go and have a glass of wine or drink of your choice in the plaza outside the church - when you are done.
Fabulous. This is a fabulous place to visit - great architecture, windows, history, and views of this place. This is a tremendous church.
Beautiful. A nice venture of the beaten path...not much more to say other than the church was built for the poor to attend by the poor

Always light a candle for your mother. This is a classic, candle-lit, dignified basilica; a perfect place for a moment of prayer and rest. I lit a candle and quickly found my lost wallet, intact. The story of its' construction by the bastaixos (longshoremen) can be bought in the bookstore across the street.

A beautiful example of Gothic Architecture. Having visited Sagrada Familia and been overwhelmed, I wasn't sure how I would feel visiting Santa Maria del Mar. As we approached a wedding party had just arrived and the courtyard was quite festive. Once inside (yes we were permitted to enter during the marriage ceremony), I understood what it was like to see such a magnificent Gothic church. We did respect the couple who were being married and did not intrude on their ceremony. We did manage to view the side chapels, of which there are 34, and get a long view of the main altar. All were unique and I recommend taking the time to look at each.After our visit, we chose to eat in one of the little outdoor cafes in the courtyard. While enjoying our meal, the happy newly weds exited the church, had pictures taken with friends and family and seemed to delight in the festive atmosphere. One could not help but wonder how many other couples had been married at this magnificent church over the centuries!

A great example of Gothic church in El Born. Stayed in an apartment right around the corner from this church. If you are in the area make sure to swing by and take a look. You can do this in 10-15 minutes and it's free most of the time.
So atmospheric. A meaningful visit. Very short queue. Interesting and stunning interior. Beautiful setting. Well worth a visit

Incredibly Beautiful. This Basilica was one of the most beautiful I saw on my trip and well worth a visit. All I had to compare it to, were the Italian Basilica, and it was really interesting to compare the differences in architecture and frescos.

Classic Historic Church. While impressive from the outside, the real treat is the different art and architecture inside this magnificent Church. We enjoyed our visit and the contrast it provided to our earlier visit to Sagrada Familia.

SO glad that I visited this place. After several trips to Barcelona, I decided that I would take a closer look in the cathedral in the Gothic area. I am glad that I did, I really enjoyed taking in the architecture, stained glass and also getting a closer look at the geese that live in a small square which is attached to the cathedral. There is also a little museum and you can also access the roof for some great photos.I paid €6 euros to enter and access all areas including the roof. I would recommend this rather than enter during the times of day when visiting is free - there are more crowds and you have to pay for access to additional areas.

amazing church. My fav church in Barcelona it is so beautiful inside sit down in the pews and absorb the true essence of the church when we visited they had the organ playing too truly beautiful it was 5 Euros to enter but you won't be disappointed

Read the novel, see the real church. This church is the subject of the novel,The Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones. It is worth taking the tour in the afternoon as the guide is informative and the views from the roof worth the climb. Take note of the image of the stone carriers on the doors, a tribute to the porters who carried the stones from the quarries as their contribution to the building.

Beautiful Basilica - lovely plaza.... We were in Barcelona around Sept 24th, the day of a big 'festival' in the evening the plaza in front of the Basilica was full of people listening to music. We visited the Basilica the next day - it is beautiful inside - it makes you very respectful of what the architects and builders could accomplish hundreds of years ago. We always put money in the donation boxes as it helps to maintain the building so that others can see it for years to come.
Great free attraction. This was a very nice gem found in the Gothic district / Born district. It was not opened all the time so we are happy we were there at a time that it was opened.
Most beautiful church in Barcelona. Many locals have told me that it's the most beautiful church in Barcelona and I was not disappointed. Classic showcase of Gothic design.
Beautiful. Out of place and time. Truly a wonder to see. Not to be missed when in Barcelona. We came upon this accidentally and were so glad we stopped in to see it.

Beautiful. Try and visit that church next time you go to Barcelona. It is very pretty and it is located in an area where there are several little restaurants. Make a visit to the church then have some nice pinchos or tapas on a terrasse. That's going to be a good afternoon.

Only visit before 1pm or after 5pm that is when there is free entry otherwise you pay 5euros to enter!!. Impressive from both inside and out but lacks something but what I do not know. Too many people thronging about taking pictures inside when there was a church service going on.
Outstanding. This is one of the best cathederals in Barcelona and offers the best views. The guide was excellent as well.
Beautiful inside!. This church seems simple, but actually it's amazing inside. The art, the light, the size, … very surprising!

Beautifully simple. I think this was my favorite church during our trip. It was nestled in a side street in the Barri Gotic. It was simple and beautiful the way a church should be. Nothing flashy and distracting here. The atmosphere was serene and the stained glass windows were mesmerizing.
hidden gem. We discovered this by accident, but very peaceful. Lots of fellow visitors taking a chance for a free seat.

Romantic Barcelona. knowing the history of the cathedral ( from the same named booked) it makes it even more attractive. This little church in the middle of the fancy Born quarter lets visitors travel back few centuries...
love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Read the book then visit this sanctuary. Serene place of quiet contentment. A really beautiful example of it's era. I loved the homage to the stone porters on the front doors.
my favourite. so mystic and well maintained. I have always find concerts or rehearsals to concerts. definitely a must stop by when in town
A Dark Edifice with Brilliant Stained Glass Windows. This is a breathtaking church. Its soaring roof draws the eyes heavenwards. Although quite dark, the windows are well worth a visit.

Read the book "The Cathedral of the Sea". The book is a historical novel by Idelfonso Falcones. It is long but a well researched and interesting novel of the construction of the church and the characters involved. Then see the church to get an idea of how difficult it must have been to build it and the genius behind it's construction.
Lovely church. One to see- beautiful church and this one felt Holy. Be careful of beggars outside. Lovely windows. Worth going to find.

Lovely little church. We did the little tour of the church , our guide took us on the roof of this lovely Catalan church and we were pleasantly surprised of what we learned about this old church.
And on the rooftop we had a lovely vieuw of this part of the city

Take the elevator to the top. I will admit that I wasn't thrilled about the 6 euro charge to enter but it is a nice church with a nice courtyard but the thing that makes it totally worth the 6 euro is the elevator ride to the roof where you can walk around and get amazing views of the city and up close views of the towers.

Santa maria del Pi is better!!. I was dissappointed by the inside for something so important to the city and as a central point for Catalan catholicism but its not particularly well articulated for tourists and the chapels and other decorations are not exciting. the basic structure is impressive however.

breathtaking.. The place is absolutely gorgeous. But in its own way.
Kind of minimalism mixed with middle age.
A best seller book of the Cathedral was written also.

Well worth a visit. We were lucky enough to have gone in 10 minutes before a wedding started. I think what makes it so good is that during the Civil war it was ransacked and so the building's structure is unencumbered by pictures etc.
One of Barcelona's jewels. One can feel the past in the church. Seems to be a little neglected (leaking roofs??) but really worth visiting

A Beautiful Gothic Church. The Santa Maria del Mar Church is a beautiful Gothic church. It was built between 1329 and 1383 by the architects Berenguer de Montagut and Ramon Despuig. It is too bad that most of the chapels were burned at the start of the Civil War. Still the church is quite unique and is worth visiting to see its architecture.

We loved it. It was a great experience. We were taken there by a friend who lives there, we were planning it for another day. But well worth it. Amazing. There was no fee, we were told that there is. It was Saturday, i dont know if it makes any difference.

Excellent visit. It might be because I'm from Barcelona, or just because this church is so amazing, but it's my favourite in the city. Strong, robust, classy and elegant are just some adjectives for it.Just go and admire both the austere appearance form outside and the magnificient calm inside. If you're interested in the story behind the church I recommend you to read "Cathedral of the Sea", a novel explaining it. PS: It used to be free, seems you have to pay something now to enter.
Beautiful. Well worth the walk from the Ramblas.Full of history & surrounded by historical buildings.What a treat.
More impressive than the Cathedral. Very Gothic, very high and a sight well worth seeing. Don't confuse it with the other Iglesia Santa Maria!)

Very good breakfast, tres bon dejeuners !. What a place to get breakfast, share a few coins with people who needs it and have a quick view of this charming church ! Quel endroit pour prendre un bon déjeuner, donner un peu de change aux gens dans le besoin et jeter un regard sur cette magnifique Église pure Catalane ' coffe/cafè is really good/bon!

September 11th 1714-2014 300th Diada of Catalonia. T was lucky enough to pick this day to visit the cathedral. At about 11am it was filled with Catalonians wearing their colors. Later in the day they made a human v for vote on independence. The estimate was from 500000 to 1.8 million people. lined up on 2 avenues, The people were lined up in rows of red and yellow shirts that went on for blocks. Google the pictures. A wonderful day. Barcelona is a great city and so are its people. The Cathedral is beautiful.

Iglesia de Santa Maria del Mar is beautiful. In Spanish or Catalan it just rolls off your tongue as you speak it. The cathedral was my favorite in Barcelona with The Cathedral in second place, but for my wife it was the opposite way around. Either way, both are different & delightful. Santa Maria like many Barcelona church was almost destroyed during Franco revolution. That this beautiful building still exists is a miracle. Warm weather outside but cool, spiritual comfort on the inside. We stumbled across it on our first day as we oriented ourselves to the nooks & crannies of the city & the Gotic. It was an experience of rest for the body & the soul. Go, meditate, sit, sigh.

Just beautiful!. Been to Barcelona many times during the last many years and this is one of my favorite Cathedrals. One must definitely visit this lovely cathedral during a stay in Barcelona,it is well worth a visit. As well as the area around, the Gothic quarter. Be aware of the their dress code.

A charge to enter a working church - which testament does that come from?. My wife wanted to light a candle - but a 6 Euro entry charge to enter a church? Greed is not good! Put a tax on hotel rates and share it around.
Beautiful!!!. Such a stunning architecture! We did not go inside a lot of crowds. You could hear organ music from inside, and everyone was taking pictures, and enjoying the atmosphere.

Absolutely Stunning. St. Mary's Cathedral was one of my favorite cathedrals of my grand mediterranean trip! It was absolutely beautiful and there was no cost! I would definitely recommend visiting this lovely cathedral!

Beautiful cathedral. When I visited St Mary's on a mid-afternoon Sunday, there were crowds of outside, dining at the courtyard restaurant tables or just taking photos of the building. Inside was quiet, almost deserted, and there was soft organ music was playing. After a tour of the Basilica, I sat down in one of pews and enjoyed the quiet, almost empty grand space.

Little jewel right in the centre of BCN. The little sister of the Catedral (plaza de la Catedral) well worth visiting especially at Christmas time, when they have amazing classical music concerts going on. Make sure you reserve on time.

Outstanding Gothic architecture. The Santa Maria del Mar started construction in the early 14th century and continued for about 50 years. This is well worth a visit whether you are Christian or not, just to see the architecture that was prevalent during that period in time

Amazing Cloister. The cathedral itself was pretty typical, but the cloister was great. It was full of palm trees, and there were white geese roaming around. There was even an old fountain that you could drink from. The area around the cathedral is gorgeous, too. It's a nice contrast to all the Gaudi attractions.
Beautiful. Really a beautiful construction and a nice place to stay for some introspection at least it was my case ...

Typical Spanish Gothic cathedral. The size is enormous, but the architecture so typical of the gothic style with arches and lack of dome. Many rich lapses by the side make this a lively viewing. Excellent stain glass windows, and a very impressive pipe organ. The children liked the garden where live goose can be seen. Free entrance for most of the church, just make sure you are well covered!

Interesting!. Very imposing cathedral in the heart of Barcelona. Free to enter, which is always a bonus! Worth a casual stroll around to pass some time, and to admire the beautiful architecture. Unfortunately some of my friends were unable to enter, due to their dress code, which is fair enough given it's their policy and is clearly stated before entering. Well worth a visit if you are in the Gothic quarter.
beautiful. The most beautiful church in Barcelona after la Sagrada Familia, with a beautiful light. It shows the history of the city.

Breathtaking. I visit Santa Maria del Mar at least twice a year and every time I go, it takes my breath away. The height of the ceiling, the vaults, the stained glass windows... I cannot help but try to imagine how it was like to live a long time ago and see this from a distance, then enter and be mesmerized by so much beauty. It is peaceful, quiet, cool... a place not to be missed in Barcelona.

Fascinating. It was fascinating to learn the history of the merchant marine area within Barcelona and to see the different styles of architecture and culture within this Cathedral compared to others around the city.
Nice church. good for one time visit. It is beautiful. But if you are pressed for time, you won't regret skipping it.
Marimar is always a treat.. The stained glass windows really need a long hard stare. the cathedral was built in an incredibly short period of time and still standing strong.

Intriguing shrine. Santa Maria del Mar (14th c.) is magnificent church that dominates Ribera district in Barri Gotic and definitely my favourite sacral construction in Barcelona (Sorry, Gaudi).This beautiful church built in the style of Catalan Gothic is as well the main "star" of Ildefonso Falcones 2006 bestseller "Cathedral of the Sea".Read the book while contemplating in the church in late summer afternoon. Exceptional opportunity to feel the atmosphere of medieval shrine colored by the light that comes through fantastic gothic stained glass windows.
I couldn't find it until too late. I have no sense of direction and I wandered around looking for this church. Finally, I found it. It was siesta. So I never got to see the interior, sadly.

Santa Maria of the Sea. Last Christmas, my daughter had bought me the Historical Novel of this title. From the time I finished reading it and passing it on to her, we were sold. Decided to go to Barcelona. The Cathedral is gorgeous. Walking around in it, there were many Saints to say a prayer to, burn a candle, etc,. We could imagine the men, boys actually as young as 12/13 with the band on their heads in order to carry the rocks/boulders for the building of the cathedral,. There are depictions of this on the doors to the church. A must see.

A magnificent structure.. A really magnificent example of a late medieval architectural inspired religious temple. It is very simple with not too many master paintings and sculptures, but the color window panes and the massive columns are simply beautiful.

Beautiful Cathedral open to all. In the Born area it is a great short visit. What a great cathedral which has been rebuilt after the war. Interesting with the new glass windows contrasted to the reinvented onriginal windows as almost all were fractured during the war although one broke during an earthquake. Built by dockworkers and seafarers in a short (70) year period is represents a unique period in time. The alter with the 1400's boat pays homage to its heritage.

Looked lovely from the outside but couldnt go in. Was very busy around here. A beautiful looking cathedral but when we queued to go in, I was told in Spanish that I couldn't go in because I had knee length shorts on. My son was very upset, he couldn't understand why it mattered, he said God loves us whatever we wear doesn't he? I have to say he has a point, particularly in the square where pickpocketing is rife! Seems an interesting contrast/contradiction. Luckily we can see past this but I wonder how many non Christians couldn't? So can't comment on the inside, wish I could say it exemplified a faith that was accessible to all but I think that must only be in the plainer churches. The Barcelona authorities really need to sort out the thieves in this area.

Gothic masterpiece,but area is full of pickpockets. What a shame this beautiful church in a beautiful area is ruined by gangs of thieves,no police,no security seem to be in presence.i had my wallet stolen then i witnessed an elderly American couple robbed off their valuable items by a child,their holiday ruined.The Catalan authorities have the absolute obligation to protect the tourists that spend millions in this beautiful city.Its disgusting that this is allowed to continue.Please be vigilant in Barcelona,leave valuables at the hotel and your wallet in your front pocket.Shame on the lawmakers.PS,the church really is a masterpiece.

A Surprise in the Cathedral. Our hotel was a short walk from this cathedral. We passed it a few times going for walks, lunch, dinner, breakfast, drinks....you get the picture. Anyway, on a pre-dinner stroll we decided to pop in because there seemed to be a lot going on. In the Sanctuary there was an entire orchestra setting up. I'm talking at least 75 musicians. Being a lover of most live music I asked and was told it was a Dutch youth orchestra. Now, the thought of a youth orchestra didn't excite me too much....you know how the flute section is never quite in tune and the tubas come in late for their part.....but WOW! the conductor faced the pews and said "rehearsal" to make it clear what was happening. When the music began everyone was transfixed by it. For anyone reading this who has not heard a live orchestra in a church, the acoustics are terrific. The point of my review is simply to say if you are in the area find out what events are planned for the cathedral and don't miss them!

One of the better churches. Some say it's free to get in but we paid. If you aren't too tired of studying Catholic churches then this is at least one of the better ones. Plenty of stained glass windows, arches, wood carvings and all the standard peripheria you might expect. it's a very beautiful setting and you can't fail to feel the age and holy atmosphere. I personally think it should be free but we paid €5 each. if your budget allows then check it out.

Since when you have to pay 8 EUR (!) just to enter a church?. Barcelona is an expensive city for tourist, so before I took my last day in Barcelona, I searched for articles like "Best free/cheap things to do in Barcelona". The articles returned by google were not too old (like in late 2012, 2013), and this place is rated as one of the recommended, with favorable comments. Not a big one; but viewed from the small "plaza" in front of it, it's quite OK. To my surprise, when I get in, there were a ticket desk there. And the price: 8 EUR/person. Couldn't believe it! The staff there said that it will be free after 5pm, but I could not wait, and rather not to wait, as I had a glance to the interior. It's dark, and not a special church. Rather overrated IMO, I've seen quite a lot of churches better than this.Near the Metro Jaume I, nearby the Museum of Picasso, so you can make a combination. Anyway check the timetable and the information about its free entrance before going. If you cannot find a suitable time slot for it, you don't have to make a special visit.After visiting this one (10 minutes), and didn't pay to get inside, we strolled to the monument of Colombo, which is a more interesting activity.

Wonferfull place for engineers. There is many church but this have a different structure something make different and lovely for engineers that looks how it was built.The interior are nice and so big. If you want to see weddings there you qill enjoy because it is one the busiest place for it

Beautiful. I love to look in churches that are this ornate and gorgeous. The architecture is just amazing. It didn't take much time to see it, but it was worth the visit. There were several people on/near the steps begging for money.

Nice church!. Nice Church, But overrated in my opinion, great example of gothic architecture, I've seen more beautiful churches than this one. It also was quite neutral in comparison to some great churches.
Church. Nice church, probably wouldn't buy ya ticket go after 3pm and it'd free. However, ladies make sure your shoulders are covered otherwise you won't be allowed in

Unusual church in the Gothic quarter. Loved hearing the history - built by the people over a period of less than 100 years as opposed to most churches and cathedrals built by the rich over hundreds of years. church felt like an authentic expression of the spirituality of the craftsmen who built is stone by stone.

Pretty little church. Very pretty, worth going through if you are in the area. Not sure if I would make a special visit to see it, unless you have read Cathedral by the Sea, and want to see the church the book was based on. Also very close to Picasso Museum, you could combine the two for a nice afternoon.

Amazing. I loved this church. It was beautiful. I was surprised how spacious it was inside. The whole area it sits in was fun to explore and enjoy the cafés. Tip: there was a man turning away women with no sleeves or shorter shorts. I had a sleeveless shirt and shorts, but they were dressy so I think that's why he let me in. My husband had a muscle shirt and shorts and he didn't bat an eye at him. He turned many away.
Beautiful VERY OLD cathedral. Amazing how buildings like this and Sagrada la Familia could have been created with none of today's helpful machinery.
nice church. quick visit to that place is ok, just bare in mind that place closes early as 8 pm. just pray inside and enjoy the peacful place. Just across the church nice restaurant to eat in

Most majestic church in the city. Despite its size, this basillica was built in only less tha sixty years. It was paid by the neighbours of the area: harbour workers, fishermen, traders and craftsmen; many helped with their labour and skills. Reflecting this, the church is sober for being gothic, and has a remarcable uniformity of style throughout. This makes it extremely pleasant to the eye. Go inside in a sunny day (so most days), and experience "feeling" the light fill the vast interior.
Beautiful. This is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. Free to get in. Just sit and admire the beauty for a few minutes.

A little gem. Loved this church - the stained glass is wonderful and a real sense of history. A quick visit was all we had time for but I am glad we made it. Lovely cafe outside for a spot of refreshment also

Insight into Old Barcelona!. We had a most interesting guided tour which gave us an insight into the history of the church and how the various periods of unrest in Spain impacted on the building eg Fire damage etc .

A must see. Very impressive building from and architectural point of view. Visited by a lot of tourists. Expect to go slow and take the time to tour the basilica and examine the different sections of it inside and out. The touring columns is to examine closely as the way it was built. Impressive ceiling. Inside walls lined up with different closed up sections honoring different saints.

Beautiful. Whilst Sagreda Familia is unmissable, this ancient building has a unique Old World awe about it. The cathedral is fantastic, but be sure to go round the back and lose yourself in the calm amongst the orange trees of the cloisters.
Santa Maria del Mar. Church of Santa Maria del Mar is an interesting place. Admission is payable but can hit for hours when you can enter for free.

A must-see. The other glowing reviews here are spot on for me. Santa Maria del Mar is a beautiful church. I don't think I did enough church visits to say whether or not it's the most beautiful in the city, but I think it'd have to be pretty special to top this. We were lucky enough to arrive to visit just as a wedding was about to begin so it added that little bit extra for us. In spite of the crowds here it's got a much more spiritual feel than some of the other places we visited. And outside, the Placa is great for watching the world go by - or wedding guests and confetti showers if you get there at the right time!

the most beautiful church in Barcelona. This church has something that makes it unique. And it can be an intangible thing. The proportions of the space, separation and height of the columns that make the place has an atmosphere that I've only found a few places to go. as might be the Pantheon in Rome or (Hagia Sophia) in Istanbul. It is by far the most beautiful church in Barcelona.

Catalan gothic gem!. A gem of Catalan gothic architecture. Free to enter. Don't be mislead - this is not "Cathedral of Santa Eulalia / La Seu" with 13 gees, this is "St. Mary of the Sea Cathedral (Iglesia de Santa Maria del Mar)". A lot of travelers pictures was posted in wrong location...

Very Atmospheric. This is a free attraction, and a must as the building is very relaxing. The paintings and crypts are very well maintained. Ladies, make sure you cover your shoudlers, and wear shorts that are around the knee - if your clothes are too revealing you won't be allowed in.

Most beautiful church in Barcelona. This is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. A rigid early gothic style that exhumes an intimate atmosphere. Find some rest here before diving into tourist hell again.
Nice to see if you have time. I thought this church was beautiful and on the day that I saw it, a couple were getting married, so it had some extra charm to it. Highly recommended!
Great and free but... . Except for the age and construction and height, there's not much else going for it. If you admire 14 century architecture then the vaults and arches are incredible.

Beautiful and free. You dont need to pay a fee for visit this beautiful cathedral.
Very beautiful architeture, statues and windows.
Note that's is close sometimes in the lunch time, check before open time.

Beautiful. We got off our tour bus to talk a walk around this Cathedral, beautiful architecture.
Definitely worth taking some time to walk all around the outside to really appreciate its beauty!
Beautiful. Did the guided tour to top, not sure necessary. Beautiful church, worth the visit. Check entrance times as is free at certain points in day we think.

Peaceful and Beautiful. Down in the gothic quarter. Free to enter . Fantastic windows and statues. Lots of local cafés with outside tables so a lovely area to wander around. Found a lovely old fashioned shop very nearby that was roasting coffee and nuts etc ( Casa Gispert ) a bit hidden round the back streets but worth a look.

Lovely church. Enjoyed walking around the exterior of the church and passing into the first part of the interior. Could not go beyond as their was a service in place. Enjoyed that this historical Cathedral was still an active church
Don't miss. Fantastic cathedral, wonderful square, brilliant stained glass windows. And free! In the center of the gothic quarter so easy to get to. Near Picasso museum.
Beautiful. I love churches, and this one is just beautiful. It doesn't cost money to enter, and there is a lot to see.
Great sight. An amazing piece of architecture just one of a number of places to see in Barcelona! Stunning. Well worth a visit but some parts do have scaffolding
Nice. Looks interesting and nice, very well preserved. We didn't enter the church but I don't think there is something more special than in other cathedrals in Europe.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is really a charming building. It is a lot more impressive inside than you realise from outside. Beautiful stained glass windows and the church has real charm with impressive architecture. It is in the middle of El Born and is worth a visit.
very nice. very nice church- from outside it looks like very very interesting with a place in front to sit. gret place we didn't enter

Beautiful. This cathedral is beautiful and has a fabulous story to go with it - I wouldnt normally visit any Catherdrals but this was absolutely lovely. It doesnt take long to walk around so I would recommend popping in on your way past.

Ordinary cathedral but the stained glass is beautiful . I have visited many cathederals around Europe and this one is nothing too surprising, although the stained glass is nice. Still worth a visit as you don't have much to do if you are not a shopaholic at the gothic quarter

this Basilica is not as ornate as others but it has an amazing story. this is a church built by the Mariners, it was thought if they assisted it would provide protection on their sea voyages and give good catches for the fishermen. There is also a guided tour which take you up the towers and roof top This is a must do!!

Churches, churches, churches.... After hundrets of churches I've seen in my life there was nothing special. For sure it is the good piece of gothic style architecture, but you won't be surprised by anything.

Little gem. Beautiful example of Catalan gothic architecture. It doesn't get as many tourists as other churches and is free to get in. A must see and there are some lovely cafés out side to sit and enjoy it.

Exquisite Gothic architecture. This church is a must-see for people interested in Gothic church architecture. It’s an exquisite example of the Catalan Gothic style with elevated side naves that gives an ambience of sublimity and lightness. Catch the guided tour if you can – it gives an excellent introduction to Medieval Barcelona and Catalonian history in architecture as well as socio-economic, cultural, and political. The tour takes you up on the two roofs to study the building techniques (and the excellent view of the city) and is thus not for the faint of heart. But the intresting and informative content is well worth challenging your vertigo for!!

Don't miss this!. In all of Spain, this was our favorite of the churches we visited. Beautiful, serene, spiritual - those are some of the words i would use to describe this sanctuary in the heart of the old city.
Visit the Roof top!. We payed 3 euros per person to use the lift to go to the roof, but it was worth it! Just keep in mind that it has to be not rainy or very windy.

After the Sagrada Familia, do not miss this church. Tourists who would not have stopped in to see St. Mary of the Sea (church, not cathedral) now include it after having read the best selling book about how how and how quickly it was built. There are now special book related tours around the church and the neighborhood. It is a favorite of locals no matter where in the city they grew up. Young women dream of being married there, more so than in the city's cathedral. It is not ornate, but is is impressive in its size and how quiet and peaceful it is inside, just what you expect of a church, but hardly ever experience it. If you belong to the many who say "No, please, not another church!", read up and and visit this one. You won't be sorry, and you won't forget the experience.

My favorite cathedral of Barcelona. Beautiful cathedral, stained glass windows, murals, and more!When I was there, a person was playing the violin and another person was playing the organ, so I loved walking around the Cathedral with the music. The geese pond was neat too. There is a fountain where you can drink the water too. I didn't go up to the roof because I didn't have time, but I highly recommend it from my friend in Barcelona.
Barcelona cathedral. Well worth the visit. Take your time and enjoy its many treasures. The simple Gothic interior is impressive.

beautiful cathedral not mentioned in any of the guides!. We just happened to be walking around from the Picasso Museum when we saw this old Cathedral! It is really beautiful inside and so unlike the Gaudi Cathedral! The nave and altar was fabulous and if you happen to go see it, have lunch at nearby Morelia restaurant!

A basilica with a great history.... Much more than just a church, this magnificent place of worship has a history dating back to the early 14th century. Its link with the sea and Catalonia's preeminence in maritime trading is a fascinating story and takes the visitor beyond the basilica's impressive physical structure. Get up on the roof for great views and when you get back to earth reward yourself for the climb in one of El Born's choice of restaurants and bars.

Gorgeous. My niece was married in this church on July 4, 2014. The groomsmen wore red/white/blue socks, and we chanted U.S.A. at the reception. The church is FABULOUSLY beautiful. Everything was perfect. The vocalist, the organist, her wedding planners, the English speaking priest - all made everything perfect.WARNING: One of the wedding party's purses was stolen in this basilica during the rehearsal the night before the wedding. Do not leave purses unattended in Barcelona. The purse was steps away from the wedding party when it was stolen. =(

Great view but a difficult walk to the top of the Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral and I chose the guided trip to the top, having been told it was easy. It's not easy. Tight spiral stairs with no handrail made the descent the hardest part. Very dark in parts. Boiling hot on the terraces so take water. However, the view is amazing and the guide was charming.
Beautiful. 5 euros to get in, but is a haven of peace and serenity. Simple but stunning architecture. Feels like a church not a museum.

Built by the people for the people.. When it comes to churches Venice has quite spoiled me but I found this somewhat austere 14th Century church beautiful and quite moving. Built by the people to fill their own needs it became a sailors' church and sailors brought models of their ships to place on the altar and ask for safety. I find that great architecture brings its own beauty and comfort and so it is here. The church is very near the Picasso Museum so on your way there or back do stop in.

Gothic Revival. The Cathedral is fantastic but even better is the Roof/Terrace tour... For €5 you can climb the bell tower staircases to the roof of the Basilica. An interesting view onto the square and into the church itself. Highly recommended!

Must see BCN sight. I highly recommend visitors read "Catheral of the Sea" by Ildefonso Falcones as it gives a wonderful perspective of early BCN and the history that shaped many of the things they will see while here. This church is beautiful and is the jewel for the setting that is el Born. If possible check to see if there is a concert in the church as it is a unique experience to be in the church as it was centuries ago. Takes you back to the Middle Ages.

More eye catching architecture. Barcelona continues to offer wonderful attractions and this is one of them. We almost stumbled across the cathedral while strolling around the city. The benches across from it allowed a welcome seat for weary legs and a chance to take in a fantastic attraction.

A beautiful church, worth to see. A beautiful church with a relatively simple interior, but very impressive height and architecture, which is adorned by lights. Nothing overly-ornamented, but there's still much to admire. I recommend it.
Great. Great option to discover the gotic architecture reflected in one of the most famous churches of Barcelona.

Amazing.. I really liked the Catedral del Mar, it's a bit simpler than the other cathedral but it has an special something about it! When I was there a wedding was taking place, the bride was late..., pretty late. Most of the tourists stayed and we all waited for her to arrived, when she did, we all took pictures of her walking down the corridor, it was great. After that, almost half of the church left!

Medieval beauty. I love, love, love this Cathedral. When you enter, it may look a little "empty", compared to Italian or even other Spanish cathedrals, but this is the beauty of the building, it was constructed to let the "mediterranean sunlight" decorate the space. I feel peaceful there.

Well worth a visit. I took the tour of the cathedral for €8 and it was worth every penny. A climb up onto the roof (it's about 100 steps and you pause half way) have you the most outstanding views. Out your guide, Marta, was excellent. She told us so much about the church and about Barcelona itself. I would really recommend this.

Real Gothic Cathedral. This Cathedral is the real one that has GOTHIC STILE. It is from 14th Century and is keeping the original structure even after earthquake and vandalism acts during the Spanish Civil War.The majestic Cathedral of the SeaMany buildings produces you the feeling like walking in the European Middle Ages.Super recommended!

Classic gothic. We attended a wedding in the Basilica but took the tour the day before. This is a unique cathedral in many ways. Built in a mere 54 years, it is all gothic, no mixture of architectural styles. Lovely and simple compared to other cathedrals.
Great place hidden in the city. Great place hidden in the city, that is why you shoul discover a city by only walking. You can enjoy the music by street musicans as well.
Beautiful chuch. This is cathedral sized with high vaulted ceilings. It is beautiful despite surviving a massive fire last century. The chapel at the far end is particularly beautiful.

unbeatable. they say it's the best example of catalan gothic architecture and they're right! doesn't look like much from the outside but from the inside - well, if you didn't believe in a higher power before you walked in, you will when you walk out! or perhaps it's simply the power of 700 years of cultural singularity at work? whatever the case, don't miss santa maría del mar!

A Church Well Worth Visiting. This church is a great piece of architecture, and if you want a litany of the saints, the small altars throughout are well labeled. We are glad we were able to spend some time there.

Magnificent Interior. I have seen many Gothic churches throughout my travel, but the history of this church stroke a nerve. It is located in ribera district, we had a tour guide explained the history of the church and It took about 53 years to complete the building and the interior is breathtaking with the huge ceilings and uniform architecture
Beautiful. A very, very beautiful cathedral. Located in one of the best parts of the city. Ideal for tourists or churchgoers alike.
Beautiful!. Very moving to learn that this church was built and paid for by the common working place people of the surrounding neighborhood. One of many very beautiful churches in Barcelona.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen!. First I did not like the fact that they charged you 5 euros to enter the church. But then I realized that it was a blessing for in this beautiful place I could really feel the history and the mistery of past times.Get away from crowded Barcelona and visit this unique place during your visit, it's really worth it.Above all, try to read La Catedral del Mar by Idelfonso Falcones before your visit, it will make a difference!

Incredible. Just wonderful to see. How they tore down the whole surrounding area to build it in the late middle ages is just mind boggling. It may not be the most elaborate of churches but it does have a fantastic flavor and right in the middle of the Gothic Quarter. Sit down outside and have a coffee and enjoy the atmosphere

Dating to the 12th century. Each Barcelona Cathedral is unique and worth a visit if you are willing to pause a moment. We followed this stop with a tour of the Maritime Museum, just past the Columbus statue, for a "sea themed" morning.

Catedral del Mar. Ok, I'm a little biased because I first heard of this church in The Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones, a novel set in medieval Barcelona that revolves around the construction of this church and one of my favorite books. I was hoping to see the carvings of the bastaixos (the porters who carried the stones from Montjuïc) mentioned in the books and my guidebook, but I couldn't find anything.For those who haven't read the book, the church is still a very peaceful place to stop and reflect for a bit. It's not terribly ornate, but it had a certain charm about it that Barcelona's other Gothic churches lack. The Baroque sacristy in the back is gorgeous and is an interesting contrast to the Gothic style of the main building.

Beautiful and Calming. Walking up to this church was one of my favorite moments in Barcelona. There is no detail about this church that stands out in my memory, just that it offered an overwhelming sense if calm. Go. You won't regret it.
Another beauty of Barcelona!. Beautiful and imposing cathedral built in Gothic style and situated in Ribera district. Very impressive and unique interiors. It worth to visit!
Lovely atmospheric old church. this church is within walking distance from Las Ramblas and was really worth visiting for a quiet, peaceful few moments of meditation.
Quiet, serene church. My favorite basilica in Barcelona, free from overadornment. A lovely cool step away from the hectic Born neighborhood.

Interesting and inspirational. A splendid gothic cathedral. The facade is very interesting on its own and the interior is spiritually inspiring especially in those areas where a lot of tourists are not strolling around.

Peace and tranquility. I am not religious in any way but you cant help being touched by a feeling of calm in this place. The colours in the stained glass are amazing and look like they were put in yesterday as opposed to hundreds of years ago.

Worth a Visit.. This is a very interesting basilica with fairly unique architecture and a long and interesting history. It suffered a little as they had no english translation books on the day we visited but we were able to work out most of the history and spent a few plesent hours doing so.

The real barcelona cathedral. Build by the people for the people, this cathedral is unique since it's the only pure catalan gothic construction. One of the most iconic and important buildings of Barcelona!
Beautiful interior. This is a stunning church, on a simpler scale than others in Barcelona. Definitely worth a visit. We didn't have time to take the trip up the tower.

Very nice church!!!!!. Nice and kind of simple compared to other churches and cathedrals in Europe. Worth to pay to go inside and look at the beautiful gothic columns and very nice stained glass windows. Worth the visit.
Backed by a good story. Magnificent ol' cathedral but more is the story behind it. Dig it out. At best, walk wth a free walking tour guide.

Spain is Cathedrals Deluxe. Having been to so many cathedrals on this trip to Spain, it is starting to become difficult to keep track of them all. This Cathedral is one of the oldest in Barcelona and looks a bit simpler than most others. Stained glass windows are fun to look at. Visited it on a Saturday, and there was a wedding in it. Plenty of restaurants and ice cream parlors around it to help you cool off on a hot day.

Pay the 5 EUR to go in. This was simply put one of the most impressive cathedral interiors I have ever seen. There is a 5 EUR charge to enter. Just pay it and know that your money is going towards the upkeep and maintenance of a wonderful building.

A gem. We were wandering in this lovely neighborhood after going to the Picasso museum, and happened upon this beautiful cathedral. This was an unpretentious but well loved church. We are so glad we found it.

Fantastic Building. Even if you're not religious, this place is well worth a visit for it's architecture alone... Very beautiful place. If you don't see this during a guided tour of the city then your guide isn't any good!

A wonderful hour spent in a marvellous church. Deciding to avoid the queues of the Sagrada Familia, instead my partner and I chose to do a tour of the Santa Maria del Mar. It's a wonderful place and we chose to do the €8 tour which includes a walk all the way around the roof. The views from the top were incredible and the highlight of the day. You can look down on endless roof gardens, and in the distance all the famous sights can be seen.Our guide was friendly, English-speaking and thoroughly knowledgable about the church and it's history. He even encouraged us to seek out the novel, La Catedral Del Mar, by Ildefonso Falcones, which is based on the church's history. You should ask him to point out the FC Barcelona shield which is hidden in one of the modern stained glass windows.

Beautiful Gothic Architecture. We enjoyed this small church more than any other in Barcelona. The ornamentation was destroyed in a fire, but the lovely gothic columns are better appreciated this way. There is more light inside this church than in the Cathedral. Beautiful.

"Church of the people.". Our guide told us ordinary Catholics built the Church over 60 years by their own skill and hard work.....an amazing Faith example. The height inside is inspiring. A great place for Catholics to attend Mass in El Borne.
Beautiful. Very beautiful with some wonderful stained glass windows. Worth a quick visit.Unfortunately beggars waiting near the doors are a hassle. Once inside very peaceful. No fee
Beautiful Cathedral. Nice cathedral, definitely worth free entry! Skip the Crypt, unless you are looking to simply donate to the church.

A bit hard to find but worth it. We found this a bit hard to find because it is tucked away behind some small streets - it is only minutes walk from the hop on hop off red bus stop but you need to go slowly and up what appears to be a small walking access - and the bonus is all the good shops further up from it.

One of my favorite interior spaces. We strongly recommend that friends visit this glorious space first, before going to the Sagrada Familia. They are like cousins, built centuries apart but with the same soaring infrastructure, strong bare bones and glorious plays of light at the right times of day.
Nice. If you're in the Gothis Quarter, you cannot miss this. It is a nice and quiet cathedral, with no crowds. Enjoy the peace, the grandeur and take some time to meditate.
tourist visit. Went round this on one of the free guided tours offered by our hotel. Interesting history about how it was built and paid for.

Kind of a surprise, but do the tour!. It was on our 'list' but it could be on yours too! for a few euro's they give you a tour throughout the church, including the roof. From there you have a nice view over the city!
nice. we passed this while on barri gothic tour. there was a ceremony and the church was full but the feeling was nice. definitely worth to get to know the story behind it!
One of my favourite churches in BCN. Has a somewhat gothic, darker ambient, but is definetely a very beautiful church in the heart of Barcelona. If you are a tourist, certainly worth a visit!
Beautiful Basilica. Known for stain glass windows & 14th Century Catalan Gothic Architecture, Crypt and Holy Sacrament Chapel, this Church is a gem.

Simplicity compared to Sagrada Familia. We visited this after the Sagrada Familia and it felt quiet, simple and restrained. The streets outside are quite busy, just off the Born area, but inside the unadorned columns stretched upwards in peace and tranquility.
The surrounding Born area is worth a ramble, but try doing so outside of weekends when we were quite overwhelmed by the crowds.

Beautiful. We went in after 5 so did not pay the entrance fee, not sure that I think it is worth paying for, but it is a lovely building, inside and out. There was a wedding due to start (Saturday) when we went in so it was not possible to walk around the whole of the interior and view the altar area up close.

Fantastic Architecture. As I was on a worktrip in Barcelona I had not really planned any Sightseeing and stumbled across this Cathedral by chance. I was in awe as soon as I walked in, smaller than Sagrada Familia but in no means less exciting and fabolous Architecture I can only rekommend to go and see it. Also pay the small fee to go up on the roof and enjoy the viel over the city.

Understated and awe inspiring. Right in the center of old town, is this gorgeous church. Contrast it to Sagrada Familia and it may seem very plain but it was nonetheless as beautiful in many ways. Walk through the surrounding tiny streets and explore, the atmosphere is beautiful.

Gothic perfection. A glorious, light and airy (and blissfully cool on a hot June day) interior with virtually perfect acoustics. The anarchists ripped out the baroque excretions during the civil war, leaving just the original wall, and it's great.

Lovely gothic reminder of Mary's glory. Handsome Gothic style cathedral which is unusually attractive because of the devastation to it during the Spanish Civil War when it was essentially burned out. The bare walls and pillars enhance the statuary in the side altars which are more modern and plainly artistic than most Gothic churches further north in Europe. Well worth the visit - the small entry fee discourages casual tourists keeping the interior relatively free and quiet

What a wonder. We thought we were "churched out" but then we were introduced to this church by our guide and founder of FoodiesGo, Sonia. To think that fishermen worked all day and then came home and in the late day and evening spent only 55 years to finish this wonder is amazing. The other churches we saw took hundreds of years and the Familiaria is still not finished! A must see.

So beautiful!!. This church is just right next door to my rental flat in Barcelona, so I've witness one of the most beautiful and respectful architecture that I've visited. The amount of visitors that flocking in each day were so much that I felt so privilege that I just stay next door to the cathedral. Highly recommended!
Beautiful Art, peaceful, great place to visit and pray if you want so.. wow this Cathedral is wonderful, the architecture amazing , is free to get in , you have to go .Love everything

Wow. This one of the most beautiful cathedral i ever seen. I went there after 5 pm, so you dont have to pay for entrance. Everyone should visit this place and it will take maybe 25 min out of ur busy trip.
Worth seeing.. It never ceases to amaze how they could build these magnificent ,towering structures hundreds of years ago. Beautiful stained glass.
Great cathedral. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in Barcelona, and it is located in one of the most beautiful areas, so you must visit both the church and the area if you visit Barcelona!
Attractive church. Worth a visit. When we visited there was a wedding which added to the atmosphere. Tucked away In El Born area of the city among the narrow streets. Calm and lovely interior.

Read the book "Cathedral by the Sea" to really appreciate. Just walking in you might not notice that this is a very unusual Gothic Church. Rather than narrow, it is very wide. The construction and design and engineering techniques must have been unique for their time --1300s. The church was built by the workers of the neighborhood
Beautiful interior. Absolutely stunning interior. Worth a visit. Situated in a lovely square with cafe/restaurants giving great views of the exterior.

Beautiful, Welcoming Church. My family and I came to mass here while staying in Barcelona. Everyone was friendly and welcoming us, smiling and inquisitive on where we were from. This is a massive, gothic style building, but inside it is open, airy with plenty of light that illuminates the magnificent details in the structure.

A haven of tranquillity. Despite the large numbers of people who visit, this cathedral manages to seem peaceful. There is a lightness and airiness to it that are rare in Spanish cathedrals. Don't miss the beautiful cloisters. And if you visit after 5.15 entrance is free.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. More beautiful really than the main cathedral in Barcelona, minus the geese of course. It is near the sea, as the name would suggest, and in the Born district near the invaluable Born Market.

Beautiful Church. We had read that St. Mary's was a church we had to see. Considering that we have visited some exquisite churches from Italy to France, we wanted to see St. Mary of the Sea. We headed out on the "Hop On-Hop Off" bus (which I highly recommend), and after a good number of side excursions, we arrived at the location of St. Mary's church ... or at least we thought we had. It seems that St Mary's is down several side streets and is not readily visible from the main streets. And so ... we walked and walked, looking for signs and after 20 minutes or so we asked directions from some people on the street. Unfortunately, they weren't sure at all and so we were about to give up and head back to our bus pick-up location. Fortunately, I heard a small group standing nearby mention St Mary's and they seemed to know where they were going ... and so we followed. Through back streets, turning and turning until I was convinced we were following a lost group. Somehow, we made it to the chuch, which happened to be fairly close to our original dropoff point! Here, on a small street, there were quite a few people standing in front of the church and the doors were locked. While nobody seemed to be standing in line, we waited about 20 minutes in the afternoon sun. We walked around to the side ... locked doors. Around to the back ... locked doors. All of a sudden the back door opened and out walks a man who we ask if we can enter. We are told yes and make a dash for the door. It seems the cathedral was just opening doors for afternoon services and our timing was close to perfect.The Cathedral is beautiful and certainly showed it's age. Much like Saint Germain in Paris and Saint Nicholas in Monaco, it is beautifully ornate and dark inside, although smaller in size. I'd recommend seeing St Mary's before seeing Sagrada Familia only because the latter is so overwhelming that anything else simpy doesn't compare. Definitely glad we visited, even though we only stayed 30 minutes. It is a smaller church and only has the one main floor. Still, a church to put on your list and visit because of it's amazing history!

Cathedral of the sea. It's the setting of the best selling novel and is in a beautiful part of the city. If you visit you need to do the guided tour which finishes on the roof of the building. Spectacular. So much so I got married here (I really did).
Not worth the money. A fancy church but not worth the entrance fee for a quick look around. Religious people would maybe get more out of it.

A contrast to the cathedral.. We slipped in during a wedding thereby avoiding a charge which always seems inappropriate .A gorgeous expression of superb glass & architecture.The cathedral is pretty awe-inspiring too but the impact there is complex & difficult to assimilate.

A Serene & Breathtaking Place. A 14th century religious site which you will enjoy, not as big as Barcelona Cathedral, but a remarkable stained glass you'll probably enjoy and be amaze, a lot of cafés around it and a healthy site to look and watch people come and go. If you want to enjoy Barcelona, visit this place as a wonderful place.
wonderful!. Was passing and popped in, truly beautiful, darkly gothic with beautiful glass windows and the pillars were equal to the sagrada pillars.wow!

Breathtaking Cathedral by the Sea. Beautiful Cathedral with such attention to detail. Breathtaking views of the sea. It was pretty chilly the day we visited but it was well worth it. We enjoyed the shops nestled away on the narrow streets.

Nice Cathedral. Actually visited in May 2013, but TripAdvisor won't let me go back that far.
The location is nice. There are cafes around the square by the cathedral, so it is a good place to grab some tapas and people watch.

Most remarkable!. Go see this place. Seriously. Accepted, it is not the opulence of the Barcelona Cathedral, but it is seriously beautiful. The fact that it is not as visited a sight by the tourists as the Barcelona Cathedral also really benefits the visitors that do come, since there is more of a sense of presence and reverence than the mob that tends to be in the main Cathedral. Be aware it is not quite as well documented as the Barcelona Cathedral, but go just to take in the space, and the immensity of it all. Myself and two other travelling companions were so taken with this cathedral we returned again after our initial visit, and got to see it at sunset. Absolutely worth the stop.
Wonderful experience.. You couldn't come to Barcelona and not visit this cathedral, the stained glass windows alone are worth it. A great visit!
Serene. We visited this beautiful place on a warm Sunday evening and sat at the back taking in the the sights and sounds of mass,whilst appreciating the architecture ,a truly uplifting experience.
It's really cool.. This a a really cool old church. It is interesting to see the detail and the amount of money that the church in Europe had throughout history. Definitely worth seeing.

An Impressive Medieval Cathedral. This is an impressive medieval cathedral. There is a nice prayer chapel on one side of the church if you would like some time for quiet meditation. There is no admission fee and it is well worth a quick visit.

Small but worth a visit. We always take time to poke our heads in to the various churches we run across. We were in Barcelona right before Christmas and had the good fortune of listening to a small presentation when we wandered in. As always, it's best to simply find a seat and quietly appreciate everything you see

Worth a Peek!. If you're in the Gothic Quarter, you should definitely peek in here. It's free, but make sure you're wearing appropriate clothing before you go in. The cathedral is a great representation of traditional gothic and Spanish architecture. The architecture is the main event here, unless you come for mass.

Rough style facade. An old majestic church with a rough style stone facade,situated in Ciutat Vella.A lot of stained glass windows,beautiful slender stone columns,a big rose window above the main door.

Mass very welcoming to visitors. Beatiful Cathedral, on a lovely square. I was told by a local friend that this was the favourite church of local residents and I understand why. Cathedral has a very mellow and welcoming atmosphere.

Beautiful and Living Church. Slip into this cool, stone building and find yourself moved by evidence of centuries of worship. This isn't a polished up and tourist-focused monument. It is real and engaging. Candles and flowers still adorn many of the side chapels. The scent of incense and beeswax is in the air and believers are kneeling in prayer in front of the altar. Lovely windows, exquisite statuary and impressive architecture is almost a bonus!

Breathtakingly beautiful cathedral. Exquisite Gothic cathedral with a minimum of decoration. Soaring columns and ceiling. As one guidebook says, "it's as if the columns were being drawn upwards by gravity".Sign up for the tour - you'll get to go to the choir areas (and where the king sat) and see spectacular views of the whole cathedral, including some of the stained glass windows. Then you are taken onto the roof! You get a 360-degree perambulation around the roof, with great views of Barcelona. As good as the rooftop of Chartres Cathedral! Our tour guide was great. The tour is well worth E10. Note, however, that there's misleading info on the website and at the front door about when the English tours are.

fasinating. We read the book that detailed the building of this church in the 12th century. It is called "Cathedral of the Sea" and is written by Illones Falcones, so a visit to this church was a must on our agenda. As we toured the church was preparing for a wedding in the next hour so there was an extraordinary singer in the church..beautiful!
Beautiful church. Went to see the church after brunch and it was a nice experience. Many details and nice architecture. In my opinion a beautiful church but nothing outstanding.

Soaring church. A splendid church. Right in the middle of El Born, free to enter (unlike the Cathedral) with wonderful, soaring views and spectacular glass. A glorious atmosphere regardless of whether you give a fig about the religious.

near passeig del born. this is v v close to our accommodation .......... simple, outstanding & soooooo worthwhile ...pls visit because it represents more what church is about - for the people by the people .....

Lovely old church. There is beautiful art here, but we especially enjoyed a trip to the roof. I think it was 2 or 3 euros each, and well worth it for the views. People also really enjoyed the geese in the cloister.
A nice old church. A place to visit, but i don't undestand why we have to pay to enter a church (5€). Nice chapels inside. Many restaurants around this church.

Beautiful and definitely worth seeing. The architecture is absolutely extraordinary and the history is also really interesting. It's in the Gothic quarter which you'll probably want to see anyway so this is definitely worth looking at. The admission price is reasonable and totally worth it.

Great if you know the History. If you research the church a little bit, it is a very rewarding visit. Still cool to visit if you have time and haven't done the research, but you can only go into so many churches before you feel like you're seeing the same thing.

Amazing. An amazing structure - worth wandering around the Gothic QUarter just to locate this.
Also worth doing this at night when the church is illuminated!
Lost of cafe's nearby with inflated prices, but it is all part and parcel of Barcelona.
