Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful examples of Gothic churches. If you have only time to visit one church in Barcelona, I would recommend this one.
They also do tours of the church and let you climb up the roof where you have a marvellous view.

Must See. Not only is St Mary's a must see, but it sits in a great area and the neighborhood and shops and restaurants surrounding the church are great. St Mary's is a very different feel and cathedral than the Sagrada and one of the oldest in the city. great history and great architecture.
Average Cathedral. If you have the time, visit. If you don't, you will have missed nothing. There are many more beautiful and interesting cathedrals around the world.
Impressive church. A bit off the beaten track, but close to the Picasso Museum and the Santa Caterina market. Quite an impressive, spare, cathedral; worth a visit. Not crowded

A Church. Well worth a visit, especially interesting if you have read the book.
"Cathedral of the sea"
A step back in time and don't forget the engravings at either side of the main alter.
You won't believe this!. Built totally with donations and donated labor, this church stands in contrast to the church's hierarchy and influence. A moving expression of the feelings of real people.

A nice Church, but if perhaps needs context?. I've seen quite a few church in my time and have to say this one was kind of unexceptional. But I did like the glass mosaics, and I think it would've been better if I climbed up to the upper levels as I just stayed on the ground level. However it is a lovely place for a bit of quiet contemplation, and it's free. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it though.

Magnificent and impressive !!. This is one of the most beautiful churches and the view as you enter the church is magnificent and impressive. It gives you calm and peace as soon as you enter the church and the beautiful intricate work on the glass windows leaves one spell bound ! Visited with my family last week and the views are still fresh in my mind. The atmosphere outside the church is lively and festive. We visited on Sunday, as the mass was going certain areas were restricted, but one could stand and listen to the choir and mass in progression.Definitely visit this if you are visiting the Palace of Catalan Music, as it is walkable distance from Palace of Catalan Music. Cover your arms if wearing sleeveless. There is no entrance fee.
Inspiring. Wonderful spiritual experience being able to celebrate mass with all. Cloisters is exceptionally inspiring .
Simply Magnificent!. Beautiful, centuries old, gorgeous. Words fail to describe the cathedrals of Barcelona this being the central one in the city.

Simple but moving. This is the church depicted in the novel Cathedral of the Sea. It is rather plain but moving particularly if you have read the novel. It was not crowded and thus it was possible to sit in silence and think about the history of this place.
Worth a view. Very nice, not a religious person but this place touches you and makes you think about things, you should visit.
Beautiful Cathedral. We accidentally "bumped" into this church while walking around and it was a wonderful surprise for us. Really a beautiful church and worth taking the time to visit. 5 Stars!
Great experience. Situated in the middle of the busy city, this cathedral is a beautiful place to pray and relax. Entry is free.

Beautiful proportions. This sweet church was an unexpected surprise while walking the city with my friend. It was evening so we got in free. The gothic proportions of the church are perfect, we sat down to take in the illumination and atmosphere of the interior space. A much more spiritual experience than the hordes in La Sagrada Familia.
Special for the evening. You cannot visit Barcelona and skip this prime place for the evening. Surrounded by bars and restaurant, it gives the best ambience for your tapas or dinner.
Very nice church!!!. A very nice church!!! Really enjoyed it!!! Really worth visiting!!! a great piece of art!! Dont miss it!
Free after 5pm. Much the same as the cathedral however after 5 you don't pay so enjoy a free look before local tapas.
Lovely. Fabulous place to pop into to visit. Brilliant views, centrally located, lovely to have a spot if lunch outside too!

All light, gorgeous light. More stunning than Barcelona's Cathedral. It's façade lights up the whole plaza in different ways depending on the time of day. It was built by the community of the time so it took them only 70 years to finish it. You can see that the builders were not experts just looking at the walls, all the more charming. Worth the visit a lot. Then walk to Mercat del Born and have gelato on the way (on a corner, right hand side, forgot the name of the gelateria, but trust me, you'll looove it). May I suggest nocciola.
better than the Sagrada Familia. I think that this church is the best one in Barcelona. It is really amazing. much older than the famous sagrada familia it has muchmore to say. must see
Spiritual. Set in a square surrounded by cafes etc it is most imposing. It is well worth a look inside as it truly is a beautiful church.

smaller cathedral, still very much worth it. This is the smaller, lesser known cathedral of Barcelona, but it's equally worth a visit. The great thing about this cathedral is that entry is actually free and it's less busy.

Tranquil. Beautiful, impressive and tranquil. After a few moderniste experiences - some good some bad! it was very soothing to be in the old city where the buildings are reassuringly classical. Amazing stained glass windows.
Hidden Gem. Entry is free for on the Sundays and other times just a few Euros which are certainly worth as it is far more quiet during the week
beautiful. The architecture was unbelievable. The talent of the artists was amazing. Just to look at the story they were able to tell.
nice tranquil spot to relax. If you wish to relax and spend a bit of quiet time the basilica is worth visiting, i witnessed a wedding here and quite surreal and thoroughly enjoyable.
Beautiful. Beautiful gothic church in the old town. Too often people bypass this treasure for the larger cathedral a few blocks away. Don't miss this though - its simple and beautiful.

First-rate gothic architecture. Simpler than many of the other Barcelona churches, the soaring columns and arches, plus the multiple stained-glass windows make this a beautiful place to visit at any time. Note: after perhaps 5pm, entry fee is waved - don't wait - pay the fee and see it before the crowds descend.

Mystic Church. this church is more than a work of art, it is mystic. if you have read "la catedral del mar" you will understand. if you have not, get the book and read it. it will give you a unique history of old barcelona and then when you visit, you will be transported back in time. dont miss this church.

I know I'm supposed to love it, but. To my mind, it's just a very large and very old cathedral that could use a clean up. I know that sounds ignorant of me, given the high ratings it gets by Trip Advisor reviewers, but, seriously, I have to say that when I walked inside I was a bit disappointed.

Beautiful old church. Our apartment was right around the corner from this church, so we had the benefit of seeing the bell tower lit up at night. Inside the highlight is the stained glass, especially when the light catches it just right, and the nativity set up down in the crypt.

Built in fourteenth century, awesome.. Beautiful old church, wonderful stained glass. The age of this edifice the architecture all add up to a sum total of overwhelmingly awesome.
A truly must visit.

Lovely Gothic Cathedral. In Barri Gotic area, beautiful from inside and out. Various saints have sections dedicated to them along the inside walls. Plenty of carvings and sculptures to gaze upon. Lovely area to wander about, check out the side streets.

Take the guided tour. This is a beautiful traditional church but the real gem is in the guided tour. For longer than an hour, we were personally guided around the cathedral, inside and out -- even stood on the roof. Historically informative and stunning views!

Beautiful!. As so many other reviewers have commented, this is a beautiful church. There was no entrance fee and it was just beautiful. The architecture and the stained glass, so wonderful. We were there on a Sunday so we weren't sure we'd get to go inside but got there shortly before 10 am and were there as the doors opened. Had a nice peaceful walk through before many people got there. Just a beautiful church.
Read the book. If you can, read Ildofonso Falcones's historical fiction novel "Cathedral of the Sea" to help it come more alive for you.
Great area. A terrific church to visit. we loved the whole area where it is situated with plenty of food and drinking places. Easily spend half a day around here
Beautiful church. Dark but lovely stain glass windows. We didn't pay an entrance fee. Apparently there is a 2 year waiting list to get married here!

Beautiful Gothic Church!. It is worth going inside to see the stained glass and huge high ceilings and marvelous Gothic Architecture! A treasure to be sure! Caught a wedding while there and that was great! We were lucky to listen to some lovely classical strings while sitting in the Cathedral and taking in the antiquity and splendor of the massive walls stone arches!

So attractive. I had about 15-20 minutes here as we stopped on the way to the meeting. It was just amazing. Very original style catholic church. Very fascinating. It was quite dark in there but so beautiful. I will definitely go back there again next time I have a chance to be in Barcelona.
Hidden treasure. We went to that area for a meal, but before finding the recommended restaurant we came inside to visit this wonderful gothic church.
beautiful stained glass. The stained glass in this church includes not only traditional artistic styles, but also a couple of windows done in modernist styles.

The Cathedral of The Sea, Santa Maria del Mar. A wondeful example of the gothic architecture in Barcelona. A church that was build thanks to the hard work of the traders and the generosity of all the people of Barcelona.
Hidden gem. Close to the Picasso museum with a gorgeous Rose window. Thankfully. Not as much gold gilt as the other church's

Superb cathedral. An early glimpse of the Catalan genius for the built environment. A beautiful, harmonic, organic space with a genuine suggestion of later invention. Superbly clean lines, light and proportion. A wonderful example of Catalan gothic and only 5 minutes from the Cathedral. Surely a must for a lover of culture.

The unobvious but worthwhile choice.... There are the two iconic destinations (Sagrada Familia and Cathedral Barcelona) but this is that basilica...you know, the one that isn't obvious and yet just as much an eyeful as its more touristed peers. Just do it and its surrounding passages.

Some say the finest of cathedrals. Incredibly beautiful and far less crowded than the La Cathedral. It sits on a beautiful, small square. Wonderful architecture and you truly feel the weight of the centuries of Barcelona history.
Take a look. Nice old church. There was no fee on the Sunday morning when we got there. Liked the architecture and the rose window.
Peoples Church. We arrived at this Church just as they were opening their doors for the afternoon viewing. With very few people inside, was easy to reflect on beauty and take some great pictures.

See it. This is another place to put on your list. It's very impressive and worth a look. There are some times when entry is free, so that may be worth looking into. It's near the port and places like Parc de la Ciutadella, Museu d'Historia de Catalunya, or Placa de l'Angel aren't too far away.

Quintissential Catalan Church. Probably more attractive and interesting than the cathedral itself, probably less crowded as an entrance fee is levied. Simple design with many side chapels and a soaring nave.

What a surprise. Well worth a look at. It is so peaceful and cool inside even though there are many tourist. Colours of the Stain glass windows was beautiful. It may have a different atmosphere in the busy summer months.

Quiet retreat. Reading up on the history of the Cathedral would probably increase one's appreciation for it as it is not very impressive, untill you really consider that it was built in the 12th century (Suddenly the structure becomes more impressive, doesn't it?). However, it does provide a quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle outside. The reviews mention a fee to get in, however I visited it on Thurs. after 7pm and it was free. If I had to pay to get in, I would most probably pass.
atmospheric. Worth the walk. Try to go at a quiet time so that you can appreciate the calm. Go early in your visit as there are often concerts.
walking around. The cathederal was absolutely fantastic! the surrounding area was equally astonishing! The architecture of the area and era is fabulous.

If you like churches. Historically significant and very close to the beach. Outer taxi driver said to watch our wallets but not to worry. We added the beachfront after and enjoyed our entire afternoon.

A delightful surprise. Our guidebooks gave this site a "good," so we didn't visit until our last day. Glad we didn't miss it. Underneath the cathedral is an excellent roman ruins site - the audio guide will help you appreciate what you are looking at. Best site of it's kind I've seen.
Beautiful church. Impressive cathedral and one of the most memorable sights of El Born. You don't have to pay an entrance fee if you manage to get there in the morning or in the afternoon.
A wonderful, atmospheric church. This is a little off the beaten track but easily accessible and in the middle of the city. It is a beautiful church and very peaceful / spiritual.
Read about it first. Beautiful church from the outside. Didn't know if it was open to tour inside. Needed to read the history about it first so it can appreciated first.
Read the book first. If you really want to appreciate this church read Cathedral of The Sea if you are planning to come, if not you may miss a lot but will still find it a beuty
Nice local cathedral. A lovely traditional cathedral located in a very nice neighborhood. -- not as large as the Cathedral of Barcelona and not as spectacular as Sagrada Famiia

Gothic Church near Picasso Museum. This is a beautiful 14th Century Medieval Church with flying buttresses and lovely stained glass that catches the sunlight. A short 2-5 minute walk from the Picasso Museum, it was popular with sailors who left replicas of their ships at the foot of the St. Mary statue for safe travels over the seas. Nice Cathedral to see especially if visiting Picasso nearby.
Simply spiritually and architecturally spectacular. However, challenging to locate and only one mass a day. Just wish we could be here on Sunday. Next time!

Great sense of community. The Cathedral was tucked away in-between lots of other buildings but we found it easily and really glad we did, it was a little gem. There were lots of small school trips going on at the time and the children were so well behaved alongside the elderly couples and small families - there was a great sense of community spirit welcoming you into the building. Around the Cathedral there are lots of small alleyways of independent shops & great restaurants - this is one of the really good spots to eat.

Haunting and achingly beautiful.. So unlike the fabled Sagrada del Familia across town, this ancient church is architecturally similar to most of the great stone cathedrals. But its story, its survival despite the devastating arson fire that stripped it bare of the icons and decorations, and the blackened stones that prove it, lend it a haunting quality, especially at night when we visited amid dim lighting and flickering candles.
Very peaceful. My wife and I stumbled upon this cathedral while walking around and went in to get a bit of peace. I'd definitely come back to this cathedral. Very peaceful.

Favorite Cathedrals. One of my 2 favorite cathedrals. Majestic architecture, breathtaking building, and great history. This imposing structure is not overly ornate, but relies on its purity of form to impress.

The most important church to visit in Barcelona. Yes of course Sagrada Familia is a must, but it is more like architectural masterpiece. There is no such holiness as in Basilika of Santa Maria del Mar. Before my first trip to Barcelona I read the book 'Cathedral by the Sea'. That book gave me so deep impact from the history and living in 14th century that visiting Santa Maria del Mar had to be done. The church is plain and simple and full of life and history.

Beautiful and free!!!. No wait!! Walked right in it wasn't to busy. Great place wether you are Catholic or not. More peaceful than Sagrada Familia if you are looking to have a moment of peace or prayer. Free is hard to find in Spain so take advantage! Beautiful arctitexure!

Beautiful!. A lot of history in this beautiful cathedral. It was stripped of much of the ornamentation in the Spanish civil war so it has a rustic/haunting appeal. We love visiting Cathedrals and this one is a beauty! Free, just walk in and take in the glorious atmosphere.

Just run of the mill. This is what you would expect there was no wow factor something to pass an hour away. They still had the nativity display out which seemed strange. Go during the week as you have to pay to get in on a Sunday

This is not a cathedral. The cathedral of Barcelona is St Eulalia, not far away. (There can be only one Roman Catholic cathedral per city.) St Maria is remarkably beautiful and well worth a visit. There is an admission charge (€6) some days but not others.
Hauntingly beautiful. Loved the history, the story, the architecture and the surroundings..Go look for the easter egg tile in the church.
A must. A must! Anybody interested in Medieval Cathedrals will find this modest but grand church an amazing structure and creation.

Description: Built in the fourteenth century, this cathedral is one of the most important religious centers in Barcelona. Cathedral seems nestled among surrounding buildings and only having yourself to it grabs you with genuine charm and delicate Gothic look. It is an integral part of the entire Gothic district and displayed in original size it appeared medieval town with its public buildings and squares that were the center of life then.
Beautiful, and Breathtaking Too. A must-see sight. A spectacular 14th century church in terms of both its construction and beautiful stained glass windows. Do not miss.

Simple and beautiful. Had read the book 'Cathedral by the Sea' so was stoked to see this church in real life to bring the book to life (imagine carrying rocks down from montjuic to the water front!!!). Very simple but oh so beautiful. Feels so light and clean and spiritual. Nice for a quiet moment.

Gothic Splendour. Must see place of startling beauty and splendour.As with a lot of places in Barcelona it is hidden from sight and you have to travel through narrow but lovely streets to get there.This is a working place, so bear in mind when you visit.There is no entrance fee, which is always a bonus. Whilst in the building you can just sit back and look up at the roof, and the stain glassed windows which are stunning. You are free to walk around, and photos are allowed, expect when services are being conducted.Within the Gottica/Cathedral area of Barcelona so a must see on your trip.
Simple but gorgeous!. The church is very simple but is breathtaking! And the history behing it´s construction is very interesting!
Beautiful place. Almost all "churched out" on this trip to Europe, this would still be one you should do. Beautiful on the inside.

The must when you visit Barcelona. You cannot visit the city and forget this spectacular cathedral. Early gothic with a significant and remarcable historic frame has to be understood from the point of view of the time it was built back in the XIV century, with the contributions of the people in the "Barri de Rivera". Do not forget it!!
Very nice gothic cathedral. Not the most impressive on the inside, very plain. The front looks great from the square, especially at night.
Wow!. The most special place in the old city!A must see when in Barcelona. And after the visit go to one of the many bodega's around the cathedral.
A nice suprise. We came across this by accident, having gotten a bit lost in the streets. It is nice inside, enjoyable for myself as well as the two kids with me.
Trip to mediaval. Very interesting to be there and to feel the whole atmosphere. From historic point of view it was amazing as well
A delightful cathedral....... This cathedral is in the Gothic Quarter, I believe, and is really something to see. Lots of people there but no admission. No trouble getting in to see it.

One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen!. I recently got married and I wish we had seen THIS church to get married in first!! The most beautiful church i have seen in my life! A Gothic masterpiece and very moving!! A hidden gem in Barcelona!!

Beautyfull and intim. A wonderfull church, with a quiet asthmopfare, more nice than the big Catedral. Often there are concerts, and worth attending.
The history is worth paying attention.

Waste of time. It is very old and beautiful and I appreciated experiencing it but I do feel that you should not choose this over somewhere else. It was not worth the walk/drive. Very dark, dusty, and bland.

Lovely cathedral. I loved it much more than the sagrada familia
has much less lines to enter and really a magnificent place.

Lovely small nave. Saw a classical guitar concert. The concert was superb and the sitting was nothing less than transporting--small audience in an intimate spot, candlelit. Just wonderful. But careful--it's not easy to find.
lovely old church just how it was built. its great to see a lovely stunning old church still in use just how it was meant to be .free entry loads of people stopping just to pray and light a candle
Beautiful architecture. Check out the small images carved all around the arched entry door - each one is unique and different. Visit for free Thursday after 5pm (verify time).

Beautiful Church. We really enjoyed our visit to Santa Maria del Mar. It was very interesting see this church after reading a novel by the same name.
Santa Maria del Mar's architecture is a complete contrast to the better known La Sagrada Familia.
Santa Maria del Mar. Santa Maria del Mar is an amazing cathedral. Take note, during certain hours of the day there is an admission charge, but it is not much and definitely worth it.

simple beauty. We toured this church by accident on night when we got lost looking for a particular restaurant.We entered by the rear door just before closing. We felt invited in by the light streaming from inside.We had time to soak in the beauty of Gothic simplicity. Please appreciate it's history which includes community, independence and strength. I loved the two statues of Maria that I found each with their ship to protect. The priest soon asked all of the visitors to leave and we went on our way to our dinner reservation.
Beutiful. I have visited before but this time I had read the book "Cathedral by the Sea" so I looked with "new eyes" this inspiring monument. I attended part of the service which was very nice.
Yes!. What a beautifull Chruch ,amazing catlana gothic. Really nice, even if the price to get in is 3 euros... Go to the terraces upstairs !

A Remarkable Church. This incredible basilica is situated near the Gothic quarter and is surrounded by some wonderful restaurants. But, the church itself is quite remarkable. Originally built in the 14th century the inside has been recently rebuilt after it was burnt out during the Franco purges of the late 1930s. The interior is huge and imposing with the most incredible pillars. It is a 10-minute walk from the Cathedral and just as impressive.

Old church. If anything valuable to see is about its history. This is where my wallet was snatched by one joker who pretended to show me a business card after doing a flamingo dance. If you happen to walk around the Gotic area then just pay a visit and snap a picture. There is nothing to lose if you miss it.

Absolutely Beautiful. If you read Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones or not do not miss this Cathedral. The interior decoration is outstanding. When you consider how this Cathedral was constructed you will look at it with new appreciation.

Stunningly beautiful architecture. This church is located in the La Ribera and the admission is free. Take note of the time though. When we were there at 12:50, the guards asked everyone to leave and closed the church. The guidebook said there was free admission from 9-1:30 and then again from 4:30-8:00 in the afternoon. The wooden doors and especially the sculptures above the doors are interesting. Money from the shippers built this church. The buttresses inside the cathedral are really spectacular.

Classic gothic cathedral. An excellent example of Spanish gothic architecture and set in an excellent part of town. Being in the old part of Barcelona the streets are sometimes narrow and confusing but don't let this put you off as it's in an area rich in history, good restaurants and atmosphere.
A Must See. One of the finest Gothic churches I have ever seen. Right up there with Notre Dame, or York Cathedral (my other two personal favorites.
Cathedral. Amazing structure appearing from narrow walkways and small shops. Truly beautiful. We saw it by accident on walking the gothic querter and was pleasantly surprized.

A counterpoint to La Sagrada..... Much more traditional cathedral in the gothic quarter. Worth a visit for the interior. The multi level aspect to both this cathedral and La Sagrada are interesting. The side courtyard is a welcome respite in the midst of the bustle of the city.

Make this your first stop in the Born District. The church is somber and beautiful and a wonderful meeting place for exploring the Born District. Perhaps one of the most interesting neighborhoods in Barcelona, El Born is like hanging out in the West Village in NYC. The church´s simplicity and history provide great perspective on Barcelona´s history.

Architecture at its best. This church has a lot of hidden gems. The courtyard with geese and chickens was a surprise. All the intricate carvings for the different prayer stations are very impressive. Although everything is gated, makes you feel unwelcome, but I understand why they do it. 6€ to get in a nod tour yourself. Make sure that you go through every doorway. Lots to see on the sides, not just the sanctuary. Loved all the stained glass, and the paintings on huge ceiling were stunning. Lots of space in the main sanctuary, crowds out front are had to get through, but once you are inside it is sparse.

Beautiful church. I've been lucky to get in just before they closed so I did not find many tourists. It was awesome, it is a huge church that impresses with its tremendous breadth and sense of grandeur, I have gone after the visit really overwhelmed with so much beauty and peace.As I came out I went just in front there is a nice square with lots of bars and Little restaurants , so I had a few tapas in a tapas bar and I have dined delicious tapas and cheaply¡¡¡

The best church in town.. This was arguably the most beautiful church I visited in Barcelona. Less famous then Gaudi's Sagrada Familia, it's very airy inside and it has the largest arch span of all the Gothic churches whatsoever. Very exciting historical background-Zafon wrote a novel based on it. The building has a charismatic air around it, it's magnetic inspite of being bulky, which is partly due to the delicate towers and the square around it.
I want to get married here!. I have seen churches in many places, but this one moved me so much! If I get married one day, I want it to be HERE! This church is amazing. Full of amazing beauty!

Very nice. Amazing inside and out, felt so much at peace just sitting there in silience for a while, its like you forget everything and just live in the moment. Very nice, loved it and would defenitly go back when im in barcelona again.

Powerful stone architecture. Very different to many churches and cathedrals in europe. Inside there is not many paintings or murials - it is all about the powerful gothic stone and amazing detail and sculptures. Free to enter and such an impressive building both from the outside and inside.

Beautiful old church. This is an impressive, lovely church. We enjoyed sitting in the back and soaking it all in. It is not garish like so many old churches are. It is nothing like the Gaudi church, but it is well worth a stop. The inside is plain, yet very open and beautiful. It is in a great neighborhood.

that's music!. Nice old cathedral. It has it's beauty and we were lucky enough to be there at a moment where a classic play was being held. That was really what we needed after a huge walk and with the heavy rain that was happening outside.

A Beautiful Cathedral. I know you are thinking, what another Cathedral to visit. St Mary is an important piece of the history of Spain and Barcelona. It has it's own unique beauty and is a great place to visit. Provides a wonderful memory of your visit to take with you home.

The lack of interior decoration is important!. This gothic cathedral in El Born is beautiful on the outside and inside, but its history is what we found fascinating. There is very little interior adornment, and the reason is that, during the Spanish Civil War, the locals expressed their resentment of the church's siding with Franco by tearing out and burning the wooden furniture and all of the décor. Look up to the ceiling and you will see the carbon from the fire. It's these little bits of local history that bring a site to life for me!
A Soaring Gothic Cathedral. This is the traditional counterpoint to Gaudi's Sagrada Familia. Dark, in the traditional Gothic style, but still awe-inspiring in its sweeping grandeur.

Gaudi's inspiration. Another great gem in Barcelona. Grab a bite to eat at cafe just outside front of church and listen to the strolling musicians that are always there. Once inside notice the enormous columns which gave Gaudi his inspiration for Sagrada Familia. Usually there is organ music playing inside. Exit on the right side and you will come to a memorial to the brave Catalans who fought for succession from the Madrid Bourbons in 1714. It is a short walk to the Picasso Museum from here and lots of unique shops and nice cafe's to grab a bite on the way.

Serene. After seeing much of Barcelona's ornate and intricate architecture, I found this Cathedral, built in the Middle Ages, sublimely serene and relatively uncluttered. Enormously tall columns inside and the beautiful stained glass windows, I found this to be the most beautiful of churches I saw. A bonus to the visit was a marriage ceremony which had just ended. The glamorous bride and groom, along with fabulously dressed guests enhanced the splendour of the Cathedral and gave an unexpected photo opportunity.

Stunning, moving basilica. We stopped in the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Mar on our way to dinner at a tapas restaurant in El Born. We had visited La Segrada Familia earlier in the day and honestly felt equally moved by this beautiful Gothic church. We stayed for the evening mass and were awed by how the soft lighting beautifully illuminated the majestic arches and how the acoustics projected the service and the music perfectly.I was impressed that mass has been offered here to tens of thousands of people for more than 600 years. Don't miss visiting this cathedral. We paid no entrance fee but gladly made a donation for it's preservation and upkeep. This was one of my favorite moments in this wonderful city.

Magnificent interior. Forbidding but impressive exterior, but go inside and another world is opened up to you. Incredible height which means that the sturdy columns supporting the weight of the roof actually look delicate and slender. Wonderful sense of space. Some great stained glass. Soothing or exhilarating, according to your mood. (The reference in an earlier review to a fee and geese pertain to another cathedral).
Well worth a visit!. Its amazing to see how wonderful this church is considering the short time that it was built in. Part of the Free Old City Runner Bean Tour.

A bit on the dark side. The church is willing to take your money but are only put a minimum effort in the experience. The cloister was under hoardings and there was no explanation apparent as to the geese. The monstrance was poorly displayed and curated. The display case did not pass the white glove test and my fingers came away black after I ran them over the glass. There should be a quid pro quo for the admission.

The church with unick atmosphere. We were looking gor Picasso Museum in the area and occasionally stepped there. Even after visiting the Cathedral of Sant Eulalia the same day and famous cathedrals in Zaragoza two days before the beauty of this church struck you immediately. The simple decor, odor of candles, huge rose window it give you incredible filling of grandeur.
Glorious. This is a beautiful church that sits within a pretty plaza close to the Roman wall. There are dinky craft stalls nearby that can entertain those who get tired of all the culture!

Beautiful.. We're not Catholics, nor religious, but do not miss out on seeing this place. The stained glass windows/doors, the architecture, the peace & quiet, the service is second to none. Free to enter. Do not miss it.

Gothic. The Basilica of Santa Maria del Mar stands in a small plaza. The building is tall, narrow and long. We did not go in as there was an admission charge.However, beside the cathedral is the Fosar de les Moreres. It once was the cemetary, and it is thought that the heroes of the war in September 1714 were buried here. Now, there is just a plaque.

candels in the night. The atmosphere in the evening, when all the candles are burning in the catherdral and she is very dark inside .it is very quite and special.the doors are open and outside there are narrow streets only for persons and busy life in the bars and restaurants.

So peaceful. On our trip we visited the Cathedral and Santa Maria del Mar. Del Mar was my favourite - the lighting is stunning, it appears to be lit by candles. It is such a relaxing place, so atmospheric and stunning. I really recommend.

Beautiful Cathedral in Gothic Quarter. Make sure to stop into the Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar if you are in the Gothic Quarter. Based in the center of a beautiful square in Bacelona this cathedral is well worth the visit. Depending on the time of day you visit the Cathedral there may or may not be an entry fee. I visited the Cathedral twice; the first time there was an entry fee and the second time there was not. This was my favorite Cathedral in Barcelona. After your visit, make sure to stop by one of the many outdoor cafes in the nearby square for a glass of Cava!
beautiful. There is a small wine bar in the square outside of the Cathedral that has great wine and food. Musicians were entertaining when we were there. Many locals frequent this wine bar.
The most beautiful church of Barcelona. I think it is the most beautiful gothic church in the city built by the people of Barcelona. The surroundings of the church are also really beautiful.

In the shadow of Sagrada Familia. It is a pity for the cathedral to be in the same city as Sagrada Familia because if it wasn't, it would get much more attention and praise. But even with such a big competitor in the same city, it is still a very impressive piece of architecture. And quite frankly it is somehow refreshing compared to the many Gaudi things which capture so much of Barcelona if you visit the city with a guidebook. However there is one thing which it is not and tha is huge. If you want to be stunned and awed, you need to go to Sagrada Familia.
Well worth a visit. A fine and elegant cathedral located at the edge of the old town. The outside front is spectacular for photos of a large city structure.

Just an ordinary cathedral. If you've seen a lot of European cathedrals you can skip this one unless you need a place to rest. Only outstanding feature are the tree-like columns which reportedly were an inspiration to Antoni Gaudi.

interesting Cathedral. This Cathedral has an interesting history being built in just over 50 years in the 1300s by the port workers and funded by the local merchants, not the wealthy nobility like the Barcelona Cathedral. In an interesting neighbor. Recommend reading the historical fiction book The Cathedral by the Sea before your visit to Barcelona.

Historically Interesting, but not Impressive. This is not the most beautiful church I have ever seen, and the lighting does not do much to improve on that. However, the historical significance of the church made it worth the visit.

Santa Maria del Mar. Despite having 2 teenagers in tow to whom cathedrals have limited appeal, it was well worth a 20 minute stop off while walking round the gothic quarter for a quiet contemplation at the amazing interior.
Loved it. Did you know that there are tours on the roof of the Cathedral? We lived so close to the Cathedral that could hear organ playing when resting on the bed.

A beautiful little cathedral near the harbor!!. After a long stroll down Las Ramblas and along the harbor in Barcelona, this was a site worth seeking out for some peaceful refuge. It is on a quiet street and on the way to the Picasso Museum. So, it is definitely a stop to make along the way.
For church-goers everywhere. One of the best. The moment you enter this massive church an air of calm descends. Beautiful, historic.

beautiful cathedral. this is a lovely cathedral in the gothic quarter. it's centrally located right by the Picasso museum. beautiful stained glass and architecture. it's a peaceful place in the middle of chaos! we'll worth the visit.

A place of great harmony. This is one of the most impressive churches I have sen: majestatic jet elegant and simple in a way. Especially if you enter on a hot and hectic day, it is very calm and inviting!
Beautiful!

Traditional Cathedral. On exploring the Gothic Quarter you stumble upon this very traditional Cathedral which is free to go into. Worth a visit, as it s very grand, completely different to Gaudi's Sagrada Famillia.

Lovely atmosphere at Santa Maria del Mar. we found the atmosphere here really peaceful and spiritually focused, unlike our experience of La Sagrada Familia which seemed by contrast to be a bit commercialised, a bit too noisy and full of people taking photos (us included, of course!). We went back for an evening service on Sunday and it was lovely to sit there in the early evening light, waiting for the service to begin. Have to say I didnt follow much of the service, as it was in Spanish, but it was good to see the church working within its community, and a good crowd of people (locals and visitors) coming in to take part, some only for a short while, others for longer.
areal cathedral. This is what a cathedral should look like old and worn and the views from the roof overlooking Barcelona are on a clear day fantastic.
Disappointing. I was a little disappointed with this visit - the cathedral was beautiful, but there were other attractions that were more interesting to visit if you are on a tight schedule.

Austere but atmospheric. This old church, unlike other tourist attractions, is a real place of worship. Visitors are allowed in for free and can take photographs as long as no service is taking place.

this is a must for real barcelona lovers. If you really want to get involved with Barcelona, this is the place to visit. Even more than the gothic cathedral in the barrio gotico this is the religious spot for local people. Some good info is provided when you enter on your right in spanish, catalan and english and a walk woill take about 1 hour. Enjoy the stained glass, the overall building and see the tombstone of the wealthy inhabitants on the floor, dating back to 17th and 18th century. Nearby area is lively with some nice restaurants, bars and terraces and.....less tourist then in the central part of town (e.g Ramblas)

A Typical Spanish Cathedral. Well worth the visit as the interior is so very typical. Good for a few moments of contemplation in a busy world and a busy city. The Plaza and streets around the cathedral are well worth an hour or so. Cafes/bars can be expensive in this area of the city.

Not just another church.. Take the time to make a visit while walking in the Gothic Quarter. There is a lot of history here and the doors are particularly interesting because they depict the workers who actually built the church.

Church. This beautiful building is a Basilica, not a Cathedral. Is is very old and a stunning architecture. A fine representation of Catalan culture. It is located in one of the older parts of the city, which are now very clean and safe.

A very spiritual moment. Considered the people's church, we enjoyed two visits to this church on our first and last days in Barcelona. We met friends for breakfast our first day at one of the outdoor cafe's in front of the church. Afterward we stepped inside to observe this wonderful building and were very happy we did. If you want a quiet moment of peace in a beautiful setting, stop by here.
Peaceful place. Nice cathedral with a serene atmosphere. Peaceful. Worth a visit if you are in the area but maybe not worth a special detour.
Impressive structure. Impressive gothic architecture but bland interior. Visit the small interior chapel behind the main altar. Entry fee €3 and €2 extra to climb the towers.

A beautiful cathedral. Don´t miss the tour of the terraces. I have been to this cathedral hundreds of times. It is one of my favorites because it is so svelte, with its thin columns, its tall lateral naves which require no flying buttresses and the fact that all the religious stuff was burned during the Civil War, so that you get to see the cathedral in its naked beauty, as it was built. As of May 2013 you can, for 5 EUR, take a tour of the three terraces which allows a completely different perspective on the church: the outside walls, the roof, the tower, the (non-flying) buttresses, as well as great view of the city. The guide is knowledgeable and the stories she told us were quite interesting. Very recommended.
An average Cathedral. We had read some very good reviews of this sight so we made certain we stopped for a visit. It was nice, but nothing special in the world of Cathedrals.

Like A Cathedral.. Santa Maria is a soaring gothic church. Apparently it suffered in the civil war so there's no medieval furniture. However you doget a clear impression of the building. It is a little dark but lookup at the coloured bosses in the roof vaulting. The columns atthe apse end are quite impressive in how they fan out intothe roof. If your up for some stair climbing there's a balcony out front over the entrance.

St Mary of the sea. we visited this site on a number of occasions. We stayed about 50mts for the door of this cathedral so heard the bell tolling everyday and had to walk past it to get to the bus stop so we would pop in for a little while just to marvel at the beauty of it. Such a wonderful place and no cost involved in the visit.

History made beautiful. To those who read la catedral del mar, it is a must visit place. Rich in history. Kept as much as possible after being burned. A church build by the people, santa maria del mar is worth a visit.
Old Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral dating from 13th century. Attended a lovely Mass there on the Sunday. Look for the geese in the cloisters! They just arrived and took up residence
Stunningly beautiful!. I absolutely loved this seaside Church. Its a must see. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have seen. The stain glass windows and ceilings are worth the visit alone.
Beautiful. Not as visited perhaps as the main Cathedral, but equally impressive. I highly recommend it for its stained glass windows if nothing else. They are amazing.

This is another Barcelona Gem. Grandiose, which fits so well with all that is Barcelona. A true representation of the epochal importance of the Catholic Church during the Medieval and Renaissance periods. Another MUST SEE
Stunning. This is probably a very personal view but this one of the loveliest churches I've been in, I just loved it.

Great experience that falls just a little short. After the British Museum and the Smithsonian, this great world collection feels a little underwhelming. Go there only to see the great local church murals. Or, better, do not enter at all but go there to sit at its cafetaria and enjoy some phenomenal views of the mountainscape along with the city.
Beautiful Cathedral. Gives you a great feeling of the history of the place. Very quiet as it should be and lots of detail to study.

The Cathedral By The Sea. This beautiful 14th century cathedral is an architectural wonder. Take the time to visit and experience as part of your Barcelona wanders.
And yes, this is the same cathedral described in the book that shares title with this review.

Beautiful church. The church's windows are spectacular and it is located in a neighbourhood with some nice streets you can wander around in. Ideal to give your feet some much needed rest during a day of exploring Barcelona while you enjoy the beauty and tranquility of the church.

Beautiful Gothic Church. You don't always have to pay to get in here... Sit outside in the square and have a sangria and watch the street performers for a while and the church may become free. We stayed a block away and they only charged to come in for a couple of hours a day. Don't feel bad to pay, as it goes towards maintaining a beautiful place!
This church is a must when in Barcelona. I always stop by this beautiful church when in BCN - it is so beautiful and makes a perfect break from the busy El Born..
Awe. We stepped in off the street and felt a sense of awe. Little Catholic tat, plenty of simplicity and reaching for God. Normal people come here to pray.

very beautiful church. So high and so simple, this church is breathtaking. There is much natural light inside creating beautiful effects. It is situated in a placent neibourhood full of shops, coffe-shops and resaturants.
The Peoples Church. Built as an alternative to the Cathedral, which is not far away, this church as the feeling of lightness that is not typical of the large scale religious architecture of the day.
Nice. One of the many beautiful churches in the city. The mix of the austerity of the building itself and the lavishness of the many side chapels is quite nice. Some nice views from the roof!

Take the tour to the roof. The church is a lot like others in Spain (sorry they all start looking the same after a while) but the tour yp to the roof was very good. The guide was knowledgable and the views of the Gothic quarter are excellent.

Small but very nice with great history. We visited there and bought a combined ticket with guided tour (duration of guided tour: appx. 45 min). The guided tour is very informative and he told us great history about this church. Really impressive!

all encompassing, ancient, beautiful. built by all the craftsmen who built the big main cathedral in bareclona, just around the corner, this cathedral, which is much smaller has such a big heart. even if you don't follow the christian doctrine and are more of a free spirit you feel oddly welcomed and comfortable in this church. maybe because it didn't matter who you were or what you did you had a place where you were taken care of. all the seamen and craftsmen who had come from far away lands with strange faiths helped built this church, from the people, by the people, for the people. this is what you can still feel here and this is also why this is my favorites in barca. go and see what she will you feel...
Beautiful. Hard to believe it was built in the 1300s. Beware of pan handlers asking for donations at the door implying that they're there in an official capacity.
A big church. It is a church, with huge ceilings, with a skull (?!) designed on the floor. You'll have to pay to go to the rooftop. I didn't.
2nd worth visiting place. Not only from outside , but also from the inside this is an amazing and one of the most spectacular places i have seen .do visit it from the inside as well .

A must see. Don't overlook this cathedral in favour of the Sagrada Familia - it provides a fascinating contrast to the modern design you can see there. Even better, there is free entry to this cathedral every day between 9 and 12.30. Take time to wander around the cloisters and don't miss the lift to the roof which provides spectacular views over the city from a bizarrely incongruous industrial platform.

Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar. This church is absolutely spectacular. We could only see the church from the outside but wow! The Gothic design is well done. The Gothic setting of the church's surroundings matches the beauty of the church. I look forward to going back again to see the interior.

Beautiful. Lovely place to visit in the fantastic gothic quarter. Free entrance - around mornings and lunchtime, although I hear that sometimes they decide to charge. Nice restaurants and bars in the square outside.

Must see. After the familia sangrada this is a must see. Beautiful architecture again by Gaudi. Very serene. I liked as to hiw they placed the different saints and no entry fee. Be sure to be covered inside

Take The Tour!. Fantastic! The tour given in English frequently throughout the day is a fantastic treat! They give you a complete history of the church, take you to the top of the façade for a close up view of the giant rose window, and best of all, onto the roof for a beautiful view of the city! TAKE THE TOUR!

beautiful and free. beautiful cathedral , and it's free enterance... also go there with a tour guide , he will tell you about mary and her special punishments then you can search inside - ther are several statues that explaine them and show the story

Absolutely must see !!. Must see. I loved the structure. Breathtaking. Totally serene !!
Make sure that you go to the roof top. ( there is an elevator that takes you at the top and it's included in the entry ticket). The view from the roof top is amazing.
It was ok. Just coming back from Paris it is hard to compare that it is not mind blowing It is just situated within all the shops
Nice cathedral. You can feel the spirit of love here. It's sacred place so do put on proper clothing! Very old building and you can easily stay 1 hour or longer in this catherdral.

a special found. you have to see this very different church from middle age, spectacular in building, but very "strait", no pictures, side-alters, tablets, just enormous columns and a quiet spirit inside.

A nice place to visit. The cathedral is beautiful - on the inside, in particular - and worth a visit if one is inclined to visit such places. As an attraction I'd say it's closer to 3 but it gets an extra point for being free, unlike so many attractions in Barcelona and the world.

My favorite cathedral. This is my favorite cathedral in the city! I love the way its nestled in a small space in the middle of the Born neighborhood. It's much smaller than the main gothic cathedral and and beautiful inside. Also its has lots of little bars and cafes around the square. Go at night and visit the cathedral and then have a lovely glass of wine in one of the terrazas

must see for gothic history!. this must be Barcelona's best kept secret! It is not appreciated enough and is over shadowed by all the newer architecture. This old cathedral includes parts of an old Roman wall and aqueduct system. Some of the displays are a thousand years old and the workmanship is amazing! I was disappointed there was no historical literature on it.
Must visit. This is definitely one of the best kept secrets of Barcelona. The space within the church is amazing, you have to feel it for yourself.

Very nice!. I know my title does not scream out 'see me' for the Cathedral but it's one of those place that is a must see in Barcelona. Plus, there are are a few hidden gems in the cathedral that are quaint.
I always stop there. I always like to visit this church whenever I go to Barcelona. It's very beautiful and is mentioned many times in Carlos Ruiz Zafon's novels

Nice stained glass, low cost, possible tour of roof as well. Nice church tucked in over near the Picasso Musuem. Cost was low (3 euro) with an option of a guided roof tour (which we didn't have time to take). Nice stained glass makes up for an otherwise fairly plain interior. Stained glass and the walk around the church is worth the 3 euro, though.

Very impressive. This church s not so unusual as Sagrada Familia, it's quite traditional. But the beauty of its windows and other small details may catch you as well. The restaurant in front of the church serves delicious fish specialties, so don't miss it!

Beautiful Gothic church. It is a church in the middle of the district of El Born , but it is a really big church , could be a cathedral in other cities! The inside is very interesting as it has this heigh and this emptiness of the gothic style. kind of minimal if you are expecting the typical Baroque church you may expect in the southern countries of europe. But this minimalism makes the place so peaceful and special.
Wonderful. Very nice cathedral, free admission, worth to see - at least when you are nearby. Opened until late night.

The best place to visit in Barcelona. It is hard to say that anywhere is really the best place to visit in Barcelona, but this is a must. It is a superb early gothic building (14th century), with the widest nave in Europe and a superb stone vaulted roof. Unfortunately it is hemmed in by surrounding buildings and has an awful chapel bolted on at the altar end (in the Placa de Born)The interior gives a huge sense of space and is often used for concerts. Note the characteristic octagonal columns and the tower. Compared to the othe early gothic European churches, this one has not suffered from later embellishments. The front door has two motifs of the men who were employed to carry the stones one by one of their backs from the quarries on Mont Juic, about 2 km away. Think on it!You will appreciate this church more if you read the novel 'Cathedral of the Sea' by Ildefonso Falcones (it cries out to be a movie or a TV series) but it will tell you a lot about the early history of this church. It was once beside the sea, but there is now 200 m of reclaimed land between it and the modern port.
Beautiful. This was the first cathedral we visited in Barcelona. The statues, windows and architecture were all beautiful. Definitely worth visiting if nearby.

Exciting experience. Some friends recommended us to visit this church. If you go there please join the guided tours in English. You are climbing 120 stairs ( with a break) but the view and the feeling from the roof is great

Wonderful church near the sea. brilliant little church, with great interior and extra. Take the trip up to the top of the church for some lovely views and photo opportunities as well as a cool sea breeze

Very Impressive. Do not miss this, it is definitely a must visit. I was very impressed by this cathedral that I went back a second time. There is a door that leads neatly to the outside where you will find a small pond, curiously looking geese and some green trees. It offers a relaxing and contemplative atmosphere and you will feel more connected within yourself as you are brought back to nature. Inside the cathedral, only electric candles can be lit by inserting coins into the slots. This is a clever way of protecting the building from accidental fire damage. There is also an elevator that enables you to go up the cathedral. The access costs 3 euros and is a nice and cheap way to get a few shots of the Barcelona city.

Beautiful Beautiful Cathedral.. We were little pressed for time and completely unaware of what 'Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar' had to offer, we didn't not go inside, but I saw the pictures on Trip Advisor after coming back from Barcelona, and I know what I have missed.Its a beautiful church. I wish I had gone in. Don't leave the place without taking a stroll in the Bari Gothic, or the Gothic quarters.
beautiful. A beautiful example of what Barcelona has to offer. Wander round the nearby streets to complete your tour too!

Great little Church. This was the 1st church we saw in Barcelona and I was impressed with the size and stained glass windows. It was neat to see something made so long ago still looking so good. Its not as massive as some of the other churches in Barcelona, but it's worth a stop if you are in the area.

Full of "grace". In the middle of Bari Goti, this church is a testament to the history of Barcelona, and architecturally is beautiful in its simplicity. A wedding service was under way (we visited on a Sat) and it gave the place even more character; an added meaning, if you will.A definite "must" while in the old city. Check out some pictures (and more details) on my trip report: http://disdatdudder.blogspot.com/2013/08/barcelona-2013-part-2.html

Disappointed on my second visit.... During my first visit over 10 years ago I was in the midst of a whirlwind tour of the old city in BCN and everything seemed magical including Santa Maria del Mar. On this trip which included a stop in Paris and tour of Notre Dame, SMdM just seemed a bit dark and tired. The stained glass (and there is LOTS of it) is not that intricate or interesting...so once you get past that, it just feels like another cathedral in Europe. With everything else there is to see and do in BCN, unfortunately I cannot recommend this as being on the 'must see' list.
Amazing!. There is so much history here. Even if you are not that into history the Cathedral is breathtaking! A lot of walking but indeed worth it.
A piece of history. The Cathedral is a work of art internally and externally. The only comment I would have against this place is the lack of respect people show when entering the Cathedral....

Interesting story of the Cathedral. The cathedral was interesting due to its story and age and how it was built by the people. It wasn't much on beauty as other Cathedrals we have seen around the world, but from a history perspective it is worth seeing.
Spiritual moment. Beautiful church located downtown Barcelona, amazing architecture. If u need some spiritual moment in the middle of fuzz and buzz of Barcelona, this is the place.

Lovely. I love how when you're walking down the narrow passage way and you turn the corner...there is a beautiful cathedral right before you. This happens so often in Europe. The exterior is as beautiful as the interior.

Very beautifull chuch in the middel of the El Born Quarter. We lived just across the street from this church and we loved it. Very beuatifull. You can vist the tarrasse ( 11 pm - 7 am) once every hour.

a simpler cathedral to discover. This cathedral is less extravagant from the other 2 in the city, but it is certainly pretty and interesting. The entrance is free. Don't forget to look down at the markings where people are buried (skull and crossbones).

One of my favorite. just a beautiful place. Visited here after we visited Sagrada Familia and before visting the Basilica. One of our favorites. People were respectful, it was a very old and traditional Cathedral. Check on opening/closing times before your visit.

Go To The Top. Very interesting church. It is not as ornate as others in the area but the construction is awesome. Must take the guided tour that goes up to the terraces and then the roof. View is spectacular. Guides were very friendly.
We were part of the book. I heart the first time about this church when Reading the book about Barcelona. It is impressive to loose oneself in the past and to imagine how it was when they build it.

Amazing and breathtaking. The first couple of times I was here I didnt pay Much attention to Santa Maria del Mar. But after Reading Ildefonso Falcones book about The Church, i have been there everytime. It is amazing that they build this Church in only 55 years 800 years ago. And you still see The statue of Santa Maria inside. The churchroom is just so huge that it takes one breath. Im normally not a Big fan of visiting churches but I Will always return to this one ( and la Sagrada! )

Santa Maria del Mar Basilica. A wonderfully beautiful church built by the local crafts people in just 58 years during the 14th century. It has become my favorite Basilica. Certainly must be visited while in Barcelona's old town Born section. A tour can be taken of the upper balcony and outside roof areas; I would recommend this for the information and views of the city. For a real treat, read a book titled "Cathedral by the Sea" prior to visiting. This book is a historical fictional account of the construction of the Santa Maria del Mar.
Photographers everywhere. Don't know if photographs permitted but the cameras and iphones everywhere - beautiful and historic church, stained glass windows, side altars - well worth a visit.

Great Atmosphere. An amazing cathedral - definitley not to be missed. The day we visited there were Spanish dancers and musicians in the area outside the cathedral. It was a fabulous atmosphere. We all loved it.
Simple but impressive. The oldest church in town, Santa Maria del Mar is very big and massive, but also quite simple, giving an impression of privacy.
A quiet place in the Born area.. This is a little gem. A surprisingly 'modern' feel for a gothic church. One of my favourite little places in Barcelona.

Beautiful Classic Cathedral. As someone from the US, I am always impressed by the cathedrals in Europe that were built so many years ago and spend so much time in there artwork and details. You will not be disappointed with your visit.
Another World. You feel somewhat special when you walk in this place!! It is often open to the general public and it should not be missed!!
!. really peaceful and enjoyable! don't miss the placa del Mar - just sit and relax there.. good small tapas and pastry shops too!

Beautiful church. This is less ornate than some churches, but stunning, nevertheless. I see there is now an entry fee of €3 for the church only, or €5 for a guided tour and access to the tower. Well worth it.

chatedrala del mar. I also bough a book. It is interseting hove citizen of Barcelona are contected eith this chatedral.
It is nice to go inside al sit for a while.
Good visit. A good visit. Quite spacious on the inside with a beautiful stained glass window. Take time and relax in here.

Romanesque. We visited here with a family member who wanted to show us her favorite church in Barcelona. It is truly lovely; mysterious and timeworn. A church of the people.No fee, just walk in and let yourself feel the peace.

Check service times!. What I saw was very good and I would have loved to have had longer to see around properly but we had only been there about 15 minutes when everyone was asked to leave as a service was about to start.
Very dark Gothic church. This is worth a visit, it's very dark inside, all grey, a very high church. There is no entry charge, no queues or anything. It's in the old town.

The cathedral of fishermen. Lovely, impressive medieval church built in just 55 years, by the donations of fishermen, a walk in the surrounding medieval area of Born and Picasso museum is a must in BArcelona

Don't miss this site. Beautiful church in the Gothic district. Great little shops and restaurants all around. As with many tourist sites in Europe, just be aware of your surroundings (take precautions against pickpockets, etc). But the area is my favorite part of Barcelona.

Cathedral of the Sea
Book by Ildefonso Falcones. One of my favorites churches! And if you like to read some nice novels and learn a little more about the history of Barcelona Cathedral of the Sea
Book by Ildefonso Falcones is a good selection if u plan of coming to this amazing city

A Slice of Serenity. We stumbled upon this gothic church by accident while walking in the old Gothic quarter and stepped inside. WOW!! This 12th century church was amazing. The height, the windows, the architecture arches, and the alter were just beautiful. There was no cost to enter, but we did donate 1 euro to light a candle. It was such a peaceful and serene church. We just sat and admired it receiving in return a slice of peace and serenity from a warm day of sightseeing. A must see if you are in the area. A really beautiful church.
Definitely worth a visit. This church is great, a cool and dark environment and lots of atmosphere. The plaza and the rest of El Born neighborhood it's in is a great place to visit as well.
Beautiful windows. Gorgeous church in the Gothic district. You can buy candles there or from a street vendor to light inside. Free entry--absolutely beautiful stained glass windows!

Beautiful cathedral.. Excellently realized gothic masonry work. Finest workmanship in windows. Visit it in the afternoon while the sun is still high so you can see the light coming in through the colorful glasses.

Take a moment and enjoy the glory. Truly magnificent in its simplicity and history. Different in so many ways than Sagrada but not comparable. If you are on a budget it's the better option because there are ways to see Gaudi's works for free. It's close to Picasso museum so you can knock out two sights at once.

Serene and peaceful. We stumbled upon the church in our meanders around Barcelona. After all the fuss and bother of more elaborate churches, this one just sang with simpleness. Sat there and it felt cool, serene and peaceful, despite noisy tourists yapping in the background.The stained glass windows are lovely, the seats are comfy, and it made my day to see watercolour artists both inside and outside the church making beautiful paintings of it.We gave a donation because it's free to visit and we loved it so much. Organist was playing beautiful music too, which added to the atmosphere.

Nice to pass through. I had a very quick stop here. Nice to drop by if in the area but nothing spectacular. The stained glass windows are very beautiful. It also seems to be much less crowded that some of the other famous churches in Barcelona.
Fabulous feelgood experience. Great background story re construction by the mostly poor volunteers of the area - a fantastic community achievement and a lasting, majestic legacy.

Gothic Greatness. This spectacular church stands out even among the almost overwhelming variety of architectural thrills on offer in Barcelona. You needn't be religious to appreciate the movingly sublime rhythms and patterns inside this great building. I found myself ducking in here often while I was visiting, and even attended a concert at Santa María del Mar, though I think it's at its best on foot, so you can wander the aisles and breathe in both the details and the resonant whole.

Looking for a ship replica?. Cathedral with soul. Check windows with stain-glass art. Ship-replica is under one of many Madonnas, we were twice inside and we had no luck. Look around, Gothic in the best. .
This is another WOW in Barcelona. The architectural work, is mind binding, when you think about it's age, and how they built it when they built it. Way before their time.

Important gothic building that is also ethereally beautiful. This is Barcelona's most loved church, even surpassing the Sagrada Familia in the psyche of the city. It is also the finest example of Catalan gothic. This is a very different church to say French gothic, it is wide, the spans of the arches second only to Rome and it is sparse, the contents were burned years ago. As a result the pillars rise out of the gloom to then get almost lost again in the glorious heights of the ceiling. Any guide book will detail the history and notable features but this is not why you should go; it is just beautiful, one of the best in Europe.

A people's church. A beautiful Gothic church built by the people for the people. Merchants, peasants, craftsmen of all trades contribute to the construction of the church. It only took them 55 years to complete. If you look carefully, you'll find many plaques dedicating to the contribution of the people. If you are into architecture, then this is a must see because this is the only church in Barcelona built in pure Catalan Gothic style.

beautiful church. This church is beautiful and free to enter at certain times. The story behind this church is just as remarkable as the church itself so get a tour guide or read up on it beforehand to get the full effect of the church
Beautiful secluded cathedral!. Beautiful cathedral with lovely stain glassed windows, and religious scenes around the edge!Quiet and peaceful inside!

Happened to pass by. We went into the church on our way to the Sea. The inside is beautiful but obviously does not quite compare to other churches in the area. Beautiful stained glass can be found throughout and candles are available for purchase.

huge free church. if you saw one church youve seen it all. I went to Sagrada famila and this one only since i was in barcelona for only 2 and a half days. Very dark inside but summarizes most gothic churches. Plus its free and in the gothic quarter/ near the beach

Wonderful place to visit - take a guided tour if you can. The impact of the visit multiply easily if you see this magnificent place in a guided tour, especially if it takes you to the roof. Very special church, not just another church in Europe. Everything about is nice, including the musician outside its walls. There is a guitar player there who plays the majestic concierrto de aranjuuez of joaqium rodrigo and does a very nice job. Don't miss this attraction.

Rooftop Tour. This church is not very ornate (it dates back kto the 13th century), but we took a tour, which led to two levels on the top of the structure. I have been on such church tours before (to bell towers, etc), but never to the roof. This was a unique experience, with great views of the city!

Great and interesting. We participated the guided tour to tower and the roof top of this cathedral. So marvellous wiew over the city and one of the bet guides I have come accross - a historian with enthusiams for his home town. This place is a must especially if you have read the book " The Cathedral of the See"

Better Experience that Sagrada Familia. I enjoyed my 40 minute tour here more than Sagrada Familia. They charge 5 euros for an extensive narration of the church, its history in barcelona, along with barcelona history. The views of the city are much better from the top of this church. Yes you actually get to go on the roof. Fabulous views and descriptions. The church was built in a catalan gothic style and only has 2 aisles, nave and no transept. Also the aisles as tall as the nave as they use the side chapels to support the height of the church. It is 3 euros to enger but pay 5 euros and visit and tour the tours and listen to this great story.

The cathedral at the sea. I you have read the book of Idelfonso Falcones, this is a must sea. You can go back in time and experience the ancient times and realise the work performed in the MiddelAges. Something we cannot equal anymore
Simple but still stunning. Very different than the Catedral or the Sagrada Familia, but still incredible. Amazing the detail work even in it's simplicity.
Nice if Time Allows. Well, it is another church in Barcelona. If that is what you want to see certainly visit but the two big churches will usually fill that category of tourism.
Visit the roof. Make sure you are dressed to visit the church, no short shorts or vests. It is a magnificent cathedral and the cloister with the geese is a delight. Worth a visit.
Beautiful church. If you like churches - well worth a visit as built by the fisherman and quite stunning, wasn't too busy either but this was in the evening.

Beautiful. I am really glad I went here, I only found out about this by reading a guide book but it is a beautiful church.
For ladies, you need to make sure you are covered up. They won't let you in if you are wearing shorts or revealing clothes. I found out the hard way!
Santa Maria del Mar. Not to be missed. Impressive church! But better than the cathedral. Try if you can attend a classical music concert in it.

On the roof of the old cathedral. You now have the opportunity for a guided tour to and on the roof of Santa Maria del Mar, the beautiful gothic cathedral outside the old city walls. The guide spoke brilliant English and Italian (may be other languages as well) and had a passionate knowledge of the building, the history and the present Barcelona. And just walking on the roof and the view was an expirience of 5 stars! You donate 5 Euro for the restauration of the church. Very well spent.You buy the tickets in the church and I think, they have a guided tour every hour. Most of them might be in Spanish, but ask if you want it in English anyway. My fellow visitors accepted it.

Very beautiful. This is a very beautiful Cathedral; this was free to enter (we were there on a Friday); compared to the Barcelona Cathedral this Cathedral is smaller but elegant in its own way; the stained-glass Rose window is gorgeous; it is very close to the Picasso Museum and does not take much time to see so make sure you spend a few minutes here at least.

So unusual. My spanish friend told me this was a very different church And she was right Built by local seafarers contribution It is so special and a completely different shae of church not the usual cross

FEE TO ENTER A TEMPLE. You are not allowed to enter the cathedral unless you pay for a ticket. At least 4 euros. This is typical of most of Spanish Cathedral. You are allowed to attend Mass without paying, but five minutes after the Mass has ended the security personnel will kick you out,
Beautiful and bustling. Gorgeous, the square in front is bustling with international and local visitors from everywhere. Saw a music performance there, lovely

"A High Point for Us.". This cathedral is unusually simple and spare. It was burned in the Civil War and has been restored to something close to its original and more pure Gothic design. We came in quietly during evening mass, and afterwards took the tour of the roofs, enjoying the views over the city. We came back another day while wandering through the Gothic neighborhood, for coffee and ice cream at one of the cafes next to the Cathedral door.

A lovely church to visit. Santa Maria del Mar is a lovely example of the Catalan Gothic style of church architecture - very simple and unfussy. In my opinion this is a better place to visit than the big cathedral - far less noisy and crowded, and much easier to get a sense of prayer if one is so inclined. When we visited there was a choir practising for a wedding which added to the experience
Beautiful and peaceful. I love this cathedral because it was so peaceful and quiet inside. Away from the hustle and bustle of outside.

And nice church and a stark contrast to Gaudi's Basilica. The church was interesting and had some nice art work in it. Overall I wasn't a fan of the design of the church with it carved up into little sections. The outside was impressive.
Perfect spot to grab a coffee and watch life pass by!. Its a beautiful cathedral... Sitting outside of it admiring the architecture having a cup of espresso was just great...

What a gem of a church!. My feelings may be biased, because we happened to stop in to visit during a wedding, but - wow! What a beautiful church! Great to see and learn the story of the church. Look at the scorch marks where the people burned the internal fixtures during an uprising.

Wonderful piece of architecture. Let me start by recommending that you visit the cathedral after 5 p.m. if you want to avoid having to pay for the entrance, besides, it is quite crowded before that. Once inside, visit every chapel and take pictures of the wonderful murals and the designs.

Peaceful Sanctury. We visited this as opposed to Sagrada Familia becuase when we saw how commercial Sagrada was, we just didn't feel as though the experience would be very meaningful to us. St Mary was just peaceful and lovely and spiritual, which is what we were looking for. There are also music recitals here too which is lovely due to the accoustics and atmosphere

Spare but elegant Gothic. Visiting religous buildings helps give a sense of the variety of philosophies and beliefs that humans enjoy. That sailors could contribute to the construction of so marvellous a building says much for their strength of belief. I was deeply moved by the austere grandeur of this building. Simpler than many similarly scaled Gothic churches, it once stood next to the sea but land reclamation has resulted in its occupying a more inland setting. It remains truly beautiful and though a visit may only take 30 minutes or so, it is well worth it and at the time of my visit it was free.At the same time nip up the narrow street to the north of the building. a Uruguayan runs the cheapest tiny bodega but he has great wines and the place has a charming disorganised buzz with plenty of cheerful locals along with tourists. It was a great end to our afternoon!

Breathtaking. We love Cathedrals and their stories. This one was beautiful, with such ornate statues. Sadly they do not offer guided tours and there's very little information in other languages, so you don't really know what you are looking at, but you can still appreciate it's beauty.The rooftop views are great and offer yet another good photo opportunity.We had lunch at Estruch on the square facing the Cathedral. The meal was really enjoyable and friendly service.

One of the best cathedrals in Barcelona. Very beautiful, quiet, spacious, very catalan. Must see, at any time. The legend has it that when it was being built, everyone in the neighborhood "chipped in" - brought stones and building materials.
The cathedral of the people.. This is the cathedral Ildefonso Falcones wrote about in his novel La Catedral del mar. A small but amazing cathedral building.
A beautiful Cathedral. This is definitely one not to miss when visiting Barcelona. The Cathedral is beautiful, simple, yet breath taking.
Nice area. Lovely church with a nice atmosphere around it. We stopped for lunch at a restaurant in the square next to it - expensive and not very good food, but worth it for the location.

attractive. This is an attractive gothic cathedral - free to visit in the morning but you have to pay in the afternoon. The cloisters are very beautiful. There is an opportunity to pay to go up on the roof but there are better views of Barcelona elsewhere.
Don't pay!. There is a side entrance where you can just walk in. Also on (some) weekends its free. Not worth paying 6 Euros for!

favourite of Barcelona's churches. Santa Maria del Mar was the first of the three major churches we visited in Barcelona (La Catedral and Sagrada Familia being the other two) and was certainly my favourite. It has a calm and cool air to it that allows for introspection and appreciation - in contrast I found La Catedral ostentatious and loud (in both senses of the word). We visited in the evening so it was quite dark inside - I'm not sure if that would be different midday.
