(The only thing is that as I waited for my mum outside of the church a pigeon let loose his droppings from the top of the building and it was a bit like a missile in force and impact! Thankfully it missed me but I would beware sitting on the edge of the building like I did!)

So blessed to go see it. I've been reading a book I picked up while in San Sebastián called Catederal by the sea a famous book written by a Spanish author. The majority of the book centers around this beautiful church that was built by the people in less than 55years.I was so surprised to find that this beautiful church was and is my back yard literally. I am renting an apartment right next to it When I first went it I paid a small sum. Then I later find out that at certain times in the afternoon Yiu can get in for free Not pretentious like the other pompous churches and cathedrals. Yiu can feel the presence of something wonderful there. On one day when I was sitting in the court yard having a cafe out popped a bride and from and their whole wedding party Definitely worth a visit

Gothic Church. Beautiful cathedral in Gothic style very different to Gaudi! Centrally located in Gothic quarter. Had stunning stained glass especially the rose window.Outside there was a lovely square with cafes and places to sit and pass the day.....if it hadn't been rainy and gloomy!Worth spending half and hour to an hour while wandering around the passage ways.

Beautiful stained glass. We stumbled upon this cathedral as we were wondering around and popped in quickly to see. As you walk in you're struck by the vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Gothic Church. The stained glass windows are amazing especially the rose window. It's worthwhile just to take a seat and enjoy a quiet moment.

A beautiful cathedral. This is a very beautiful cathedral. It is centrally located and gets a lot of tourist foot traffic. Consequently, it can get pretty crowded. It is worth a stop in should you be in the area. Don't forget to look up, there are some cool features on the outside of the building near the top.

Really nice church with amazing stained glass.. Just in front of church there was a small market where I bought delicious cheeses.
The church is very nice - there are no crowds inside. You can just sit and admire architecture and stained glass windows.

Not Just Another Church. We entered the Church on the right hand side (facing the front) in the morning when the lines were almost non-existent. As you enter you will see a gated area containing geese that sometimes start honking when excited - this area is the Cloister - as you walk around note the stone boxes mounted on medieval walls containing the bones of notables - also see names inscribed on the separate stones that make up the walkway. (Secret washroom - at the far side of the gated area there is an entry that on the right leads to a single female toilet and to the left two urinals - one of the few places you don't have to pay someone) Go through the open doorway out of the Cloister in to the main area of the church and observe the detail in architecture - and the huge structured arches that support the building. A lift is available to take you to the roof (3 Euros) where you will see panoramic views of the city. Careful where you step as the walkway on the roof is only scaffolding, some places without railing - not for the faint of heart. We revisited on Sunday morning and were entertained by local outdoor orchestra at front steps of church and locals performing a traditional Catalona dance - they will sometimes encourage bystanders to join in. There are benches in the square but come early as they fill up quickly. This site is worth seeing while in Barcelona

Another gem in the Gothic quarter. One of the joys of walking around in cities like Barcelona is that just going for a wander means you'll come across something stunning. This was the case for us while just exploring the Gothic Quarter - breathtaking.
Very nice church by the waterfront area. Just bumped into this site as we were exploring the waterfront & heading to the Gotic area. Very nice church.
Always stop there. When ever I go to barcelona I always pass by the cathedral where I will take time to pray and thanks god and pay my respect to the place with candles
Beautiful church. A church well worth the visit. Beautiful architecture and nice location very near the waterfront. Also the surroundings are great to discover.

A true treasure. A beautiful basilica dating back to the early 1300s and now finally and wonderfully restored. From an active and central parish church, in its early centuries, to the shippers and merchants of Barcelona, through its dark years as a storage warehouse in the Spanish Civil War and then somewhat forgotten, it is great to see the Santa Maria del Mar now back in great shape.

Great place to stop and take in the neighborhood. The church is stunning, especially at night. Lots of people in the courtyard, it's a nice place to stop and sit on the steps of the cathedral and just hang out for a while or have a little picnic.
nice. beautiful church...nothing outstanding inside but very worthwhile visit... the restuarantes in the square are lovely too and its nice to explore the area
Lovely traditional church. It is not Sagrada Familia. It is a traditional church but a nice one at that. A good place to pause and reflect, or just admire the stained windows.

Worth A Look. If you are in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona, the "People's Cathedral" is worth a look. Unlike the Gothic cathedral, it is free. This 12th Century church is large, but unpretentious. There was a wedding taking place when we visited, which added to the experience. I like old churches and this one helped me absorb the atmosphere of the Gothic Quarter.

Great people watching from the placa. This is our favorite spot for people watching....yep, our 5th trip to Barcelona and it always includes an afternoon with a bottle of cava across from this magnificent cathedral. We were disappointed that we got to witness no wedding parties this time...local staff indicated there is a 2 year wait to get married here.Rain or shine, this is just a cool spot with lots of exciting people traffic.
A true gem. Love it. A great gothic masterpiece still loved by the people. No pretensions just a solid monument. Great!

Pretty church, different from the typical overwrought churches. This was a nice, semi-plain church in Barcelona. I liked it a lot actually for its plain-ness. Sometimes churches are so overdone that it makes me mad to see all that wealth with starving homeless people sleeping across the street. This church was much more reserved. It was elegant and makes you feel reverent even if you are not religious.

Beautiful old Gothic style church. Really beautiful inside and costs only 3 euros to get in and the church allows you to take photos . No frills but beautiful design. You can relax after by sitting at the cafe's outside the church. Worth seeing.
The Cathedral by the Sea. Loved the book, The Cathedral by The Sea and it was one og the first Basilicas I visited. Absolutely beautiful.

Beautiful. The church was very quiet while we were there and beautiful in a traditional way. I would recommend visiting if only to contrast with the Sagrada Familia in style. Currently having some works done which does affect the ambiance.

Beautiful Cathedral. A place of refuge on an unusually rainy day in Barcelona. Wonderful peaceful and tranquil place as a rest from the hussle and bustle of Barcelona. Worth a visit. Free entry, but would suggest leaving a donation of your choice.
Lovely gothic church open & free to visit. Lovely atmosphere, gorgeous stained glass windows, very impressive size & space. Well worth a quick visit.

check before you go. We really wanted to see this - but it was closed for renovation - check before you make a trek there. It was interesting to see the size/outside construction and gothic features - but we really, really wanted to see the inside

What a cathedral should be like!. We actually enjoyed this cathedral more than we did the Barcelona Cathedral. It is more open and spacious and feels like a house of prayer should feel like, unlike the big and imposing and impersonal cathedrals that are the norm in Europe.

Simply awe inspiring. We never walk past without going inside to sit for a few moments and lighting a candle in one of the Saint's niches. The city is busy renovating the building so some days are not very peaceful. But do not stop that from visiting every time you are in the Barri Gothic.

Better than the Cathedral. I enjoyed this church more than the Cathedral, and it has a WAY cooler history, and its free. Also, there are tons of cafes in the church's courtyard including an AMAZING wine bar (vinya del senyor). Just a wonderful atmosphere in general

Church. This is a lovely church, and the vaulted ceilings are gorgeous and 100 feet high. There is one particularly spectacular modern stained glass window. However, after seeing Notredam and Ste Chapelle, it's not worth paying for. We got in free on a Sunday afternoon.

A must. Great gothic church. From the outside you don't get the real picture of the place. Cost around 6 € put is worth of it. For the price onsider it as museum not a church (churches should be free for all). The inner yard with ducks and outdoor men's room is a great change for the most of the churches I've been. Great view for the roof. Has a little museum area. Please visit!
Impressive. It's not overly impressive from the outside but the inside is glorious.And what an atmosphere and history - impressivePut it on your visit list

Humble and most beautiful!. We got there at 18h on a Saturday evening, with just hundreds of candles burning to illuminate the humble but yet beautiful interior, suddenly someone plays Bach Chorals on the organ - it was like a special performance, for free. In those moments and in this church you can sense how devote people must have been when they built it.
A quiet jewel of a church. Gothic in a particular style - elegant and airy. Well worth stopping off and looking round. Rest those weary feet in this peaceful place!

Much more than Sagrada Familia & excellent value. Now THIS is a church. Looks lovely but fairly unremarkable from outside but inside its a sanctuary. Silent as it can be with tourists in, its a beautiful Cathedral and offers a lift to the roof, small "art gallery" and the Monstrance room, the crypt, beautiful stone carvings and amazing choir gallery, and the most astoundingly peaceful courtyard with a large pond housing 13 white geese. This is a magical place to just slow down and think. We visited in April and it was 6 euros admittance and not too busy. Outside and just across the pathway is a free entrance courtyard with a fountain and balcony. So simple but enchanting - couldnt pull myself away from it. Very well worth a visit - note this is the citys Cathedral, Sagrada Fam. is a church - i can understand why now, its special.

Interesting if passing, but there are more amazing places in Barcelona. The St Mary of the Sea Cathedral is a pleasant and interesting place, but not a 'must see' (compared to the Gaudi Sagrada Família of the Barcelona Cathedral itself. If you are in the area then pop in.

make sure you see the monstrance. A beautiful cathedral which thankfully still has a place for private prayer which is respected.
The monstrance housed in a side chapel is something else like nothing I've ever seen before.
The gothic quarter where the cathedral is found is a lovely vibrant area with lots of small squares, pavement cafe's and attractive archtecture. An area well worth exploring
Lovely. Loved this. Alot of spanish school children in the day we were there, with tape measures, running about doing a school project, i quess, and alot of noise. But it was worth seeing.
The geese. Its free, you must see the geese in the cloisters and the discreet toilets. Plenty of photo opportunities.

Lovely Gothic church in an interesting area. This is a simple Gothic church in the old sea men's quarter. It doesn't take long to visit, but has a lovely cloister and the neighborhood is nice. Good place to stop for tapas in one of the places nearby.

Heavenly Cathedral magically appears. Almost by accident, whilst wandering through the charmingly quaint cobble stone lanes off La Ramblas, we happened upon a beautiful square, housing fabulous antique markets, and a myriad of colourful shops and cafes. Overshadowing the glorious square, is this magnificent Cathedral....massive, historic, and altogether too beautiful - much like everything in the enchanting, intoxicating city of Barcelona!

Better than Sagrada. This is located in the centre of the city - Not far from Metro Jaume1 and is free, exceptionally well built and stunning to look at. Use the Hotel Colon ( 5 star ) opposite fro a drink and a place to have a decent wee too.
Stunning Church. This church is beautiful, the stained glass is lovely. There is no entrance charge, check opening times before you go.

Better than more famous sagrada familia. Lots to look at and appreciate here but not so full on as at the more famous sagrada familia, so that it was possible to relax and enjoy this beautiful cathedral. There was understated architecture and art, an indoor garden with geese as you arrive, golden chapels, a trip up the tower for magnificent views over the city (fee for this, but there is a lift), ordinary history under your feet as you walk over pavements provided by ancient city guilds. I am not normally a fan of church architecture, but really enjoyed this cathedral.

Understated elegance. In some ways we enjoyed this more than the Sagrada Familia, because of its more traditional and solemn grandness. The stained glass windows are some of the most beautiful we have seen and it was a much more moving experience tan the awe inspiring grandeur of Sagrada Famillia. I would definitely recommend visiting this and then when your done (or even before your visit) go and enjoy some of the finest deserts you'll have anywhere in the world from the amazing Bubo Patisserie and Cafe. The tapas there is excellent too.

a must see. After reading the book, "Cathedral of theSea" by Ildelfonso Falcones, I made sure to search out this cathedral. The book tells the story of the building of this beautiful church by the fishermen and peasants of early day Barcelona. Knowing its history just added to the delight and emotion of visiting this lovely cathedral.
WOW. Breath taking. Not to be missed. This is a most visit when in Barcelona. Plus its in the Gothic Quarter.
Beautiful. Gorgeous church in lovely old area. Worth a visit. Didn't open until 4.30pm the afternoon we were there but nice cafe opposite to sit and wait.

historic. a calm place to recharge during the walk through the city - plus its history is interesting (If you can find it out) I was lucky enough to be with someone who knows the history of the city's architecture--there was a small plaque outside giving some info on the circumstances of its construction.

A Wonderful Cathedral to Visit. The St. Mary Cathedral is a key feature of the Gothic quarter and based around the sea theme (the alter has a stylized sailing ship). It is a very old, elegant and with a welcoming feel.

Gothic majesty. I know that the other cathedral is the hive draw of the city, but you're missing something if you don't visit this original version. It's a Catholic masterpiece with so much to tell in its architecture and presence. As a Christian it clearly holds a particular draw and interest for me, but my husband was also really impressed which he isn't often by churches and cathedrals. If you see nothing else make sure you go to the cloister, it's outside and has orange trees, fountains, fish in pools and even Palm trees - if you can't find God there then you're not looking very hard.

Sunday Morning Dancing!. A beautiful ancient Cathedral, not to be confused with La Sagrada Familia! On the Sunday morning we found the rather charming sight of circles of locals dancing slowly together to the live music being played on the steps.
Really nice!. A nice church worth visiting. Cannot be compared to Sagrada Familia or the Cathedral but I guess it's the next best thing. Access without a ticket.
Barcelona Cathederal. this must be classed as one of the wonders of the world .Probably the most spectacular building I have ever had the pleasure of visiting !!!!!!!!!
Quite Awesome. Loved this Gothic structure. The architecture is awesome. Found it very peaceful and not tourist-like.
stunning. Definitely worth a visit. Barcelona's favourite cathedral. Less tourists - go in the evening when it is serene and peaceful

Stunning Church in El Born. We stayed in an apartment 100 yards from this church. It is in the El Born district, a blend of old and new. The beauty of this church is its interior simplicity. As noted elsewhere, the interior was burned during the Civil War, leaving a bareness which is simply stunning. The columns inspired Gaudi's La Sagrada Familia. The Cathedral of Barcelona is ornate; the Cathedral of Santa Maria del Mar is not. But the grandeur of such a large open space puts it at the top of the list of must-see churches in Barcelona. The bells chiming also contribute to the serenity of the place.

Gothic at its finest. Beautiful inside and out. The stained glass is gorgeous in here. The rose window is beautiful. Wonderful sense of space and air inside. Almost a perfect representation of gothic architecture. The story behind the construction of the church is also wonderful.

Good contrrast with the Cathedral of Barcelona. This church was gutted during the Spanish Civil War - go to the Cathedral to get the other experience. The emptiness provides a kind of pure experience of Gothic architecture - though hardly AUTHENTIC it is much easier to see what's going on with the structure. The modern stained glass in mainly pretty good.
A very pretty church. Lots of old stained glass and very calming atmosphere. Not as large as the Cathedral but stilll worth visiting.
good spot. Great spot to visit,few cafes with free wifi and lot of shops in the area same as other amenities, architecture around the area is also with great antique look
Beautiful cathedral. I was surprised by its beautiful exterior and interior.However, it was strange to see the inside of it electronic candles instead of the traditional wax or paraffin.
Sagrada Mary. Try to visit when a concert take place - classical or local music.Notice that the place is closed in the early afternoon hours
Most butifull. A very butifull church, I liked it better than the main cathedral of Barcelona. Very simple which make is much more powerfull.

Beautiful building, hold local intimate concerts. We visited and noticed that there was a small intimate guitar concert in the evening and reasonably priced. We had a lovely evening there after dinner listening to the local musicians. I say local I think the person we saw was really famous but we didn't know him. Fantastic.
great catedral. enjoyed my visit to the catedral, the frescos and alter pieces were very opulent and impressive a must visit
REMINDING THE PAST. On your way to port vell or to ciutadella park go and see it.If you are an architecture fan you -ll enjoy.

Lovely cathedral. beautifully proportioned, stunning vaulted ceiling but possibly a little overpublicized... a nice place to visit as part of a wandere around the area rather than a specific destination. The church closes between two and six (open until half eight) and there are plenty of cafes and interesting little shops in the surrounding squares.
A beautiful Church.. I'm not a religious person but this was just an amazing place to see and in the most interesting area of Barcelona. Absolutely huge! Well worth a visit.

Breathtaking.. This place is so much better than the cathedral! This church is outstanding for its simplicity. I know the book (Catedral del Mar/Cathedral of the Sea) was a work of fiction, but its good to read the book before visiting just to give an idea of the devotion of the people who built it and an understanding of early medieval Barcelona.
A surprise. I happened to passed by and the got in, the internal was simply amazing to see, very impressive. It is gothic style and it is free to visit.
Excellent example of Catalan gothic. This is a beautiful church which has been preserved impressively. Don't miss this church, or the cool medallions stuck to the ceiling.
A peacful haven. With encouragement from the hotel and the Trip Advisor guide we visited this beautiful church and were humbled. Well worth the detour.

Nice place to wonder around. Churches in Barcelona are usually good- very good place to wonder around and visit. Can't remember much as I think I went to 5 different churches and they all blend into one single giant church with amazing sculptures on the sides behind the bars.
Santa Maria Del Mar. There is no charge to visit this church and it is well worth a visit. It is a beautiful church and there is so much to see and take in.

Loud renovations ongoing and generally not that special.... when compared w other churches of its size/renown. The history behind it though (built from donations from sailors) makes it interesting. Can see it in about 20 mins in my opinion.

Awesome walk for an awesome church. Its free to get in, insides are incredible, the walk through the gothic part of Barcelona is lovely and you can then have a beer and some olives across from the church and stare at it some more! Fantastic!

As lovely as I expected on the outside. but inside we will have to save for the next trip, because we could not get in - the cathedral was shut from 1.30pm to 4.30pm. This is often the case with opening hours, so check before you plan your day. Also: entrance to some of the sights is free of charge at certain times, so check that if you are on a tight budget.

Fantastic pure gothic. Fantastic gothic contruction, fully completed in the past, no later "neo" supplements added. Pure, clean and breathtaking. The interior is spacious, very impressive, the rosetta in the facade is huge and gives beautiful colorful spots inside at sunny days. An absolute must see in Barcelona.

beautiful cathedral. This church was very beautiful on the inside and outside. There were even several courtyards within that had swans and geese swimming in a pool. Remember to wear clothing with sleeves if you're visiting, as many churches in europe will not allow you to enter if your clothing is revealing. I would recommend!

Stunning. An absolutely beautiful building and truly is one of the best Gothic cathedrals in Europe. The stained glass windows are wonderful and I was particularly enraptured by the soaring pillars around the altar - truly astounding that such great architecture was being created so long ago. A must visit when in wondeful El Born.

A wonder of space. Contrary to most spanish churches the choir is not situated in the center of the church. This emphasises the beautiful spacious interior. Especially impressive are the slender pillars which are almost incapable of supporting the roof.

Beautiful Cathedral but note the timing. This was a beautiful cathedral. I actually went in the late morning and it just closed its doors. I think it was about 11am. Then the opening hours was stated on the door. I can't remember what time it was closed in the afternoon. It might have been 11am - 2:30pm i think. So we decided to walk around the area, and returned at 4:30pm. It was nice and quiet, though still with a fair bit of visitors. But we enjoyed sitting down and feel the solemnity of the place. The pillars looked similar to the Sagrada Familia, with its high ceilings, making it pretty majestic. There's no entrance fee but you can buy candles to offer to the many alters of Mary in the cathedral.The cathedral looks old and rustic, which differs from the sagrada familia. I would still recommend a visit to this piece of history and it shouldn't take too long (no queues).
Saw on the Gothic quarter tour. Nice old church and the area around it is also well worth seeing especially if you go with Runner Bean Tours
Beautiful. This church has everything a gothic building should have. It is a perfect example of this kind of architecture. Worth visiting.
Pretty Little Church. A pretty little church, worth spending a few minutes browsing. Try and go earlier in the day to avoid the large groups arriving.

A wonderful place to visit. I really liked visiting this cathedral as the architecture is another example of the gothic style. The towers can be seen from a few blocks away beckoning to you. Going inside takes your breath away with the high ceiling and the chandeliers. A very pretty place to visit.

Simply beautiful. Very different from La Sagrada Familia, this church was built by donations from the fishermen of Barcelona. It is spare and simple but beautiful. Well worth a trip and located right in the gotic quarter, near the water (naturally...).

Is a cute one. This Cathedral seems to be less commercial than others like the Gotico or Sagrada familia. It is rather cute from the point of architecture. I like that it has three or four enterance/exits and in near by you can find plenty of places for coffee or snacks.

Breathtaking church. If you choose two churches to see in Barcelona, make them the Sagrada Familia and Santa Maria Del Mar. You can see the inspiration from Santa Maria in Sagrada Familia, with the high, arched ceilings and open, airy interior. It was an inspiring and interesting place and made for an interesting contrast with Sagrada Familia. I went here and then went to Barcelona Cathedral, and they are similar but this is nicer inside because of the bright, open space, whereas Barcelona Cathedral is blocked into different areas so you don't feel the impact. (You want to be sure to see the exterior of Barcelona Cathedral, though.) The light fixtures, ceilings, and columns are almost identical, so if you had to choose one, I would recommend this one as it was prettier. Both are free, though, for just wandering around so if you're not "churched out," you can certainly go to both. The surrounding area is also very nice and interesting (El Born) and worth walking around. Visiting this church makes a good day with Barceloneta and lunch on the beach.

Beautiful and Unique. Definiteiy worth a visit, but do a little reading about the architecture before you go. Without knowing a little about it beforehand, it can look like any other old church. With a little reading (any guidebook will cover it) you'll be able to see what makes this a unique Gothic design. Sits on a pretty square with some good shops and restaurants. If you can, go by on a Sunday morning when there are locals doing folk dancing. It was really fun to watch them - people of all ages were participating. Fun.
the "truly" Barcelona chatedral.. Despite there is a Chatedral in Barleona, placed in the gotic quarter, the truly chatedral is Santa Maria del Mar. I recomend specially a visit

Nice but not a must. In my opinion this is not a must-see site, but it would be nice to walk around and have a look if you have time,You need to be careful of what you are wearing. You need to be properly dressed to enter the cathedral.

CHARMING CHURCH. Featuring the peculiarities of Catalonian gothic, with it`s stony amplitude and rounded spaces, this temple is really charming. Attending Mass here, with the music and chorus, is a privilege, even for who does not share the Catholic religion. Liturgies are frequently held in Spanish, not only in Catalá. Dont miss this church!
Santa Maria Del Mar in El Born. Built, I believe, in the 14th century and the best example of Catalonian Gothic. Majestic and beautiful.
Really nice church. Very interesting church and the area in front of the church is really nice to have a drink or dinner.
The old cathedral. It is very interesting to compare the medieval archtitecture with the cathedral-architecture from Gaudi. Look at the pillars and the ceiling, the roof, the ship and the choir.

Underwhelmed. I was really excited to see this place because it looked really pretty in the pictures. It was closed when we got there (I don't know if it's ever open) and it wasn't fantastic. It's in a nice area, and probably has some religious significance, but we weren't all that impressed.

IF I EVER.... ... Get married again (hope not, LOL), it'll definitely be at "Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar". I gotta confess, I'm divorced for nine years, but my marriage hasn't been in a church. Spectacular, outstanding architecture, sea, Barcelona... What else one can expect from a temple? so if you don't wanna get married again, at least spend a few hours admiring this monument :-)
Stunning!. The starkness of this place really gives you a good overview of the Gothic character of the place. This place was an inspiration for Gaudi.

An impressive and beautiful church. This is a very old and historic church, deeply rooted in Catalan history and in the development of the city of Barcelona. It has a wonderful and spiritual feeling about it.

Beautiful church. The church of Santa Maria del Mar is situated in the El Born quarter of Barcelona. There were some renovations in progress at the time of our visit. It is a beautiful church - don't miss the monument and the eternal flame just outside and the images of the architects on the front doors!
Beautiful Church. Open to visitors, this church is spectacular, you can also purchase a candle for around 1euro and light this within the church.
astounding. beautiful inside, so much going on around it is difficult to understand always for someone of a different religioun
Beutiful architicture. Beutiful architicture and the neighbourhood is very interristing.But entering only for the top view of barcelona. So it depends on ur budget.

A quiet and impressive landmark in the busy gothic quarter. When walking round the Gothic quarter you cant not visit this church. Great free sightseeing in Barcelona without the crowds. An impressive, very dark and imposing historical church that is such a stark contrast to Gaudi's Barcelona. Situated in a great area where there are many alleyways with coffee shops and antique stores.
Spectacular church. Stumbled upon this church while walking around Barcelona. Very ornate and worth a look. Looks of gold on the walls and lots to see.Nice and quiet inside.

Glorious. The story of how this was built makes it very interesting and one of the first churches to acknowledge those whodid the back brakiing work. There's a novel written about it, read it Cathedral by the Sea - Ildefonso Falcones . . in the same genre as Pillars of the Earth by Follett
Peace and reflection. When in the gothic area stop for a while to absorb the calming spirit of the church. Very impressive piece of ancient history.
Beautiful. It's so beautiful from the outside, but really worth the time and small amount of money to go inside. It will take your breath away.

Beautiful Church worth a quick visit. This is a pretty church near the gothic quarter. Chances are you'll be near this church at one point or another, so with free admission, it's definitely worth a visit. The interior is gorgeous, with beautiful details and stained glass. It's a great place to take a break and relax during a trip.

Great. This cathedral is really great, I have read book about the story of this dome before I visited it in May 2011 and I was surprised anyway. It is really one of the best cathedrals I have ever seen.

Overshadowed by Sagrada Familia, but a must visit. Eglesia de Santa Maria is often overlooked by some when visiting Barcelona, but it is a very good example of wonderful gothic architecture found all throughout the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona. Do not skip this one. It's an excellent place to spend some quiet time and collect your thoughts.

Beautiful. This church is in the old part of Barcelona near the Picasso Museum and is well worth a visit. It is a large Gothic Church with a plain stone interior on a fairly large scale. Some fine shrines, statues, stained glass and other details.
See it on your way to something. It is a church. Old and interesting, but don't lan your day around it. We stopped on our way to lunch. If you have seen many churches, it is only average.

Imposing. Encased in a tiny square - it is almost impossible to take a full picture of the cathedral! - this traditional and imposing cathedral is something not to miss while walking around in the Barrio Gotico.

Beautiful cathedral with so much history. While the outside of this cathedral may not be as spectacular as Sagrada Familia, it is absolutely beautiful inside. We attended Christmas Eve services and the music/acoustics were very impressive. To learn more about the history of the Santa Maria del Mar, read Cathedral of the Sea by Ildefonso Falcones, a long but fascinating fictional account of its construction.

A stunning cathedral.. With a rather impressive facade, the interiors of this cathedral are absolutely stunning, with high ceilings, beautiful coloured windows and a brilliant acoustics.
One can easily spend an hour walking through the beautiful parts of this cathedral.
Part of the history of El Born. Knowing the history of this church let us fully enjoy a visit to one of the most beautiful classic gothic building we’ve ever visited. A must for architecture lovers.

One of my favorites. This is an amazing cathedral both inside and outside. Examine the very interesting stone carvings high on the building. Compare the construction of the arches, ceilings, windows, and columns in this building to the Barcelona Cathedral. There are interesting differences. Please be courteous, some visitors were not very sensitive to a memorial service for someone who recently died. An early morning visit for a few minutes of quiet meditation can be refreshing here.
emotion!. I read the book some years ago about the construction of this Cathedral, a fantastic novel for a fantastic Church. Don't miss both!

A really nice prototype Of the gothic. I am in love... With Barcelona! I adore medieval times. Just hang around in the center of this beautiful city, where every house and every stone has a secret. Discover it slowly.There is a book about this church and about the people who lived around, which describes it very well: The cathedral of the sea by Ildefonso Falcones.

Nice Area. This was a very beautiful cathedral which is free entry to the public - good for those who want to see some great sights without spending a lot. The neighborhood around the church was one of my favorites in Barcelona as it is a bit off the crowded Las Ramblas. There is also an amazing difference between the old and the new architecture in this area which is quite interesting. On more than one occasion I was able to sit and listen to some local musicians playing on the street to the left of the cathedral (when facing the front) which was extremely enjoyable.

Beautiful place!. This cathedral is a stunning building very near the centre of Barcelona and a short walk from Placa de Catalunya. In my opinion the close proximity to the centre is one of its best features as many landmarks are a few metro's away which can prove to be very costly. The Cathedral is free on a morning until 12.45pm and i believe after 5pm its also free however in between these times there is a fee of 6 euros.
Just great. I value this cathedral a lot, it contains all historical aspects you would seek in such cathedrals and it definitely pull you in.

Free entree and great atmosphere. The atmosphere there is the most wonderful thing. Because the entree is free, everyone can get in. If you sit on the chair for just 10 minutes, you have already seen many interesting people. We were there in the dark, it's a shame that we did not get to have look at the building outside. Beggars are hanging/sitting around the cathedral, friends are gathering for drinks in the little cafe's nearby, etc..

Lovely ambiance. Beautiful atmosphere in the church, lovely neighborhood around it. Quiet, religious ambiance, not crowling with tourists, at least not in an annoying way.
beautiful architecture too.
In the basement there was a nativity scene set up, with a tiny waterfall. A bit kitsch.

Definitely worth a visit. This is a must-see church although we were there in the evening and the light wasn't great, particularly for photography. We planned to return one morning (nb the opening times or you will be disappointed) but unfortunately didn't manage to do so.
Lovely church.. An interesting church, not far from The Ramblas. It is beautifully decorated, especially the lead light windows. A must when in Barcelona.

Early Catalan Gothic architecture. The church is a wonderful display of Catalan Gothic architecture, with octagonal towers. The interior was burned in 1936 during the Spanish Civil War, after the Church sided with Franco. It was restored after the end of the Spanish civil war by Bauhaus inspired architects, Santa Maria del Mar has become one of Barcelona's most admired architectural buildings and easy to get to with its location in the old town.

My favourite!. We stumbled upon this church!I an in awe of it!The architecture is stunning!I actually went back for sunday mass but they didnt have one. So instead stayed there for over a hour! Even though it is a tourust attraction people are very quiet and respectful!I am glad i found it.

Another beautiful church in a wonderful city. Be careful because this church has specific opening and closing times, you can easily get caught out, but there is plenty to do in the many small side streets if this happens. Well worth a visit, nice piazza out front for a coffee and to take in the beauty of this cathedral.
gorgeous cathedral. Europe is chock full of gorgeous cathedrals, but that doesn't take away from any one of them being spectacular. This one is.
A beautiful church. This church had a wonderful atmosphere and enhanced our visit to the Old Town in Barcelona. Free entry.
Nice place.. Is free. Is not a cathedrat but is really nice. Its in a part of bcn called born. Lot of tapas places
Magnificent old building. This was a very humbling building, we lit a candle whilst we were there. The location is really quaint in a magical little square.
One of the nicest churches in Barcelona. I like this church because is simple (compared to others) but very familiar and invites you to pray. Definitely worth a visit i that area of town

Fairly average cathedral. I was fairly underwhelmed by this Cathedral. It's probably worth a look if you're in the area or are particularly interested in cathedrals but to me it was just a plain sort of Cathedral, without the usual splendour and interesting decor of Spanish churches,
A true gem and must see.... This was my second favourite church in Barcelona after La Segrada, different in style but interesting architecture and well worth seeing, free entrance.

One of my reasons to go tonBarcelona. There is a book " la Catedral del Mar" the "Cathedral of the Sea" I read it few years back and fell in love with the place, I visited the church and the mass, it was absolutely breathtaking, nothing shirt from the book and the stories behind it, it is in the gothic quarter

Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar. Stained glass windows were just stunning, and the height of the ceiling was just amazing.We visited early in the morning and it was ideal to pause and reflect on this wonderful church.
A lovely Cathedral. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this elegant and deeply spiritual place. Don't miss the Cloisters. Nice little gift shop.
My favorite church in Barcelona. Located in the historic center of Barcelona, this church imposes its history, its magnificence, yet its simplicity.

Beautiful and poignant church!. This will always be my point of interest when I come back and stroll El Born again - I prefer this locale than Las Ramblas because of its lively cafes, botique shops, and the best tapas in town - El Xyampanyet!
Huge!. So much history that this cathedral had in to making of this building. Make sure when you go, you look for the skull and cross bones in the floor.

Lovely peaceful church. My boyfriend wasn't particularly keen on me dragging him around a church but as we were passing we decided to go in for a quick look. I've been to much more impressive churches but it was nice to go there for a quick visit. A lovely peaceful place in the middle of the gothic quarter, not too far from the Picasso Museum so we went on the way back from there.

Impressive! . Makes you feel small and humble.
It's a shame they don't have audio guide there to understand the meaning of everything you see . It's truly God's place and not a tourist one.
worth a trip. worth seeing especially knowing the history of it. had a great tour guide that was with a tour operation that operated by tips only

Beautiful. An absolute must see in the gothic area of Barcelona, amazing architecture and tranquil building..
An escape from the maddening crowd outside!

Beautiful without being gaudy. While wandering around Barcelona I passed by this cathedral. On entering, I was amazed by its beauty. As opposed to many other European cathedrals, this one lets the architecture be the star. The towering arches were exquisite especially in combination with the light from numerous stained glass windows. I was in awe thinking about how this cathedral was constructed so many centuries ago.

Wish I'd had time to tour inside.... Mine is but a partial review - with limited time I could only wander-about and photograph the outside for about 15min. It is both impressive & lovely - on a return to Barcelona (which I expect to do one day) I will definitely make time to visit the interior.

Sanctuary. The first time I walked into the Santa Maria del Mar it struck me that there was a reason these large churches were referred to as sanctuaries. I am not particularly religious so it was interesting to me that the overwhelming feeling of being protected from the outside world was so strong. The quiet simplicity of this church is worth the effort to visit.

Church for the people by the people. This church has such an interesting history. If you have read the book by Ildefonso Falcones Cathedral of the Sea, you know what I mean. It gives me shivers and it breaths the tears and pain of the builders who carried the heavy stones in their backs from all the way from Montjuic mountain.
Gothic!. There is surprisingly much to see in the cathedral including a gaggle of geese, including one that spent the entire 15 minutes we were watching it staring at the wall.

Nice Gothic Cathedral. The church is a nice place to visit especially on a Sunday when it's free. We spent about 30 minutes inside. I wouldn't go out of the way to see it if you are short on time though

impressive cathedral with great history behind it. it is truly a grand impression when you enter the church and if you know a bit about history (there is a great novel with the same name which was translated into many languages) it is even more amazing the way it was built. unique wooden chorus in the middle. the church is closed in the afternoon and opens back up at 5.15 pm when tons of people storm the church on weekends - maybe not the best time to visit. something I didn't like: only electric candles can be lit, which is a bit strange and disturbs the atmosphere, but then I guess it makes some sense to preserve the church. Very impressive to visit!

Simple and beautiful. A very basic and beautiful showpiece of Catalan Gothic. A nice place for prayer or reflection. The story the guide related made it more beautiful, as it was built by the local craftsmen in the 1300s (?). It's also used as the background in the best selling novel Cathedral of the Sea, which I immediately went out and bought for my Kindle. A nice stop as you're wandering through El Born, but take your time inside.

Gorgeous cathedral. Beautiful cathedral in a fun area of the city. This cathedral has a very different look and feel than other European cathedrals (i.e., Paris, Trier, Strasbourg). Entrance is free, but be aware that men must remove their hats and women must cover their shoulders before entering.
Siesta times. The outside of the church is interesting. Just wish I could have seen the interior. Unfortunately they take siestas. The church is closed almost all afternoon.

Breath-takingly beautiful. While the Sagrada Familia is the landscape and city dominating structure and should definitely be visited, the Santa Maria del Mar is the "small church" that should not be passed by.

Do not miss this gem of a cathedral, in a fun area!. Beautiful cathedral, usually open and never have to pay to visit, Great fun area, walk around the church to the Borne, old street where they help josting centuries ago. Lots of neat bars and restaurants along this street and around the church. Notice the tile of the stone mason on the left side by the front door, showing how they carried these stones on their backs from the nearby mountain Montjuich.

Awe inspiring.. This Cathedral lies in the Gothic quarter and can be easily accessed by subway or bus. Its just a quick walk from Las Ramblas as well. Free to get in and truly beautiful inside. A must see.

what an experiance. Having made our own way to the city its was a wet raining day and to visit this was a marvelous experiance and the architecture was stunning and is well worth a visit and allow yourself time to take it all in

Nicest church in Barcelona. When you walk around in the Born area, you really should go and have a look inside this Church. I really think this is the nicest one in Barcelona. It is very original since it is a very simple yet impressive church.
stunning stained glass windows. This is worth a visit if only for the stained glass windows inside. Beautiful architecture. A more simple church than the cathedral but we liked it better.
stunning. This is a stunning cathedral. I love the architecture of this building in the El Born area.Its well worth a visit and its makes for a very tranquil break from the Barelona noise.
Elegsia de Santa Maria del Mar. Entrance was magnificent and height of ceiling incredible. Stone work and stained glass were impressive
Renovations hide stain glass from display. Unfortunately renovations meant the stained glass was covered up at present. Disappointing. Great atmosphere and ornate paintings but little in translation.
Gothic with a capital G. Visit this on a clear evening to get the best out of it silhouetted against the night sky shows the architecture at its best.

Church with a history -- a popular landmark in El Born area of Barcelona. This church with a history (you have to read it in the novel "La catedral del mar" by Ildefonso Falcones) is smack in the middle of El Born area. It's a great landmark as well as a sight worth visiting. The 1714 memorial, called "Fossar de les Moreres" in Catalan is next to the church in a small plaza. You can have a cup of hot chocolate in Bubo after visiting the church :-)

beautiful church. because the position of the church is surrounded by high buildings it was hard to takes photos where appear tthe whole building specially in the back wich is the main entrance also my photos from inside all were blur really strange because never had a blur photo in any other place with the same camera,maybe is better to take a more professional camera

Simple, beautiful church.... A fine example of the Catalan Gothic style, this is a simple church. Worth a visit if for no other reason than to seek a break from walking and the noise of the streets. The church is free, and for 5 Euro you can get a tour of the roof!! Definitely worth it at sunset.
Wonderful. After reading "Cathedral of the Sea" by Ildefonso Falones I had to see this cathedral. It was more awesome than I expected. Loved the carved bastaixos on the front door.

Beautiful building. The entrance fee is 6 euros - cheaper for senior citzens and children go free. Peaceful place to relax from the hussle and bustle. You can access the roof by lift where there is building work at present but great views. Only issue with this visit is why do they allow beggars to be at the front door of the cathedral. Not a good image.

Very pretty gothic church. Very nice alternative to the main cathedral in Barcelona if you are not willing to pay 8€ to go into a church. It's located in the El Born district, so while you're there make sure you pop in. Go there when it's dark, it's magical with all the candles! There are free tours at specific times but we missed it so I cannot say anything about it.
Dark but lovely. Flickering candles, dark interior, emits gothic beauty. The entry was free and the location is great.
Magical place. If you've read Pillars of the Earth, Shadow of the Wind or Cathedral of the Sea, you will love this place. Spectacular tribute to the poor souls who built such a spiritual place!

The Catedral of Love. The impresionant Catedral, builted in 54 years iluminated the life of Barcelona from medieval times to now, and inspires one of most faimous catalan novell of love '' La Catedral del Mar'' by Idefonso Falcones, wich transform in ''Catedral of Love''. If you are inloved or you are loking for love must to go to pray in.
Inspiring. Very beautiful, with quite a wonderful story behind it. Beautiful stained glass windows, many very fine side chapels. Much history here!
Lovely!. Impressive church with a great histoy behind it! Also nice cafes arround it to sit and enjoy the season changing!
Simple but Impressive Church. This church has a commanding presence and inside is very impressive although not overdone with lots of gaudy religious artifacts.

Soaring architecture & beautiful windows. Don't go out of your way, but if you're in the area, this is definitely worth a (free) visit. Not impressive on the outside, but the interior boasts one of the highest spaces. Windows are beautiful, especially with afternoon sun coming through.

very beautiful Cathedral. I did not venture indoors and should have because I know the inside is spectacular from photos I've seen. The lines were just too long for me and having walked around Las Ramblas all day I did not have the energy to wait. The outside is magnificent and I walked the exterior enjoying the carvings and the details of architecture.
Shame it was closed for restoration. Walked to se this after reading about its construction in a book. Sad to see it was all closed up for renovation.

Interesting church close to Picasso Museum. Interesting history is visible in this church. The charring on the ceiling is still visible. Small wooden boat on the alter insures safe passage for all sea men.

Nice Gothic Church. Lovely Church found in the Gothic Quarter. Good for a quick visit
A wedding was in progress when we visited.
Restaurants & bars in the court-yard in front of the Church.
Recommended.
Lovely church. Quite, peaceful, big and beautiful... go visit and thanks God for giving the blessing to be there at such amazing place

A haven of peace and tranquillity. This charming church is not overly decorated and is quite dark inside giving a feeling of peace. There are plenty of murals and small chapel like alcoves to explore. If the weather is hot and humid outside this will restore your spirits. Watch out for the afternoon closing.

Santa Maria del Mer. Great gothic architecture - similar to Cathdral but worth the visit. Easy to find and located near the Picasso Museum and lots of little bars including a wonderful bakery/coffee shop - Brunels - churros and chocolate - yum.

Santa Maria del Mar. This church is simply very special, located in the heart of the most charming neighborhood in old Barcelona, El Borne, and just a short walk from the Picasso Museum. Built in the early 1300s, the church and its spectacular rose window survived the fires of the Spanish civil war. The plaza in front has a near perfect ambiance, a place to read, sip wine and watch, as locals and tourists pass by. Great for couples, families, and those just by themselves.
One of my favourute spots in town!. Gorgeous church in the Born neigborhood.It's always crowded with people and ocasionally celebrates weddings and musical events. A must in town!

Stunning. Peaceful. Free.. At the conclusion of a walking tour we ended up here and spent 10 reflective minutes sitting and enjoying the beauty of this stunning church built by the people for the people. Well worth the stop.

Quiet amongst the hustle and bustle on Born. Beautiful example of a gothic church. Free to get in - take the opportunity to chill out and admire the industry from the local community that built the church in record time. Apparently local men would give up their free day to haul stone from the quarry at Montjuic. Note the figures on the front door. The coffee shop opposite is a nice place to sit for an hour or so watching the world pass by.

Beautiful cathedral in a lively plaza. This cathedral bears no significance to me since I don't know who St. Mary was in the first place. It's an exquisite structure but if you've been around, you probably would have seen more magnificent cathedrals. However, it is conveniently located at a square with lots going on, so if you're around the area, you shouldn't miss it for the buzzing atmosphere. Remember to dress appropriately if you would like to enter the cathedral.

Must See. This is in the top 8 must see in Barcelona from Lonely Planet's Barcelona book and the 2nd church after Sagrada Familia - and it is a Must See. The windows are beautiful, the architecture inspiring and the entrance free (after paying Euro 16 in each attraction, it is a refreshing change that something is free and it is so beautiful).Please note though that the church is closed from 1 PM-430 PM since it is an operating churchEnjoy your visit

Rubbernecks in the temple. Liked : More the sense of history and the obvious devotion of people who were there as worshippers and pilgrims than anything else. Disliked: the disregard of many shutter-bugs (yes, we took some photographs, and tried to be discrete about it) for the fact that this is a place of worship and that a degree of reverence and respect, even from tourists who don't share the faith of the worshippers, is surely simple politeness.
Getting married in Barcelona... Truly stunning church, got married here and loved it and had our reception in nearby La Luna restaurant, very memorable day never to be forgotten.

Beautiful. Beautiful Gothic church, in the Gothic Quarter about 500 m from Plaza Catalunya, within a short walking distance from our hotel. We could see the church from the hotel's window. The surrounding streets are nice with cafes.
Favorite Square. The surroundings at Santa Maria del Mar turned out to be our favorite neighborhood in Barcelona. Nice restaurants in vicinity and excellent wine bar outside the church. Enjoy!
Another gothic church. You won't impressed if you have already visit cathedrals in Germany ,Italy etc but if you are near it's worth to pay a visit

A must see (but tank tops and shorts are not allowed). Include a visit to the Cathedral when you walk around the Gothic part of the City. Important advise: tank top shirts or shorts are not allowed (neither for women nor for men) inside the Cathedral, so you may want to include some extra clothes in your backpack (or you can buy a pashmina for 0,5-2 euros right by the Temple). Curiously, the guy who prohibits the people to visit the Cathedral if they don’t follow the rules, smokes right on the Cathedral stairs and throws his cigarettes on the floor.

Impressive church in a lively square. The church of Santa Maria del Mar (don't confuse it with Santa Maria del Pi near la Rambla , or the Cathedral in Barri Gothic) has an impressive exterior, decorated with delicate sculpture and is situated in a picturesque and busy square with the same name. Inside the church hasn't anything special, except from the painted vitraux windows. It's worth a visit, especially at night when the lighting makes this gothic building look even more grand.Around the church you can find beautiful restaurants with local delicacies, wine bars as well as cocktail bars serving outside when the weather is good.

Pretty church, relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Because I had read the Cathedral of the Seas book, I had to see this church. It was very beautiful inside and just as Arnaudt (the character in the book) had described it. Free, which was nice,and a lot more relaxed and welcoming than the main Cathedral in barca.

Hidden Treasure. We decided to visit the 'Cathedral of the Sea' (I recommend the book) having already spent some time in Gaudi's popular cathedral. The people's cathedral of Barcelona is much less well known but is, in my opinion, a hidden jewel

Beautiful church in Gothic Quarters. I'm not too sure how, but the two times we stopped by this area, right outside the church, there were always things happening -- one night there was a free house music concert and a play ground for the kiddies and the next day, they had a samba party...the church is pretty and you can light a little candle, but once you've seen La SF, there is nothing that compares in Spain

Wonderful church and surrounding area. The church itself is ancient and beautiful. The surrounding area is known as the jewish area (because of its history) and is very ancient and interesting with lots of fab shops and restaurants. It almost feels like you are in Rome.
Very close to The Rambla. Very of church, but worth visiting, it does not take long to go around it, so you could include it with another tour.

la catedral del mar. this gothic church inspired the novel "la catedral del mar" the cathedral of the sea it is a wonderful monument constructed by the stevedores around the 13 century. the acoustic is great, if you have the opportunity to go to a musical event in this cathedral, do not miss it

A good place for a sit down and a coffee. In Barcelona for the day having arrived on the Thomson Dream cruise liner. After a bit of sightseeing we decided that we needed a sit down and a coffee. We found a very acceptable cafe just around the corner from the Cathedral. After refreshing ourselves we went to look around the outside of the Cathederal. However only being in the city for one day with so much more to be seen we didn't go in. If we ever go back then it will be on our short list of buildings to visit.
Traditional Church- but worth seeing. This church is close to all the action and can be seen quickly. The size and the stain glass windows along with the lighting are very impressive.
Amazing. Beautiful church - find out when it is free (usually in afternoon) and walk through. Feels medieval - gorgeous stained glass.

Very historic Cathedral that is a must visit. The cathedral is very old and historic. Please note not to go during mass times because you will not be able to see all of the church. I recommend spending time at the St. Antonio and Immaculate Conception chapels. They are particularly beautiful.

Ancient and Historical Catheral. This is one of the most impressive churches I have seen in Barcelona. It is very old, grand and solemn. It has beautiful glass windows and nice gothic architecture. It is located in the El Born district and not too far away from Museo Picasso.

Superb cathedral. An awesome building and a welcome contrast to Gaudi, although the Catalan Gothic style seems to me to show similarities - maybe Gaudi got inspiration from the columns and floral motifs?
Stunning. This was built in 1332 and is beautiful. Its the oldest Gothic style cathedral in Barcelona and is really gorgeous. Well worth a visit.

Magnifique!!!. As I normally do with my wife, we enter all churches we come accross while traveling. To both pray and appreciate the architecture. On a busy day of walking and shoping , it is really refreshing to take the time to light a candle, sit , reflect , surrounded by the amazing beauty of this cathedral

Very nice peaceful place for a short visit.. This was a very peaceful church to visit. I went there in the afternoon, and despite being busy and noisy outside, it was quiet inside, there was a guard patrolling to prevent noise and photography which was a good thing. There was a service underway and even though I'm not religious, it still was a very peaceful place to visit for a short stop. However there is not much to see inside, and also not many good photo angles from outside. And honestly not that much of the outside to photograph, because it has many flat walls and only a small decorated entry way. The main reason the inside is nice is from the high ceilings and Gothic architecture, and stained glass windows. But you dont need to stay long to appreciate it.
Peaceful. Although probably the smallest of the other cathedrals, be sure to take 15 min to sit relax in here. It's in the heart of the bustling city.

Celebrate. Celebrate the peace behind the walls of the church. It embraces you. The colors of the church warm and one can feel a special atmosphere. If one has had too much on ones shoulder, it is a place where to recharge the batteries.Women should cover their shoulders and don't wear short pants.

Surprise. Never have I stepped into a Cathedral and for this one to be my first (actually of many on this particular holiday) I had tears in my eyes at the old beauty of it all. It was haunting like an old cathedral would be but so beautiful. The tourist part of the place was not over done and those tending the shop area were quiet, kind, patient and really added to the peace of it all. The stained glass windows were as expected but they had one in particular that seemed new and out of place but not offensively so. I had a difficult time taking photos in color but my black and whites and antique shots came out amazing!
historic. located in el borne this church gives u historic perspective and a Modern lay around of the new shopping area.
stunning. we were on a tour and eveything was a bit rushed,the place was mobbed,but dont miss this its epic and iconic.

Very nice Gothic church. I certainly recommend to visit this church. It is not crowded and access is free.The stained glass windows are very nice. A quiet place to take some rest during a walk in the Barri Gothic and Ribera.
nice bars around it. church was just as you would expect a big church to be but the square next to it had some fantastic bars and street entertainers - wonderful!
Stunning architecture. I love to explore churches & cathedrals & stop and say a prayer when I travel. Please take the time to light a candle, sit & reflect & breathe in the beauty of this cathedral.
Old and very solemn church.. DanskEngelskSpanskBeautiful church without too much unnecessary adornment. High ceilings with very beautiful stained-glass windows. Glad that I got to see it.
Fenomenal Gothic Church in the hear of Born. A gothic cathedral with an imprave nave . Insipired the book with the same name . In the heart of barcelona. a must see.

Very nice. It is good if you find time and visit this church. Sometimes there are a lot of tourist but visit early in the morning or come to Barca in April or October when there are less people and not so hot. You'll like it.

A beautiful old cathedral. This was a very nice stop, and a cool reprieve during the heat of the day. Admission is free. The church fronts on a plaza (of course! It's Spain, after all!) which joins some nice little shops.

Lovely Cathedral. Despite many visits to Barcelona I only visited the cathedral recently for the first time as it was very hot and being free seemed a good place to sit in the cool interior for a short while. So glad we went it it has lovely windows. The statue of the virgin and child in with an old Barque in font is fantastic

"Just perfect". This is a lovely, old, quiet church that is full of history. You can see scars from the revolution. Magificent stain glass windows. There is something special about the place. It whispers to you if you take the time to listen.
Interesting history. Check out the bullet holes in the wall and the sunken patio where the soldiers were buried. A torch burns 24/7 to remember them.
Wonderfull sight in the evening. It is a very beatifull church, which you must see in Barcelona. be sure to see it in the evening whit light on.
well worth a visit. no charge to visit,which is unusual in barcelona.but so beautiful and worthy of a visit,dark peaceful and not that packed.closes for a few hours in the middle of the day
Peaceful. Its free to enter the Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar. Its very peaceful and if you want some quiet time away from the bustle of tourist activity, this is absolutely gorgeous.

The most beautiful structure in Barcelona. We dropped into this place by accident. The journey from the main street into a narrow street that leads you to this old church is wonderful for any photographer with a good eye. Once you enter the church its not hard to be amazed by the gothic architecture and angel like songs emanating by the volunteers of the church. We spent a lot of time inside absorbing the serentity that encompassed it inspite of a number of visitors.
The most beautiful church in town. To me this is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. It's simple in its decor and yet the space is warm and fills you with comfort. It's a very special space.
Brilliant. If you like bling churches this is for you. Architecture amazing with gold gilt edges. Downgrades the religous bit my having slot machines for light electric prayer candles

Not the best but worth a stop. Compared to the Barcelona Gothic cathedral and Sagrada Familia this church may underwhelm a bit. That said in most other cities it would be a first class site, it's more on the plain side but is still fairly grand in scale and worth a half hour to check out if you are in the area.

The People's Cathedral. Historical and interesting - very nice to visit - not time consuming and free. This is not meant as a slight in anyway, it was on our list and we would go back to visit again. Thank you Barcelona for sharing Eglesia de Santa maria del Mar. You can feel the people's love for the Lord.

A quiet place, nice for contemplation. The atmosphere is good, and the architecture fantastic.
It can be reached with the Metro, and is a short walk from the Picasso Museum.
It is located in the old city, with narrow streets and little traffic.
Beautiful. Although I still adore the Sagrada Familia by Gaudi, this cathedral is grand and exquisite. It takes your breath away!

Impressive. Large, older than most surrounding buildings. Located close to the sea, a nice area to visit. Also a great place to cool off! Even on hot days, it's really cool inside, which is interesting. Not too crowded either;

Simple and majestic. Let the crowds go to the Sagrada familia, the most beautiful church in town is this one. It is pure and simple gothic in line with Franciscan thinking. There is no particular piece of art or altar sticking out, it is just beautiful by its architecture and dimensions.
Beautiful Church. Definitely worth a visit. But I love old churches. Definitely like the chapels. This church "feels" old and it is.

Great example of Gothic church. While strolling in the Barrì Gotic, I suggest you to enter this beautiful church of the XIIIth century with a great atmosphere. Its highlights are the rose window in the facade and its authentic glass windows. Entry is free. The small square in front of it is also worth a visit; often street artists are seen here.
Beautiful Church. I loved to see the various devotional areas. The art was amazing. Though I totally respect the attire requirements, the person at the door could have been a little nicer.
Hidden treasure. I visited this only on my third trip to Barcelona, and I must say it was worth it - there are some amazing old frescoes.

Built in the 1930's - amazing!. This is an old church in the old quarter, an area of the city that my children loved. Walking around here is easy because of the narrow streets, creating lots of shade on hot days. The church itself is a masterpiece and was filled with soft music and incense and lulled us all into another world for 30 precious minutes.

It's free!!. Very surprised that it was free as the Cathedral entrance was 6 euros (lift to roof free - well worth going up) and the Sagrada Familia was 16+ euros!! and hours waiting in the baking sun!!
Worth going to. We didn't plan on going there, but were glad to come upon it. The stone work gives it a feeling of grandness.

Barcelona Gothic. Our hotel is literally around the corner from this beautiful church and I love how it gracefully sits in the square for all to admire. Built for real people, this building feels welcoming and peaceful - almost modest. You can just imagine it full of residents, from past to present. Once you go inside though, it's hard not to marvel at the stained glass windows and ceilings. I am not Christian, and this is one of the few churches I've felt truly welcome in. I did read a fiction book of the same name by I. Falcones and it was fun to see it in person and imagine elements of the story playing out in front of me. Also, as a fan of architecture, it's such a pleasure to see a true Gothic building.

A VERY BEAUTIFUL CHURCH IN THE BORN AREA NEXT TO THE SEA.. This is another beautiful church in the Born area. I loved this church. it is different to la sagrada . It has a real church/ religious feel to it. It is also a very old building and it is very grand. Right next to the picaso museum. Definiately visit when in Barcelona.
Impressive. Old and nice place, in very good condition, some strange visit hours, overcrowded especially at the end of the day.

Beautiful Church. Quiet a contrast after all the Gaudi stuff. Beautiful more traditional church. Worth taking a look if you have the time, there are only so many times you can stand in a que for hours!

My favourite Church in Barcelona so far. Overall I preferred this Church to the Sagrada Familia. This is probably because it is old and has a more spiritual feeling and atmosphere. I also like it because it is simpler than most Churches on the continent - not so ostentatious.

Peace Haven. I've been in Barcelona almost 20 times and I always visit Santa Maria del Mar. It is an example of Catalan gothic....so wide, elegant and harmonious! And it is located in the old and interesting, now gentrified, Born neighborhood, in the area of Ribera, near the Ramblas and the Barceloneta (old port area). You can miss Barcelona's cathedral, but you cannot miss Santa Maria del Mar.
Perfectoooo. It's so nice, not only as architecture, but it has this magical placa around it that is charming at night. U would find restaurant, bars,...Must go for a walk around it
Lovely church. We witnessed a lovely wedding, everyone looked so glamourous and happy. The church feels welcoming and peaceful
Historic Cathedral. If you can see only one cathedral in Barcelona see this one, it is very beautiful not to mention historical. The surrounding city is also very pretty.
Beautiful!. Peaceful, soaring ceilings and stained glass. Light a candle and sit for a while to rest from the hustle and bustle outside.

Students Travelling in Barcelona. This was right beside where we were staying, with no entrance fee and open at convenient times. The church is surrounded by shops, so it seems a little out of place, but it is gorgeous both inside and outside. If you intend to visit Barcelona on a budget, I would definitely recommend a visit here. If not visiting La Sagrada or the Cathedral would give you the same experience, only visit it if it's not out of your way!
Beautiful!. A must see! Have a glass of wine in the little bar in front of it! And then stroll around the neighborhood!
Just okay. If you are in the area the is cathedral is probably worth a stop - it is free to get in and will only take 5 minutes to explore. But it is not worth a special trip to the area.

Great Architecture. One of the best "Igrejas" I have visited in my life. A different one, with a deambulatory behind tje Main Chapel, open to pass by, not concealed by the "retabulo" of "Altar". Made by hand, for 80 years, by the people of the sea, as were known the fishers at 1299 a.C. in Barcelona.

realxing and cool in summer. I was drawn into this church not by it's exterior, but by the organ music that wafted out of the church. Not only did that give a wonderful atmosphere, but the many fans that made life just a little more comfy in the heat of summer, was the only gesture that I saw in Spain, that acknowledged the tourist's discomfort.

Worth a look. This cathedral has a stiff challenge from the Sagrada Familia and is much less ornate than many similar cathedrals, especially in Italy. When you go in at first, it appreas rather drab, but as you get used to the light - or even better the lights are turned on, the quality and character of the interior becomes apparent.
Nice cathedral. Not among the most spectacular churches we have seen, but still worth a visit. Free entrance.

Beautiful, hidden gem.. The cathedral is tucked away in the middle of the city, and it is beautiful! Even if you do not go inside, it is worth walking by on the outside and admiring it's beauty in the open square in front of the church. It is also in a fun part of town, with a lot going on!

A classical gothic cathedral not so known. As herds of tourists head to Barcelona Cathedral, this is the real and genuine Gothic church in Barcelona, without the modern additions and decorations that makes more rich but impure the Barcelona Cathedral.
The lights enters through the stained glass windows, making the church immense, and without all of these additions you can feel the spirituality.
My all time favorite church in BCN. Due to a fire, the church is now stripped practically bare with the only decoration being the side chapels. A great place to meditate.
Another quiet sanctuary in the city. Very large and not as beautifully decorated as some we have seen but still very moving. Worth a quick look and just a few steps from the madness of La Rambla.

Lovely. Beautiful church, we went to mass then got thrown out ! Thought it was cheeky to charge after we attended mass so decided to go somewhere else. Security guards aggressive considering its a church.Loved mass though.

If you are going, read this book. Ildefonso Falcones Cathedral of the Sea. It changes the way you see a building, to know how it came about within the context of human struggle and the meaning of "giving".

Nice church. Really nice church, you will pass by if walking the gothic quarter but it is not to die for. You can go in to see it and compare but if you see the cathedral and the sacred family you are covered.

A lovely cathedral and self guided tour. We enjoyed seeing the beautiful cathedral and the self guided tour was an easily used headset where you chose the descriptions you wanted to listen to. It came with a map of the locations and a suggestion of the full tour or suggested highlights taking around 20 mins. If you spotted something as you went round though it was easy enough to tap in the number and find out more.

Amazing Gothic cathedral. While it is sad that the wood furnishing of its interiors were burned during the Spanish Civil War, the fact that this church has been such an integral part of the La Ribera neighborhood for centuries is amazing --- as is the glory of its Gothic architecture.
Nice church. This church is very nice. It does not overwhelm like a lot of churches but it is worth the visit.

If you read the Book The South Sea Cathedral.... An historic place surrounding of spirituality of the place. The humble of the place and the location help you to ubnderstand what the story was about. How amazing was this long creation.You will see the place where the players of the book really stayed!You do not expect greatness in terms of luxe, this is about special people, ambient and religiousness.Simple charmed

Beautiful church and surroundings. Nestled between a lot of buildings it is hard to see from afar, simply follow a map and you'll discover this beautiful building with a nice plaza outside with cafes to have lunch at.Walking around its inside is a great, relaxing activity. Filled with icon to saints and candles you can purchase and light to your particular saint.
Ed95. An absolute stunning Place of worship. The Cathedral had an almost unearthly feel to the place and you knew you were in a very special place
Built by faith. Truely the people's cathedral right in the middle of the Born.Beautifull building built by the Barcelona fishermen.good sorroundis as well.
A real find in a very interesting area. Well worth a visit before stopping off at one of the many nearby Tapas bars, or the Picasso Museum
Nice for a quick visit. Worth popping in to have a look a nice visit with restaurants around the church.
Beautiful church. Built by the inhabitants of its quarter this church is really something special, take a look inside and learn about its history!

Worth a quick stop and visit. If you have time and can drop by this cathedral, I recommend just going in to appreciate the interiors and architecture, take some pictures and perhaps say some prayers (if you are religious). This should really not take much time and it's free. I think we spent less than 30 minutes here. If you don't have time or if this is not along the way with the rest of your itinerary, just skip it since there are other much better attractions to see (Gaudi's works, Palace of Catalan Music, Hospital de Sant Pau, etc.).
late Saturday afternoon. there was a wedding - beautiful venue - interior is spectacular
Massive, incredible building. I loved the Cathedral by itself. Only warrning to the people who love wearing tank tops, please cover your shoulders before entering this amazing object.

Even more interesting if you have read the book.. This lovely church is beautiful with no additional knowledge, but if you have read the book "Cathedral by the Sea", you will feel as if you, too were there for the buildng of this gem. Don't miss it.

A must, and will only take 5 mins. A really stunning church, quite unlike others in that it is grand and imposing yet simple and understated in style. It's free entry and just 5 minutes from Jaume 1 metro stop (keep walking downhill towards the sea). It'll only take 5 minutes, but is a welcome break as it is very cool (temperature wise) and beautiful.

Certainly worth a visit.. This church is good, less crowded. They won't let you in if you are not dressed properly. It doesn't take more then 45 mins to tour this church. If you are in Barri Gothic just do not skip this place. Its very photogenic from outside and calm and serene and of course religious inside. There are very beautiful paintings and statues inside. Do not forget to go to the roof of the Church, there is an elevator to take you there. You can capture scenic views of the Barcelona city from there.
Lovely Maria of the sea. Light in this cathedral is stunning through the stained glass windows. Quiet retreat from noise of the city.

Impressive cathedral. As all the cathedrals its an impressive building when you see it, inside its beautiful decorated with paintings, statues.. You can do a whole tour in the cathedral, see alot of Saints. Go up and have a wonderful view of the old city ..
closed for renovation. All shut when we visited with renovation in progress.Ah well, means we have to return to Barcelona next year to catch this....
