Wonderful church. We didn't go inside, but outside?..... what a magnificant building!
Beautiful stained glass windows. It is well worth visiting. Lovely architecture as you would expect. Interesting font.

We found this cathedral by accident.. While we were looking for the Picasso Museum we found this amazing church! We had to go inside because we just had too. The inside with all of the saints and stained glass windows made us feel that it was a special place for many souls.

Wonderful peaceful place. It's not Gaudi, but it's not supposed to be. This is a lovely, old, quiet church that is full of history. You can see scars from the revolution. Magificent stain glass windows. We visited twice and took our time on each visit. There is something special about the place. It whispers to you if you take the time to listen.

Nice place for a moment of silence. Located in the heart of the Born, you can't miss it. A great place to pause during a day of sightseeing and give a quick thanks for the good things in life, and a visit to Barcelona is definitely one of the good things.
To Barcelona from Shanghai. We discovered it by surprise and spend a few hours there... it's meeting point for friends and couples.... nice atmosphere and warm place.

Best-of-all catalan temples. Finest example of catalan gothic style, this church was possible by the individual contributions of the neighburs of La Ribera, as a way to thank God for the conquest of Mallorca in the XIII century. Clarly very much more elegant and delicate than any other in the city!

Nice, but the average cathedral. In the netherlands we have only three churches that are nicer, but we are protestant, however Spain, Italy and France are catholic and have plenty that have more to offer than this cathedral. For those of us who visit a cathedral in this part of europe for the first time, do go and visit, for those who have seen plenty be warned that it is simply more of the same and nothing special in comparison to for instance the churches of Rome.One big plus you can take the elevator to the roof for free and the entry is just Eur 6 each. The windows are also not bad (but nothing in comparison to those in Gouda).

A mind experience. Winter. My favourite time to visit this remarkable jewel of Gothic architecture in in winter, the season when Barcelona seems less rowdy, less crowdy, more enjoyable. Bach, Mozart, Mendelshon. The classics perform for you. Music festivals are then more plentiful and one of the regular venues for people to enjoy their favourites is in the Catedral de Santa Maria del Mar.

Awe-inspiring!. I am not religious, and we had been to Sagrada Familia the day before, but this church was not even comparable. The size, structure and feel of this old church was completely different than La Sagrada. We had a wonderful time hanging outside of the church for over an hour at this fabulous wine bar right outside the church (review of that place forthcoming--will need to look up the name again).

Gorgeous. Historical. Special.. To me, this is the most beautiful church in the entire city. It's got a wonderful, rich story behind it (read the book "Cathedral of the Sea", perhaps, before visiting Barcelona...). While I am not a religious person, per se, I do visit here often, as the building holds a special energy. They have a lovely Christmas mass celebration, should you be in Barcelona during the holidays.
Recommend a vist!. Entrance free, and lovely to go inside a cathedral which we stumbled upon by accident - well worth a look!

Beautiful. Beautiful stained glass in this church, tucked away in the quiet streets of an area that is largely pedestrianised. Although a lot of people were there to solely view in a tourist capacity, unlike other churches where this can disturb the tranquility, this church retains the peace necessary for quiet contemplation.

Beautiful inside and Out. Lovely building inside and out, worth a visit.
My Photos don't do the place justice so when in Barcelona don't miss this place.
Visit the church. Go inside is free part of visit the gotic !!!!! On Sundays are a Family dance in the morning...in the afternoon the plaça is full of people.
Interesting location in El Born. Nice architecture and to walk round the exterior of the building
Beautiful church. Very interesting part of the city, historic location
Nice. Not a needed stip but if you r into church and stuff its a must see
westipswich. interesting - lots of imagery we found it a little overwhelming and quite dark - was worth a visit as the surroundings quite fascinating
Popular with schoolkids. Went on a weekday and there seemed to be a class sketching the stained glass windows in each alcove. Impressive but not in same league as La Seu
Disappointing. Went to see this after Sagrada Familia, it was a real let down. The inside was very gloomy. Only high point was a beautiful stain glass window.
Disappointing. Unfortunately, went to this after the Sagrada Familia, which blew me away. It was dark, old and quite ordinary. Apart from one stunning modern window.
Historical Gem. The history of this cathedral is very interesting and we enjoyed the guide telling us some local tales of its past.
lovely church. just amazing inside, just wandered in and watched a service it felt very welcoming
beautiful. Just a wonderful feeling here, the atmosphere is majic in the area of the Borne District, and just outside the church in the courtyard are the nicest cafes shops and restaurants.
Beautiful. Well worth the time to visit. Beautiful Cathedral. A must visit
Beautiful views of Barcelona. My wife counted 200 steps up to the cathedral but everyone was worth it for the views provided.
This religious local icon is beautiful. If you are at the Gothic Quarter, this Cathedral is a must.
Nice. The history was interesting. It's nice, but it's not like the Church of the Sacred Family.
Beautiful. Beautiful inside. Lots of grottos and places to pray quietly if you want to. Not as impressive as sagrada famailia, but worth a trip

Hail Mary. I am a free thinker and an ar enthusiast. So my main interest was to appreciate the beauty of the cathedral's architecture and take in the sights as a tourist.St.Mary Cathedral turned the free thinker in me to think about believing in one path...what a beautiful place of worship and what amazing expressions...in the paintings, the sculptures, in the construction....I am sure there was a divine intervention for someone to get this inpsiration...and am sure the reigning deity in this cathedral was definitely a main reason...

Must see - start here if you can. I'm surprised by the reviews that state that this church is nothing special. My wife and I started our tour of Barcelona with a visit to this stunning work of architecture and history. While not overpowering in size, it is full of rich detail and stunning design. This is a must see location if you have any appreciation of art and architecture. As others have stated, it doesn't have to be a lengthy visit to appreciate its beauty.Put this on your list!
Interesting!. Small church worth spending a few minutes or an hour...nice location too.

Preferable to Church of the Sacred Family. Right near the Museum Picasso is the excellent and beautiful Cattedrale Santa Maria del Mar, an exquisite example of traditional church architecture (especially compared to Gaudi's Church of the Sacred Family). Take a while to just sit and soak in the atmosphere. The building is currently undergoing restoration, so some comparison between the two structures makes for thoughtful observation.
Typical church. Not sonething exceptional ,it's something you visit because it's written on tourists books

Go on a sunday or bank holiday. Steeped in history, go see the 13 geese that represent the age in which Saint Eulalia was tortured after refusing to recant her christianity. A very sad story. Cathedral in a lovely area. If you go on a sunday or bank holiday monday you will see the locals doing the sardana dance (? think this is what its called). No admission fee before 1pm or after 5pm
Very nice. Definitely worth a visit, but having already been to the cathedrals in Toledo and Seville we weren't awe-struck.

Start your tour here. THis is oldest cathedral. If you start your tour here - take some time to sit in a pew and then go to the Sagrada Familia, you will see how Gaudi was inspired by the design. Also, read the book, Cathedral of the Sea as it will give you great Barcelona history and tells the story of the construction of the cathedral in a very easy to read novel.
Wow!. Fantastic on photo but you must see it with your own eyes to appreciate the great cathedral.

Sunday. This church is within walking distance from the Romblas. We went on Sunday morning before 13:00. Admission is free at that time. And on Sunday's the community comes out of the woodwork and dances, the Sardana Dances. It is just precious see these Catalunya people gather for these impromptu dances and listen to the wonderful band that plays for them.
Absolutely beautiful!. After reading the novel "The Cathedral of the Sea" I had to visit this church! It was just wonderful...and I will be back on my next trip to Barcelona!
beautiful church. This church is almost at the sea and inside is beautiful and round about you have many tapas and wine bars

Well worth a visit. Had read about this Church before our visit, saw the symbolic geese in the fountain courtyard. The courtyard was a nice cool spot on a hot day, with toilets. A 14th century historical cathedral in good condition.
Gem in the old city. Tuck in the maze of the narrow streets, it's a surprisingly huge and impressive church
Beautiful. Everything is beautiful about this Cathedral, you can't miss it if you go to Barcelona
Most "romantic" catholic service. Full of history, beautifully nit at night in a great neighborhood!

The sailor's tahnkgiving work. All the church tell a story of old Spain ,from the King and Queen to common people and sailors.
I disliked the noise of visitors during the ceremony.

Great Church in a Bohemian Part of Town. This church is located in a part of town our tour guide said was being reestablished by a lot of younger artist types, and she was right. My wife refers to this type of community as bohemian. The shops and cafes in the immediate area around the church were full of young people (late 20's, early 30's) and the area was thriving. The church itself on the outside is old and dirty (afterall it is some 200 or so years old) but the inside was beautiful. High ceilings, statues, stained glass and artwork. Though a little out of the way, the church and and a coffee or gelato at a cafe are worth the trip.
Great Cathedral. This was a very nice palce to visit..and is surrounded aby nice restaurants..and bars...

Lovely church!. The church is wonderful!It has a couple of entrances, and we came by one of the entrances, that wasn't the main one. So, we weren't really all that impressed with the church's outside look (we got a bit spoilt with all the kitsch that Gaudi is all about), although it is quite a look when you come to the Placa Santa Maria, and this big church stands upon you.When we entered, we were imedietely impressed. It is wonderful from the inside! A bit dark, like all great gothic churches, and very charming. I loved all the coloured glass!We left the church through the main entrance, which is incredible from the outside too.We loved the church, and actually came back to it about two or three time while we were in Barcelona.
simple but nice. a very nice older church, great view of the past along with seeing how it is today.

Visit en route to Picasso Museum. In the heart of the Ribera district, this Catalan gothic cathedral is a short walk from its neighboring famous attraction , the Picasso Museum. It was built with sea merchants' money and survived a fire during the Spanish Civil War. Its free to the public and its cool dark interior is well worth a short visit.

Worth a visit. This is not the nicest church in Barcelona but considering that it was built and financed by the ''lower class '' in the Middle-Age , it is quite impressive ! Its simplicity gives it a charm not found in bigger and more illustrous cathedrals ! Services are still being performed at the Cathedral and we were fortunate enough to find seats to attend the Easter Mass ! A magic moment !

Essence of a Spanish cathedral. Loved walking through this place and sketching the architectural details. It is also a little known fact that you can find a very clean bathroom in the courtyard behind some bamboo screens... tiny but a huge gift to travelers since they can be so hard to find in Barcelona. The courtyard itself is just lovely, and a beautiful place to sit for a few minutes of quiet contemplation (if you happen to be there when it's not full of tourists.) I have looked for the Roman ruin, as Hikermeister mentioned in an earlier review, but never been able to locate it in the three times I visited.

Lovely church!. The church is wonderful!It has a couple of entrances, and we came by one of the entrances, that wasn't the main one. So, we weren't really all that impressed with the church's outside look (we got a bit spoilt with all the kitsch that Gaudi is all about), although it is quite a look when you come to the Placa Santa Maria, and this big church stands upon you.When we entered, we were imedietely impressed. It is wonderful from the inside! A bit dark, like all great gothic churches, and very charming. I loved all the coloured glass!We left the church through the main entrance, which is incredible from the outside too.We loved the church, and actually came back to it about two or three time while we were in Barcelona.

This is the HEART of Barcelona. Spend a day just wandering. A map is hany to have but keep it in your pocket. There are museums, shops (Don't miss Jobal on Comerc 21 for saffron) and churches. Oh...food too!

Gothic area great visit. The Cathedral is the centre of the Gothic district, which includes a Roman ruin hidden deep in its midst. We had a local guide, wiithout which I am sure we would never have found the Roman ruin. I tried to go back to the cathedral a couple of times, but kept getting lost in the maze of narrow streets.
As the novel tells.... I visited the church because I read the book "La Catedral del Mar" based on the construction of this church. The church is beautiful and full of history. Very nice visit!!!
A very nice cathedral.. Not out of this world but worth seeing if you are near.

Build by fishermen. It's a place full of history and a magnificent gothic cathedral. The church didn't pay a penny for it. The Barcelona fishermen did. It's very wide and beautiful. It looks like then. No luxury, not overdone.

Not the cathedral, but very nice just the same. It's a cathedral and though not the main one, it is definitely worth seeing, if you have the time. I think what distinguished this place is how tasteful the design is. It's lovely. The only reason I don't give it an excellent is because you have to prioritize and if you are only going to see one cathedral in Barcelona, it would have to be the main one, which is spectacular and also very interesting. We had 5 and 1/2 days in Barcelona. So we could see both.
pretty church. Worth a visit - nice church, interesting history to it as well.
Beautiful building. Another place you need to visit when in Barcelona. We also took the lift to the top and were rewarded by great views. Make sure you walk the entire area as there's so much to see

Surreal scene during mass. My wife and I walked by the Cattedrale and its plaza each day of our trip to Barcelona. On our visit on Sunday morning, the scene during mass was surreal. A bunch of picture taking tourists were in the back of the Cattedrale as the security guards were seating parishioners as mass was being conducted up at the altar. When you go to the Cattedrale be sure to go into the cloister in the back and see the geese.
Interesting!. The Born area where the Cathedral is placed is great! stylish, young and not as crowded as the Gothic.

Such an amazing place!. Santa Maria Del Mar us easy is miss with all of the other cathedrals and sites in Barcelona, but don't let yourself. It's amazing! I read "Cathedral By The Sea" before heading to Barcelona and it really put the church as well as the city in perspective.

Very impressive cathedral. My wife and I visited the Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar on three occasions during our trip to Barcelona. Not as ornate as the Sagrada Familia but it has a more reverent tone. It contains some very nice stained glass windows.
A MUST. Beautiful in its gothic simplicity. It is one of those places that draws you into prayer. At noon on thursdays one can go up to the roof and have a breathtaking view of "old" Barcelona.
nice and interesting. if you are interested in churches or if you just pass by on your way please have a look at it.... but for me it is not a must.

Such a peaceful place. A really beautiful building and more in line with what a holy place should be like. Whilst the Sagrada Familia was impressive, it felt far too commercialised.We really enjoyed sitting inside the Santa Maria. I'm not Christian, but we ended up sitting and reflecting on the pews such was the over whelming atmosphere of the place.Thoroughly recommend a visit. One of the best hidden gems in Barcelona.

Modest but elegant church. This church is really modest but elegant with its narrow pillars. The cathedral was build by the people of Barcelona as a house of worship and this you can feel when you visit it. You won't find the usual grandeur of other cathedrals, just calm. It is impressive in it's very own way and well worth a visit.Just mind the opening hours: they have a siesta.
A must for who's read Ildefonso Falcones book. after reading Ildefonso's book just had to visit this cathedral; it's like stepping back into 14th century Barcelona.
A gem. An austere exterior hides one of Gothic architecture's most impressive spaces. It is simply fantastic the way the light comes in between the columns.
Not to be missed. Amazing altar pieces some 14 century well worth a visit.

Nice to see if close by and has good views from the top.. I think it is very good to see it if you are already in the area but the it doesn't really distinguish itself massively from other cathedrals. Having said that they do have lots of statues and paintings of Christian related things which look quite nice so if you had spare time it would be worth going out of the way for.It's worth going up to the top in the elevator (costs €2.50) for a nice view. Also before 12:45 and after 17:15 it is free to go in (except the elevator) otherwise you have to pay, not sure how much as I went when it was free but I think it was around €6 - €8.
A more traditional church. Loved this church - the interior had very large and intricate stained glass windows. Very beautiful.
good impression. Within the building there are not so much to see, except you are religious or have specific interests, but I was feeling well inside.
Pure Gothic. If you don't like Baroque etc additions to lovely austere Gothic cathedrals, this is the one for you.
Just a quick peek. It was Holy Week so we were shooed out - maybe they were preparing for a mass. Still a beautiful classic church.

One more cathedral. Of course you should visit it when you are in the area. It is quite nice but it does not distinguish itself from the other ones in Spain. It is probably along your itinerary so please go in but I though that others were more original and stunning.
Fair. Not amazing as though,but one time visit and a quick glance

Gorgeous and awe-inspiring, steps from the city center. Another stunning example of architectural prowess and beauty. So glad we stopped in after deciding not to wait on the insane line at the Picasso museum. No lines here, but plenty to see!

Epic and majestic. My favorite church in Barcelona. The size is truly incredible and outstanding constructions being built in the 1300's outlasted several disasters that destroyed other buildings of its time. Along with no admission charge and not over crowded this is a great stop on your trip.

simple elegance. I love Santa Maria del Mar, it's soaring, light filled and unadorned. Whether you are a religious person or not, there is a feeling of peace and tranquility in being here. Of special interest is to go to an organ concert there when the sounds fill the church with beautiful sounds. Don't miss Santa Maria!!
A Church in the best neighborhood (el born). We think that is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. The architecture is magnificient. The church is located in our favourite area of Barcelona.
Interesting. An interesting place to visit, but only with you have time left... There's other places far more interesting in Barcelona.
Old but nice. Nice old traditional cathedral, no entrance fees, beautiful
Impressive. I visited the cathedral when it was almost night. But still we could see all the beautiful stained glasses on the bright side. Don't miss the blue modern one at the back, near the chapel.

St. Mary del Mar. This church has an older feel because it's more simple than many cathedrals. I like the ship in Mary's hands, not only does it advertise who sponsored the church but it must have given seamen a comforting feeling to know Mary was watching out for them.
Must go. It's a beautiful simple church. I love the boat under the virgin and while there are pleny of churches out there, this one has a special place in my heart.
a place of quiet beauty. This elegant cathedral should not be missed. It is not elaborate, but strikes one because of its clean lines and architectural honesty.

A stunning building. I have visited this church many times on trips to Barcelona and it never ceases to impress me. Unlike the cathedral, you are able to see the wonderful architecture to its full extent - with soaring pillars and lots of light. It doesn't look too impressive from outside but don't let this put you off. Go inside and be amazed!
A cathedral for the people. A must for everyone who have read Falcones book. It's a very fine and open cathedral. Feels really welcoming.
excellent. but the queues were horrendous we didn't go in but admired from outside because of this
Nice. We went there on the 1st half of the day (late morning) when it wasnt so crowded. Loved that church - inside you feel like being in a movie about ancient times :) Recommend to vist it:)
Important Cathedral. Could not go inside, but took lots of pictures of the exterior.

The most gothic building of Barcelona. Essential and paceful church in the centre, it must be visited at least to be compared with the cathedral. The entrance is for free. Mediocre frontage, but really pleasant interior, with a very nice rose window, tall columns and unadorned walls. Very good acoustic, as weel: a voice concert would be the perfect occasion to enter.

Nice to see if you have the time. Worth the visit if it is on your path. I would like to have gone during a service to listen to the acoustics for which it is well known. Beautiful large church in Catalan Gothic style - but not unlike many churches I have seen.
Well worth a visit. beautiful inside and especially good to go when there is a service taking place. The music adds to the experience & atmosphere
Beautiful and undervisited church. Quiet, tranquil church in the middle of a charming neighbourhood.
peaceful and beautiful. more lovely than the big cathedral, this is really a "people's church."
Catalan Gothic. this cathedral was built in only 55 years, it is really authentic for it´s era
Beautiful church. This church is beautiful. It's quite cheap to get in and it's located near La Rambla so it is easy to stop by.

A cathedral of inspiration. The fruit of the work of peasants in medieval Barcelona, the plot of a contemporary bestseller and a nice monument in the middle of a pintoresc quartier in the city. Don t miss the wine taverns in front of it as well!
nice church. A beautiful church located in a great neighborhood-Gothic Bari
Not as well known but very pretty. We like churches and this one is prettier than the cathedral. Good to visit if you like gothic archetecture

Silence is key. When you visit cathedrals, there is usually a lot of noise. This is a wonderful gothic church that conveys silence. Sit and observe, it's a wonderful building build with the fishermen money only!
gothic wonder. unadorned poetry in stone. and just round the corner from the best tapas bar in the world.

What a wonderful building!. This place is awesome! Wife and I like visiting churches but this is terrific and although it has a Gothic feel to it, the wonderful stained glass windows give it a beautiful colour.

A lot of stones. Amazing that people have built this by hand. Great windows to look through and see all the lovely colours. After you got your spiritual dose, don't miss all the ice cream in the area.

Don't miss it!. This is a grand Gothic Cathedral that might not get the attention it deserves. It's an extremely impressive building though they are currently in the process of restoring it. The details in the design of the exterior were especially interesting. Don't rush through this one. Take the time to soak in it's majestic ambiance.
Beautiful Gothic. This cathedral brings a nice relief from all the Gaudi`s buildings. Very pure and beautiful Gothic.
Beautiful Gothic. This cathedral brings a nice relief from all the Gaudi`s buildings. Very pure and beautiful Gothic.
Not to be missed. A veritable island of peace in a sea of seething humanity. Loads to see and experience including going up to the roof for a fantastic view.
Pleased. The first time we went to visit this it was shut, we went back and were pleased we did. The church is very simple but a tremendous example of Gothic architecture.

Just happened upon it.... Just ran across this. It was just past dark and the Cathedral was just beautiful. I felt very welcomed and loved just walking around and admiring the whole building inside and out.

Fourteenth Century beauty.. Guidebook claimed this was the most beautiful church in Barcelona. It's interesting in an interesting neighborhood, but can't (pardon the expression) hold a candle to the cathedral. We've been in a lot of religious buildings and I'd have to say the cathedral of Barcelona is at the top of my list.
Beautiful. Very interesting and beautiful quite different from all the Gaudi

Cathedral of the Sea. Had to visit after reading 'Cathedral of the Sea'. Wasn't disappointed. Yes, it's another cathedral but how they built these monumental structures six or seven hundred years ago, remains a mystery to me.
SPECTACULAR. This is another don't miss destination in Barcelona. Check hours, as it's not always open.

Often confused with Cathedral of Santa Eulalia. I probably have visited too many similar establishments so this did not really impress me. I could see though how some concert would be great there and how that would give to the place the different feel. We enjoyed much more the Cathedral of Santa Eulalia with the courtyard and the rooftop terrace. Some pictures posted here as Santa Maria del Mar are actually made in Santa Eulalia.

Authentic and warm Church. Most people gt there because of Carlos Ruiz Zafón book and none is desappointed. It is a very peaceful and authentic church and entrence is free, a nice alternative to the Barcelona's Cathedral
An unexpected find. A lovely small church that goes back to the beginnings of Barcelona.

Peaceful and beautiful. There is something to this church that keeps you together. I visited this church at least twice in a 4 day visit. The first time I was there was on Good Friday - it was crowded but just got to swim with the crowd - in spite of that there was a special quiet inside. You got to go to experience it. I also took the lift upstairs but it didn't seem all that fantastic. You get to see the spires at close quarters.

Short of expectations. Stepping into this cathedral did not give me the normal feeling of awe and peace. The candles were all electric, so to light one you had to deposit a coin and press a button - this totally changed the ambiance. I love lighting candles, so this was disappointing. The saint alters were interesting. The church felt too crowded with people and objects. I left feeling more impatient than inspired.
Didn't know where we were. We were just mooching and went into the Church to sit down. It was beautiful and we stayed to watch the stations of the cross which is apparently celebrated daily.

Most beautiful Church in Barcelona. After the disappointment with the interior of Sagrada Familia, this wasa positive surprise. Santa Maria del Mar is a gothic masterpiece built inthe 14th century. It is IMHO the most interesting Church in Barcelona. A sightto not miss!
Another must for this city. Visited during the Easter festivities so rather crowded butwell worth it.

Awe inspring cathedral nestled in the middle of narrow medieval streets. Beautiful stained glass all around and free to enter during specific times of the day. Walking inside is like time traveling to a different time away from the modern side of Barcelona. When you are done, step outside for a cafe con leche, snack, or dessert while you continue to gaze upon its exterior beauty.
just another cathedral. It was good to visit the Cathedral but nothing special
church. incredibly simple and beautiful, it surely deserves a visit.
Church. The nicest one, and the simplest one, in Barcelona. It is called the "sea cathedral". There is a nice book (a novel) escribing how the fishermen have built it.
This church and the area around is worth a visit. Since it is semana Santa we could not see the front part of the church but we know it from former visits and always come back
Nice to see. This cathedral is also nice to see. Just go and see it yourself
nice to see. It is nice to see this cathedral. Just have a look for yourself.

wow! better then Sagrada Familia, imo!. WOW!!!!Go there. Really! Go. For all the reasons.The magnificence of the building is amazing, in my opinion, more breathtaking then Sagrada Família or even Notre Dame in Paris.The architecture of the building is amazing! You feel crushed once you walk in the door. I'm not religious, but i felt that was a sacred place to be.Plus, it's in Gothic, so lots of places to see nearby and, best of all, it's free! Although i would recommend leaving something or lighting some candles to help maintaining the building...After Palau Guell it's my favourite place in BCN.Go, go, go!!!!!

An active scene.. Loved the building and its surrounds. Didn't like the mix of people having a communion service whilst surrounded by noisy camera flashing tourists (no respect) and a brigade of security guards babbling on walkie talkies. Left and visited later when service was ended.
Quiet contrast. One of the few medieval remains, so a treasure. A place of tranquillity for this area.
Impressive church in El born. sober pilars, impressive vault, sense of humility.
Very interesting building. So many different side chapels and lovely windows.

Gorgeous Cathedral in the Barri Gotic. I'm a sucker for gothic cathedrals & this was a real treat for me. Buttresses, octagonal towers, stained glass, oh my! This cathedral of Catalan Gothic style is a must-see! There are some restaurants in the courtyard outside...linger at one of the sidewalk cafe tables for hours, people watching & listening to the glorious cathedral bells.

Beautiful and great atmosphere. Even if it does need some recovery work, I consider this one more beautiful than the Cathedral (La Seu). Located between the picturesque Barri Gotic and Born district, inside you will find a peaceful atmosphere. Pay attention to the beautiful stained glass over the front door!
Beautiful. After seeing the many works of Gaudi, this was a nice change. Very pretty church and in a great section of town.

My favourite church. Forget about Barcelona's cathedral, if you like Gothic architecture then Santa María is the place to be. Very airy, lots of light and amazing overall. Entry is for free and it's located in the very popular Borne quarter, a must visit in itself (good tapas bars!) so going to this church won't divert you from the must see places in town.
Breathtaking. Way better than the Sagrada Familia, despite not so famous.
Full of history. Although a little dark inside, the history is evident and and you are transported back to the seafaring days of Columbus and his peers receiving blessings as they sail off.
Lovely Cathedral!!. I really liked this Cathedral, more than the Basílica de la Sagrada Família! Inside was sincere, impressive and a place to reflect.
A must on the Barcelona visitors list.... One of the most visited cathedrals in Barcelona for a very good reason...
Very beautiful. Not to loss. A wonderful gothic chatedral near the old city and Barceloneta. vety importante!!!!!!!!!!
My favourite church in the world. Simple perfect: simple lines, beautilful and colourful windows... no doubt it is the nicest church I've ever seen.
Ancient church. A little quieter away from main centre - and has pretty little square and streets around it.

If you see one church in Barcelona, see this. This is Gothic par excellence and the good thing is that the Republicans during the Civil War gutted it of all the accumulated votive junk common to Mediterranean Gothic churches and what you're left with is the stark beauty of that style. It contrasts so nicely with the gaudiness of the Sagrada Familia and even beats another church "Santa Maria del Pi" because of its very cleanliness. You'll be awed.
Very nice building. Perfect building and in good shape. Great neighborwood with plenty shops,restaurants,etc.

A gothic marvel and Mozart. With the help of folks on tripadvisor's Barcelona forum we managed to find a concert and it was held here. The sheer majesty of the the interior space in this ancient cathedral is breathtaking and cannot imagine what it seemed like to people in the 1300's! However filled with the music and voices of Mozart's requiem - sublime. There are concerts, many with well known classical guitarists, on a regular basis and this helps with ongoing restorations of these wonders. Treat yourself.

under renovation in early 2012. The Church of Santa María del Mar was undergoing a major renovation project when we visited in February 2012. It is generally quite an austere church, with much less decoration compared to other old and important churches in Spain. Details of its interior were comparatively rundown when we looked around. The church is a large structure with very restricted sightlines at ground level, hemmed in closely by narrow streets. We were interested to see a major church restoration in progress but this church is probably not yet a sight most people would make a special effort to see before other higher priority sights of Barcelona.
Good. second stop on bus route and really quite central no entry charge

Inspiring concert, dramatic setting. This is the most authentic feeling church we've visited, less gimmicks but lots of amazing soaring, 14th century ceilings. We attended a concert - Mozart's requiem - and the matching of space and music seemed perfect. Thanks to all the help I received from the tripadvisor Barcelona forum in finding this concert!
A Nice Cathedral with unique decor. THis a a good example of gothic works but it closes for a few hours in afternoon, check the schedule!
its a work of art. A great example of gothic art. Watch for the time as it closes mid afternoon.

Pretty church in a great area for tapas. This pretty gothic church from the 14C is well worth a visit and located in a nice quiet area away from the bustle of Las Ramblas. Significant because it was built during the rise of Spain's maritime supremacy. Some of the cities best tapas bars are in this neighborhood including la Vinya del Senor across the street from the church.
Calm nice area. The Catedral isn't super big, but I love the surroundings (Ciutat Vella). There are also nice cafes around the place. Be prepared of the many street performers coming in your way.
Seen from afar.. Didn't go in but wandered outside. Great wine bars around the church.

Surprisingly spiritual. For someone who is not religious in the slightest, this actually felt a very spiritual place indeed - there's just something quite special about this building. The architecture is fantastic inside and a much more classic cathedral as opposed to the stunning Sagrada Família - completely well worth seeing both. St Mary of the Sea itself is set in and amongst a maze of streets which makes it quite unique. Well worth a visit

Where Ildefonso Falcones' novel takes place. A lovely church in the lovely Born area. I read the book last year and wanted to see the place again - I also visited the church in 2011, but this time I also wanted to compare it's Gothic style with the Roman style which I saw in a monestary in Raval.

Elegant in its comparative simplicity. After seeing many decadent cathedrals, this seemed almost austere and frankly, more spiritual than many. IF you like visiting churches, have a connection to maritime, or are in the area, I strongly encourage you to make the stop.
Off the beaten track. We were recommended visiting this cathedral by our hosts and it was well worth the trip. A beautiful building, not ornate like the main cathedral, intimate and informative.
Stumbled across. We literally came across this beautiful church when wandering the area. It was busy due to a religious service.
fabulous. It really touched me even i am not a very religious person.It has personality.

Outstanding!. I am a local and have been to Santa Maria de Mar hindreds of times and it never ceases to astonish me. It's an otusantding example of gothic architecture: high, elegant in its simplicity and in an incredible setting: the district of Ciutat Vella (Old City) and Born, the old district of merchants now turned into a trendy district teaing with designer shops, restaurans and nightclubs. The cathedral of Santa Maria del Mar (Our Lady of the Seas) is truly like a ship standing proud in the wurrounding and changing sea of city life.
this was very moving. this was free to go in you just had to give a donation if desired

Breathtaking at its very best. was going to give this a miss as this was our last morning but so so glad we didnt.. again could spend at least half a day walking around.. up the stair cases is not for the faint hearted..
Worth seen to.. Just its easy find and why not see it. You can get of at this stop on the hop on hop off bus tour.
gorgeous gothic cathedral. gorgeous gothic cathedral in a fantastic area 'el born', with several nice places to eat and trendy shops
beautiful monument and inside garden. Its a beautiful cathedral,and it have a very pretty inside garden,so charming
Found it by accident!. Beautiful like all the other churches in Barcelona!

Definitely worth seeing. I have to say I enjoyed viewing this just the same as Sagrada Familia. It was lovely, 9 euros entry (including the lift!), very beautiful. Lift to the roof to overlook the city (the lift is extra at Sagrada Familia), the little garden/fountain area in the courtyard was a nice surprise. Geese and fish can be found here. The museum room was nice to see aswell. More traditional then Sagrada Familia.
Beautiful!!. It is a beautiful church in a magnificent quarter. Definitely worth going inside and also walking around the area.

Beautiful gothic cathedral. I was amazed. I'm a fan of Gothic architecture. Although this church is fitted on the narrow streets around and it is hard to get a full overview of it, it is still massively impressive. Interior is amazing, spacious, with light playing on the walls, columns and presbytery. Got to see it on your own eyes.
Difficult to find but worth the effort. Found by accident when wandering around the side streets of teh old town
Beautiful. Day or night, a place to visit and enjoy its embrace. If you had read the book by Ildefonso Falcones, even more enjoyable!

Beautiful. Loved this church, you can buy candles at the back and light them under whichever saint you want to dedicate your prayer to. The candles light up both sides of the church- its really beautiful.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful, gothic cathedral. I suggest reading Idelfonso Falcones "Cathedral of the Sea" to fully appreciate the blood, sweat and tears that went into the bulding of this holy place.

Beautiful, simple, pure feeling in the Sea Cathedral in Barcelona. Enjoyed a tour about the Book the Cathedral of the Sea , you can book a tour on the website
itineraplus the cathedral is worth a visit .
A beautiful Cathedral. This is a place that is full of light, it is not like the big Cathedral. Also it is in an interesting barrio.
Beautiful with a touch of barca. Dont miss the FCbarcelona stand glass window as a tribute to the $ donated b the club for its restoration!
wow - the gold!!. amazng architecture but scaffolding on parts when we were there
read the book. best gothic church in city, book captures what life was like in medievel times: "cathedral of the sea"

Beautiful church with wonderful stained glass. The "Eglesia de Santa Maria del Mar, the "people's cathedral", was built between 1329 and 1384 and is a perfect example of the catalan gothic style. It is located in the Born Ribera district and in my opinion, is the most beautiful church in Barcelona. The architecture is impressive, with 16 symmetrics columns, but the highlights are beyond any doubt the many, different and fantastic stained glass windows, that give a colorful and peaceful subtle light to the place.
It's a church not a cathedral. Very nice gothic church with fantastic decorated windows, really worth spending 15-20 min in it

Some nice bars around. You can stop in any of the surrounding bars and locals which offer tapas, pintxos (a basque specialty). Not exactly cheap, but worth it.As in any place near the city center, just watch your wallet.
Another classic church from the middle ages. a beutiful church from the middle ages, well worth a visit
another church another city. no outstanding features, after seeing Sagrada Familia there is little to say
Great church. Very interesting example of the Catalan Gothic style. Imposing church.
Must see!. Really easy to get to using the metro, and worth a visit if you are here! It is completely different to anything else to you see, and well worth it.
One of my favorite churches in Europe. The beauty and majesty of this church is hard to describe. For every trip I make to Barcelona, it will be on my must see list.
Nice. Original masterpiece of gothic art in Barcelona, build from artisan and workers' comunities, to made the Cathedral of the Sea, despite from official Barcelona Cathedral.

Gothic beauty.. Located in the heart of the city, this is a lovely cateheral located in my favourite area of the city. When the city is buzzing and you need a break this church is worth a step into and you will be transferred back in time given the antiquity of the place.
Beautiful Temple in the heart of Barcelona. Its a very nice place to explore in the lively and cozy neighbourhood of el Born in Barcelona.
See it while you are here. My 2nd favorite Gothic Cathedral...Dijon has my favorite

La Ribera church. A noteworthy church in La Ribera - I wouldn't necessarily make it the reason for the trip into the area but definitely worth checking out if you're nearby. There are some notable restaurants (Sagardi) and pastry places around the area too.
Fascinating. Had some quite time there although it's a busy place!

Beautiful small cathedral. This cathedral is stunning in its simplicity. The windows are really beautiful and the interior is quite simple, almost pure. The place is not pached with golden statues etc. It has a serene atmosphere.
la mas bonita. this is my favourite church in BCN, not very crowded, free entrance and a beautiful gothic style. A visit is recommended.
A must see. If you have any time to spare, a cab ride to this place is a must "Unbelievable"
Nice stylish old cathedral. We liked this beautiful cathedral with its many chapels.
Gorgeous. I loved this Gothic Basilica in the Barri Gotic, the history of the place is intriguing and the architecture is amazing.
Gaudi's Master Piece. Should not miss this iconic church which shows the master pice of Gaudi
Beautiful and not on all of the tour stops.. Visit this exquisite church. It is breathtaking, and it is not on all of the tour stops.
Gothic gem. really intersting church and not as well lit as some so felt more atmospheric - lots of skull and crossbones on tomb stones in floor still to find out if they belonged to pirates...

Lovely cathedral being restored. Breathtakingly beautiful inside. Inside well lit on Saturdays- particularly choir stalls. Do visit Cloisters with the protective geese. Trip to roof (being restored) expensive at 6 euros pp, but views of city very good.
brilliant, views from top are good. 6 euros entry, worth it and it doesn't cost to take the lift up to the roof
I love this place. Is really beautiful, and gothic. Is a piece of art in the Barrio Gótico.

Worth a brief stop. Depending on your love for church architecture this could underwhelm. My friend, the interior designer, thinks this one of the three most beautiful churches on Earth. To me, it's somewhat Spartan and it's not easy to get a dramatic perspective of it from the outside because it's crowded by other buildings. Possesses a sense of reverence that a lot of famous tourist churches haven't been able to maintain. If you plan to go, you might want to read the novel Cathedral of the Sea to get a better appreciation for this building.
Church of the people of Cataluya. I found it very welcoming to all people and impressive in size and history.
Beautiful.. Be sure to check for opening and closing times or you might be disappointed.
Great Gothic church. I especially liked the rose window on the exterior as well as the spaciousness created by the absence of transepts inside the church.
Beautiful place. We went in just as it was getting dark and the beauty and atmosphere of this building was truly impressive. Really worth visiting.

Amazing. Don't miss this gothic cathedral: it is beautiful without being overly ornate.! Stained glass are breathtaking. Look at the skulls on the floor. The atmosphere of this cathedral actually made it a very good place to pray or meditate. Also neighborhood are lovely: there are a lot of shops and good restaurants. The best cathedral in Barcelona.
love the gothic architecture. really liked this church because of its architecture,It is a typical gothic church. Worths your visit and your attention.
Beautiful. Wonderful stain glass, interesting history, and in a nice neighbor hood with some good restaurants and shops.
Georgous!. beautifull place, eorth to visit, espacially at evenings when the lights inside and outside are on

Best church in the world!. I've seen alot of churches in my life, but this one is by far the best (except for a few in Italy)! Amazing gothic structure and just breathtaking. We even saw a wedding taking place here.

Gótico catalán. Ésta es mi iglesia favorita en Barcelona. La sencillez de sus líneas es, en mi opinión, su punto fuerte. Toda una hazaña arquitectónica: hacer que te sientas cómodo en un espacio tan enorme.
Amazing Old Cathedral. The organ was really pretty. The windows were as well. The little chapel in the back looked really really old and the wall paintings were awesome!

a gem of Spanish architecture often overlooked by tourists. While you can get "cathedraled out "in Spain this gem seemed to miss out on the mass tourism of the main cathedral . Mass time is best to get the full atmosphere of lights, candles , music and incense !

thought provoking. we stumbled across this little gem on our first evening in Barcelona - very thought provoking and peaceful. The best time to go is the evening as there are lots of queues for this during the day.
Breath taking stained glass. We very much enjoyed walking through this Catedral! The stained glass was gorgeous!
Gothic church... Offering true tranqulity is what is a great, vibrant town but this place is serene and worth the visit.
Simplicity and peace. A place to rest and reflect. A few beautiful details underscore the general impression of simplicity and peace

Read the book. If you plan to visit try to read the book - El Catedral del Mar - an excellent historic novel buily around the origins of this wonderful cathedral. I read it in Spanish - i don't know if it available in translation.
Great Church in a Great quarter. So peacefull. So beautifull. You must go and visit it with no hurry.

Fabioulos cathedral. Impressive cathedral, very rich yet not too fancy.
Check daily prayers schedule.
very peaceful and welcoming. Myself and my partner work at sea so it is lovely to come in to the welcoming cathedral and light a candle.

Wonderful cathedral. This church has been built by the workers, it is so pure and simple.
Read the book about the building of this cathedral. "The cathedral of the Sea". I did take a guided tour of the area and it was very interesting.

I love this Church. One of my favorite churches in the whole world. Beautiful nave with sparse paintings in Barcelona colors (blue and burgundy). And absolutely amazing windows, absolutely awe inspiring when the sun filters through.
Beautiful church. Very near the cathedral and full of history. Gothic and beautiful.

I liked it more than the Catedral. Santa Maria del Mar was better than the Catedral IMO. It is smaller and the location seems much more authentic to me. It is far less commercialized but has the ultra-old feel to it that is interesting in european churches.
Read the book and see the church!. May be the most beautiful cathedral we have seen. Simple and elegant!

A restfull place. Squeezed by the surrounding buildings the cathedral may not seem that impressing, but the interior is remarkable due to it's open and airy character. A lot of space! Rest a bit, dwell on the today's events, and afterwards grab a cup on the square in front of the cathedral.
Beautiful. Lovely cathedral. Beautiful example of Barcelona architecture.

Gorgeous. Somehow I liked this church more than any I have seen. I regret that I did not take the tour offered (it was lengthy). Also I was there in Spring 2009 and it was under major renovation on the exterior. In fact, you could not even see it--it was totally enshrouded.I noticed you say it was built in the 14th century but I was thinking it was 13th. Queen Isabella attended this church when she sent Columbus. A must-see. But beware of the cobblestones---after walking on them all day I had to limp into a pharmacy for a knee brace.AA must see.
Lovely place to escape the hustle and bustle of Barcelona.. A very special church that offers solace to all who visit.
The little cathedral. Is good to know that the cathedral has a fantastic sonority and was build for common people
beautiful cathedral. the story behind the building of the cathedral and the cathedral itself is interesting

Beautiful 14th century gothic architecture church in Born neighborhood. Said to be the widest church in diameter perhaps in the world (though I might remember incorrectly). It was discovered during the excavations under the church in 1960 that this site was originally occupied by a Roman necropolis (cemetery) from the 4th to 6th centuries. Being inside the church made me feel so tiny, almost the same feeling in La Sagrada Família (the Sacred Family Temple). You should read the history behind it before visiting it.

Sweet and serene. Beautiful church in the Born district. Wonderful place to get away from the bustle of the city, sit in silence, soak in the sacred atmosphere of nearly 1000 years of worship. Be sure to find out when it is open before going there! Weddings on Saturday.

A 16th Century Catalan Gothic Church. At the center of El Born is the Church of Santa Maria del Mar, dating from the 16th century in Catalan Gothic style. During the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) the Church sided against the people with the conservative forces of Francisco Franco (who won). In retaliation, the working class took their anger out on this church and burned all the wood furnishings and décor. The church’s tree-like columns inspired Gaudi when he designed La Sagrada Familia Church. Sixteenth-century sailors left models of their ships at the foot of the altar for Mary’s protection. Today, there is a classic old Catalan ship model at Mary’s feet. The neighborhood is a great place to visit as well.
Serene spot in a lively city.. My husband and I found ourselves in Santa Maria del Mar at least once a day. It is such a peaceful place, wonderfully inclusive and inviting.

A beautiful place.... ... one of my favourites.I love old churches and have stopped at so many around the world... Santa Maria del Mar and Barcelona Cathedral are right at the top of the list.You just feel the hundreds of years of history all around you... from markers etched in stone on the floor...to the amazing glass work.Stunning !

A Beautiful Church. Santa Maria del Mar is probably one of the most beautiful churches in Barcelona. It is a Gothic church that has plenty of light in the church. There is a rose window that adds elegance to the church. The images of St. Peter and St. Paul on the west door are very good. The tympanum with the image of the Virgin Mary and St. John is wonderful. The church looks a little bare because during the Spanish Civil War the chapels with all their images were destroyed. However it is of no matter now. There is beauty in simplicity and this church is very tranquil and beautiful.
Cathedral of the Sea. Worth looking for it!! not many people know about it or try to find it while in barcelona. but its worth the extra time you spend while in the gothic square of the city
Cathedral. Nice example of an older cathedral, but not overwhelming. A lot going on in the Placa during the weekends.

I loved this church!. This church was one of my favorite sights while in Barclelona. Built in only 55 years by wealthy shippers in the 1300's, it was a marvel to see... (and the Sagrada Familia is still under construction?) Add to that knowledge that many of the big blocks you see on the facade were carried on the backs of men called "bastaixos" from the ships to the construction site (see pic)-- just amazing to me. Don't miss it. This church is in a nice, quaint neighborhood... just steps from the Picasso Museum and some good tapas places.

beautiful church. This is my favourite of all the churches I visited in Barcelona. The high vaulted ceilings and lack of clutter makes it feel very open and peaceful. It helps, too, that it's not as crowded as the Barcelona Cathedral. Lovely architecture and stained glass combined with a peaceful and less gaudy interior make ir worth a visit. There's no fee, but I always put a coin in the alms box to thank the church for letting me photograph there.
Beautiful. See this cathedral. It's one of the most beautiful buildings in the center center. You will not regret it.

Simple and beautiful. On our Barcelona Day Tour, I specifically asked to be able to stop and visit this church. We were not disappointed when we walked inside. It has a large open plan with huge vaulted ceilings. We really liked the simpleness of the statues and decorations.It is found on the edge of the Gothic area with narrow streets around it.

Beautiful example of Gothic architecture. Before we went to Barcelona, I read "Cathedral of the Sea" which is about the building of this church, so I was excited to see it and I wasn't disappointed. It is open and beautiful, so spacious. The church is free, but get there before noon because it was closed in the afternoon. I enjoyed that they actually had real candles here instead of the little electric lights that have become common. The church still feels like it must have when it was built. It is so much more peaceful and enjoyable than the cathedral. Go see this church, you won't be sorry.

Fun taking pictures at Santa Maria del Mar Barcelona. This is one of the most exciting places I go often in Barcelona when friends visit, with my Saturday photography group or with visitors who request this photocircuit. It is now known because of the Carlos Ruiz Zafon´s book that has been translated to many languages and also because it is a place where less is more. Being a church built by the poor, Sta Maria del Mar is not the typical cathedral full of decoration, golden altars and images, instead it is a nice and quiet place (when not full of tourists) where light enters in a very graceful way.Picturing Santa Maria del Mar is fun and different to other churches because architecture and people become the main thing, the solid rock walls and the peace that they inspire leave more than one visitor just breathless, so faces and corners become very interesting.One big space where you can see it all from the entrance also allow people interested in picturing to have a wide point of view of the whole place.

Absolutely Beautiful. The church is an easy walk from the metro station (Jaume I) and is incredibly beautiful. I recommend printing up a short page of history or bringing a guidebook to give you some background to read while you are there. A visit should not take long and is worth a little of your time.Inside, is gorgeous with lots of stained glass windows. There is a small chapel behind the altar which has a very different feel to it than the rest of the church and is worth stepping into. It is free to visit the church and I much preferred it instead of the Cathedral.

Inspiring church.. A truly amazing gothic church with loads of character and worth seeing if venturing around this part of Barcelona. This area is commonly known as the Born district and is full of littl boutique shops, the picasso museum is located close by also and is definitely worth the visit.

Not a Cathedral. The word Cathedral does not mean "big, fancy church." Cathedral denotes the church where a Bishops chair or "cathedra" is located. There is Cathedral in Barcelona, the Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia. The term Basilica is sometimes used to donote a big, fancy church like St. Peter's in Rome, Italy, which is not a Catheral, either.

Peaceful, restful place. A great gothic church, without being obnoxiously overdone, there is a purity of line and design here that is very pleasing to the eye. The building was done in the 14th century, and the magnificent stained glass was added in the 15th to 18th centuries. I can see why the previous poster chose this as a wedding spot, it would be ideal, particularly because there is no choir in the center, as there is in most large european churches (actually, I heard that there once was a choir, but it was burned during the spanish civil war). I also heard that it's a great place for concerts. For myself, I just visited midday, but found it a lovely spot to rest, relaxing after a long day of sightseeing, just smelling the candles burning. Admissionis free. It's open 9am-1:30pm and 4pm-8 pm.

WOW! You must visit!. OK, I am slightly biased! I got married there in August '06, so of course I love it!Thing is, I loved the place as soon as I saw it's magnificent towers appearing in front of us as we strolled down the street from the direction of Las Ramblas...the huge door and fantastic circular stained glass window add even more grandure and drama to the church.Inside, the isle seems to go on for miles, the huge chandeliers and imposing alter are simply stunning.Get down there on a Saturday and enjoy a church service. The Plaza bustles with life, love and laughter, it really is amazing. If you don't manage down for a wedding service, go anyway and sit outside sipping a cold glass of Vino....bliss!

Beautiful. This was my favorite cathedral of Barcelona.This Gothic cathedral was beautiful without being overly ornate.Making it beautiful was the stained glass which was stunning.The atmosphere of this cathedral actually made it a very good place to pray or meditate. We actually liked it so much that we visited it daily to meditate.
